It‚Äôs been years of searching for games on the App Store and I found a few games that were good, but they were not exactly the kind of game I was looking for. I was looking for a game where you have freedom instead of following a single storyline, I was looking for Amazing graphics in a game, and I was looking for something that is long and satisfying. This game has gone way past my expectations, from graphics, to gameplay, to story/side quest, to exploring freely. There‚Äôs just so much to do, I look forward to playing more and getting new updates to add even more improvements. Keep up the good work! (Also a few suggestions to make it better, Add more side quest that has some useful rewards maybe, and maybe a friendship or couple system to make it more realistic; like more interactions throughout the game, most likely with online people, oh and one more thing; even more characters and weapons which will draw more people on as well as keep players playing for who knows how long) thank you.
title: Long awaited Game!

review:
I honestly kinda had high hopes for this game when i downloaded it because i watched some game plays about the game But it didn‚Äôt turn out well, This game is going to need major bug fixes for the mobile before doing anything else with the game like updates and so on. And i know i should play on the ‚Äúrecommended‚Äù version of the iPhone but you cant expect people to go out and buy some expensive phone just to play some lame game. 
For more the opening of the game is my first impression. I just ended up with a nice headache because i used headphones. The audio was.. like all scratched up or, i don't know how to put this and the animation or video or.. whatever you want to call it was stopping non stop. The only smooth part of it was the character picking and picking your name. Then once i finally loaded up i was surrounded with darkness, that made it really uncomfortable. 
I‚Äôll still and try to play the game and might leave another review. all i want is the mobile experience for ALL versions of the iPhone to be improved and not just the iPhone i want all the different platforms experience to improve if ey are having this same problem 

And sorry if this sounds all weird, random or doesn‚Äôt sound right. I don't have the best English.
title: Meh...

review: I think this is an epic game, the graphics are unreal and the story is amazing. I just have a problem with how this keeps crashing every time I play, my phone over heats like an oven and I think part of that may be because of its big map and top graphics. Although the game is good, it‚Äôs just really annoying that this just keeps crashing. Even tho this is meant for pc, I think they should make this version just different so it‚Äôs more suitable for the phone. Other then that, this game has no problems and is a great game, and for new players I recommend not wasting all your resources on leveling all your character, first aim to get al l the characters, then play with them, and then decide which ones are the best although in the process you will have to level up some of your characters but you only have to level up your two mains. But until then just save as much resources as you can. You can use the premogems to get wishes which you can use to unlock characters and weapons. Also you can play with friends after adventure rank 16
title: Great game but...

review: First things first, the graphics. Breathtaking! I experimented with the settings and the game is still pretty on the lowest graphics settings. Second, the story! From the games I‚Äôve played, the story is really unique and interesting! Plus there‚Äôs side stories that can distract you while helping you level up! Another thing I love about this game is the attention to detail. Like Barbara for example, she calls herself an idol and whenever she does her abilities in Mondstadt the people clap for her! That‚Äôs just an insane little detail that I appreciate. There‚Äôs also so many hidden secrets and Easter eggs that are so amazing too! Basically this game is so worth it. I may or may not have been playing for hours on end. Keep up the amazing work!!! I do have one quick suggestion for the devs that‚Äôs been annoying me during combat. Can there be a specific button for climbing? I‚Äôve been in combat a few times and suddenly my character starts climbing and it‚Äôs slightly stressful during boss fights. If you read this I hop you have an amazing day!
title: Where to begin with this amazing game?

review: I would just like to start off by saying an amazingly well written and programmed game. I play both on PS4 and mobile but far prefer the console version. This game is a true open world game which is rare in games nowadays, with the amazing storyline and side quests. If I had any complaint about it, it would be about the fact that after level 20 leveling up gets increasingly difficult, repetitive and time consuming. Most side quests have to be found by just walking around I would like it more if you added more features to the map like possible side quests or explorable areas for more experience points to help with leveling. I also feel like there should be more mobs it gets a little repetitive fighting the same kinds on repeat though I understand since the game is fairly new. The last thing I would add is a monster dossier that‚Äôs probably one of my favorite thing about games I love being able to see all monsters I‚Äôve fought/unlocked and also a little backstory on them.
title: Ways to improve upon your game

review: I really love this game! The graphics are amazing, the battles are fun, and the voice acting is really nice to listen to. However, this game also has a few problems. One of them is the immense crashing. Every 5-15 minutes, the game crashes and it's getting really annoying. If it helps, sometimes I see red or green lines on the buildings before the game crashes. Another problem is the battery usage. Only this game drains too much of my battery and sometimes my iPad starts overheating. I've checked the other apps ands it's only this game that's causing the problem. Also, the enemy spawns sometimes takes way too long. For example, there's this quest where you have to unlock a tri-seal. The Meaty tribe has this sort of challenge and you get 1 minute and 35 seconds to defeat 10 enemies. The problem is, the enemies take too long to spawn and the result is 50 seconds of battle time. And those 50 seconds are becoming shorter because of the spawn time of the boss, so I can't pass the challenge. Please fix this, especially the crashing. I will hate to have to delete this game because of it.
title: Love the game but...

review: first off i just wanted to say this game is amazing. they really payed attention to detail with some things that have heavily peaked my interest, therefor making me want to play even more. although, i am only a mobile user! i play on my iPhone 8, before (a few months ago) i tried playing this but it just led me to a black and white screen. im not sure what fixed the issue because after i waited 2-3 months for it to be fixed and it started working after i get an update for my phone? anyways, the bugs i deal with on a daily basis NEEDS to be fixed because it‚Äôs the small things ruining my gameplay. sometimes, when i‚Äôm fighting monsters, it lags a whole lot and the day switches to night, and the night switches to day. that happens about 3-4 times. it‚Äôs really annoying. whenever it‚Äôs raining for me, my game lags and crashes. and everytime i go into monstatd, the graphics become blocky, and i have to restart the game in order for it to be good again. amongst all these small bugs, i still enjoy the game. but PLEASE please please fix this. thank you
title: - mobile issues (ft. iOS)

review: Let me start by saying that I am AR40 at the time of this review. The gameplay and story are amazing. The gacha aspect is a hit or miss with their low rates. However, once you get past the honeymoon phase of the first 20-30 hours, you will start to realize that miHoYo designed the game in a way that limits the player‚Äôs progression in every single way possible. From the smallest thing such as crafting ores to level up your weapons to spending resin for running dungeons and bosses to get ascension materials. They limit it all. It‚Äôs like they are trying their best to prevent players from progression in an OPEN WORLD game. Some might argue that the game is design as a mobile game. The funny thing is that playing on mobile is the hardest compared to playing on PS4 or PC. Furthermore, I have never seen a greedier company than miHoYo. They made $100 million (their entire production cost) in the first 2 weeks, yet they don‚Äôt have any sort of daily login rewards outside of the initial 7 days and when they do send out codes for rewards or host events they give you crumbs - not even enough for a single gacha pull. I hope to see big changes soon because they seem so inexperienced even though they have another game Honkai Impact for the past few years.
title: Greedy company that brings the game down

review: I knew nothing of this game until my friend got into the beta. I‚Äôve been following it ever since. I couldn‚Äôt wait for its release. The game itself is fantastic. The music the story, sure it‚Äôs a BOTW clone but it does so much of its own thing that it really stands on its own two feet. The only downside I see to the game at all is the loot box style way of getting characters and weapons. But it is early. I‚Äôm only adventure rank 12. It goes to 60 so who knows what you will unlock along the way with time. That also being said even without 5 star weapons or characters I have had no real issue making it through anything so far so the characters and weapons to me are more of a skin/cosmetics thing then any sort of pay to win if anyone is concerned about that. But even with the one downside I gave it a 5 star and even wrote this review (which I don‚Äôt normally do) because the game is so fun. I own every console and built my own computer I don‚Äôt normally play mobile games but this one got me. It‚Äôs very well done.
title: Don‚Äôt normally write a review but...

review: I have put in about 40 hours of gameplay so far. Haven‚Äôt spent a dime but I have quite a few characters unlocked from playing the game. Sure you could easily dump some money in the game to get the characters you want but they give you plenty of currency in game. I find myself making a ten times pull every other day at this point. I know early on this will be easier to do with the rewards in game for the launch but you don‚Äôt have to spend a dime to enjoy this game. The graphics are great the story and lore has been fantastic. There‚Äôs so much to learn and the characters you talk to fill you in on a lot of the worlds background. The voice acting has been awesome and the soundtrack is so good I have to play with my sound on always. I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect when I installed the game even though I was waiting for it to release. Any expectations I had have been completely blown away. I‚Äôve been telling everyone to get this game. You have to try it you have nothing to lose but your free time
title: Absolutely amazing

review: I hope someone out there will see this some day, the game is absolutely stunning, in my opinion it‚Äôs on par with breath of wild, and it‚Äôs as close to breath of wild as you can get on mobile but, (and I‚Äôm probably the only person here with this issue) I was raised a devout Christian, and I can‚Äôt play games with elements of magic or dark magic in them, so I‚Äôve never been able to play a game that‚Äôs as visually stunning as this, because of the sorcery and witchcraft which in my religion and culture is strongly banned. I hope one day someone will make a mobile open world game, as beautiful as this, maybe with technology as the ‚Äúsuper powers‚Äù of the characters or mecha monsters, horizon zero dawn had this concept and I still couldn‚Äôt play because I have Xbox, not play stationüòî it would make me so happy if one day, a game as beautiful and expansive as this, with legendary items and characters, could be made without utilizing magic or bloody gory violence. I think such a game would be able to increase its customer base to no end
title: It‚Äôs beautiful but

review: Let me get this out of the way. First, YOU NEED A STRONG DEVICE to even run this game properly. iPhone 8 Plus and above will do the job. Sexond, the gacha, THE GACHA RATES ARE LOWER THAN FGO. Though you get a lot of currency to pull near the start, I recommend saving and not immediately rolling the gacha unless you‚Äôve already decided to pay up. Third, BE CAREFUL REROLLING, YOU MIGHT GET BANNED because bots are rerolling accounts which are being sold. Fourth THIS WILL BE GRINDY I played in the beta, and most other players will agree, it takes time and many resources to build teams, and I specifically said it with a plural word. Fifth, YOU WILL NEED MULTIPLE UNITS for end game since dungeons have different effects which will benefit specific characters. I think I mentioned most of the things that WILL RUIN most people‚Äôs experience, now for the good stuff. This is MiHoYo‚Äôs third major game, Honkai impact blew my expectations and standards for a mobile game, and I know this will do it again. I wouldn‚Äôt have imagined an open world mobile ga,e like this when I first downloaded Honkai. THIS CAN BE AN AMAZING GAME, it just needs time...
title: NOT FOR EVERYONE, but is great for some

review: First off, I haven‚Äôt played the game too much, but from what I have played and continue to play the game is just amazing, the graphics, frame rate and dialogue are truly top notch. And with elements like the open world and polished combat you are sure to have loads of fun! I also want to address the negative reviews, pretty much ignore almost all of them, those reviews are mainly talking about how the game wont open or doesn‚Äôt have controller support. To that I would, chill out. The game has been out for like 2 days and I experienced the same issue with logging in, but after a little while I was able to get in and start playing. It makes no sense to me when people rate a games quality based on the fact they couldn‚Äôt get into it. I understand it‚Äôs frustrating, but that‚Äôs kind of a weird thing to give the game a 1 star when you literally just need to wait a small amount to play. Overall the game takes a lot from BoTW and I‚Äôed say if you download this you‚Äôll absolutely love it!
title: Possibly a masterpiece!

review:
So I am officially addicted to this game. So much replay ability is very good in a game and this game feels like it should cost money, and deserves a 5 star review. However, as with many games, there is also a problem. The problem with this one is that it fails to run well on lower end devices. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I am still addicted to this game. The constant crashes and massive lag spikes don‚Äôt deplete that much from the game itself, as they barely ever screw you over. I wasn‚Äôt actually going to write a review, until the lag spikes interrupted my gameplay. At the Luhua Pool, there is a quest where you have to help a man find his art supplies. However, my lag spike did not load that character. Or the door to the temple. Seeing as there was no door, I walked into the temple, without doing the quest and a supreme lack of oversight. I claimed the chests when they loaded and teleported out. Now I attempted the quest just because I need XP. So here I am, an idiot who opened a door with no chests. So now I can‚Äôt complete the quest. Thanks, game.
Please fix this I need it badly.
title: Great game, except for lag. and a known issue

review:
A chinese company making a free to play game that captures all the best aspects of JRPG‚Äôs & breath of the wild! This is one of few times the gatcha system didnt dissuade me from playing. The game has a great original soundtrack, combat system, & (something Botw lacked) voicelines for practically everything (& in multiple languages)! To top it all off, the game is cross-compatible w/ ps4, pc, mobile; cross-save for mobile & pc, & a tba switch date! All of this free so i dont understand how anyone could give this game anything but five stars. The story & dialogue are better than most retail games lately & the cutscenes are as beautiful as the world that‚Äôs created. There‚Äôs gonna release more content for free. I could go on about how astounded i am by this game & i recommend to anyone who enjoys PvE & multiplayer. I have an iphone xr & it runs super smooth & my phone doesnt get as hot as i thought it would. 

my only negative critique is the lack of keybinding/being able to edit the location or functionality of the mobile controls.
title: it‚Äôs not a knock off; it‚Äôs inspired by!

review:
Alright, this has got to be the BEST game I‚Äôve ever played on my phone. It‚Äôs incredibly immersive, expansive and so finely-detailed for a game that‚Äôs adapted to the iPhone. It‚Äôs like playing an actual console game on your phone. No lagging, no annoying ads to watch or skip, no required in-app purchases or pay-to-play/win nonsense. It‚Äôs got a Zelda BotW vibe, mixed-in with maybe some Kingdom Hearts/Final Fantasy elements. 

The developers put so much detail in the game, and it shows. There‚Äôs voiceovers, a free-roam environment to explore, tons of quests to complete, etc. Honestly, I‚Äôm blown away that this game is free. Games like this is so rare nowadays, where develop quality games for others to enjoy first and foremost, and cashing in on the game from it being less of an emphasis. Not saying we all deserve free games, but it‚Äôs easy to see how money-hungry game developers are nowadays, and are willing to churn out a mediocre game year after year for the sake of money, and expecting people to pay top dollar for them.

I HIGHLY recommend this game.
title: Absolutely stunning

review: I usually hate games like these because they require skill to play, but this game requires no skill. The amount of serotonin I got from this is amazing. I especially love the amount of voice acting in this game along with the graphics. I also think it‚Äôs a very nice feature to have a time and weather cycle going even if you‚Äôre sitting idly by. You also get to cook foods and ingredients with items you have collected on the ground or have bought with the game currency which I think is a very nice side feature. I do have a question though, I noticed that we get to form bonds and friendships with the characters but does it go any farther than that? If so I think that‚Äôs really interesting. I‚Äôve been playing since yesterday and I‚Äôm already in love with this game, the plot, and the characters. If you‚Äôre reading this to decide if you want to play the game or not, I highly suggest it. It‚Äôs not a pay to win game, in fact I don‚Äôt think there are any in-app purchases though you‚Äôll have to check.

So, when I got this game I was super exited! But when it comes to those scenes? Well it stays on a picture of it, it kinda makes the sounds.. some what but I can‚Äôt see anything, it‚Äôs like the game is going to crash but it isn‚Äôt.. I‚Äôm playing on my iPad, does that have to do anything with my problem?? And when i log on, I‚Äôm logged into my Game Center account but it says I have to go back to it, and when I don‚Äôt swipe the game up and restart, it crashes but that what I have to do to play it, what‚Äôs up with that?! I wanna play the game, not stare at nun all the time or whatever, but enough of me complaining, I just love all the details to this game, it is a remake of hanikai impact, (if that‚Äôs how you spell it) although I haven‚Äôt payed hanikai impact yet, or downloaded it.. so I‚Äôm not sure how good it is compared to this game, BUT I would recommend playing this game because it‚Äôs a super good game to play, only if your interested in fighting a lot and surviving, not too too much for survival but I still love it.

Have a great day, please consider what I said. Choa~
title: Amazing but super laggy (please read)

review: I do really like this game. The art style combined with solid mechanics and an interesting story make it worth playing alone. That said, there are things that do need to be fixed. Early on they throw a lot of free stuff at you (as most f2p games do) and there is a decent amount of content to keep you occupied. The problems start once you hit adventure rank 20 or so. After awhile the game literally becomes pay to play. You have the energy to do a max of 6 missions (depending on the mission, could be as low as 2.) you are basically given a choice, save the daily gems you get to do a free 10 summon once a month, or use them to get more energy so you're able to upgrade and level up characters and gear. Despite this I do really enjoy the game and will continue to play, but if the current resin system doesn't change or they don't add other free ways to just play the game then I will be abandoning the game. Definitely worth checking out for now. Without a few changes in the future I would definitely say pass and spare your wallet.
title: Great game at the start....

review: I downloaded this game the day it came out, and I gotta say I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised. The gameplay is pretty good and simple, the music is nice and fitting, the graphics are great for a mobile game, I like the anime aesthetic, the voice actors are good(at least the japanese ones), and open world games like this are my favorite. It feels like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild but with magic. The story is relatively engaging and there are mechanics that make it feel like a survival game, like cooking, climbing and hunting. Some downsides I can think of are that the game is really big. Right now, it‚Äôs sitting at 7.12 GB of storage and took around half a day to download. Another downside is the rarity of the good characters. I have pulled quite a few times so far (around 30-40 times) and have gotten no characters, only items. And the last downside I can think of is that sometimes when alot is going on, the FPS drops like crazy, but that‚Äôs expected for such a big game. Overall though, this game is good enough to get 5 stars from me.
title: Good experience

review: This game is great. I like it a lot and I can do almost every quest, there is one quest that is extremely hard to do in mobile. It‚Äôs the search the vault/protect the cache, the first round to fighting off one mecha/ruin guard and then you live on to defeating 3 at the same time. If the cache still has some percentage left and you beat the 3, you then have to fight the ruin hunter. Unlike another quest where you‚Äôre surrounded by water that you/your enemies can drown in this only has water where you can freeze your enemies and it only sometimes works. I‚Äôve found a few quests to be difficult but this is by far the hardest. I have gone to tutorials and even those in the comments also say that it‚Äôs is extremely difficult on mobile. Considering this, I‚Äôll probably drop this quest as I‚Äôve done it multiple times and I‚Äôve depleted a lot of my food. Other than this I love the game, I‚Äôve played for about 3 days and I‚Äôm already adventure rank 20. Plus I haven‚Äôt had any technology problems like crashing, or glitching. (I have an iPhone XR)
title: Great but there is one thing

review: This game compared to mobile games is definitely a must have. It being a open world breath of the wild style game. Exploring and grinding quite fun. The story while so far nothing spectacular is fun. The only two things that brings this game down a little. Is the gatcha system and rates. While free I wish they did things like separate the weapons from the character banner. Do what epic seven and allow multiple rerolls. So you don‚Äôt have to make a new account. Plus that would stop people selling accounts. Another thing is for people that aren‚Äôt used to gatcha game or rusty. Give them some more tips like focusing on two dps rather than the whole team. Had to start over cause I had to much fun and spread my resources thin. Trying out all the new units. Still for a mobile game this is the best of its kind. It‚Äôs about as good breath of the wild a fun but flawed game in iteself. So yeah I recommend it...... though devs can you please stop giving me 5 star weapons and just give me a five star character instead. XD
title: Great game but

review:
I‚Äôve been poking at Genshin Impact the last couple of days. I love the graphics! The character system is really fun too. I love being able to swap between the main character and others to combine elemental powers and find new ways to take down enemies. Being able to climb every where and glide is a lot of fun too. However I will say the mobile controls are a little annoying at times. 

I love that you can summon more heroes to fill out your team. It‚Äôs tempting to use real money to keep pulling for a hero, however it‚Äôs nice that you can earn in game currency to do the same. I look forward to seeing what new heroes they bring to the game.

I haven‚Äôt been able to find anything that suggest this game can use a controller. I play on an iPad Pro and have a lot of space to navigate, but I find when running around the world it‚Äôs hard to pan the camera around with out hitting other abilities or sometimes my thumb doesn‚Äôt register when I‚Äôm tapping on powers to activate. If developers could add controller support I‚Äôd give it a 5 star.
title: Awesome, but could use controller support

review: Coming into this game I thought i was fake when I saw the trailer on the App Store but it blew my MIND when I started playing it first of all I‚Äôve never thought in a million years that a game like this open world battle game would exist this early I‚Äôm very HAPPY ‚ù§Ô∏è I think this is the very very closest game that comes anywhere near Breath of the wild I‚Äôd BOtw had a combat system like this one I would still be playing Botw when I found out of can change the graphics to even higher same with the FPS THE GAME RAN EVEN SMOOTHER!!! And more beautiful I kinda feel guilty playing this game for free I wouldn‚Äôt complain if you charged for this game but thank you so much for making this game free a lot of people including myself can‚Äôt get the money right now but I‚Äôm happy it‚Äôs free thank you so much I‚Äôll complete this game it‚Äôs lot of fun I recommend going into settings and changing the FPS to 60 and the graphics even higher your experience will be 100% even more enjoyable thank you!!!!
title: I‚Äôm very surprised highest graphics 60 FPS

review:
I have seen so many mobile MMOs that I was scared this would just be a carbon copy of the others gameplay wise. I was so pleasantly surprised. There is no button you can press to have the game play itself, there is nothing to automatically move your character from place to place. You are forced to run around this world and explore which I absolutely adore. Not only that but the graphics are stunning! I don‚Äôt even mind that I had to free up quite a bit of storage on my phone just to download this, it was worth it! I wouldn‚Äôt have even minded paying for this game. I genuinely never expected the quality to be as good as this. Yes Honkai Impact is fun, but this game is on the next level. 
ALSO WHY ARE THERE SO MANY ATTRACTIVE CHARACTERS IN THIS GAME LIKE WHAT?! I‚Äôm going to be really irritated when I look at one of my sketchbooks and it‚Äôs just filled with these characters and human versions of monsters bc I totally haven‚Äôt started drawing the monsters as humans already. 
Send help I‚Äôm obsessed.
title: Favorite Mobile Game EVER

review:
Initial impressions are very high but like my favorite gum it loses steam quite fast and you end up hitting a wall of grinding and tedium in order to progress. Have no fear just buy the monthly pass or spend money on a battle pass you might say? Both of these things don‚Äôt actually compensate you with progress within the game or speed up the character progression system. Even if you do end up pulling a 5* character later the resources needed to max them out make it feel like less of a good thing and more of a sinking dread of choosing between progressing and gearing or wasting thousands of resin leveling up a new character. 

Mihoyo is this game a collectors game or not? What‚Äôs the reward in spending any money here. I‚Äôve never played a game where I‚Äôve spent so much and gotten so little, I understand there‚Äôs not a lot of content because it‚Äôs new but this monetization strategy might be successful initially but will drive off spenders like me because unless I keep spending I basically have to grind endlessly just to hit a pity banner. 

Until the game improves and they make more significant changes to the resin and summon system id stay away.
title: This game is like juicy fruit

review:
I LOVE the game so far! It really is like botw, which makes me appreciate it even more. The graphics, storyline, and everything about the world is beautiful. I‚Äôve spent a good few hrs so far without getting bored. I also like how this game isn‚Äôt pay to play. The spawn rates aren‚Äôt that good but I can live with it. You can still progress in the game with the default characters. The game itself is great, but I do have some suggestions that I think will make the game even better:

- The ability to go into every building. While the towns are beautiful and big, I think it would be great being able to walk into houses and every business.
- Have more ways of healing. Cooking is great but maybe add an inn at each town? And also, have characters revive over time after getting defeated in battle? Or you can even add a feature where characters heal little by little whenever they sit.
- Have the npc conversations go back to where you left off prior to you selecting your reply. It‚Äôs kind of annoying having to go through all the dialogue in order to read the answer to every choice.

Like I said, the game is fun. The only real con I have is that the game overheats my phone and crashes at times. I usually have to play with my phone near a fan and plugged in to keep it cool and prevent the battery from draining. Other than that, you would not regret downloading the game!

Note: I play on an iphone 8 so I can‚Äôt speak for the experience on older models.
title: FUN & some suggestions

review:
Okay so, I NEVER have enjoyed mobile gaming other than your casual mindless low budget games. Games that you play cause you‚Äôre bored and waiting around. Nothing that you really need to focus on. 
But THIS? This game is absolutely fantastic. It has an amazing story line. It‚Äôs fully fleshed out. Ease of access to play. I downloaded it about 2 hours ago and have been playing it since. I‚Äôm only now taking my first break from it to write this review and then I‚Äôm jumping right back into it. Its beautiful graphics and gameplay design, open world exploration features, and my interest in anime rpg‚Äôs, has sucked me in and I have no intentions of stopping until I need to go to work. This is absolutely amazing. Developers? If you see this? Please continue making games. Don‚Äôt ever stop. I would have paid good money for this if you asked me to. Thank you for being the first to make a mobile game I am willing to put my time into. Would have given this 100 stars if I could. WOWOW!! ü§©
title: Wow. Just wow

review:
It‚Äôs been 2 days and I‚Äôm VERY addicted. The game itself is fun, but there are a few flaws. Around every 30 minutes or so, the game crashes, and cut scenes are very choppy/laggy. It can be annoying sometimes, but I would still continue playing. Sometimes when I‚Äôm in the loading screen, I can‚Äôt log in either until i refresh the app or shut down my device a few times. (These problems I‚Äôm having might just be my device itself, as I‚Äôm using an older ipad.. not completely sure though) It‚Äôd be nice if this game could be played on a Mac as well (there‚Äôs a windows extension, which allows you to play on a Mac but I‚Äôd assume it‚Äôd run a bit slower).

Other then these minor problems, the plot is very interesting and I never imagined myself to be playing a RP game and be entertained well. Even if you‚Äôre unsure about this game, I recommend trying it out (the uninstall action is always there if this game isn‚Äôt for you). Who knows, you might end up spending five hours a day on this game like me.
title: entertaining game but a few bugs

review: I really wish I could rate this game higher than one star.  It has a ton of potential, and I looovvvee the idea of a wide open world with quests.  I play on an iPad, and the first problem I encountered was basic navigation.  There is a joystick control in the lower left corner of the screen, but it‚Äôs never mentioned in the help, and there‚Äôs not enough contrast that you can easily see it.  I only found it because I remembered another game with a similar control that I hadn‚Äôt been able to see either.  Once I got navigation sorted out, I advanced to Adventurer 4 and had fun doing that, but then I got to the part where I made it to Mondstadt and was given my glider and forced into a confrontation with Stormterror.  The audio is apparently corrupted because it keeps stuttering and the screen is completely black except for a few controls.  Every now and then, I see a red arrow, and I assume Stormterror is in that direction, but I can‚Äôt see what I‚Äôm supposed to be doing.  Things like this really ruin the game for me.  I will probably uninstall and reinstall and try again, but I don‚Äôt hold out hope it will help much.  I‚Äôd like to be able to escape that quest, but I can‚Äôt.
title: Lots of potential, but poor instructions...and buggy

review: I have been waiting for a very long time for this game to be released so I pre-ordered it downloaded came back to my iPad first generation to play only to get hit with a white screen it takes about 4 to 5 seconds before it shows up and then I‚Äôm hit with a complete black sky but the characters the buildings the ground everything is visible but you can‚Äôt see from a far everything is black is happening on other devices on the iOS not just The iPad Pro first generation which I am on please fix this issue the game runs perfectly fine on my Samsung Galaxy A20S! So it blows my mind that the game is glitching out on an iPad Pro first generation. PLEASE FIX THIS ASAP!!!  Honkai 3rd impact works prefect on my iPad Pro 1st gen so idk what‚Äôs going on. I have uninstalled and reinstalled this game played around with the graphics on the lowest setting but it will not take that black background away and white loading screen. It‚Äôs funny because this game works perfectly fine even on high stands on my Samsung galaxy A20s
title: White screen and black background

review: He is very underwhelming as a 5 star, and his support abilities are not even on par with Venti. Zhong li was hyped up as a fighting god, but instead his normal attacks are so low. His pillar‚Äôs aoe is too small and enemies can easily walk away from it. What would be better is if the pillar had a taunt like Mona, so enemies would actually take damage instead of walking away. His petrify is too short, and since his normal attacks are so low, switching to another character uses up time. What would be better is if the petrify was longer and the physical/geo damage buff it had in beta was added again. Please consider making some buffs to Zhong Li, he is my favorite character. Geo as an element overall could also use some changes to boost up damage. Zhong li as a shield user is an alright idea, but since the game is all about beating the clock and doing the most damage, having shields instead of a damage dealer is not the best. Locking his core support abilities behind a constellation paywall is also bad. Characters should feel complete at constellation 0, and constellation 6 should be bonuses. Going all the way to constellation 6 should not be the only way to make him feel complete, instead of feeling complete at constellation 0.
title: Buff Zhong Li

review:
Right now when I start the game on my powerful iPad Pro all I get is a blank white screen for about 10 minutes, then music starts and I‚Äôm able to ‚Äúplay‚Äù. Upon initiating my game, the intro cutscene was 98% frozen and only offered about 3 seconds of actual footage until I got disconnected somehow from Ethernet (likely server side issues). 
	After about 6 forced restarts of a broken laggy cinematic that I cannot skip, I managed to reach a very smooth part where I could pick and name my character. After that it was a couple more seconds of broken cinematic which I somehow managed to get through on the first attempt. Then the real horror began... 
	My first open world experience was that of a 5 inch view distance and then black nothingness. All enemies were giant blobs of white light, and only some of the grounds textures would actually load in. The only part of the game that actually works smoothly and completely is the User Interface Game Menu such as talents etc etc.
	Character animation is very well done, but with all these other issues mounted up I‚Äôm gonna have to call this a game flop for IPad Pro users.  üëé I do not recommend this game for anyone using a Mobile Device.
title: Would like to love this game.

review: Personally I would say yes and no the game has amazing music, story, and the overall feel of the game is great. But I would not drop any money on this game. The drops are bad  0.6% and even if you pay your still going to get useless things. I have played multiple Gacha games like epic seven, love Nikki, knights chronicle, Guardian tales and their drops are much better than this game. Furthermore the currency to get drops without spending money can be obtained by opening chest, problem is you will most likely get 2 and 4 useless items. The stamina mechanic is unbalanced in my opinion the enemies could start rushing and shooting missiles at you but if your stamina is depleted your just going to have to hope that your character doesn't die which they most likely will. Even though the game is new they should try to fix these problems but then again in the beta version when you opened chest you could get I believe 10 for the free currency but they cut that so yeah.
title: Is it worth it?

review: I been playing for around 20 hours now and I can say that Genshin Impact is probably the best open world RPG you can get. It‚Äôs similar to breath of the wild where you can interact with many of the world‚Äôs elements. The graphic is insanely well done and the storyline is exceptional. Game like this are free because they rely on the Gacha system to profit. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with this because the developers put in an insane amount of work and we can support them by purchasing stuff. However, if you are free to play know that in the latter stages, it will get increasingly difficult to progress without spending. I Benn playing for many hours now and haven‚Äôt reach that stage yet. So rest assured that even if you are F2P, you can have a very good time as Genshin impact focused on solo progress and PvE instead of PvP. I spent $20 on the game and progression would still be normal if you didn‚Äôt. Overall this game seems very balance and it‚Äôs clear that the developers put a lot of effort in making this game.
title: WELL MADE GAME

review:
If your looking for a fun game to either pass time or invest your days into this is the game to do it with. The other review is someone who tried to launch it when the server wasn‚Äôt live yet. So that problem won‚Äôt happen for you. Back to the review. I‚Äôve played over a hundred hours during the beta and everything translates well to the base game as well. This game has full voice acting for most of the characters in the world going into this game don‚Äôt think of this as a BOTW clone. This game was heavily inspired by BOTW‚Äôs art style but that‚Äôs the only part taken. This game is built from the ground up and people can easily sink 200 hours into the game. A heads up is the company who makes this game is famous for making gatcha games. Everything in this game can be earned in game but it also can be bought with money. There is also co-op in the game. So if the gatcha style bums you out just know that the summon system is the only gatcha mechanic.

 I hope this review helps you out.

title: If you do add it back, I would really appreciate it!

review:
This game is AMAZING. It takes place in a fantastic open world rich with lore, scenery, and people. The gameplay mechanics are easily learned and the player characters are all very unique. Quests are easy to understand, but difficult enough that some might take some actual planning to beat. The leveling system is simple and gets increasingly harder as you go on. There are  multiple different types of puzzles out in the world that give rewards when completed. Other features such as gliding and cooking will never not be fun to do. 
It‚Äôs truly an amazing game. 
However, it‚Äôs also prone to lag and random crashes. I‚Äôm nearly 100% sure it‚Äôs due to the massive amounts of data within the game that they let you download all of at the beginning of your journey. The crashes can take place at the worst times, but they miraculously always start you back off only a few steps from where you were. 
Other than the lag and crashing, I have nothing but positive experiences playing this game. 
This game IS worth the hype.

EDIT: after about a week of playing, the crashing has almost completely stopped, though once in a blue moon does it happen again. The lag also becomes less common, though not to the same rate as the crashing. Lag occurs mostly in battle, and while it can get annoying, it‚Äôs understandable with all of the fire, magic, and claymores being thrown around. 

Still an amazing game, just thought I‚Äôd add this.
title: GREAT game

review: Let me start off saying the game is great. The story, the quests, the characters, they are all amazing. The mechanics and the art is great. The thing is, it‚Äôs incredibly difficult to play. The cutscenes never work, the audio cuts in and out and my screen freezes. I tried closing it and opening the game again, but the cutscene just does the same thing, so I have to wait it out. As your traveling around, the graphics don‚Äôt load, so sometimes you have to interact with a character or something but you can‚Äôt since the graphics didn‚Äôt load. The only way for the graphics to appear is to close out the app and re open it. Sometimes when you interact with something or someone in the game, the game freezes, so you have to close out the app and reopen it. I don‚Äôt like having to reopen the app every few minutes. It gets quite annoying. It‚Äôs such a fantastic game, but these bugs are making it really hard for me to want to keep playing. Please fix these bugs, I love the game and don‚Äôt wanna give it up. (I do wanna mention I am playing on mobile)
title: Could be great

review: Overall, I am absolutely blown away with this game. As someone who has been around since Honkai‚Äôs earliest days, I knew I could expect great things from Mihoyo, but I didn‚Äôt think I could be more excited than I already was the day of the release. I remember being there for the countdown before everyone started screaming that the game was finally out! The mechanics, visuals, gameplay, movement-everything just feels absolutely amazing! There‚Äôs just one small problem I have. Occasionally, my game ends up crashing. I do play over my iPhone 8 and it tends to have a heating problem, so I‚Äôve balanced this out with lower graphics, but the game crashes frequently and I‚Äôm unable to prevent it anymore than I already have. I‚Äôve taken precautions to reduce battery usage and prevent over heating, but it will still occasionally crash! I‚Äôm in awe for this game, but I‚Äôd love for this problem to be looked at if possible for some of us who wish to play undisturbed.
title: Great game! Lots of crashes.

review: I love this game the characters are adorable and everything is so detailed, from the grass to clouds in the sky it‚Äôs amazing and vibrant, I love that the map it so huge! If my friend hadn‚Äôt told me this was coming out I probably never would have played it but I am glad I did! This is the kind of game that you want to play for several hours and there is so much to explore, I wish you could actually team up with online players and have a more social aspect kinda like tales of wind and Iruna does that would make this game absolutely PERFECT! Maybe in the future I hope the devs will add that in instead of just for certain boss fights. I‚Äôve always been very specific with the types of games I like big maps, free roaming, joystick controls, good story and graphics and of course being able to team up with actual people I really hope the developers make note and possibly included it in a future update cause that would make it my all time favorite game!
title: Amazing game, however.

review: When I first downloaded this game, I first thought to myself whether this game is going to be as good as PS4 and PC, but after running through it, it surprised me. After playing the game for almost a week now, adventure rank 27, I can safely say this is one of my most favorite games i‚Äôve ever played. This game is so beautiful, and the fact that I have my graphics all the way low and it still manages to run smoothly is unbelievable. What I also love about the game is by the fact that you can get a guaranteed 4 Star if you summon on a multi. This way when you summon, you won‚Äôt get fully shafted by only getting 3 stars. Overall I rate this game 5 stars because it‚Äôs a lot of exploring, quest, cute girls to collect from the gacha system, cool combo‚Äôs, and an intriguing experience. The one small problem i‚Äôm having at the moment is crashes, where my game just freezes, but that‚Äôs just a bug and I expect them to fix it in the later future. Good Game!
title: Amazing, And Beautiful Game

review: I play on pc but hop on my phone from time to time. This game is addicting, the world is beautiful and amazing. The story is intriguing, gameplay is ehhh but still fun (but I predict the gameplay might die down in the future). Although this is a gatcha game the chances you‚Äôll get someone good isn‚Äôt rigged. A lot of my friends including me started with really good starter characters (Xingling, fischil, and Barbara) without having to pay a single dollar and two of them even got venti. Other people might have their horror stories of exaggerating saying they remade 10+ accounts for good characters but I highly doubt it since I got it on my second re roll and my friends never had to. The game is still in the works but gosh is it amazing. Always something to do and isn‚Äôt promoting its stuff to say (HEY BUY THIS BUY THAT) like other obnoxious mobile games. I recommend playing on pc since the graphics and control is more interactive and visually pleasing if you have a pc.
title: For a game that‚Äôs known to make average mobile games this is actually a keeper

review:

title: Twin problems

review:
I have been looking for a game like Honkai Impact 3 for a long time but there are none around. Honkai Impact Will Always have a special place in my heart, so I looked up the creator, and found a game that was coming out this Sunday. I had Placed my order and It finally arrived. When The Game started downloading, It took about three hours. I don‚Äôt know if my internet was at fault. But it still made sense for it to take a long time, and such.

   But anywho! Let‚Äôs get on with the actual review of the game; At first glance, I already loved the graphics and the music. The first scene was amazing (Even if It was in 3d) I loved it. And The originality the game has is amazing, I never thought I would be so attracted by it. Games Like Honkai Impact, and This one Don‚Äôt deserve to be free. They have so much work put into them. It is really amazing And I hope I can be one to experience everything at first glance with everyone aswell! I am so thankful for everyone who worked hard in building this game.
title: It‚Äôs Amazing

review:
I‚Äôm not the type who usually enjoys MMORPG‚Äôs, they‚Äôre incredibly grindy and boring for me. However, Genshin Impact is one of the games that has changed my view on MMO‚Äôs. Not only are the graphics and characters great, but the story keeps your interest. I can‚Äôt wait to see how far this game will come along!!

Couple suggestions though!!

Is it possible to have friends on other servers? I wasn‚Äôt able to locate one of them because he was in Europe, and I was in the American server. If not, definitely should be a thing! :)

Another thing that would be really neat is romancing characters in game! Going on dates and gifting them things.

Some other suggestions would be to make talking to friends more accessible, even if we‚Äôre not in co-op, it would be nice to talk to the ones online. 

I think the co-op mode definitely needs some tweaks, but it‚Äôs getting there. It‚Äôs not the greatest game for co-op, because there‚Äôs a lack of things your friends can do with you. We should be able to do more quests with them. It would also be nice to be able to have avatar emotes in game. 

Another thing I think could need updating, is the camera option. There‚Äôs a lack of poses and features for it, as a creative person, it would be nice to be able to take more photos of my game and with my friends! 

But all in all, you guys did a really good job with this game, though there‚Äôs still a few things that need to be tweaked.
title: Updated Review

review: Genshin is fine. Aesthetic wise, it‚Äôs above almost every mobile game I‚Äôve played, and the first few hours are a blast. However, because it‚Äôs trying to be both a gatcha game and an open world game similar to others, it fails at both. It‚Äôs not good at being open world due to having to grind repeatedly, making the world feel less and less interesting by the day. And it‚Äôs not a good gatcha game by making it not worth paying under hundreds of dollars. But the biggest problem with genshin impact is how it punishes you. If you play through the game fast, it punishes you by not having any end game content, and if you play the game slow, it punishes you by having the difficulty go above what you‚Äôre capable of, making everything even slower. To get the most out of the game, you have to play as efficiently as possible while keeping a very specific speed as to not fall into the boredom that comes with moving too fast or slow, and that‚Äôs no fun. This might improve in the future, but that would likely take a year at least.
title: Not worth playing long term.

review: As of writing this I have just finished the chapter 1 prologue missions on PS4, mobile, and PC. I‚Äôm a heavy mobile gamer that dabbles into the console from time to time. This game has great longevity and playability... there are elements of a lot of games in this one including BOTW but it‚Äôs also very different than those games in a lot of ways. There is a unique gameplay and style to this game that you can‚Äôt find anywhere else.... from playing through the opening fights and missions I‚Äôve found the load times and quality of graphics on the PC far surpass the PS4 and mobile... my computer isn‚Äôt the best gaming computer either (acer nitro 5) runs seamlessly and feels more fluid.... this is also my first ‚Äúcomputer‚Äù game I‚Äôve played that‚Äôs not solitaire or some match 3 game... I highly recommend this game for everyone.... now if they can get on board with the Apple TV and run the game through that platform... I feel like there would be great potential!
title: Amazing game!

review: The game on pc is amazing, fun, graphics are nice gameplay is smooth and addicting  , the world looks very nice and there is a lot to explore and a fair micro transaction system, and most importantly it is not pay to win, devs are generous as well and give you quite a lot of premium currency for now, this seems unreal for a mobile game and it‚Äôs really a step in the right direction for a f2p game, my only complaint is that I cannot play the game almost at all on my iPhone 6s Plus, I have a black wall around me and it pretty much follows me, I cant really see more than 2 meters ahead, also I cannot open the settings menu either to try to lower graphics n stuff but this seems more like a glitch than a incompatibility with the device. I understand that the devs recommend iPhone 8 and above for it but I feel like it could be easily playable if I could get rid of that black wall, I would really appreciate if this will get fixed and I will give it a 5 star for sure.
title: Game is great on pc but unplayable on my device

review:
I‚Äôve been really enjoying the game so far on my phone. One of the biggest draws is that you build your party to your play-style. I love being able to switch to various party members to maximize the elemental combinations. You do have to be a bit lucky at times in getting characters that work for you but it‚Äôs fairly easy -so far- to get the means for the 10 items ‚Äúwishes.‚Äù It‚Äôs primarily single player ‚Äúworld‚Äù that allows you to have other join your world (or you theirs) once you reach a certain level so you have the option to co-op. There are times where certain mechanics are frustrating (you dodge an incoming attack that hits anyway and it becomes a chain of knockdowns with no escape) but that happens with any game. 
This is one of the few games that seem truly f2p and is one of the few games that has earned my respect enough to debate donating. I just wish the formatting of the PS4 account linking would allow for cross-save between mobile and the console
title: Very enjoyable and customizable

review: This game is honestly one of the best games on mobile, I‚Äôm not surprised it came from the creators of Honkai Impact. I don‚Äôt see it as a Breath of the Wild clone, it has its own uniqueness and even with similar functions when controlling the character I barely even think about the similarities. My only gripes with the game are the lag in certain places, especially when fighting against lots of monsters. The lag mostly happens whenever I use Klee. The voices and dialogue are great as well, but there are some places where the dialogue box either doesn‚Äôt match up with what the voice line of the character is saying or it‚Äôs incorrectly saying something. (For example, I am using the male character for the game, but Paimon refers to me as a ‚Äòshe‚Äô when talking about going into Stormterror‚Äôs Lair.) Overall not too bad of an issue, since this doesn‚Äôt happen all the time, but it would be wonderful if you guys could fix some of these bugs. Thanks!
title: Great Game

review:
AR 40 here
No matter if you are a hardcore player or a casual you will eventually hit AR 30 and you will start to run out of meaningful things to do in Monstadt and Liyue then you‚Äôre left with a few options, scavenge the world hope there‚Äôs a respawned chest or one you‚Äôve missed, wait for daily commission and resin, or pay the absurd price for resin that also increases in price. Don‚Äôt forget about co-op, with only 180 resin a day you can do 9 domains with your friends! Even if it took 10 mins to do one domain thats 90 mins of gameplay that you would have to wait 2hrs and 40 mins to even do one domain. You can play the game casually but if you don‚Äôt hit AR 40 your world bosses won‚Äôt drop parts that are randomized that gate your characters talents. We ask for more food(resin) they give us a bigger bowl what a joke! They are trying to address everything else but avoid resin and won‚Äôt tell us why or when. Even if you love this game can you justify 0.6 rates? Don‚Äôt get haggled with their little changes and their so called ‚Äúevents‚Äù that barely give anything... They will empty your wallet anyway so why can‚Äôt we ask for more? Oh right we ran out of money need whale friends to help!
title: Resin

review: I love the game and it‚Äôs functions. A small problem about it is the rates for 4 and 5 stars. Sure there‚Äôs a soft pity but as a f2p player primogems, which is the main currency for gaining  Intertwined or Unreconciled Fate for wishing and the only way of getting new characters besides the ones you get for free, but the character rates seem like they‚Äôre almost more common than others like in my main account I got more Noelle‚Äôs than I did getting Xiangling. I‚Äôm not hating about it but it‚Äôs a bit annoying to get some of the characters I already have than the ones I use on my team. Hopefully there‚Äôll be an update or some kind of event that helps with it. And I know that the rate up for certain characters are boosted in the featured banners but I don‚Äôt even get much of those featured characters than others like Razor or Ninguang. Either way great game and I hope there‚Äôll be a lot more content coming soon :D
title: Best Gacha Game I‚Äôve Ever Played

review:
So I I got the game and decided to check it out since the ads on it were really good. I really want to enjoy the game, but the entire game is just like, "no you don't get to enjoy this". 

The intro backstory is very VERY laggy. Like I couldn't really enjoy it and no matter how many times I close out the game and reopen it to see if it'll stop the lag, it doesn't. 

The second part is the game. The entire world is literally a black void, not even joking with you. There's nothing but black void. I was heavily confused and tried accessing the game controls and couldn't find them to see if it'll fix the black screen that I'm seeing. 

Last part is that Everytime the character steps in water, (can't see the water mainly because the entire world is a black void but know it's water because it keeps saying wet) it give this bright blob of light, not letting me see the character at all and it won't go away for like half a minute. 

These are the only problems I'm experiencing at the moment so I would really really REALLY be grateful if there was a way you guys could fix this because the game looks absolutely amazing from the ads. Since it's very much new to the public, I highly understand why this is happening. Which is why I'm still giving 4stars since this is very much excusable. 

Overall, I'll be fully ready to give a 5star when these little malfunctions are fixed. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Plz help

review: This game has been on my radar for a couple of months now. Gotta say I‚Äôm pleased with the results. It‚Äôs sort of a clone of botw but has enough of its on content and mechanics that make it stand on its own. The exploration in this game is amazing, and while there are cash grabs in game none of them seem to be required or really off scale the game like that (you‚Äôll just need to make sure grind if you don‚Äôt play). Top it all off with the fact that there‚Äôs a pic client and you can literally pick up where you left off from your mobile adventure. I think this ones a winner. Now I‚Äôm not sure why there isn‚Äôt any controller support for iOS devices l especially when controller use is a wide thing nowadays. Nothing wrong with the on screen controls just like the feeling of pressing buttons. That‚Äôs the only real gripe I have have with this game which is honestly minuscule. Peeps pick this one up, it‚Äôs new, it‚Äôs free, it‚Äôs fun

title: Really good! But needs some work

review: I usually never review apps or games of anything but wow, this game is SO AMAZING! And FREE!? I have always wanted to try and find a good, open-world RPG for mobile and came close to a few good ones but never one like this that hits the nail directly on the head! Countless hours of gameplay, good story, lush open-world, and BEAUTIFUL GRAPHICS! And again... completely FREE! Overall this game is so good, I would easily pay $15-$20 for it after knowing what I know about how good it is. The one thing that would really be the cherry on top of this deliciously crafted masterpiece, is if it were to have controller compatibilities. I know it‚Äôs still early on and still in the process of being fully developed and tweaked but, if later on down the road you could use a controller to play; that would make this the %100 best game I‚Äôve ever played on a mobile device. So please, in the future, maybe try to find a way to make that happen! :) A+++
title: AMAZING RPG!!!

review: Even though I rate this at 5 stars, I don‚Äôt recommend playing it on the phone because it runs at far fewer frames than on PC or a console and the game chews through your phone‚Äôs battery. Go grab Genshin Impact on PC or on the consoles and you would enjoy the game much more. This game is very much like Breath of the Wild in terms of being a sight seeing simulator, which is a good thing if you love exploring and searching for secrets, puzzles or random battles. If you didn‚Äôt like Breath of the Wild, Genshin Impact might not be your cup of tea. The rates for 5 star characters is extremely low but you can probably beat the game with the free characters given to you. So far the game does not have a pity system for 5 star characters so beware of spending any amount of money on the game, you could spend hundreds or thousands and not get a 5 star character. Avoid spending a lot on the game and have fun with what you‚Äôre given.
title: Excellent game on PC or consoles

review:
Okay so aside from this one critique (and it‚Äôs a big one) I love the game and it‚Äôs story... WITH THAT SAID; The adventure rank system and story progression system is WAY TOO NERFED. Instead of having a natural story progression block like just your characters levels and them being too weak, they have an outside Adventure rank level that you have to level up to progress the story... THIS IS HARDER THAN THE STORY. And for why? It literally takes you out of the experience and makes you feel like you‚Äôre doing grueling tasks. Why does it take a full week to unlock a mere 4
20 minutes of gameplay. It forces you to explore the world, which... understandable I guess but what‚Äôs going to be the fun in exploring the world if you‚Äôre forced to just so you can... play the game? 

But... other than that, the story, from what I‚Äôve been able to play, is super immersive. The character design is very well executed, and aside from the one huge overarching punishment for actually doing the story, it feels like the game rewards you in other ways :)
title: GREAT GAME... but...

review: Hello devs and other people from the Genshin impact staff team. I love the art work so points for that, love the fighting system so points for that as well and finally playing with friends! That‚Äôs gotta be the best part, now if u guys can make this even better that would be amazing. Alright anyways what the title of the comment says ‚ÄúController support for IOS‚Äù please add support for that, you guys already do that for pc and ps4 why not IOS. Please devs and staff members, add some love for the mobile community by adding controller support so we players can have a easy time enjoying your beautiful game with an controller instead of our fingers on a screen. Thank you for your time and I hope you guys have a beautiful life and health one as well.

review:

title: Huge Lag

review: This game is fun as I play it on my PC a lot. However when I take it to the mobile experience it is actually unplayable. I downloaded it on the iPad 5 generation which is well capable enough to run it, however it doesn‚Äôt work well. The download process is smooth, but the screen is just black in most places where color would otherwise be. In game, aside from constantly crashing, you actually can see in a small radius, but anything far away is just covered by the black screen. This radius doesn‚Äôt redeem it though because in fights, like the ones with storm terror for instance, you literally can‚Äôt see anything and the entire screen is black aside from icons. The same goes for dungeons as well. I really hope Mihoyo fixes this because my iPad is easily capable of running this even if it does have to be on the lowest settings. I don‚Äôt feel the need to buy a new iPad to play a game with a bug that can be fixed. This same problem is on my iPhone 6 as well.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work well on iPad 5th gen and iPhone 6

review: In game I my vision extends out at about a 9ft radius with everything beyond being completely invisible and black, along with water being invisible at all times. There are also a couple glitches where my character flashes after stepping into or out of water. Monsters also seem to flash brightly when they come into view making them hard to fight (the light fluctuates but covers a third of my screen) if this turns out to be a personal problem with my device (an iPad Pro) then I will simply delete the game but I would hope this can be fixed. I have been anticipating this game for about three months since I discovered you from your other project  Honkai Impact. Considering that games performance, I know Genshin Impact will do just as well and if not better considering it‚Äôs multi-platform and cross platform co-op. Five stars since I know when I can play it, it‚Äôs going to be bomb.
title: Glitches/Bugs

review:
Please read before downloading. This is an informative review that does NOT Gish about the game OR say it‚Äôs trash. I‚Äôm just informing you. This game is NOT what I was expecting when I downloaded it. But I was nevertheless impressed by this app. There are good things and bad things. I‚Äôll do good first. Also note: This game is really 5 stars. I only gave it one so you would read the darn review.(no one reads 5 star reviews)

1. Stunning graphics. They are amazing. Anime fans will appreciate the graphics.

2. Good mechanics and gameplay. They are simple, concise and well made.

3. Although there is a lot of it, the plot is compelling and keeps me engaged.

4. Free to play. Uh, devs? You could have made serious money selling this game. When I got it, I was thinking, ‚ÄúCan it be? A mobile game that isn‚Äôt a cash grab?

And now the bad parts of this game.

1. In the beginning, there was a lot of story and not a lot of gameplay. That has improved as I progressed. Now they mostly tell the story through the gameplay.

2.I did not expect so much ANIME. I don‚Äôt really like anime, so I was not pleasantly surprised by it. This was a pro as well because the graphics ARE really good, I just don‚Äôt like them.
 
3. The SPACE. The full game, not just the demo, takes up 6 GB on my phone. Why?

I highly recommend this game, but don‚Äôt take my word for it, PLAY!
title: This is NOT a review that doesn‚Äôt tell you about the game

review: Genshin Impact is, by far, my favorite rpg even though I‚Äôve only been playing for 2 days. However, although the game is amazing, and I love the feel of it. I have two problems. One, the game keeps crashing, now this problem I can understand because the game is new, there‚Äôll be some bugs. Not to mention the reason it keeps crashing could be my phone‚Äôs problem, not the games. However, the next problem I‚Äôm 99% sure is the games fault. I can‚Äôt login. I used to login using Game Center, but whenever I try to login it says ‚Äúthird-party not registered.‚Äù I don‚Äôt understand this because, first off, I‚Äôm using the same device so it‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm logging in from a completely new device. Secondly, Game Center has always worked, so why is it saying that now? I really want to login into my account because I‚Äôve made decent progress and don‚Äôt want to have to start over from the beginning. So please, if you know a way to fix this, please do share.
title: Can‚Äôt login

title: Hoooly hell

review:
Honestly, I had no idea what to expect going into this game, but I am very impressed with what you can do. It plays like Breath of the Wild, in terms of exploration and item creation, but it also throws in elemental effects and statuses. You acquire different characters through the story, each one with an assigned element and fighting style, and by switching your party members you can create various effects both in combat and on the environment. There‚Äôs a huge area to explore, even if you don‚Äôt work on story quests immediately. The only issue I‚Äôve encountered so far is that it does make my phone overheat if I play too long, and then the game crashes. But you can also play on other formats, so if your phone can‚Äôt hack it, switch to PC or console versions. 

All in all, I definitely recommend this game for anyone who like games with a focus on exploration and experimentation.
title: Best F2P experience I‚Äôve had on my phone.

review:
I‚Äôm not someone who is into anime (TV/movies or games), so when I saw people raving about Genshin Impact and decided to give it a shot, I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd be able to get into it... but I did. It doesn‚Äôt feel half-baked or like it was built for mobile; it‚Äôs a real, open-world game that just happens to also be available on mobile - that‚Äôs genuinely impressive to me for a new game.

That being said, my only complaint is the lack of controller support (which it sounds like may already be in the plans for the future). The touch controls are far better than most other adventure games that I‚Äôve played on iPhone, but I‚Äôd still much rather play with a controller personally.

My last bit of praise is for the granular adjustability of graphics settings - that‚Äôs something that I hope to see more of in future games (instead of just ‚ÄúLow‚Äù, ‚ÄúMedium‚Äù, or ‚ÄúHigh‚Äù settings).
title: Excellent game, one complaint

review: Excellent, immersive gameplay. Frequent updates. Quick and effective hot fixes. Devs respond to feedback. Diverse and unique characters. Only real complaint is the time it takes to update the client from App Store. Perhaps it‚Äôs just my internet but I gotta start the update process at the beginning of my day and watch it to make sure it finishes. Be nice if character switches didn‚Äôt drop characters during Dvalin fight but it‚Äôs not actually hard content.  <INSERT RANT> Nobody really states this but your artifacts basically define which characters you should build. Drop rates are consistent, yes, but stat rolls are horrid and fixed to grant much higher chance for all the least desirable values. Can‚Äôt ask for more from a gacha game though. It‚Äôs more about the grind and less about the gameplay. Late game is not for elitists set to obtain the perfect sets in a timely fashion. Best be prepared to stick to a character and a dungeon for the long-haul else you will be disappointed.
title: Best part of 2020

review: First off I have to say I love the game and I can‚Äôt take one flaw and rate it poorly, but if you can‚Äôt play multiplayer without completing quests you should be able to drop them and this is optimized by the Trials of Tianqiu. This mission includes one very difficult time based trial in which you have to kill an assortment of monsters. I have taken many many attempts and found it near impossible and after some research found that there are others experiencing the same troubles. I also went into another side mission underpowered that I‚Äôm still half way through. Can you please make it possible to quit quests or at least make it so you can still play multilayer without completing them because me and my friend were very excited to play this together and so far we‚Äôve waited 2 days after reaching adventure lvl. 16 and I still can‚Äôt finish my side quests.
title: Trials of Tianqiu

review:
I love this game so very much. The characters all have amazing stories, the graphics are lovely, amazing storytelling, and I love how even the NPCs seem to have a story to them. This game is great overall and I have nothing wrong with it. However, the game always crashes for me. I‚Äôm not sure why. (I‚Äôm on iPhone 8) I‚Äôll play the game for awhile and sometimes if I teleport, travel, do a wish, click on the paimon head, or anything the game will crash. During combat it‚Äôs happened a lot too and even when I‚Äôm on coop it crashes. It saves up to the point it crashes thankfully but it is very irritating having the game crash every 20-30 minutes. I would love to enjoy the game and play for hours on end but I simply cannot because the game crashing annoys me. I hope it is fixed soon because I do love this game and want to play it to its fullest ability.
Also the drop rate is HORRIBLE in this game. You‚Äôre lucky to get some of the rare characters in this hame.
title: Amazing game

review: I love this game! It‚Äôs really hard to play though, the sky is black so I  can‚Äôt see very far, I also can‚Äôt see the beautiful landscapes I have heard about. When fighting the storm dragon I can‚Äôt see a thing that is the landscape, me, the dragon, or the ground. I am stuck in that spot in the game since I can‚Äôt see it to attack it! Also when it‚Äôs playing the short videos to say what is happening or has happened the clip short circuits. title: I love it but major glitch!

review: I‚Äôve been looking for RPGs like this for forever! Everything I‚Äôve played in the past cannot compete with this game. So much to do and see! The free roam has always been on my list for a game but it‚Äôs usually a game with a price. This game is free and runs on my PHONE so well! I am so impressed and recommend this to everyone. The only downfall that I really don‚Äôt like about this game is that it‚Äôs basically pay-to-win. It takes a while of grinding, which I don‚Äôt have time for just 1 sitting of playtime, to earn enough to pull a wish. Then on top of that is the pity system. As I tell my friends about my experience with the wishes, ‚Äúthe pity system does not pity the poor‚Äù. After playing this game for over a month and pulling over 130 times including pull 10s, I finally got my first 5 star and luckily it was a character. Other than that, I have no complaints. I understand the profit made off of the wishes so what can I do. I love this game!
title: I‚Äôm so impressed!

review: I‚Äôm waiting for it to download but from what I‚Äôve seen, it reminds me of Love Nikki. With the Gacha style gameplay and the 7 nations, it also has an anime art style. So I might like it (I was addicted to love Nikki for the longest) I‚Äôll edit this one I‚Äôve played the game. Edit:  this game is totally amazing but I‚Äôm taking a star off for the fact that it‚Äôs pretty laggy for mobile, most likely because it‚Äôs 5.6 GB. It‚Äôs a great game and the world is really expansive. Its a bit like playing Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild. But I most certainly recommend this. Edit 2: this is my new favorite game, it‚Äôs a mix of some of the best games I‚Äôve ever played. The lagging is still a problem but it definitely doesn‚Äôt have anything to do with storage. It‚Äôs probably since it‚Äôs relatively new on mobile. So 10/10 recommended also, do your gacha in groups of ten so you always het a 4 star character.
title: It sounds interesting edit: ITS AWESOME

review: I absolutely love this game! It has amazing graphics and an exciting plot and almost everything you could want in a game! It really does feel like you are experiencing this game in real life. It is just a magnificent game in general. I will say though, you have to be prepared to face some though challenges or quests in this game, especially the timed ones. I think I have tried to pass one of the challenges almost 10-15 times already, and I still didn‚Äôt pass it. Those kind of challenges are kind of overwhelming to me.... I dunno if that‚Äôs just me or not though. That‚Äôs the only thing for me, so if you guys could maybe increase the time limit so that it‚Äôs a little less overwhelming... that would be great! Besides that, everything else is just incredible, I honestly could play this all week long if I could! PS: Paimon is sooo cute and amazing üòçü•∞!!!!
title: Love this game... just a tiny suggestion

review:
This is a well made game. It runs smooth on my iPhone se2020.  The environments are rich eye candy, making exploration the most fun part of the game. 

The story is pretty nice, but it is easy to lose focus due to the bordered sandbox style of the game, yet it is easy to get back on track with the menu of quests and the ability to have navigation to lead you to the right point. Fights are not boring, but gets a bit reputations. . .yet the game doesn‚Äôt revolve around fighting all the time and there is a ton of others things in the game to keep it feeling fresh.  

Regarding gotcha. . .I have never spent money on this and never will. I am pretty satisfied with what I have and still have fun! Some of the fights are a bit harder due to not having a plethora of five star everything, but with some patience and ingenuity, you can do what you need to advance in the game.

title: Love PlayStation hate Nintendo

However when I was trying this out on mobile, it took around 7gb and it‚Äôs understandable but once I logged in the rendering distance was around 5 yards and the background is just black. When you see a special affect like getting wet or catching on fire, there would be this lighting affect that‚Äôs really bright and will probably make you look away. The cutscenes are laggy. Also when your fighting Storm Terror for the first time, you‚Äôll be blind so it‚Äôs hard to kill it when you can‚Äôt see.
