title: Please fix the black screen problem that is occurring at this time I am writing this

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this game is amazing with each character‚Äôs unique skills to the layout of the world. Once you get to about AR 30, the game essentially turns into a waiting game.  Each day comes with 160 Resin which will fully replenish after a full 24 hours. It also comes with a daily quest reward of 60 Primogens. These Primogens are your average currency in order to pull or ‚Äúwish‚Äù characters from a randomizer. One pull is a staggering 160 Primogens.  To get a full ten wish stack, you need 1600, and after finishing all the quests, you‚Äôre only way to get continuous PG is through daily quests. It takes a full month just to get ten wishes and you may not even get anything you want. World Chests can sometimes give from 2,5, and 10 Primogens, which in the spectrum of wishes is a low offer. Mihoyo, please do something about Primogens like make the daily quest rewards larger.
title: A Waiting Game

review:
This game is one of the best gacha games I‚Äôve played, hell i can go as far as to say it‚Äôs THE best gacha game I‚Äôve played. However there are a lot of issues with it that should be fixed. 

Which is no problem but the lack of developer actions regarding these issues are really worrisome. One of the issues that become apparent later in the game is the resin system and while mihoyo has addressed this issue theY have done it in a way that doesn‚Äôt get rid of the core problem while making themselves out as the food guys by saying hey we‚Äôve heard your complaints. While i enjoy this game quite a bit I‚Äôm worried if I‚Äôm gonna be able to do that when i reach AR37 since it already feels like an empty open world with nothing to do because of the lack of respawnable chests and the resin system.(im AR35).

Hopefully they take a step in the right direction but right now I‚Äôm worried about this game‚Äôs future.
title: The developer feedback is holding this amazing game back

review: I enjoy playing this game very much so but with that being said there‚Äôs certain things in the game that could definitely be improved and fix such as the way of getting characters it‚Äôs ridiculous that I have to spend so much money to be able to actually get new characters. Because you only get main three characters at the beginning of the story and that‚Äôs it ! And I don‚Äôt really appreciate that not to mention as well the game dialogue talks about all 7 gods and yet we only get 2.Plus throughout the entire game you get to see and meet brand new characters that have a vision with a element on them but there actually not characters for you to unlock in the game! It‚Äôs just like a simple teaser. To the point that The final mission it‚Äôs like a prologue to continue the story furthermore but it doesn‚Äôt and it leaves you with a lot of questions. Plus having only 24 characters it‚Äôs very small amount when the majority amount is just fire type characters !
title: The game could be better

review: This is a stunning game and impressive for a phone to run smoothly. The mechanics of the fighting are well thought out and interesting enough to keep playing. I have only one gripe with the game and I‚Äôd be willing to change my rating from 4 to 5 with one change; add Xbox one controller connectivity to the mobile version, also please change the button mapping with B and A for the menus. It really throws me off playing the pc version when I have to hit B to choose an option, I‚Äôd prefer if it was A. I‚Äôd still want A to be jump when actually playing but in the menus A and B should definitely be swapped. The only thing that would make me play more at this point is the fact I hate touch screen controls for action oriented games even though the touch controls aren‚Äôt necessarily bad, but controller connectivity on the mobile version of Genshin and Honkai would seal the deal and land you guys a 5 star rating from me.
title: Beautiful design and mechanics but...

review:
Hello, 

I think the game is amazing but for me I personally felt that the coop function was lacking. I had joined with another friend and thought we would be able to explore together but it seems that the exploration depending on who‚Äôs leader really only benefits one person when it comes to chests, waypoints and even statues. I can‚Äôt investigate anything on my friends map nor can I help with the specters or tasks, which I did not think would happen. Another friend of mine had explained the devs made it this way so people couldn‚Äôt loot resources on other peoples maps which makes sense! However is there a way you can add a function that allows people to do these things (quests and chests, waypoints or even statues) depending on relationship points? >.< might not be possible and might be asking too much but asides from the coop function I really enjoy everything else there is!
title: Coop >.<

review: I just started playing this a few days ago and it‚Äôs become one of my absolute favorites. The details of the storyline, the graphics, the phenominal voice acting, the beautiful chracter designs (Amber‚Äôs got to be my favorite), everything was well made and overall amazing. However, there are problems with it crashing and lagging. When I first opened the game and it was the first opening cutscene, I had to restart my Ipad four times because it kept lagging and froze to the point where it crashed. I also noticed that I could only play the game for roughly 20 minutes, and then the game crashes. It happens all the time, and I hope you guys can fix this issue. This is one of the best games I have ever played, and it would be even better if you could fix the crashing/lagging issue as soon as possible so I, and many other players, can get the full experience without interruptions! Amazing game :)
title: LOVE THIS GAME! However...

title: This game

But as the days go on I‚Äôm getting kicked off all the time, graphics take to long to load(I was walking through buildings), when I open a chest I have to wait 15-1 min for its contents to come out, when I do a battle that has a certain amount of time to kill the targets I‚Äôm waiting for 30 seconds for them to start spawning(wasting time waiting for them to spawn which makes it hard to complete the challenge, I can never get a spear when wishing like(even for a 3 star spear it‚Äôs like trying to get a 5 star item, game freezes when fighting/ lags even though I have good wifi(stated in the beginning) and when I try to watch the cutscenes it freezes and the audio sounds like a Honda Civic without a muffler. The game is amazing how you fight monsters and there are quests and more it‚Äôs just when you level up your carecters to level 50 I got stuck because after I leveled up the carecters to level 50 I did the domino to go to world level 1 after the monsters leveled up more most of the monsters turned to level 40 and it was hard to get the items to make the carecters able to level up to 50-60 because I couldn‚Äôt get the items from buying from the shop because they were sold out i don‚Äôt now how to get the items it‚Äôs hard fighting a boss that‚Äôs level 40 because I‚Äôm level 50 so I‚Äôm stuck at level 50 world level 1 they also said that every time your adventure rank gets higher the monsters grow higher levels the game is really nice it‚Äôs just harder when you reach world level 1 because the monsters get to be level 40 or get higher levels

title: My favorite game but...

review: My favorite game of the year so far to be honest. I‚Äôve put a ton of hours into it. You hit a wall at adventure rank 38-40 where materials are near nonexistent and progression comes to a screeching halt. The devs create an absolutely amazing, beautiful world yet there‚Äôs no incentive to go explore when chests don‚Äôt respawn. Rewards for EVERYTHING in the game are too little. Resin required to progress and acquire gear with a super slow timer to get more. The gacha rates are some of the worst in the entire industry. Please please please increase rewards across the board and give us a reason to play the game daily for more than 10 minutes. People will stop playing even if they have the characters they‚Äôve always wanted if there‚Äôs nothing to DO with those characters. Weekly bosses shouldn‚Äôt have resin cost. Multiple active banners should be a thing. I‚Äôm holding on to hundreds of wishes because the banners only showcase new characters and forget older ones. So much love and attention went into this game yet it cripples itself at nearly every turn.
title: Incredible yet greedy game

review: It‚Äôs easy to see why this is the second most popular game right now. It‚Äôs like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Attack on Titan clashed. Open, inspired, breathtaking world. Astounding voice acting. Characters that are actually like-able. Storyline that keeps you immersed. The list goes on. The true achievement of this game is the fact that it‚Äôs on mobile. If I wouldn‚Äôt have played it myself I wouldn‚Äôt have thought it were possible. Yes it takes up a lot of space, yes it‚Äôs not worth downloading unless you have a newer generation phone that can handle it, and yes I‚Äôm sure some people will complain that it‚Äôs not an MMO. But if you‚Äôre a fan of the RPG genre with a ton of exploration, collectibles, crafting, lore, etc. this game is a must download. 6 hours in and I can wholeheartedly say that it‚Äôs a masterpiece. Thank you developers for giving us this crowing achievement in mobile gaming.
title: Lives up to its name.

review: My friends and I have been playing this game non stop, I first only downloaded it on my iPhone 8+ not knowing I could also download it on my pc. Since then I‚Äôve been grinding away trying to reach rank 16 to play with my buddies. I‚Äôve had 0 issues with this game and it runs so smoothly on my phone although it does have a tendency to make my phone pretty hot. My friend had some complications on his pc but that‚Äôs another issue we have. For IOS it runs beautifully and the game itself is beautiful. The music, the characters, the cinematics, and the gameplay are all so well thought out. I never thought I could play a game of this caliber on my mobile device, I‚Äôm excited to see what else is in store for mobile gaming. Kudos to the creators! I‚Äôm in love! I‚Äôve been getting all of my friends to download the game, I can‚Äôt wait till we all reach level 16!
title: You need to download this game!

review: The game itself is probably Six out of Five stars.  The story, writing, and art would all be too-shelf even for a paid game, but are kind of unheard-of for a free-to-play.  Unfortunately, it‚Äôs almost like there are two completely different teams at work, one trying to make the content as amazing and enjoyable as possible, and another trying to add enough boredom into the end-game to make you spend money.  The resources to obtain special characters are insanely expensive, it costs around $200 to guarantee you get a character you want, and rate you earn materials to level them up is also either very slow or very expensive.  Fortunately, you don‚Äôt need elite characters or a perfect team build to enjoy the main story.  So, it‚Äôs still a five star game, just a bit frustrating at times with the way character progression is throttled.
title: Five Stars Despite Flaws

review: Ok so first of all, at the time the servers went live I couldn‚Äôt open the game on my laptop. It keeps crashing whenever the warning pops up and so after 30 minutes of trying to open the game, I gave up and was rather disappointed because I couldn‚Äôt play the game on my laptop. The next best thing to do was to play it on my ipad which will probably have a worse graphic. I played the game and it was really good... well for me anyways. It is such a beautiful game and it‚Äôs 100% free to play. You can get 6 characters completely for free(the character you start woth and a character that can only be obtained before the 1.1 update)just by playing the game. I just wonder why people rated it a 1 star just because they can‚Äôt open the game and that was BEFORE the servers were live and of course some also rated it a 1 star because there device can‚Äôt handle the game smh.
title: Its great

review: I could go on for hours, No. Days, about how amazing and fun this game is there is the graphics, everything but... I do have two problems first problem, Cutscenes during the cutscenes my tablet glitches and the cutscene freezes and I can hear it but I can‚Äôt see it like the very first cutscene where you choose if you want to be the male or female it froze and it only worked when I chose the name and gender, so that‚Äôs the first problem. Here is the second problem, When I‚Äôm in the middle of battles my game freezes and then kicks me out, Let‚Äôs say I‚Äôm fighting a Hilichurl camp I get halfway through and I have like two Hilichurls left then my game freezes I get kicked out I go back to the game I have to go through the start screen again and I have to fight the entire Hilichurl camp AGAIN... title: It‚Äôs super fun, Other than two problems.

review:
Great. Absolutely great. For a mobile game, off the charts. Gameplay is good, graphics are good, story is good. But, the main thing I hate about this game is the wishing system. It‚Äôs so hard to get the character I want to play because of the rng. I‚Äôd rather it be a confirmed purchase. You could spend hundreds of dollars and still not get the character you want. To me, that‚Äôs insane. Please fix this because this is the one out of two things that‚Äôs tearing down the game so badly. The other problem is the gems. The gems drop often, but not often enough. It‚Äôs 160 a roll and 1200 for 10 rolls together. On average you get like 20 from a mini-quest. I think the quantities need to be changed. 

So if you‚Äôre reading this, I highly recommend getting this game. It‚Äôs f2p, but if you want a high ranked character, you‚Äôll have to pay some. The amount I don‚Äôt know but likely a lot. The free characters are good, and you will definitely get at least 2 bonus characters in the beginning.
title: Amazing game but...

review: Honestly, I love this game or I *would* love this game if it weren‚Äôt for the fact that I can‚Äôt see very far because of the black that‚Äôs covering the scenery, and sometimes my screen goes completely black I thought it was because of my phone so I restarted it, redownloaded the game all that but it still did not work. I even tried to use another account but it still stayed the same! Also the cut scenes are very laggy but maybe that‚Äôs from my device but usually it‚Äôs pretty smooth for other games so it‚Äôs kinda weird that it‚Äôs very laggy for only this game. I was so disappointed when I couldn‚Äôt get it to work the game works with other people just fine and it looks amazing but I was really upset when I couldn‚Äôt play it myself, sure gameplays are an option but it isn‚Äôt the same as playing it myself. If you could try and fix this issue because it happens with other players too that would be great, but until then I can‚Äôt play the game unfortunately. I‚Äôm begging you to fix this it‚Äôs quite aggravating.
title: A few problems

review: When I got the game and read the reviews, it didn‚Äôt seem all that bad, however: I have had to delete more then eleven games/apps off my phone to reduce, not eliminate, the severe lag in imagery and audio. Although the game animations are very well established, it‚Äôs not worth it. It took up so much room in my phone my contacts had to be deleted and my group chats wouldn‚Äôt work. The last straw for me was when I found out my camera and my flashlight didn‚Äôt turn on. Immediately, I deleted the game and wrote a review. Now, I must retrieve all my contacts, apps, chats, etc. It‚Äôs not an online roleplay game, at least, that‚Äôs what I thought I was getting. I only had the app for a few hours so I‚Äôm not sure if you can invite people to your game. Also, though the character art is beautiful, you can only access two characters per gender. It‚Äôd be much more profitable to make custom avatars so people can have the option to complete tasks and roleplay at the same time. Most importantly, please rid of the lag. It is absolutely unnecessary to sacrifice so much for a silly game that‚Äôs not even the slightest addicting.
title: Why??

review: For me there is no other word I can use to describe this game other than masterpiece. It truly is one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played and can‚Äôt believe how incredibly well it runs on mobile. The attention to detail is ridiculous, graphics are eye candy, the music is serene and well thought out in terms of placement in the game, the dialog isn‚Äôt boring and there is plenty to do and collect. There is a great mix of missions that range from taking a while to just a few minutes so you can always be progressing even if you can‚Äôt play for very long at a time. I‚Äôve never played a free game where I wanted to spend money because otherwise I borderline feel guilty for playing for free. This is how in-app-purchases should be, make a great game so I ‚Äúwant‚Äù to spend money, not forced to. These developers deserve IAP because of the sheer quality going on here.
title: Masterpiece

review:
Seriously. Are you kidding me? I went to the most critical reviews, and people say this is P2W? Have you seen a real P2W game? This is so stress-relieving, it really gets me hyped whenever someone mentions this game. I started playing right after I pre-ordered it, and I‚Äôve been hooked ever since! This game is definitely F2P, although gacha is addicting, I can easily overcome the temptations and play free. Pity isn‚Äôt hard to get, although would like it a bit lower but it‚Äôs reasonable. The game‚Äôs graphics are amazing, and I started to sightsee on the game. What‚Äôs funny, is that the game just released and there‚Äôs so much more potential to this. The music is amazing, the character design, the art, the sceneries, the fights, virtually everything. This has been the missing key in my life, and I am very grateful for all the happiness it brought me.

Hopefully more to come!
title: F2P open world. All that was missing from my life.

review:
First off, if you don‚Äôt have the recommended hardware don‚Äôt bother getting this game because this is the most graphics demanding game I have ever played on an iPhone. 

I spent about $200 on this game even though I didn‚Äôt have to spent a penny. The world is just so large and beautiful and the game is just so good I wanted to pay for it. There are so many details in this game that are extremely well thought out. For example, taller character will stand in shallower water but shorter characters will be swimming; all wild animals can be killed for meat but if you shoot at a bird the nearby birds will fly away; ducks can fly but are usually reluctant to fly away at first. 
The entire world contained in this game is amazing: with cities, villages, rivers, oceans, ruins, forests, plains, and so much more. The game mechanic is simple and satisfying; if you get past prologue you‚Äôll know if this is the game for you.
title: Great game

review: This game is great and the story a interesting and fun, it‚Äôs easy to follow and invest yourself in it. That said, I wish that you could sell or trade at the stores as well as buy clothes for certain characters. And another big thing is the controls, I like the controls and game mechanics, BUT I would like it even more if there was a way to edit your button layout, because I sometimes randomly attack when I‚Äôm trying to turn around because the attack or jump buttons are in the way, getting a button layout editor built into the game would be so much better specially for gamers who might be handicapped. For me personally it would be even better if it had a DualShock interface since you can connect an actual controller to Apple devices, but the button layout would be easier honestly, please add it.
title: It could use some things

review: Absolutely great game... except if you do not have an iPhone 8 or higher. Please please please, add a ultra low graphics end setting for iPhone 6s+ users or fix bug where the screen goes completely black due to particle effects (rain/wind) or a flash/bursts of light are shown from particles of chests and enemies (wet effect causes screen to burst with light making it impossible to see that area, also applies to chests).  Lastly, render distance is very limited so beyond a certain radius around character, you cannot see anything besides pitch black, making it difficult to find chests or anemoculus.  Also at certain heights in the games and in dungeons, screen is completely black making it impossible to play, so can‚Äôt farm equipment upgrades. Don‚Äôt recommend the game for people if you do not have right specs for the game and have these outcomes since it might ruin your experience but if not, great game.
title: URGENT: iPhone 6s+ Users Patches Please!

title: Very Nice

review: The story is too short there‚Äôs not much to do in world,the enemies are repetitive and the whole game is actually repetitive...I am just waiting for blue protocol after I use up the daily blessing I paid money for it‚Äôs going where it belongs in the trash bucket. Basically you do this short story in this anime breath of the wild game,explore a massive but empty map with respect enemies, dungeons are limited because of this stuff called resin you earn so can‚Äôt do those all the time..and you earn new characters IF you‚Äôre lucky...or like me you‚Äôll get the same character you never use a bunch and get these pointless things called constellations...I honestly like dragon raja better. title: Dumpster fire

review: This game is awesome. It‚Äôs aesthetically beautiful, a great story line, and extreme fun. I love that it‚Äôs an open world type of game play as well. You not only get to follow the gameplay but go off and do whatever you‚Äôd like to do on your own. I‚Äôve been debating for a while whether or not to get this game and I‚Äôm really glad I did. I haven‚Äôt been this invested in a mobile game in a LONG time. There is a lot to do in the game and they don‚Äôt make it extremely difficult to reach certain levels you need to be able to continue on with your quests which is awesome. I haven‚Äôt noticed any annoying ‚Äúyou have to buy this to do this‚Äù type of things in the game either. Everything you need is easily obtainable through game play. I think my favorite thing in the game is the wind gliding, it‚Äôs really fun and relaxing lol. 10/10 I definitely recommend.
title: It‚Äôs beautiful & so fun!

review: Wow, I am thoroughly impressed with this game. Do you have a fully open world R.P.G. playable on one‚Äôs smart phone is is fantastic. I really enjoy everything about this game so far and I haven‚Äôt ran into any issues such a bugs or lags yet which is a ‚Äúwin-win‚Äù in my book. I can‚Äôt really get enough of ‚ÄúGenshin Impact‚Äù and I enjoy playing it while saving up my crystals in ‚ÄúHonkai Impact‚Äù which is a really great game in my opinion. I‚Äôve been playing ‚ÄúHonkai‚Äù for over a year now and I‚Äôve been looking for a game to occupy me while I build up my Stamina and save crystals ( since I get a little bored and start spending them after a certain point) and this game is more than going to do the job! I think ‚ÄúMihoyo‚Äù have outdone themselves with this game and for any one looking for an excellent game this one I feel has a incredibly strong potential to be one!
title: ‚ÄúAn enjoyable game experience‚Äù

review:
I‚Äôve been playing mobile titles for about 12 years now. I‚Äôve seen hundreds upon hundreds of them come and go, and there are many that are brilliant. This title is effortlessly among one of my favorite mobile games‚Äîand games in general‚Äîof all time. It proves that a free-to-play title can have a business model that isn‚Äôt aggressive or exploitative, and that the base free experience doesn‚Äôt have to be a struggle. 

The graphics are astounding in how vibrant and crisp they are. The frame rate is silky, and the combat is so responsive. I‚Äôve found myself gleefully running around in random directions, curious about what I‚Äôd find next. All of this, and it fits in my phone. An experience this well-done fitting into a device that can slip in my pocket is mind-blowing.

Thank you. Thank you for proving that the free-to-play mobile space can be a great place to play.
title: An absolutely monumental achievement.

review: Genshin Impact is the best game I‚Äôve ever played in my phone, it‚Äôs graphics are astounding for a mobile game, the sound effects are high quality and, unlike most games, the voice actors are impeccable. The story so far is looking promising, and the game plays very smoothly, and on top of that it‚Äôs very fun, whereas with other mobile games I give up out of boredom, but with this I just want to play more and more of the game. All of the characters are different in their own ways, each of them unique and lovable, keeping you engaged with them. The only flaw I see with this game is that I don‚Äôt find an actually difficult fight often, but when I do it‚Äôs really fun. Overall, great job to all of the people who worked on this and to those who helped make this possible, keep up the amazing work, and don‚Äôt stop what you‚Äôre doing now!
title: The Best Mobile Game I‚Äôve Ever Played

review: I‚Äôve been a long time fan of Honkai Impact so I was excited when I found out they were developing another game I knew it was gonna be great. Honkai Impact has always blown my mind how far they push mobile gameplay, to see Genshin Impact go even further is unbelievable. This game functions like a full game and has so many tasks to explore and secrets. I‚Äôve only been playing for a few hours and have already collected tons of lore snippets to read. Yes it‚Äôs a gacha game but it‚Äôs also an incredible game to play free and I‚Äôve been happy with my rolls even without spending. Knowing the devs history with Honkai, I don‚Äôt believe the micro transaction system will wind up being too money hungry to enjoy. Obviously it‚Äôll take some consistent game time to keep rolling but with this gameplay I am A-Ok with that! Amazing job guys you really know how to impress
title: I expected a lot but am still astonished

review:
This game looks soo good and based on what people said (anime Zelda) I got excited to play it. After downloading the game I entered the game to 1/3rd of the screen blacked out. I thought it was normal at first and continued playing. However, paimon (an npc character) kept pointing to the endless void and commenting on the ‚Äúview‚Äù. At one point there was a roar in the distance and paimon described whatever it was to be something huge, again I couldn‚Äôt see anything but a blacked out background. I was so bummed because I missed what to me sounded like a dragon flying above me?

 Anyway the game plays out like a 90‚Äôs game who has to load every single pixel, imagine silent hill but with a black fog instead. Some animations also turned into a bright glowing white orb that covers my whole entire character (I don‚Äôt even know why or how). All in all I‚Äôm pretty sure it‚Äôs not a bad game, but it needs to be heavily fixed before I can play again. I play on my iPad Pro so this might not be the case for other devices.
title: Why does it load like silent hill (but with a black fog)?

review: This is a free to play a game that has the most elbow grease put into it that I‚Äôve ever seen. While far from perfect, with a limited number of characters - the gameplay by itself has the most effort I‚Äôve seen put into the core game, to deter from the common monotonous gameplay of other games of its type. MTX are present as well as the common Loot rarities and content-based leveling up ‚Äì but none of this is necessary. In terms of game interaction there are a lot of borrowed elements here, however some of the games design decisions in interface are so well thought through and refined for a F2P game. My one criticism is that you won‚Äôt run into a point where there is legitimately very little to do. I think this is going to round out over time with more characters in weapon types, however they aren‚Äôt here yet. Also the world itself can use more variety.
title: Big effort F2P Game

review: So I‚Äôm gonna be honest I didn‚Äôt know what to expect from this game. A friend suggested it so I downloaded it and started playing. I got addicted to playing even though I enjoy multiplayer more than single player. There are many great characters you can play with, and all have their own unique abilities. The only complaint i have is I would like to hear our main character‚Äôs voice in cutscenes, but otherwise its a great game limited at times, but amazing fun. There is puzzles to elemental reactions as well as a crafting and cooking system. Not everyone might agree with me, but i suggest just trying it out for yourself. They also added an multiplayer system you just have to get through a certain bit of the game first. Well anyways neat game and I‚Äôll continue to enjoy it even if I‚Äôm stuck on mobile version of the game.
title: Great Open World

review:
I love this game to bits! I can‚Äôt get enough of it..but there‚Äôs still a few issues tho:

-The monsters...Fighting monsters are entertaining but it gets annoying when the monster leaves you alone at random..then you try and fight it again and guess what? It‚Äôs entire hp is back up. This frustrated me during some quests with difficult bosses..

-The frame rate...Even with strong internet connection, it sometimes crashes due to the graphics. I thought it was my storage at first but no...If I am with many items and I am fighting many creatures and their animations and stuff, as well as fighting animation of the character, can crash the game or if I am talking to npc‚Äôs..the game can bug out before crashing. I apologize if I ramble but this was a main issue I had.

-loading time for cutscenes, areas, etc. can be a bit buggy and force me to restart my game..this too is frustrating since it can reset quests and interactions of characters..And even erase progress I have gotten..also some things don‚Äôt load completely in, example..Investigating a barrel and something pops out but it doesn‚Äôt appear at or it appears later..or it crashes the game, and cause more problems in playing.

I apologize if I am complaining..But thank you for making this wonderful gift of a game! I fell in love with it and I can‚Äôt wait to see what more it holds.
title: Successful! I like it. But..

review:
So far I‚Äôve been enjoying the game,  it‚Äôs not quite an mmo which is what I was hoping for but honestly an action RPG that is very well done.  The story plot so far is quite entrancing.  The artwork you can tell the developers definitely put a lot of work into it.

On mobile it‚Äôs a bit annoying to move around as the camera continuously zooms back in I do wish there was a way to lock the camera zoom to where you want it.

The attacking is actually one of the best I‚Äôve seen as far as mobiles go.  I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a heck of a lot easier on a console/pc.  

***I do wish it was out on the switch or on stadia because using a controller would probably make it a lot easier to move. ***

There is a gacha system but honestly they pack you to the teeth near the start of the games first chapter with enough currency that you can do quite a few summons without spending a dime.  I‚Äôve even pulled a few 5*s. 

Artwork - 5/5
Combat - 4/5 (probably 5/5 on console and pc)
Story - 5/5
Gacha system - 2/5 (you can play without using it)
Bonus - almost fully voiced over - 5/5
Overall - 5/5 because it‚Äôs one of the most wonderfully done games in a long while.  There needed to be a new RPG with a new story and there just hasn‚Äôt been any that grasped my attention.  

Again this is strictly my opinion.
title: Honest opinion

review: I have been following this game for quite some time now and now that I can finally play it, I can say proudly I am not disappointed. This game is fantastic even on mobile, though the small controls are a bit hard to get used to. Still this game performs well and looks amazing. My only problem with this his game is the gacha rates. They are extremely low and you would have to spend $200 for a pity pull and that‚Äôs not even guaranteed that you would get a 5 star character and could just be a 5 star weapon. There needs to be some tweak to the gacha system or even increase the rates at this point. Other than the bad gacha rates this game is fun and honestly you don‚Äôt need 5 star characters to beat endgame content, 4 star heroes perform just as well as long you have pulled multiple of them to ascend them.
title: Only drawback is the gacha system/rates

review: When I first pre-registered, I honestly didn‚Äôt know what to expect, but I can say for a fact that I am addicted! I‚Äôd visited the Genshin Impact website several times, and even though I missed the beta, I‚Äôm still satisfied that I stuck along to experience it! It has the vibes of an anime Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, but with the character collection aspect(s) of an anime gacha-style game (i.e. you spend in-game currency that you earn or purchase in order to roll for a chance of obtaining new characters as well as items). The way the music changes when running or in combat is amazing~ Honestly, even though there‚Äôs micro-transactions, if you explore enough, I feel like you could earn anything- Just have to be willing to put in the time for games like this! Also, I have my hopes up regarding controller compatibility for the mobile versions!
title: In LOVE With This Title!!

review: I have an iphone 6s and i‚Äôve never had problems running games like this with large open worlds (heck, i play dragon raja using data all the time). And though the description says it‚Äôs recommended for iphone 8 and up, its pretty much unplayable and, trust me, it‚Äôs not even worth trying if you have an older device like mine. first of all it crashed a bunch in the beginning. after the crashes i was finally able to get to the downloading screen. but after it downloaded the cutscenes lagged  so bad i had to close the app. once the cutscenes were over i got to the game play and to my surprise the entire environment wasn‚Äôt loaded. there‚Äôs just a huge void and you can only see a tiny portion of the world at once. not to mention it takes about 5 minutes to load the game every single time. from the reviews, it sounds like a great game and I want to give it five stars. but, until i can actually play the game, i‚Äôll leave it at two stars for now and hope it gets fixed
title: Virtually unplayable for older devices

review: Third review, more complaining. This time, it‚Äôs with stormterror. Idk how anyone is supposed to beat the boss without being able to see anything. I can‚Äôt see anything and I‚Äôve been fighting him multiple times for about half an hour. However, there was one time when I could see a red indicator showing it might be close but it went away fast. I still also can‚Äôt see the cutscenes and part of the background is dark. title: Still a problem part 2

review:
I‚Äôm playing on PC, which is identical to the mobile game, and so far it‚Äôs pretty great. The story is engaging and there‚Äôs tons to do outside the story. I‚Äôm still very new to the game at adventure rank 12, but I‚Äôve put in probably about 10 hours. My progress is very slow, because there‚Äôs just so much to explore that I keep getting sidetracked wandering around the map finding new things midway through the story missions.

As far as p2w elements, I‚Äôm sure this game has them, but at my level of progression, it‚Äôs hardly even noticeable. To get new characters, it seems you have no choice but to pay for premium currency or whatever, but even with only the characters you get for free, it still feels like I‚Äôm playing premium game.

Also, my phone won‚Äôt run this game, but it‚Äôll run on pretty much any PC with integrated graphics.
title: Great game so far

review: I downloaded genshin to just see what it was about and now I just can‚Äôt put it down. I often find that it‚Äôs 2 am and I just can‚Äôt stop playing. I love the amount of info on everything it makes it so you don‚Äôt have to look at a wiki page half of the time, also the leveling up seems really polished it is made so you don‚Äôt have to pay for a single level up. One last thing I really enjoy that I wish more games had is the element system I love making combinations just to stack an some extra damage, the characters style and personality‚Äôs also seem to go with the element that they have.
