title: I just can‚Äôt put it down

review: I am I‚Äôm love with this game as someone who always is looking for a new game that‚Äôs exciting has great animation and that has a compelling story that makes me want to follow it and played more to find outWhat was gonna happen this is the game this is a game of been waiting for for years like I have no words for how beautifully it‚Äôs animated the voice actors that are in it like some other voice actors also voiced in some of the best animes out there and that‚Äôs not even it just everything flow so smoothly my only complaint would be is that lag sometimes is if you‚Äôre in like a bottle with more than like three or four like Hillitrils or creatures like that but other than that it‚Äôs really beautiful there‚Äôs a lot of really cute character is a lot of really relatable story lines the jokes are pretty funny and all the characters look amazing
title: I have no words

review:
I‚Äôm playing this game on an iPad Pro, and the game is in bad need of controller support.  As it is, the game is difficult to play simply because the on-screen controls are uncomfortable on a large screen.  For a game which involves platforming and aiming and which also has a PC port and a PS4 port, ignoring controller support is inexcusable.  Hopefully, this will be patched in soon -this would warrant a few more stars for this review.

The gacha system for obtaining new allies is brutal - some of the lowest rates you‚Äôll find (0.6% for a 5*).  They don‚Äôt seem to be super generous with currency at the moment, so you should go into the game expecting to be playing with the story-provided characters and one or two other 4* characters unless you commit to whaling.

The game occasionally decides it wants to take several minutes to load (on a white screen), so if that happens to you, you probably just need to wait a few more minutes before trying to restart the game.  It doesn‚Äôt happen EVERY time you load the game, but I‚Äôve encountered this several times so far.  Bug?

Frustrating controls and brutal gacha aside, the game looks very good for a gacha game and is actually fun when you‚Äôre not wrestling with the clunky controls.  To me, the game feels more like Sword Art Online: Lost Song for the PlayStation Vita than anything else - right down to the flying in Lost Song and ‚Äúsingle player MMO-like‚Äù feel that all the Vita SAO games had.
title: Needs controller support and some optimization

review:
For a mobile phone game, this is phenomenal.

Hell, even for a console or PC game, the open world experience is very immersive and captivating. 

The gameplay is solid, and although it incorporates more traditional gacha-style game progression, it does so in a way that isn‚Äôt too obnoxious. You can easily progress whether you spend real currency or not.

A lot of the fun for me is in the story and the gameplay. It‚Äôs surprisingly good story and character voice-overs will keep you entertained, as an RPG should.

My biggest complaint is probably that is just a bit too open world, and there aren‚Äôt too many activities to keep your interest for more than an hour or two at a time. This is a fine game to help you relax, but as a grind, it can be kind of boring. 

There is a lot of ambition to this game, and I can‚Äôt wait to see just what they plan to release in the upcoming months, especially in terms of multiplayer. For what it‚Äôs worth, there is a lot to do right now, and I recommend diving in now while it is so popular. 

To summarize, it‚Äôs among the top 5 most gorgeous mobile games you can play. Cross-platform, and very little bugs and gameplay issues, but you will spend a lot of time exploring and wandering the big open-world, so be prepared for a lot of silence and atmosphere.
title: Absolutely amazing!

review: Sure, the game is indeed fun but once you hit AR30 you‚Äôll come to a realization that the resin system is poorly implemented and doesn‚Äôt even compare to other gacha stamina-like systems. You have to waste more money just to achieve your weekly battle pass objective. The drop rate on the characters you want are lower than any other gacha game I have played and funny enough the pity system only kicks in after 90pulls which is about $200 and you don‚Äôt even obtain your 5-star character you want but a 5-star Weapon instead. They aren‚Äôt even going to do anything till people have complained enough about their bad practices, even the Chinese community have rated this game a 4.7/10, so that should tell you something since the game is created by a Chinese Company. Either way, they aren‚Äôt going to release any updates till Nov 11, so a month of being in a pathetic state till they maybe fix the game. I suggest you stay away from the game for a few major updates and then come back to play it and hopefully the game is in a better state.
title: Fun game but gated with terrible Resin system.

review: This game is so well made, I can‚Äôt deny it. I‚Äôve only played for a day (probably less) and it‚Äôs amazing. I‚Äôm adventure level 13, the storyline is worthwhile, the quests are fun, I‚Äôm already hooked. Though some monsters may seem hard when you first encounter them, they get easier over time. I think the strength of some monsters makes it more enjoyable. Though, in some areas, like Liyue pass and ruins, the monsters are really strong, but, if you sneak past the monsters, you can get all the shrines and towers! I love it so far, I‚Äôm so excited for v1.1. The only problem I see is that on mobile, it crashes a lot, which can be really annoying. Earlier today I was fighting the mech monster for the dragon tear in the ruins, and my game crashed mid-battle, and when I opened the app again, their hp reset. I basically see no other problems.
title: Absolutely lovely

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact and was told by an online friend to play this game. Apparently my friend abandoned the game due to his lack of playing games, and he mention to me there‚Äôs too much religion in the game, and he hated the game. Dang dude. It‚Äôs like literally a game you need to play for little to few days if you want to like the game. Some people has no self-restraint when it comes to playing games. ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Anyways, my point is I am in love with the game, story and dialogue is good so far, acting is interesting, and as an artist that draws, and paints traditionally, and digitally. I am impressed with graphics, animation, and art style of the characters. Paimon is so cute and the other characters. 

What could use some improvement is that I‚Äôve been experiencing some lag. While playing which is interrupting my game experience, and also the app crashing is another problem which I gave this game 4/5 stars. 

Also this is not feedback, but it would be lovely if you make this game available on MacOS and PC which would be amazing. Because I‚Äôm worried about using up a lot of storage on my iPhone 8 with 64 GB. So it would be a good idea if someday if you developers make MacOS and PC version of Genshin Impact. 

Overall, impressive game, animation, dialogue, characters, art, and story but the lag, and app crashing should be improved.
title: Impressive game but experiences lag & crashes

review: My iPad is only a year old and struggles to play cinematics at all. Many issues on the speed and performance. I did download it on my ps4 and so far I love it. I am still new to the game but so far it feels like it has the potential to be a masterpiece. It reminds me of several games, including breath of the wild, but it also has its own unique vibe that is pretty fun. Paimon can be annoying at times, mainly for the constant reference to herself in the third person. Again though this game has pulled me away from some big triple a titles, as well as others like warframe. My only fear is that it may get a bit repetitive, like warframe did. However I love the freeroam, it helps with that issue. Over all, a great game highly recomend, ifyou have a console, or the newest and best tablets/phones to play on.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work well on ipad 6th gen, but it is GREAT still

review: This is the first gacha rpg game I‚Äôve ever played.( and the first game I‚Äôve played with this kind of movement and combat style) but I have to say this is my favorite game I‚Äôve ever played! The combat is stupidly fun and the quests and dialogue are way better than I expected them to be! I‚Äôve heard a lot of people complain about paimon but I honestly love her, she adds a cute but sassy aspect to the game! I must admit that I honestly hate anime, but this game doesn‚Äôt really feel like anime(even thought all of the characters are in the style) and I might say I love it even more! I like the cute and tough aspects a lot of the characters have, I just don‚Äôt really like the sexy aspect. I mean Lisa flirts with you on many occasions even though everyone in the game addresses that you‚Äôre under age, so if you could change that then this game would be perfect
title: A great first impression!

review: I first downloaded this game because I beat Breath of the Wild and my good friend recommended it. I was hoping to start it before remote work but I wasn‚Äôt able to....it takes up SO much of your data! I have a lot of pictures and school related things on my phone I can‚Äôt delete, so if it comes down to it the app is the first to go. My game started after about 5 hours, when I opened it....it‚Äôs the anime knock-off of Breath of the Wild. The plot is a little different, but having your main character lose their memory and need to travel across the open-world to fight monsters and visit shrines/statues is LITERALLY the same. Even some of the monsters look similar to Nintendo‚Äôs design. I think the app is great for someone who wants a fun open-world game and unlimited data, but I would consider spending money on a different game that doesn‚Äôt require in-game purchases for a better experience!
title: The Knock-Off Zelda: More Data and In App Purchase

review:
I was recommended this game by a sweet boy over at GameStop when I was trying to figure out if I should try and purchase a PlayStation (EVENTUALLY).. 
Me; a current iPad user who is fully taking advantage of this beautiful game... and I am consistently speechless. 
Even though I was concerned about not being able to efficiently play the game without an controller. Genshin really did amazing with allowing me to be successful while using the controls via iPad (touchscreen).  
I could not wait to play this game and I am just ultimately shocked with the performance and easy utilization of playing cross platform with touch controls.
Although I feel that using a handheld device may be more difficult to navigate basic foundations of the game (locating quests, using combos, dealing with a small screen). The game is truly converted to a form that makes me.... speechless.
Mihoyo and the team did a beautiful, outstanding job with the cross platform diversity and conversion to held held.
I hope I‚Äôll be able to see this beautiful game on large screen one day...
And keep in mind, they the adventurers run slower so you can see the detail and beauty of the game. 

iPad 5.
Rare lag (only when there is a change in Lands).
Make sure to update. 
Make sure to close all apps before playing.
title: Speechless... (iPad Platform)

review: I can‚Äôt stress how good this game is. The mechanics are amazing and I have yet to find a noticeable flaw in any part of it. This games open world concept and diversity of characters and powers reminds me a lot of Skyrim or Fable. The voice acting is enjoyable and I like the plot that has been given. Of course something I notice over and over again that I absolutely love is how the characters don‚Äôt necessarily run out of materials. Like how Amber doesn‚Äôt need to stack up on arrows because she materializes them with no usage of stamina. This game is easy going and very beautiful and detailed. I also haven‚Äôt come across a point where I get tired of playing, everything about this game is addicting and entrances me every second. By far has become my favorite game I have ever played on a mobile device even if it‚Äôs a large app.
title: Best game in a while

review: I have to say... this game is absolutely gorgeous. Everything about it is extremely eye pleasing. I was looking for a game like this for ages, and I‚Äôm so glad I managed to come across it before servers launched. There have been minor glitches I‚Äôve experienced, but nothing that effected the quality of the game in any way. I do have a question though...or more of a suggestion. I keep receiving Tons of Mora coins as rewards and such, but I can‚Äôt find anything to spend it on? This could just be because I haven‚Äôt gotten as far as others in the game, but nevertheless it would be cool to be able to do more with them. Otherwise, this game has far exceeded my expectations! Particularly in the lore and character design (I have to say, Venti, Noelle, and the main character are by far my favs in terms of design!) I cant wait to see what‚Äôs in store!
title: Breathtaking

review: It has the things you hate, it has the things you love. It‚Äôs F2P and P2W either choice is viable.  They are constantly updating and introducing QoL things. My major gripe is the quest dialog that isn‚Äôt 100% skippable and they are changing that, so I can‚Äôt really gripe too much.  There are currently (1.1) two zones and even though I‚Äôve explored all over and done everything, my achievement book says otherwise. I hope this company continues on the track they are on. The ‚Äúenergy‚Äù isn‚Äôt really energy. It doesn‚Äôt keep you from playing the game, it‚Äôs more like lock outs in wow or timers in other games.  I can still go farm mobs and bosses outside in the world, cook food, gather other mats and search for chests. Being able to go into my friends world and collect loot from their world and vise versa is another great thing.
title: All around good game.

review: The game looks great and handles pretty well but there is something weird that I just can‚Äôt find anything out about.... whenever I start playing there is a dark, massive void bubble around my character.... it‚Äôs almost like a dome that‚Äôs about 5-10 feet (10-20 if you count both sides) and about 15-20 feet up. I don‚Äôt really know if this is some sort of setting or maybe a glitch but it really hinders the open world feel of the game since I can‚Äôt seem to say any of the world, plus the water also is a void where there would be water there is just dark nothingness, if anyone knows anything on how to fix this it would mean the world to me since it takes so much of the fun away. Just to recap there is a bubble about 10-20 feet across and 15-20 feet up that blocks out all of that you can see plus the waters a void so please tell me how to fix it, thanks
title: The void... I need help with it....

review:
First thing I would like to point out is the fact how well made this game is I‚Äôm still surprised that it is free to download!!!!

Second there was some questionable ideas in the game that I didn‚Äôt quite understand first the gacha system is alright but I hate the fact that I have to pull the same character to upgrade their constellation but when it comes to my main character I can buy the materials and a souvenir shop it sort of annoys me that I have to pull the same character.

Third thing I would like to have outfits in the game I would spend as much as I need to see Beidou in a wedding dress or a Christmas outfit thank you very much also a gifting system would be nice my friend has this one character she got from a wish but she doesn‚Äôt like the character ( I want that character üò≠) it sad to see him rot in her character list
title: Wonderful game but little flaws + Idea

review:
The story is surprisingly good and the gameplay is pretty enjoyable. I was expecting to really enjoy this game. 

However, a normal part of playing an RPG is progression- you become stronger and are able to face stronger enemies. But because of the gacha mechanics, that‚Äôs just not there. I can be 10 or so levels higher than the enemies that I‚Äôm fighting but because I haven‚Äôt gotten a 5 star character with a 5 star weapon, combat takes an inordinately long time. You‚Äôll find yourself needing to use 2 or more full weapon combos on low level trash enemies. Never mind the 10 minute fights for larger enemies well below my level. You have enough HP to survive their attacks, so it's not challenging, its just tedious. 

As a sidenote, there are fairly long periods of the game where you have to do dailies to get your account level up to the point where you can continue the story missions. It's not the worst thing in the world but it is kinda grindy.
title: No real progression

review: This game is actually really fun! I‚Äôve been looking for a game that could replace some of the other mmos I had stopped playing because I got bored and the games became too pay to win or too grindy for my tastes. So far, i really enjoy the game! Each character has a unique way of playing and I‚Äôd say I really don‚Äôt mind the gacha system since it doesn‚Äôt stop you from enjoying the game...as far as I can tell anyway! I wish the game had character customization. At least for the main character. I would have rather played with my own character, rather than the default starting character. I prefer games where I can have customization and play as my own designed character and sadly, this isn‚Äôt that...but it‚Äôs still a ton of fun! I haven‚Äôt gotten that far in the game- but if it starts to lose its charm, I‚Äôll update my review for sure! Recommend this game!
title: So far, fun game!

review: I don‚Äôt know how often you guys read reviews but I just want to say that this game is fantastic. The BOTW inspiration is quite obvious (if not almost a copy) but I‚Äôm not gonna complain about it. A free open world game where you can play as any character you want is awesome. But I have bad news. The Primogems. I get it; there aren‚Äôt really a lot of characters yet but can we please get more ways of collecting them in the future? And it can be anything you want it to be; I just want more ways to get Primogems. You‚Äôll probably be getting a lot of complaints about them from F2p players (I‚Äôm F2p but the Primogems kinda don‚Äôt bother me). Also, the lock on. It‚Äôs frustrating to be focusing on one enemy only for the game to go ‚ÄúNOPE‚Äù and focus on another enemy. Those are really my only complaints; this game is fantastic and wonderfully made and I hope it gets better in the future!
title: Okay, where do I start?

review:
Ok so I‚Äôd normally play mobile games but as I was searching for game to play with a friend came across this one. Ended up playing for 4 hours when I was on way to snooze town. Now it‚Äôs a game I‚Äôm gonna be playing in between mmorpgs I play on my pc. 

So what makes this game really great is anyone who into Zelda will instantly get nostalgic feelings as it will remind any Zelda fans about Zelda. Due to Graphics and the overall plot even though it‚Äôs kinda mundane as in the plot it‚Äôs going with is like any other game like it. But normally it‚Äôs hard to screw up this type of plot so it always good. 

So the combat is really interesting you first select between 2 siblings to play as. Then once your through the first couple introduction quests you get your first combat companion, what is a fire elemental archer. But unlike traditional games were they out in the open world there not around. Because you got to switch to said character to use them in combat. Personally think it‚Äôs unique but honestly don‚Äôt like it but it is unique so whatever. 

Personally hope it comes to either steam or epic game store because being able to play on pc or even on my Xbox. Would make playing the game 10x easier as I‚Äôm not accustomed to mobile games but do enjoy checking them out.
title: Great mobile Game

review: i had preregistered since the beginning, sadly i could‚Äôt play because when i open the game its just stayed in a white screen and it never worked but now today it finally work i played it for a little while and it was awesome, one if not the best game in mobile yet. even tho my phone barely handles the game at the lowest quality i can still have fun and explore the world, its like botw but with waifus. this may be selfish of my part but i wanted to ask if could get all the update rewards/bugs rewards that were given in the game since lunch, the only reason why i am asking for such a selfish request its because i couldn‚Äôt played before because of my old phone. :( so if you doit awesome, but if its not possible i understand and i will still love you and played this game. :D
title: it Surpass my expectations

review:
I downloaded this game yesterday and i think I've been experiencing glitches through out the game. First thing i notice was the view in the distance as well as the ski are pitch black despite everything in close proximity being well lit. I don't see the sun but there‚Äôs a distracting lens flare that beams off of my character at certain points in the game which makes combat and traveling difficult. I made it to the storm dragon fight and I don‚Äôt see anything. I must be in the pitch black sky flying around randomly but I‚Äôm not sure because I cant even see the character onscreen. The combat controls are visible as well as the map and objectives which leads to my confusion. It‚Äôs a beautiful game when i can see things to admire. 
I tried deleting and reinstalling the app but the problem didn‚Äôt change and I‚Äôm getting similar results when I switched the server. If this is part of the game then please help, i cant adventure in pitch darkness.
title: Beautifull game but

review: I never thought i‚Äôd be able to play a game like this. i was wary of a character collection system and worried it was another overrated team game, but it‚Äôs not at all like that! i‚Äôve never seen anything like this before and i love it. my iphone 7 plus is below the recommended and i do have to take breaks every once in a while due to overheating but it‚Äôs honestly not that bad considering my phone is pretty old. i‚Äôm on the lowest settings and it‚Äôs still absolutely gorgeous. the world is unbelievably beautiful and everything i‚Äôve ever dreamed of in a game. you can play immersively running around everywhere yourself AND you can teleport places for efficiency. i‚Äôm absolutely in love and so grateful to the devs. i 100% want to live in the world and i‚Äôm excited to see what gets added in the future and explore everything!
title: A dream

review: Genshin Impact is a ‚Äògatcha‚Äô game at heart. It entices you with an interesting gameplay loop and quick progression at the beginning of your adventure, but quickly devolves into ‚Äúpay money in order to have fun.‚Äù The content is locked behind a timed ‚Äòresin‚Äô mechanic, (which can be solved by paying. See the racket?) limiting you to only so many actions per day. This leaves you fairly bored and without much to do save for play for around 20 minutes or so to do daily quests each day. Playable characters, usable weapons, and further upgrades for them are also locked behind payment, meaning that should you have any specific play style in mind you will end up having to pay for it. All in all, the prices are cutthroat, the rates are awful, and the developer knows and preys upon these facts. Become invested at your caution. I give it a 3/5 because the game itself is fun, except the makers are using that fact to prey upon your wallet.
title: Fun, but also scammy

review:
Okay so the reason I‚Äôm rating 4 stars is because I‚Äôm into the second chapter, the one you need to be Adventure Rank 10 in order to access, and the kick outs have worsened. By this I mean I‚Äôm just getting to the part I have to track down Venti, and whenever I try to progress it kicks me out and starts my progress over in terms of tracking.
This isn‚Äôt the first time I‚Äôve been kicked out repeatedly, I know this game is fairly new on mobile however I can‚Äôt even play for 10 minutes without being forced out. Earlier on the most I could play is maybe, 30 minutes? And that‚Äôs with my little tricks I‚Äôd use. I really enjoy the characters and the storyline, however I can‚Äôt progress because it keeps kicking me out. I don‚Äôt want to stop playing this game, I just got one of my favorite characters too.
Thank you, I hope you have an amazing day :)
title: Love it! However..

review: When I first played the game I was immediately drawn into it. The gameplay and story are amazing. The RPG elements was well integrated and I‚Äôm expecting more from you guys in the future. Tbh  I wasn‚Äôt expecting that much when I downloaded the game but I was wrong. Anyways just want to say I‚Äôm enjoying your product. Although there‚Äôs some minor or major issues you should fix. First of all the optimization of the game. Not even an hour of gaming in my laptop. Its overheating to the the point that I can feel it on my lap even when the pillows are covered and I could say the same to the iPad. You guys should fix this issue because it doesn‚Äôt only ruin the gameplay of one person but everybody who encounters it. Second, again the optimization. Opening cutscene of the game begins to lag (I was playing it in a brand new iPad). I keep on exiting just to have a decent cutscene but failed to do so. The other reasons of the problems of this are just optimization. I hope you fix it.
title: Issues

review:
I previously said, "I would absolutely love to play this game as it looks very entertaining, however, I am completely unable to open it; it's the only app on my phone that crashes every time I try to open it."

I realize now that this is the fault of my phone and not the game. I wanted to try the game so I downloaded it onto my phone, thinking that it would be fee to play on my ps4 as many mobile to console games are. When I found that this wasn't the case, I was beyond delighted and have so far throughly enjoyed playing it! The art is gorgeous and the fighting is very unique! It really feels like a free to play done right and I hope it does well to set a better precedent for other games that claim micro transactions or a $60 price tag are absolutely necessary to make a sustainable game!
title: I retract my previous statement

review: After playing for a week I still cannot believe this is a mobile game! This game is so well made, so much fun, and oh so beautiful! I played both on the PS4 and iOS and I still can't get my head around how fast it loads on iOS after teleporting. On my iPad, it only takes a few seconds but it takes close to a minute or more on the PS4. The story so far is engaging like a well-made triple-A title and the voice acting in all language is top-notch. The world only has two regions so far but it is already gigantic, there are so many details and everywhere you look is very picturistic, you can see lots of devotions went into this game. The music is really soothing, sometimes I just let it play in the background. Lastly, Piamon so funny, some dialogue really cracks me up, please keep up the good work.
title: An AAA title finally came to iOS

review:
Great  visuals, great characters, and a well thought out and enjoyable story. The combat system is well done and the cutscenes are spot on. I have been enjoying the game thus far and plan to continue to play for some time. The only issue is in a game like this the drop rates should be better. Getting one and if your are lucky two 4 stars per ten pull is not enough. This will irritate people and they will stop pulling even if they don‚Äôt stop playing. That is my only complaint. I would also like a way to drop a pin and navigate to a specific location of my choice, so I don‚Äôt have to look back at the map so often.

Excellent work devs. Excellent works to the voice actors and everyone who helped bring this gem to life. I wish you success and healthy profits.
title: Great Game all around just improve the pull rates... a bit.

review: The game design is amazing, the progression is just right for all levels of video game players low-medium, the graphics are perfect in every way, the music is super chill and when u get into a adventure or battle scene the music turns into either a semi-tense semi-adventurous music, and I overall love the game. But anything with that much godliness must have something wrong with it, the game has a mega download file and it will run through battery levels, getting four star heroes is fairly easy but getting more than one five star hero is almost impossible unless you pay or put in a lot of time and effort, which I‚Äôm not saying is a bad thing because the five stars are very powerful so it makes sense for them to be rare, I have t even gotten one lol. But overall I absolutely am in love with this game!
title: I love it but...

review:
Ok I hate open worlds but this game is just amazing now the reason i hated open worlds
Because the graphics where terrible and they pushed micro transactions in my face and the game had no good story and the combat system was terrible but this game just fixed all my problems with open worlds
As when you get in they don‚Äôt push micro transactions in your face they actually make you play the game to see if you enjoy the game instead of saying buy this buy that 
And that you actually get to be able to enjoy the world get used to of what the game is about now the only problem I have it isn‚Äôt like a problem more like a little change is that I get to join my friends on not such a high rank but it is okay and also the story and world building is amazing and warning spoilers if you are just downloading the game but I love where we start with a bang in the beginning and then we start actually playing instead of explaining the whole reason why this happened instead of making you play the game to figure out of what is happening 
And one thing I kinda have a problem with is
I want to make wishes more easier to get
But it is just a suggestion but in all the game is really good
title: I love it it is perfect for anyone

review: I don‚Äôt know what engine this game is using but it is definitely not well optimized. At least please support different rendering options. For previous iPhone you can lower down the graphics resolution as well as details such as shadows and renderings such as water and grass. I saw the minimum requirement is iPhone 8 and I thought I can give a try on my iPhone 7 and it just crashed after every 10 minutes, especially during a combat or walking inside a large city. I do like the big open world and stories but many other open world games are much more smoother than this. Please consider adding adaptivity to different phones and make it faster. At least for me if the game is running smoothly I can tolerate some level of graphics quality. Otherwise it‚Äôs just too annoying when the game crashes. Actually I can run most of other RPG games in the App Store without any problem using my iPhone 7 but this one is just so hard to play without suffering from lagging.
title: Too much lag and does not support low resolution

review:
It really does seem like a beautiful game, however, I can‚Äôt fully enjoy it. At first it ran kinda smoothly, the sky and surrounding terrain was completely black, so I couldn‚Äôt see anything besides the area around me. But once I got farther and had to actually fight, my entire screen went black so I couldn‚Äôt see anything. I logged in and out of my account, restarted my tablet, and did whatever I could to see something but my screen is still completely black. I can still run and attack, but I can‚Äôt see anything. The cut screens are also very glitchy, I can‚Äôt watch them without one of them stuttering and shorting out. So I have to log out and log back in every time it does :(
It‚Äôs such a beautiful game, but I really hope some of these bugs get fixed so I can enjoy it. I have an IPad 5th gen, so I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs the reason why it‚Äôs bugging out, but i really hope this gets worked on in the future.
title: Bugs

review:
The game is amazing in how it draws you in with its open world style, quests, gorgeous art, and seemingly endless supply of things to grind. Then you get gated by their resin system. Ascension mats, weapon mats, gold, exp, talent mats all need resin to collect and you will begin to hit a wall around AR25. It just becomes 10 min of dailies and log off. Co op is incredibly buggy and has little value still. The storyline ends at AR29 and you will be almost done with all content by there. The next update is in 5 weeks(verified by mihoyo), but it isn‚Äôt even a big content patch. The first big one is scheduled for 12/23, so be prepared for very little things to do compared to your first week. Lastly, the gacha rate is 0.6% for a 5 star, the lowest rate of any big gacha out there. They also stop giving you free rolls pretty soon so it‚Äôs not f2p friendly at all. 
Unless Mihoyo makes some big changes in the coming updates or adds in some small frequent patches, there is very little content later on and not much to do.
title: Smooth sailing in the beginning then wait 10 weeks for content

review:
This is a very well thought out and well made game. A lot of love went into every nook and cranny of its gameplay and world. Unfortunately... it‚Äôs a gacha, and not exactly a generous one at that. The early summon gift is kind but a bit frustrating to be rolling weapons that feel more like gear level fodder than meaningful results. I‚Äôm glad to support a game that has more direct ways of doing so- whether that be cosmetic purchases or an outright cost to play- but it feels frustrating knowing that others have very different and possibly better gameplay experiences not based on meaningful RPG choice but because they paid and rolled better.

As a game, it‚Äôs competent and gorgeous to look at. I never thought Breath of the Wild mixed with a more traditional RPG would work, but this is clear proof that it does. If you can look past the gacha elements- then give this game a try.
title: Impressed, but also annoyed

review: I have not once sat down to write a review before, but I just had to just this once. I don‚Äôt normally play games on my iPad but when i do i like simple and easy/challenging games. This game is the complete opposite of that, this game is adventurous and the visuals are outstanding. This game truly makes Nintendo look stupid. With the power of this iPad 60fps RPG type games are a must and this is one of the best ones i have ever played. I‚Äôd recommend this to anyone of all ages especially adults. Thank you for making this well designed game, I hope other companies see how amazing this game is and they try to make an even better one. Sooner later we will have full fledged console like games on iPads and such and that‚Äôs very exciting. Nonetheless great game i have enjoyed playing it thus far!
title: Best Game to Play on a Tablet!!!

review:
I rarely leave reviews on apps, and never play mobile games, they‚Äôre just not my thing. I started playing Genshin Impact reluctantly on PC as I‚Äôm apt to spend lots of money on these types of games (gacha). 

I can gladly say that the mobile version of the game is very easy to use and almost as good as the PC version! This is the only game I enjoy on mobile, and I love that I can pick up where I left off on PC and vice versa.

The games soundtrack, world, and art style are all very well done. It drags you into the world and it feels fresh. Although the developers say that Breath of the Wild wasn‚Äôt an influence in its creation (probably to avoid lawsuit), one can easily see it at play here. And let me just say, that‚Äôs not a bad thing.

As far as micro transactions go, most people say you can get through the whole game without paying a penny. Those that want all 5* characters and weapons will of course spend, but it‚Äôs not necessary by any means. I willfully spent $30 my first day, and got 3 characters I‚Äôm happy with, but by no means was I forced to or needed to do progress. The only complaint I see around is the resin system, which was put in play to keep addiction in Chinese culture down. 

Overall, great game on mobile AND pc, I‚Äôm really enjoying it.
title: Fantastic!

review: I absolutely love this game so far. It handles fairly well, and it looks gorgeous. I‚Äôve played your other games, such as honkai impact 3, and it certainly feels like an improvement. I love the open world feel of it, and the ability to interact with the environment and combat. Ofc there‚Äôs some loading issues, and occasional lag spikes, but if you get past that, it‚Äôs wonderful. However, I hear it is out on console, so I tried to use my controller to play it (I use an Xbox controller so maybe that was the issue) but was a little disappointed to find it didn‚Äôt work on mobile. Ever since controllers were able to be used on IOS games, I‚Äôve preferred to use it instead of touch. It‚Äôs a bit more responsive and easy to handle. So please, add controller compatibility to the mobile version!
title: I love it a lot, ofc it‚Äôs got its quirks

review:
I love the art and music. When I first played it, I was supposed to talk to this fairy thing. But I didn't see it around, so I just picked an interesting direction and walked. I saw a city of windmills in the distance so I decided to go check it out. I explored it, battled some monsters, gathered herbs, killed harmful wild boars and used their meat, learned how to cook(!) and learned to glide from high places to lower ones, gained some levels and eventually got a little bored.

Then I remembered the fairy, so I teleported back to where I started and found her. She then proceeded to teach me how to play the game. Except I'd already learned what she was saying. In fact she told me to kill some monsters and open their treasure chest... and I already had. They weren't there before and the chest lay empty. I chuckled at that.

After that, I played the game as designed, and the quests are fun and beautiful. Except I was a much higher level due to my exploring so the quests were easier than they should be.

The combat takes actual thought. I've defeated foes way too difficult for me by tricking them and using my characters in just the right way. Unlike other iPhone games where you can just turn on auto-combat and your strategy is uneeded.
title: Thoughtful, beautiful and fun!

review:
This is a free open world RPG better in some ways than Breath of the Wild, though worse in others of course due to mobile restrictions, and it‚Äôs free.

Free. Like, really. What? I spent some money in the gacha because of retail therapy(help me) but honestly you don‚Äôt need to spend any money to get all of the characters. It‚Äôs just pay to progress faster, you can progress just fine though through normal gameplay.

Story is decent, better than a lot of mobile games. Paiman is annoying as heck but you get used to her eventually... think of how annoying Navi is in the original OOT. It‚Äôs like that but worse. The English dub is mediocre but like... you can switch from it to Japanese, Chinese, Korean... the only downside, you miss out on some additional lines that aren‚Äôt subbed so... try to deal with English if you can? If not, it‚Äôs not a huge deal.

Combat is pretty tight, but it can be pretty boring on some characters/elements. However, luckily you get to unlock more skills later, so it‚Äôs probably far more interesting later down the line. Some enemies are very difficult, and you should hold off before fighting them, while others are cake.

Overall I‚Äôd give the game a 7/10 if it were a console game... but this? This is a mobile game. 10/10
title: Giiiirl

review: I‚Äôm a free to play player with two 5 star characters (Diluc and Klee) and am at adventure rank 40! The graphics, storyline and gameplay are amazing and unmatched with most other games I have reviewed. Its extremely free to play friendly although I recommend mihoyo to make the resin system a little bit more free to play friendly. I can tell that the game had a lot of work put into it and isn't just a money-grabber. mihoyo is being extremely generous when they made Genshin Impact this free to play friendly considering the money spent in it. The game is underrated and I definitely recommend to play this game, the wait for the download is worth it! I would like to express my gratitude for mihoyo and their work in Genshin Impact, its the best game i've played all year and I believe that it really deserves more love.
title: The game is great!

review: I‚Äôve got to say this game has taken most of my time in the past couple days since launch. The graphics and quality of this game is incredible. I expected a more pay to win system in genshin because of the gacha rolling system they have but, it really isn‚Äôt. The one thing that sets thsi game apart from other games is that it is free to play completely. Leveling up and getting far in the game is all up to how much time you put to the game. The only thing pay to win players get from the gacha is 5 star weapons and characters. If you grind enough or have a exponential amount of luck, the game is very blessing in giving you rolls to get new characters. If they added a more co-op experience then what it is now, it would 100% be known as the best free to play open world games out there.
title: Amazing game but...

review:
Been hearing a lot of good news from this game so I decided to try it since I‚Äôve been a fan of Honkai Impact 3rd for years I downloaded the game on a iPhone 7 I downloaded the game and well and I clicked the game and all I saw was a white screen. It asked to send me notifications so I hit allow
And the screen cut in half One part of it being white and another being black.  then after a couple seconds it kicks me out the game acts like I haven‚Äôt even opened it yet . I don‚Äôt know what to say I thought I was going to get a good game but instead I got a white screen and I had to delete a lot of things to download this game do I have any regrets yes. Will I ever download this game again probably not . I can‚Äôt even give a good rating because I have no idea what the gameplay is like .  Do I hate the game no I just wish I could play it
title: I can‚Äôt get in the game

review: I‚Äôve been playing this game for a while now, and it‚Äôs been amazing. I‚Äôm ar40 (adventure rank 40) and it‚Äôs still fun to play and farm. I‚Äôm also a f2p (free to play) player, I have never spent any irl money on this game. Out of all the game time I‚Äôve run into a few issues but only 1 that hasn‚Äôt been fixed. My Qiqi elemental skill and burst sometimes does not do the effect, such as the Harold of frost not showing up or the preserver of fortune not effecting the enemies. Not the worst problem but it does effect some gameplay of mine since I use Qiqi a decent amount. No other issues since that. These developers do a very good job on the game and deserve all credit they get and much more. I just wanted to let anyone who reads this of this issue. Thank you for reading... :) <3
title: Slight Problem, not too bad.

review:
I absolutely love Genshin Impact and the game itself is very fun and addicting. I had no problem shelling out money to get the characters I wanted, yet now, I don‚Äôt ever want to spend a PENNY on anything MiHoYo makes again.
This is because of Zhongli. Zhongli was a very hyped up character, not to mention he is an important character (as important as Venti, to not spoil anything). Yet this poor guy hits like a wet noodle. A FIVE STAR CHARACTER IS WEAKER THAN XIANGLING WHO IS FREE AND IS A RANDOM TEENAGE COOK!!
Why, might you ask? Well MiHoYo probably saw how well Childe sold and how much they got people to whale for not only the character but his constellations. I feel like Zhongli is even worse with this. Half his kit is locked behind a paywall, and remember, as a gacha game, this is not even guarantee to get all his constellations (unless you‚Äôre crazy enough to hit pity again and again).
MiHoYo seems to have moved on from Zhongli, but I haven‚Äôt. They‚Äôll do the same thing again until they pay for it, and I‚Äôll start early by never spending any money on them again.
title: MiHoYo is a greedy mess

review: Ok so when I try playing the game on my iPad, the cutscene at the start is INCREDIBLY laggy, to the point where it stays on a frame, and you can hear the characters talking, speaking of which, the audio keeps stuttering, and basically its very laggy, but when I got into the tutorial where you can walk around, there was a certain view distance where anything outside of that view distance is just pitch black. Also its really laggy too. My patience ran out and I deleted the game out of frustration. Other than that, if you can run the game without any issues, I think it will be an amazing game. I am very Very VERY mad that I couldn‚Äôt experience the game in it‚Äôs fullest potential as I was one of people that played the other impact game, Honkai Impact, and that game was awesome. I hope you fix this soon, Mihoyo. I will still play, on computer, but I wish to see on my iPad, as i can play it more often.
title: Its a little broken....

review:
Alright, so I pre-ordered this game a few months back, and now that I‚Äôm playing it, I‚Äôve noticed a few things. It feels, and plays, like a retextured version, of Zelda Breath Of The Wild! I‚Äôll list a couple of things I noticed...

1. The stamina bar, works exactly like the Zelda games‚Äô stamina bar, and when you climb something, it‚Äôs undoubtedly similar.

2. The storyline is even similar, a person who is close to the protagonist, gets captured by this godlike being, and it‚Äôs your job to rescue that person.

3. The game has gliders, literally gliders, they function the exact way the gliders in Zelda do.

4. When you switch over to a different character, such as someone with a bow, it works the same way as in Zelda, and with a tank class, if you hold down the attack button, it will send you spinning as a special attack, and eats up your stamina, oh, and guess what? It works the same way as Zelda.

5. The enemies? They almost aren‚Äôt even retextured, they just all look the same as the enemies from Zelda.

6. The game, is fun, and has an engaging storyline nevertheless, but it only has so little unique features to not get a lawsuit from Nintendo. Overall, fun game, but a little sus on the original side. 
 
-Your friend,
  Grimm
title: Someone made a fun bootleg

review: You‚Äôll start this game out thinking it‚Äôs just a good looking game that borrowed breath of the wild‚Äôs mechanics, but once you get into it, you‚Äôll realize how stupefyingly amazing this game is. This masterpiece has tons of great voice acting, an in depth intriguing story, and a well made combat system. This game is jam packed with spectacular locations, beautiful architecture, and interesting quests. The map may very well be as big as breath of the wild. Character movement is fluid and combat feels perfect. So many different towns that put breath of the wild‚Äôs four tiny villages to shame. With different architecture types and so many interesting places to visit. This game kills my battery but it‚Äôs worth it. Even just the landscapes are spectacular. I really can‚Äôt heap enough praise onto this game. Definitely the best mobile game I‚Äôve ever seen.
title: Unbelievable

review: I‚Äôve only managed to progress as far as I have because I play on pc with a controller. The game is great, and there‚Äôs a lot to like about it but it‚Äôs difficult at best to play on my iPad (and won‚Äôt even launch on my phone, which I get it they recommend an 8s or better but it‚Äôs stupid, in my opinion that I can‚Äôt use my 7 to launch the game at all, I‚Äôd even be happy just playing on the lowest settings but it won‚Äôt even launch.) But even when I can get the controls to work on my iPad it crashes a lot, consistently it‚Äôs crashing when I try to enter the domain for the mondstadt gourmand quest. I would love to be able to play this on my iPad or iPhone so I don‚Äôt have to bring my laptop to work with me when I just want to play for a few minutes at break or lunch, but the crashes make it very difficult to play.

review: I ask this because I love this game and my friends would prolly too. But they won‚Äôt play if they can‚Äôt play with me. title: Please let the multiplayer be unlocked faster

review:
I love this app I play it whenever I have spare time! However, when doing the quest ‚ÄúSong of the Dragon and Freedom‚Äù I always get stuck on one specific part, it‚Äôs the part where you need to break the seal in ‚ÄúStormterrors‚Äù lair. I do everything thing it tells me to I get up until the point when I have 2/3 done and then when I get to the last one, I killing all the monsters that are guarding it. After that I start to collect the ‚ÄúGlowing things‚Äù (cause I don‚Äôt exactly know what they are called.) And I go to put think in the thing in the middle but for some weird reason it‚Äôs like there is an invisible force field or something, and I just can‚Äôt seem to get in. I would love some guidance on this part if I can get some, that‚Äôs the only issue.
Amazing app still!
title: Amazing Game! But...

review:
Wow. Just wow. I'm not at all a fan of Anime/Japanese style RPGs, but this game is incredible! Graphics are gorgeous. Movement and combat are well polished. Story and writing are good, and the English is perfect. And the attention to detail throughout the game is superb! Being able to really go anywhere - climb walls to the tops of buildings (and then glide down from them!), get on top of tree stumps, sit on benches, climb cliffsides, swim in rivers, anything - is awesome! And being able to attack and damage many things in the world too, not just barrels üòù.

And no auto quest completion, movement, combat (that I've seen so far anyway)!! üòÄ

This is how you do an RPG!

I think the only complaint I have so far is being able to level up from items - to me, coming from an old school RPG background, that's just a cheap way to do it. Doesn't require any skill or thought (unless they make it so the items can only be acquired through combat, completing quests, exploring, and character interaction/diplomacy, but so far I've seen the items delivered in mail as gifts). I know that's how games are done these days to keep the kiddies hooked, but really, this game already has so much in it to keep you interested, I don't think that element is necessary.
title: Beautiful

review:
So, Mihoyo finally made an openworld game. *slow clapping* 

I played Honkai Impact 3rd for a long time, and i thought that the open world feature in that game was really nice. You guys must have thought that it was great too, but you couldn‚Äôt really do much with it because Honkai Impact was more focused on other stuff. Solution? Use those great graphics and awsome gameplay and make it into a new smash hit of a mobile app. 
I am very impressed with Genshin Impact. Everything runs very smoothly and keeps you hooked for hours. Let‚Äôs be honest, the game only has bad reviews because people don‚Äôt have enough space on their phone or have an older model. Everyone else, who actually came prepared, is really enjoying it!! 
Cheers to Genshin Impact, and the lovely development team that made this game for us to enjoy!
title: Ayyyyyy

review:
Genshin Impact is probably the most fun I‚Äôve had playing a mobile game in years. It‚Äôs graphics, world design, battle system, and characters are all amazing and unique. My only gripes with it are: When I‚Äôm just opening up the app, it takes at least a minute to load (load meaning where you see the MIHOYO screen, then GENSHIN IMPACT), and that whenever I switch my party around, without fail, I know my game will crash. I don‚Äôt know why it does this, I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs a bug. I‚Äôm hoping it will get fixed soon, but I love this game and want to watch it grow.
**EDIT:** As much as I love Genshin Impact, it‚Äôs becoming downright unplayable on a mobile device. Whenever I try to do a commission/quest, I‚Äôll get about 3 dialogue lines in, then the game just crashes. This is with every quest, so I physically CANNOT progress in the game. PLEASE do what you can to fix this
title: Love this game, but...

review:
So relaxing, and a masterpiece from the graphics and character design. Time simply flies playing this game. Running around on the grass is so peaceful and keep reminding me of sword art online. I see so much potential like the possibility of adding online play with players around the world when technology allows it. A few suggestions would be to not let the game be so easily stopped just by eating food, because every time i eat during a fight, it feels like i‚Äôve already lost. I wish there‚Äôs a little more interactive elements like cutting would and building your own lodge. 
This game already has the graphics potential to evolve to sword art online game, i just want more interactive elements with the open world even if that means it‚Äôs gonna eat my storage.
title: Technology the only restricting factor

review: I love the game so much there‚Äôs so much you can do it‚Äôs also an English completely English dubbed is incredible especially when you can‚Äôt read the subtitles. All the customizations all the characters so much you can do I mean seriously I‚Äôm level 70 in the game and I‚Äôve been working hard got a few five star artifacts  and a five star weapon it‚Äôs incredible the time that has been put into this game was well worth the wait and it came out on my birthday pretty cool also it‚Äôs an incredible game amazing storyline amazing graphics so much detail keep up the good work thank you for creating a beautiful Gabe a work of art. Also I am a free to play player so it‚Äôs not that bad to play for free you don‚Äôt have to pay to win everything you know thank you  mihoyo so much..
title: My favorite game ever

review:
I love this game so far. I‚Äôve put in probably 5 hours, and it hasn‚Äôt tried to burden me with micro-transactions. The art style is beautiful, and the story is good. Like others have said, it‚Äôs reminiscent of Breath of the Wild, but is far from a copy cat. It manages to stand on its own without relying on the ideas of others.
The only thing I can complain about is the lack of controller support. For a game that has controller mapping on the PC and console versions, it‚Äôs strange to me that the IOS version doesn‚Äôt support it. I have a Steel Series Nimbus controller (along with Xbox controllers) that I could use if the game featured controller support.
With that said, the in-game touch controls aren‚Äôt bad, and the combat feels intuitive. I would still love to see controller support, however.

Thanks so much to the developers for creating this piece of art!
title: Needs one small improvement!

review: The game is absolutely amazing. Combat is fun yet challenging, characters are all somewhat balanced. But there is one things that‚Äôs been bothering me since day 1. The game is to p2w. I know it‚Äôs a gacha game and it‚Äôs made to make money but as a strict f2p the game gets to grindy. A good example is the constant priomgem shortage. I am constantly out of primogems and only being able to accumulate around 5 just from running around and getting chests I will eventually not be able to get more. Sure the daily quest give some but it‚Äôs just not enough. Only getting 60 from the dailies is just to little and will cause some f2p‚Äôs to not play cause of the lack of material needed to get characters. I‚Äôm not asking much but if the daily gem amount you could get from the commissions was higher I‚Äôd be able to at least get one wish in once a day would be great
title: To p2w

review:
This is the best mobile game premise I‚Äôve ever seen. Open-word MMORPG with anime visuals, just awesome. The gameplay is excellent and entertaining, and the story in actually very well-though. However, there is currently too little to do, since the story and side quests are very few and the update rate is horrendous. 

But my biggest complaint is the broken gacha system. F2P players get barely any premium currency from quests and events, there is no permanent log in bonus, and the banners are extremely expensive. Also, the rates to get the characters you want are too small, and you need 90 pulls to get a mercy character, which might not even be the one you want. Very disappointing. Seriously, if this game wasn‚Äôt gacha I would say it is one of the best games ever made, mobile or otherwise. Please Mihoyo, make Genshin Impact more F2P-friendly. I really want this to give this game a 5-star review
title: Great game, but

review:
The game runs well and has a lot of good qualities, but they end up losing people because of the makers‚Äô greed through the energy needed to complete dungeons and bosses. It‚Äôs a shame since they already made $2 million but still couldn‚Äôt fix the broken regen energy rate for their fan base. 
If that wasn‚Äôt enough, the way the world scales makes it incredibly difficult and not rewarding to level your player level up. You end up not being able to go to areas you e already unlocked because the boosts the monsters get, and then you can‚Äôt level up your characters because you can‚Äôt beat the monsters you need the materials from to level up your characters. That discourages people from playing the game or discouraged from leveling up AR. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: It‚Äôs okay

review:
This is probably the best game I‚Äôve ever gotten, it‚Äôs full of actually interesting storyline and characters. The graphics are beautiful and even side characters have voice actors! The game runs smoothly on mobile & I love it! The characters have such diversity and there‚Äôs somebody for everyone! Plenty of characters to collect and side quests & main quests to complete! Similar to a game close to heart being ‚ÄúLegend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild‚Äù in the way the characters can glide and fly! It‚Äôs beautiful and has everything you could possibly want! I definitely recommend to anyone & everyone! I‚Äôve already recommended it to 20 people, I look forward to updates!
title: Best game on the App Store!!

review: I‚Äôve loved this game from the start. Beautiful gameplay, great action, cool characters very well made. The wishes are what frustrates me I‚Äôve put about 20-30 hours into the game already and started 2 days ago. I hate lucky games cause i always end up unlucky. Example my friend has 3 ‚Äú5 star‚Äù hero‚Äôs while i can‚Äôt get anything past a 4 start or my friend will get a ‚Äú5 star item‚Äù and he‚Äôs a way lower level then me. title: Fun, addicting, frustrating

review:
The thing I liked most about this game is that I was able to play it day in and day out (for free) without a single ad, and it wasn‚Äôt until I hit a certain level that I decided to throw some cash at them to support how wonderful of a game this is. I love all the loot and the mass bag space to hold it all. The combat is creative and immersive, as well as the world with something to kill or collect around every corner. There‚Äôs a lot of lore too if you‚Äôre into that sorta thing xD. 

A few complaints...some sort of healer in town would be nice. Getting food to heal is a chore, on top of the ‚Äúbeing full‚Äù mechanic, which is a pain if you‚Äôre trying to take down a boss. Healing in an RPG should not be this difficult. There‚Äôs Alchemy, but no Health Potions? This makes zero sense.
title: I can‚Äôt stop playing

review: I have had this game for less than a week and I‚Äôm already in love. It‚Äôs asthetically pleasing, the combat systems and elemental reactions are outright amazing, and the storyline and level progression are top-notch as well. I only have one single suggestion, and it‚Äôs that when you are playing on single player you don‚Äôt need internet connection. I don‚Äôt really know about the inner mechanics so this might be a fundamentally impossible change, but if we could have the option to turn off multiplayer and play single player without internet connection that would be nice. Now, this is only a quality-of-life thing and in no way negatively impacts my opinion of the game, it‚Äôs still a wonderful game. It‚Äôs just a little thing that would be nice to have.
title: Wonderful Game! Just one suggestion

review: Don‚Äôt read any further, just download it. It‚Äôs honestly incredible, there‚Äôs no reason this shouldn‚Äôt be on Apple Arcade or cost money. It has more charm than most triple a games I‚Äôve played. The ‚Äúguide‚Äù (basically Navi or fi from Zelda) is the the first character in that role that doesn‚Äôt make me want to pull my hair out. The combat and story are surprisingly fun. The only thing I would change about the game (besides a few quality of life improvements) is having the follower characters be able to fight with you when you‚Äôre not controlling them, but I assume this was left out because the game is already pushing the limit on my phone. Im really hoping for a sequel and at this point I don‚Äôt care if I would have to pay money for it.
title: No reason this game should be free!!

review:
Aside from the gacha system for characters it‚Äôs a good game and I hope it gets better with more content and story. 

Despite the backlash of it being a ‚ÄúBOTW‚Äù ripoff it really isn‚Äôt. There are aspects of BOTW in the game like climbing, gliding, graphics, etc. However the story and gameplay is different. So to the people who dislike it for being a clone, play first.

Overall I am very happy about this game. The need to use money is optional and the game gives you a decent lineup of characters at the start to handle every encounter. My only hope for the gacha system is the occasional gift or event for players to use it from time to time.

I would highly recommend this game to my friends and I can‚Äôt wait to play more.

title: It‚Äôs Amazing~ A good single player open world rpg.

title: Combat 5/10 Graphics 6/10 Gacha odds 2/10

review:
Hello! Genshin Impact is probably one of the BEST anime games! You‚Äôre own character has a voice! Most anime games don‚Äôt have voices for our character. 

GLITCH/BUG
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-

Although, there is one problem...there is a glitch/bug that everything is black! This happened when I was playing for the first time, choosing my gender, and then I accidentally picked male! I panicked and deleted the game then, downloaded it again. the next time I played it, I chose the correct gender. The moment when I loaded into the game, everything was black. I thought, maybe because I don‚Äôt have much space? No, that wasn‚Äôt the problem. 

WHERE
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

This glitch/bug was surrounding me. The area where I step at, (EX:  next to beach) wasn‚Äôt black. But, as soon as I walked somewhere else, it was black. 

COMPATIBILITY

title: Great game... but

review:
This app needs so much improvement. This is a list of things wrong with it.

- takes up to much storage. I had to delete tons of app and photos just to play it.

- the scenery is horrible. By that I mean I can‚Äôt see a thing. The sky and water is black. Just black. Only the things around you show color. The rest is just black.

- random white flashes appear whenever I move my camera. A person with epilepsy can have a seizure. Is it so hard for you to fix these things?

- I hate having to stare at a white screen just to play this disappointment of a game.

- It took a long time to download, just for it to become disappointment. I was hoping this would be an amazing game, as shown in videos. It‚Äôs not worth it. Trust me.

- the intro glitched so much and was very laggy. The voices would lag and everything. Please fix this.

- this app doesn‚Äôt work on iPads or iPhone 6s. If you have any of these devices, this app isn‚Äôt for you.

- you guys haven‚Äôt fixed any of these problems! So many people have complained and will continue to be disappointed and leave bad reviews and overall never play the game again.

Please fix all of these. Mobile players are very disappointed. I probably will never download this game ever again until it improves. If you do download this game with an iPad or iPhone 6, don‚Äôt be too hopeful or you‚Äôll be let down. Once you get the game, you‚Äôll totally be disappointed.
title: Improvement

review: I never review any type of all, ever. But this game is simply too fantastic to not let everyone know about it. How this is a free game is beyond me. So the style is very similar to breath of the wild, even down to the small puzzles everywhere that were used to unlock the deku seeds, are in this game masterfully made. The combat is unique and very original , and the map is massive. There really isn‚Äôt anything bad to say about this game, even the way you fight when combining elements , and having things like fire burn and destroy shields, while lightning is highly effective when it‚Äôs raining, and how fire makes ice explode when enemies are frozen, is all amazing. You guys deserve all the credit for a game I will spend hours on and gladly support in the future. Keep it up guys this is a masterpiece.
title: Simply amazing

review:
The game is good, especially for a free to play game. You can easily get 40-50 hours out of this. 

The biggest issue is that the game is a gacha game, which wouldn‚Äôt be an issue if it was fair but the pull rate for a 5* is 1 per 90 or 0.6% whichever comes first, Which more often than not you will hit the 90 first. Other games in this same category have a 7.0% pull rate. Meaning you are more than 10 times more likely with this games competitors. 

There is no free daily summons, no daily log in rewards, no rewards monthly calendar, and the rewards run dry after the first few hours of leveling. The game makes you trial hero‚Äôs so you will see how much better than yours they are. 

If you do all the content to level 25 in less than a month there is no more game left. You become a trash collector trying to find all the trash chests in the world for just a little bit more exp / money / artifacts / weapons / books so you can progress. But that runs dry around level 30. 
There is nothing to do after the main story quests. And the things that are available are tied to a ticket system called resin which holds you back even more because of the random low drop rate and random rolls on gear. 

The resin system allows you to do 2-6 ‚Äúdungeons‚Äù daily depending on which you do. These have low drop rate on resources or items of a useable tier. So progression is locked behind months to years of daily play.
title: 0.6% gacha rate

I really want to play the game and I‚Äôve deleted and reinstalled it a few times but nothing seems to work and I‚Äôm kinda sad some of my friends are ahead of me. Please look into this problem I‚Äôm sure many others are having it too.

title: nice game!

review:
I love this game and the graphics. I don‚Äôt mind some of the bugs and they seem to be ironing those out more and more. 

I even so far don‚Äôt mind how much of a grind leveling is because it‚Äôs sort of fun, but I think like other reviews the pay to win aspect will come out the longer it‚Äôs played. I also would rather monetization focus on customizing, skins, clothes, avatar hair options and how you look, and open up a little more of the nice weapons and characters drops from wishing. 

My largest issue isn‚Äôt one everyone would share, and I think I might even get made fun of for how I feel about it, but I wish in the story I wouldn‚Äôt be forced to ‚Äúworship‚Äù the statues in order to progress. Maybe it‚Äôs just the wording. I don‚Äôt mind leaving orbs but I don‚Äôt like being forced to participate in a game religion even if the game is focused on it. I didn‚Äôt have an issue with the story at all until I realized leveling the statues requires ‚Äúworshipping‚Äù them and that‚Äôs not ok with me. 

I might stop playing entirely because of that but will see if I can still progress if I choose not to do that part. 

Suggestion: change the words from ‚Äúworship‚Äù to ‚Äúleave an offering‚Äù 

I think that would help a little to be honest, and might help other people like me be more interested in the game.

But as an ongoing game it‚Äôs Mihoyo‚Äôs duty to keep on trying to better their craft and art, and the Resin system is utterly lacking compared to Honkai. The pull rates could even be changed from pity 90 to maybe 50 or even 70. I log in daily and am super excited for future content, but for ‚Äúrewarding‚Äù engagement with the drop rates for materials, the Resin needs a major upgrade.

title: This game is great BUT.....

review:
Could not pet or interact with dog in Monstadt. Needs immediate patch. 0/10 horrible experience. Not being able to pet doggo has left my game experience a fragment of its glory. This dog rolls over onto her back and that belly is literally begging for scritches. And yet, no such relief is coming. Oh how the cries echo through the air!

The game is unbalanced. It‚Äôs amazing, by far the most visually amazing game I‚Äôve played so far. It‚Äôs astounding how far mobile gaming has come. The game is relatively high spec, but that‚Äôs completely understandable. It‚Äôs a breath of the wild clone with gacha team building, the game needs more horses and less teleporting. The combat is fun, first few missions are really boring, though it gets better over time. But that dog. It makes this game... Completely unplayable.
title: Fatal Flaw in Wonderful Game

review: I know a lot of times you see reviews and wonder if they are paid. I promise you this one isn‚Äôt. This is the most fleshed out mobile game I have ever played and that‚Äôs AMAZING considering it‚Äôs Free to Play. The game has a slightly smaller region than BoTW but plays pretty much the same. The difficulty isn‚Äôt too crazy which is kind of a shame, but it has a really cool world to explore and some puzzles to handle along the way which aren‚Äôt crazy in difficulty but decent enough for, again, a free game. Now obv, it has micro transactions but the great thing is that they all basically feel cosmetic. The game gives you 5 characters for free through the story missions and never makes you feel like you need to purchase something to eliminate the grind. All in all, great game. Kudos to the developers.

The bounty‚Äôs you can only do three per week same goes for the reputation commissions. The daily commissions only have four per day. Then the boss battles. title: My Suggestions!

review:
This game is a really good game and beautiful and loved it at first but end game, gacha rates and progress of characters are the worst I‚Äôve experienced. Enjoy the story but quit after that if you are F2P player.

At first this game is enjoyable but once you get to Adventure Rank 40+ and done everything it is all about maxing out and grinding till you drop game.

End game materials will take you YEARS to complete because 1 character might take 6months to max out even if you‚Äôre the luckiest gamer in RnG history (materials are so rare and RnG + can only be farmed once a WEEK).

Gacha rates are sooo LOW that the developers refused to show the drop rate and made it to 50pulls guarantee which sounds good to many but really it‚Äôs just saying that mandatory 50pulls for your S hero so whale if you want 7 of them to max out or to even be viable to end game bosses.

Also you need many good different heroes to play because of elemental properties for different enemies. The free heroes are trash and boring.

Hero progression is one thing to worry about but wait there‚Äôs more!! you got artifacts with RnG base stats, what about weapons? well Yeah! you need good weapons too!.  So grind till you‚Äôre wallet is empty or grind till you say it quits.

This game is soo grindy with little rewards, it will stress you more than relax you. RnG is the worse and very P2W/Whale focus game.

Enjoy the story but quit after if you‚Äôre F2P.
title: Pay to Win Whaling game

review: Overall this game is phenomenal! The art, and just dedication is what really brings out the extraordinary gameplay. But, the summoning for five stars. This is really the only complaint I have. The rates for 5 stars (just one) can be under .600%! I‚Äôve seen people blow off hundreds of dollars just to get maybe one five star. For a free to play player like myself, this takes away a lot of the excitement when a new banner comes up. It‚Äôs so devastating that people have to make new accounts again and again just because they can‚Äôt spend money. Just general advice, you should make the percentage higher, or at least make a guaranteed five star pull for beginners. The whole game is great, but the constant reliance on recharging to get a good game play ruins that, and makes it less enjoyable.

review:

review: Game is amazing so far and runs alright on my IPhone XS on max graphics. However there are some glaring problems with this game. First of all the rates. They are god awful. These are the worst rates I‚Äôve ever seen on any gacha. And the fact that you can get weapons on the same limited banner as characters just makes it worse. The only saving grace is that pity carries over . Next up is Resin. There is just not enough to actually farm things. title: Great game but...

review:
Gave a 1 star review because mainly of account security issues. The company has had two security vulnerabilities exposed in the past few months already (mind you, this is a company founded in 2012 and has had lots of experience in these types of games). First one was how easily hackers could grab your phone number if you linked it, and the second was your email. And now, apparently, there‚Äôs a way for hackers to get your name from your linked social media accounts (especially Facebook) very easily as long as they know your password.

The community‚Äôs been trying to push for 2FA because security is important. Imagine spending a hundred or so on an account and that it can easily be hacked through brute force. They don‚Äôt notify you if your email/phone number gets unlinked either. And what‚Äôs more, they‚Äôre most likely aware of these, but haven‚Äôt fixed them. And they haven‚Äôt made an announcement addressing these issues.

At this point, making an account is all at-your-own-risk. Until they fix the vulnerabilities and start listening to the players more often, only then will I change this review.

Yes, it‚Äôs a great game with great characters, amazing design, wonderful music and a fun rpg element to it. But that all comes at a cost that your account can be taken out of nowhere.
title: Security issues mainly, and not willing to listen to major feedback

title: Hunka burnin

review:
I‚Äôve put about 8 hours in this game, and so far I‚Äôve enjoyed every minute of it. Whether it‚Äôs the beautiful graphics of the open world, the fluid-like gameplay similar to BotW, or the Gacha system, it has been a pretty awesome experience! People complain about the probability rates of the Gacha system but that‚Äôs how RnG works. 

Now to the part I wanted to complain about, Co-op mode. The main reason I wanted to play this game was to enjoy it with my friends as we progress through the story, however that was all put to a stop once we got to rank 16 (the rank requirement to start co-op). The options were so limited for my friends that I thought they should‚Äôve just left this as a single player game. The only thing they can do is participate in my dungeons, loot materials such as iron chunks, and explore the world with their story progression being halted. I was hoping we would be able to progress through the game together, but that hope sure did get squashed. In the future, I am anticipating some major improvements to the co-op feature to make this game more enjoyable for the player and their friends.

Other than that this game has been a delightful experience

Thank you!

title: incredible

review:
This game features gameplay that you'd see on a $60 Console/PC game, but it's a free-to-play mobile game. The combat system is very smooth, intuitive, and just feels really good to play. On top of that, the game has beautiful, stylistic graphics and effects, as well as beautifully animated cutscenes. 

If you are the story type, you will find satisfaction in the depth of the story this game features- but you will find that you can also go off explore the large, open world to your heart's content, your curiosity constantly rewarded with hidden chests and challenges that make the detour worthwhile. 

This game has a little bit for everyone, and I think once you pick it up, you'll have trouble putting it down.

I only started playing yesterday, but when I found myself surprised at how much fun I was having, I wanted to tell people. The expansive map, the interesting inventory system, the excellent soundtrack (which surprised me the most‚ÄîI haven‚Äôt gotten too far yet, but so far it‚Äôs really, really good), and a leveling-up system that‚Äôs complicated but not tedious, it all feels really solid. I would honestly recommend this game to people, it was definitely a pleasant surprise.

review:
I have been able to play to the first city. The game looks wonderful, but it does not run well on my older iPad Pro. The starting white screen takes a minute to load the title (which is a terrible sign), and nothing renders after that except for instructions on how to start the game.

In game, the cinematics are incredibly laggy and stutter. When I‚Äôm able to move the character, I can only see within a few feet of my character. The entire background is black/void. Water is black/void. Lowering the settings does nothing for render distance except make the graphics more blurry. Eventually, you will get to a forced encounter, where the game does not render anything, and you cannot continue.

This seems to be the problem with anything but iPhone 8 and up and the newest iPads. If you have an older device, don‚Äôt bother downloading it until they fix these performance issues/bugs.
title: Lots of bugs and performance issues.

The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because they let you choose some dialogue as your character but it doesn‚Äôt make any difference in the story EX: in one side quest you have to get a present for another character you can pick what to give the options are flowers food or a book out off all this you give them a book no matter what which is kinda disappointing 
Overall you should really play this game it is genuinely interesting
