review: The game is so beautiful and by far the prettiest mobile game ever. The world is so interesting and calming. The voice acting is amazing and engaging, the sound effects make it even better. Even simple things like the opening menu is pretty to look at. So far, I haven‚Äôt glitched or had major lag. My only complaint is sometimes it gets a little~ too hard for a beginner player like me. I also think leveling up in general should be easier, both adventure and character levels. But even that is a nit-pick. Overall, it‚Äôs great and I recommend it. It will be hard to find something better than this.
title: This is my favorite mobile game and I‚Äôm not even far into it yet!

review:
I rarely write reviews, as I find most games to be barely worth the time. However Mihoyo has outdone itself a second time. Honkai Impact 3rd was and is one of my top games, but this edged itself ahead. Beautiful graphics, breathtaking music, fun and simple combat (yet challenging to master), engaging characters and storyline all play to its strengths. There is no sense of pay to win or pay to play.

If I were to call out a weakness, it would be that the dailies are a bit too time consuming with the ‚Äòspend original resin‚Äô aspect, which I struggle to complete.

I am thankful for Mihoyo games as I have been under extra social distancing due to cancer, they have made the time much less difficult. Thank you!
title: Amazing game

review:
I will preface by saying I am more then willing to change this review if this problem gets fixed. 
I love this game so much, so I was concerned when I opened the game two days ago and it crashed after displaying the logos. I figured it was likely a one time thing, as I had been playing without problems for a while. However I have opened this app many many times over the last 2 days and it just will not work. I have restarted my phone, reinstalled the app, updated my phone, everything you can think of.  
I play on my iPhone SE (second gen) 64GB with around 15GB of storage remaining. I am so confused about why the game suddenly stopped working for me, and to be frank angry. I‚Äôve admittedly bought a few things and I‚Äôm not happy I don‚Äôt have access to them. I have sent a customer support email with no response, not even automated. I just don‚Äôt know what to do. Please help.
title: Cannot open app for more than a minute

review:
The game is beautiful. I loved exploring the world and experiencing the story. I would totally recommend everyone try out the game for a bit. 

But, the rates killed the game for me. I completed the entire story and was level 31, when I pulled my first 5 star. I got a legendary bow. Putting in several hours a day to grind the game for almost to weeks just to pull a bow in my pity was a real let down for me. I continued playing and grinding through the event, but I‚Äôve just hit level 40 and haven‚Äôt pulled any other 5 stars. With how difficult it is to get enough resources for one or two pulls, just to get some useless weapon that I have 5 dupes of really put me off the game. So be warned, you could very easily be let down by the gatcha system in this game.
title: Good game, bad rates

review: This game is amazing. One of the best open world games I have ever played. The graphics are amazing and the controls are very easy. The only reason I‚Äôm giving this a 4 star is because of the primogems, the world quests, and the summons. For the primogems all I ask is that you make them more easily obtainable. I could be grinding for hours and I would only have a few hundred primogems. Second the world quests. The world quests are really frustrating. Most of the time they aren‚Äôt specific enough so the quests are even harder to do. Then with the summons. This is the most frustrating part of the game for me. I‚Äôve summoned like 100+ time already and I only got 1 5 star. I understand the 5 stars are supposed to be rare but it‚Äôs just not fair.
title: Devs please read

title: Love this game but..

review: If the Resin system isn't significantly improved by the 1.1 patch, this game is going to fall off very quickly. We need more ways of obtaining Resin by playing in-game, so that we can progress at our own pace instead of being throttled and cut off after our first 20 minutes of gameplay. I'm not joking when I say the only significant portion of progression you gain from playing each day is at the first 10-20 minutes of gameplay when you do your daily commissions and spend your Resin, and after that you get hardly anything worthwhile. Making all of the chests respawn each week would also help with this, as the open world feels completely empty after you've gone through each area once or twice, and it doesn't require any Resin. This game has a ton of potential but if MiHoYo doesn't bring change to things like Resin soon then they're going to lose their playerbase fast.
title: Resin System Needs Changes

review:
So co op.... it‚Äôs very limited. You can‚Äôt do quests, open chests, or do certain dungeons. Like the Temple of the Lion, Temple of the Wolf, and things like that. You can‚Äôt even do quests with other people nor can you open the chests. Even if the person who works you joined open a chest, you don‚Äôt get any loot.

 Also, there should be something like a gifting system or perhaps a trading system. For example, when you have too much of an item and have no need for it, you can always trade it with someone for something you actually need. 

However, the graphics of the game is on point! It‚Äôs so breathtaking, like the graphics and gameplay are so well put together!! The characters are nice as well and I really love the game. 

The anime aesthetic plus the open world adventure is so also well designed. Another feature that I (and probably many other players as well) like is the fact that you can mark places. It‚Äôs so convenient and easy to use. The only reason i put 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the co op being limited but other than that I‚Äôm in love with this game!
title: Trading/Gifting System & Co op

review:
These reviews are incredible. I wonder how many people actually don‚Äôt realize that this game is a copy of breath of the wild. Yes of course it is a good game. I feel kind of sad for those who have not experienced breath of the wild first, which, is a beautiful game by the way.

Of course it‚Äôll be laggy, because the main botw map was intended for the nintendo switch rather, and not a mobile game. It‚Äôs a bit upsetting knowing the game style; map and such as was copied and yet sits here free to use even; despite the rest of the game being original, breath of the wild definitely deserves credit.

Other than that the game is cool and I like the concept, props to the makers but I hope this game doesn‚Äôt overshadow the creativity and beauty of breath of the wild, and I hope it is known.
title: I can‚Äôt love it.

review: This game is overall great with the anime aesthetics, quality characters, and has great potential. However, once you get through the honeymoon phase and get to a certain Adventure rank, you hit a wall that is mainly caused by the resin system. This severely limits your progress in the later parts of the game. I know this is a gatcha game, so that includes some energy system. However, the game does not give much options to recharge your resin besides having you spend money. I would be happier if they added other ways to recharge resin. Such as when you rank up your Adventure Rank, complete all your daily commissions, and allow us to go over the cap. Also the 5 star rates are waaay to low. if they added ways for f2p players to obtain 4 and 5 star characters easier, it would be amazing.
title: Great game but has problems.

review:
Yes its totally free - i even have a 5üéñ already!!  I imagine the inevitable ‚Äúpay wall‚Äù will come later when you need staggering payloads of materials to ascend your characters and weapons.  BUT you can grind for those items, its that they give you more characters than you should level up maybe?  Already started saving back some level up and ascension items just in case i pull someone better than i already have...

Overall this is easily a top 5 game on iOS right now - I play most games for at least a little bit.  Unless you are one of those afk idle nerds, this is an absolute must play 

Side note - the PS4 version is also top notch - consider this a dual purpose review
title: Quintessential JaRPG

review: Maybe because it‚Äôs on other platforms as well, but I‚Äôm giving this 5 stars because it‚Äôs a RPG I can actually play on my phone, that‚Äôs not auto-combat, auto-quest, auto-run, etc. The game looks amazing and is fun to play, and it‚Äôs cool to switch around characters and run around in the big open world. I‚Äôve only done the prologue so far, but cutscenes so far are well produced. It does have a couple hiccups: Paimon is annoying but ignorable, controls on mobile are a bit sluggish (controls much better on PS4), and while there are teleportals in the huge open world, travel on foot is slow. Maybe as stamina increases travel will be easier, but I‚Äôm hoping there will be mounts in the future.

title: It‚Äôs good

review:
This game is fantastic, but there‚Äôs two huge issues that I have with it. The first is that it crashes or becomes unresponsive (requiring a full restart) every 8-12 minutes. This is extremely frustrating. The second is how unforgiving the gacha system is in the game; I.E. the combat is balanced so that if you‚Äôre not paying a lot of money, you‚Äôll always feel behind and underpowered.

That being said, I love the exploration aspect of the game, and the combat is fun and interesting. The character progression could use some work, and the story could use better writers. But the voice acting (where present) is really good.

My final verdict is don‚Äôt play it here on your mobile device. Get it on a platform they care about, like PC or Xbox or (when they release it) on Switch. The crashes here are nearly unbearable, and it very much ruins the experience.
title: Great game, bad crashes

review: I downloaded this game on my phone once before deleting it. I played it awhile beforehand though, and from what I saw the graphics and audio were incredible. I was getting very invested in the story when I decided to download the game on my iPad. Even with my iPad being completely updated, I was experiencing horrible issues with glitching audio and a black screen encompassing most of the beautiful imagery. I checked online and MANY other people are having the same issues. The game also has trouble loading and it took FOREVER to download so I‚Äôve been pretty disappointed. I‚Äôm hoping these bugs will be patched soon considering me and many others were very excited to play this game and were let down. Please consider this before you download.

title: Amazing...but

review: The controls feel fluid, the story is engaging and well written, the open world is truly open and the map is huge and gives a real sense of adventure. This game is unlike anything I'v played on mobile before and I'v had more fun with this than any AAA game I'v played in awhile. I know that this review is constant praise but it is genuinely impressive and FREE. Not since Warframe has there been such a well made free to play game that doesnt feel restricted by paywall. I don't feel like i need to pay a cent for the game, but i will anyways because i support this kind of care and love from a development team, and i feel as though I'm easily getting my moneys worth from the money spent.
title: Absolutely incredible. Unlike any IOS game I'v seen.

review: I‚Äôd say this game is the best game that has came out since the App Store even was a thing. The story is actually good, which makes you want to not miss it and pay attention to what‚Äôs going on. The character progression is iffy, but you can deal with it. It has minimal grinding, but fun grinding. Killing monsters in this game is satisfying since you get to combo your units together, or just test out your new unit with sick artifacts. Overall if you don‚Äôt mind your iPhone being turned into a frying pan, give this a try and it‚Äôll make your mind explode from how good the game actually is.

title: The sky is black the water is black AND I CAN NOT SEE!

review:
Dear developers,

This game is off the charts. Like it‚Äôs not always about fighting like any other RPG games. This one, it‚Äôs all about adventure and discovery and the thrill to be part of the game itself. Like I can imagine being a part of storyline and I love the elemental symbols and it‚Äôs chain reaction, like you know, it make sense like if you cast pyro on dendro, which is wood and yeah it would catch fire. The graphics are crazy good and I‚Äôm an anime fan so this suits me well. However, I would REALLY appreciate if the game lag reduces. The lag seriously reduces the game‚Äôs true potential. And my phone gets overheated even after just 10 minutes of playing. Overall, pls reduce the lag. And then I will give u 5 stars. Thanks! Love the game, don‚Äôt stop improving!!!!
title: This game!!! This game!

review: I‚Äôm a huge open world fan, and this game did not disappoint at all. I was expecting some kind of ‚Äúpay to progress‚Äù notice to pop up but since that never happened I happily enjoyed this game. The other game creators should really take a page from mihoyos book, because I haven‚Äôt played a game day after day consecutively like this one. Absolutely love how difficult it is to raise your rank, it definitely makes it a bit more challenging and I love how it gets more difficult as you progress, as a game should be. The only downside is, of course, the primogem situation but being that this is a gatcha game, I totally understand. 10/10 would recommend üëåüèª
title: Breathtaking game üò≠

review: I love this game it‚Äôs great but there are a few problems one being the lack of resin refresh and the second being lack of co-op content I feel like you should have more co-op stuff like domains and even a second spiral abyss type thing where you build a team of 4 and go to see how far you can get and the further you progress the harder it gets and better items you will receive. You could even do multiplayer quest like hidden stuff you have to find and puzzles that take multiple people to complete there are all kinds of things that could improve in this game but those are the few I can think of right off the top of my head
title: Great game

review:
Been looking for a game like this for years. If breath of the Wild was two player this would be it. Mix in some MMO style play, with an excellent combat system. It‚Äôs fun but not too hard. Gets better as you level and understand the game. Didn‚Äôt plan on spending money on it but tbh they have definitely earned it. 

Yo the DEVs: please don‚Äôt stop adding content. Ever. My gf and I will continue to support the game with purchases for years if the content continues to be this good, and continues to be this dense. Some form of competitive play would be nice too. 

Only complaint is the PS4 version doesn‚Äôt use the same account as the phone or pc. I play across all systems. This is my only gripe.
title: An amazing game

review: This is an amazing game that easily rivals netease games in the current mobile market. You can play with friends whether they are on pc or on their PS4 from your phone and the controls are perfect. I‚Äôve already spent hours playing exploring the world and the game is far from tedious. You can discover new food recipes and mysterious locations that will trigger another cutscene and bring you into a completely different scenery. The game also grants players with premium currency so you can roll for new characters throughout the story, but the free story characters are more than enough to enjoy the game and get through the actual game content. Amazing game!
title: You don‚Äôt need to spend money!

review:
I was happy when I found put that they had a mobile version of this app because I didnt have a laptop/pc or anything like that.

 So I downloaded this game and it took a while, but I didn‚Äôt mind that. After downloading I went straight to the app and the first thing that happened was something about notifications popped up and then it crashed(multiple times).

 I didn‚Äôt think anything of it and decided to delete and redownload. The same thing happened again and this time I found it weird because other rpg games(even ones that takes up a lot of storage space and/or uses a lot of pixels) works fine on my phone. So I deleted and redownloaded again and this happened for about 4 to 5 times till I got tired and just gave up playing it.
title: Crash

review:
This game is so much better than I ever thought a mobile game could be. My fianc√© and I are obsessed. I‚Äôve played 60 dollar games that weren‚Äôt so well made. Absolutely amazing.

Edit.

Once you get to about adventure rank 30 (took my fianc√© about a week and I‚Äôm almost there) the game time gates you hard with the energy system in the game known as resin. You will get to a point where you login and use your resin and do your dailies and you won‚Äôt be able to grind end game content until your energy refills (and it‚Äôs very slow). I still think this is an incredible game that I would recommend checking out but unless changes are made to that system I think a lot of people will lose interest because they literally keep you from playing the game.
title: I changed my review and here‚Äôs why.

review: Even if it‚Äôs a little bit‚Äùtoo‚Äù similar to botw and they recommend to use a iPhone 8(or something like that) I have been waiting for the game almost around a year and even if I got to play a small amount(cause I have an iPhone 6s and it can‚Äôt barely even render the world around me only a certain space) I will say it was somewhat fun even with the ol‚Äô gacha and microtransactions it‚Äôs a indie group and a game that at least it can pretty much destroy the potato I call a phone and the game on its lowest settings, so I‚Äôm really hyped to see what will the Switch version will be like although I do hope there‚Äôs a way just to play the game by yourself and that the game also expands over to Xbox because it might go well I don‚Äôt really know.
title: I give it 4 stars

review: This game. My god. It has taken over my life ever since I played it at PAX. Since then I have been watching it closely, and from the convention, to the beta, to now, my opinion hasn‚Äôt changed. I adore this game. The graphics are beautiful, the open world is gargantuan and it gets even bigger as you go, the mechanics are so much fun to get used to, and I‚Äôm honestly blown away how this game is free on top of all of that. There are micro transactions - like any other free game - but they are 100% not required in order to progress or be good at the game. All of this and more makes it incredible, and if I sung all its praises, we‚Äôd be here all day. I can‚Äôt wait to jump back in for real. Thank you, Mihoyo! üíï

title: Controller support

review: This game is simply amazing. It‚Äôs BOTW but anime and has voice acting for the characters. The combat is better than BOTW as instead of backflipping away from and enemy and flurry rushing you can use the enemy‚Äôs strength and turn it into a weakness and use a different ability‚Äôs to give them a weakness. This is not a good description of the combat. Just play it for yourself. There‚Äôs just one problem with the game. Just ONE and it‚Äôs the menus. title: Amazing game. Menus are a roll of the dice

review: As a PC/Console game on mobile it's pretty good. Great visuals, music despite its lack of originality. Gameplay loop at its core is fun. However the extremely predatory monetization is just awful. Terrible rates and stamina system. It's like they don't want hardcore people to play yet try and force them to stay. Disappointing considering all the feedback they received during closed beta and the more fair & sustainable system in their previous game Honkai Impact 3rd. Baffling considering they reduced the amount of currency you can earn in Abyss from the beta considering the atrocious rates. Well below industry standards. Sad to see that they pushed monetization to the limit for launch, damaging dedicated long term investment in the process. Story is also unimportant with unskippable cutscenes. Let the players decide if they want to pay attention to that annoying cringe. Please do better.
title: Artificial Shackles, Gambling, and Regression in Consumer Friendly Monetization & Longevity

review:
As a person who is not new to GACHA games, the resin (aka energy) system in this game is horrible. This game wants to be an open world MMO, and for the first 20 ranks feels exactly like it. Once you finish the story content though get ready for a serious drop in things to complete thanks to the lack of content and resin system. End game type items are dropped by bosses and domains but the only way to actually get the drops is to have enough resin to ‚Äúreceive drops‚Äù, if you don‚Äôt- you can waste time fighting them and will receive nothing as a result.

Not only that but unlike other GACHA games, your resin doesn‚Äôt increase with rank ups, so you‚Äôre severely limited to how many battles you can actually do. The only 2 ways to replenish this are with items that are sparsely given out (which don‚Äôt even fully replenish resin) or canibalize primo gems (used for summons for characters) which means you can‚Äôt summon as many times to try and get hero‚Äôs you want. Another thing tied to the resin system: experience books to level up your heroes. What does that mean? 

You either have to spend money to play the game, or sit by idle and spend 20 minutes a day on the game and then log off while you wait for resin to replenish. 

This game will get a 1 star for as long as paying to actually play is required.
title: Resin system ruins the game

review: This game can be summed up to one word, amazing. For a while I‚Äôve been looking for a open-world game that allows you to have fun, I found it. Your not tied to the story but lured in, exploring the world is a blast because within 300 feet there‚Äôs a little side-quest type thing you can do. Collecting characters is pretty good, its a little hard to collect Primogems, I‚Äôd recommend adding in more side quests. Puzzles are unique, GRAPHICS ARE AMAZING, the co-op is really fun with friends. I do wish there was more you can do like a world boss that‚Äôll spawn in the map you can take down, rather than the bosses you can fight solo. Other than that its a wonderful game, I can‚Äôt wait to see whats next!
title: Truly Immersive and Fun

review:
Seems like it would be a good game, but whenever I go from having to wait through an ungodly long random white screen that randomly crashes to get into the game, into an hour+ long 6GB download... only to find out the first cutscene for the INTRO OF THE GAME hasn‚Äôt been properly rendered, sound hasn‚Äôt loaded properly fully to the point it hurts to listen to, and then it again... crashes after minutes of painful sounds RANDOMLY... I don‚Äôt see how I could rate this anything other than a 1 star. 

I‚Äôve been following this game for a long time so I‚Äôm very disappointed at the final product not even being a product at all. If the game is fixed to an area where it‚Äôs even LOADABLE from the beginning I‚Äôll come back and give it a shot again.

EDIT 1: Also, make your app support page something other than a link to your download page. Not really helping anyone there devs.

title: Really amazing game

review:
I must say it has the aesthetics but when you realize it‚Äôs just another suped up gacha game the illusion fades.

Characters only have two skills so you end up hack and slashing your way through the game which is pretty mindless and boring. You get to switch characters on the fly BUT that‚Äôs provided you get them from the gacha. The rates are trash so you‚Äôll never end up with strong characters unless you spend money. Even then it‚Äôs like 16 dollars per multi roll. You‚Äôre better off buying Breath of the wild. I‚Äôve done 10-15 multis and didn‚Äôt get a single 5 stars while rerolling. So that usually lets me know the game will be more pain the fun in the stand point of a gacha. If you plan on spending like 20-30 I say hard pass. Waste of money since likely you won‚Äôt get much.

title: Wow

review:
So, I downloaded this game on release day, on my PS4. It‚Äôs an amazing game with gorgeous graphics and good gameplay. When I found out it was also on iOS, I wasn‚Äôt sure how well that would carry over. But the mobile controls are well integrated, and I almost like some of them more than my PS4 controls. 
However, while this game is cross-play and cross-save, it unfortunately cannot cross-save with the PS4 (most likely due to Sony and not the creators of the game). I play around with the mobile version, just because I enjoy the game, but I would spend a lot more time on it if it was actually able to link to the account I play on at home.
title: Amazing, Even on Mobile

review: This game really is addicting, even if you are a free to play player. The consistent quests/grinding and the imagination of what you can do with the characters is endless! It really keeps the player engaged. This is hands down, one of the best games of 2020. The characters all have their unique personalities and backgrounds, it‚Äôs an open world that involves co-op, which also involves npc shops! Though the co-op isn‚Äôt necessarily beating the campaign with others, but beating the side quests others. Looking past that, I really enjoy this game and if I could spend money on this game, I definitely would. I look forward to all of the features and events that miHoYo gives us!

Okay, I love this game, I play it all the time. The graphics are gorgeous and the story is amazing. But when it comes to getting more characters, when you don‚Äôt have enough of the in-game items to do a gacha pull, the price for Genesis Crystals is asinine. You can‚Äôt really do anything unless you buy the thirty dollar Genesis Crystal pack. I would love if the devs could just lower the price by at least ten dollars. I get that the devs get a lot of money from the high priced in-game currency because they get people obsessed with buying it, but still, it‚Äôs too expensive for the people that aren‚Äôt completely addicted to the game. That‚Äôs the only major flaw of the game that I‚Äôve noticed. All in all, the game is amazing.
title: Amazing Game, but...

review:
Mihoyo have done a tremendous job with this game. Beautiful graphics, smooth gameplay, engaging characters and an intriguing story that keeps me coming back! For a Gacha game, I feel surprisingly fulfilled as a free-to-play player. Sure, I don‚Äôt have some of the best characters like Diluc, but I‚Äôve still managed to form a diverse roster of units and that is wonderful! And the story is just wonderful. Hats off to Mihoyo for creating a villain that I actually can feel compassion for and consider a friend, despite everything‚Äîthat‚Äôs so hard to do. 

My only qualm is that I want the rest of the main quest! There‚Äôs still so much left and I‚Äôm excited for more. Keep up the great work!
title: Superb and engaging!

review: It‚Äôs unbelievable how beautiful this game is.  I get totally consumed by the environment and story.  The controls are solid.  Gliding is amazing.  It‚Äôs hard to believe this is a mobile game, it‚Äôs that good.  Plus it‚Äôs f2p with no ads!  So far I haven‚Äôt needed to buy anything but I did anyway because I believe in supporting the devs when a game lets me choose to buy stuff instead of requiring it or bombarding me with ads.  I‚Äôm playing on an iphone 11 and the game runs flawlessly, although it will drain the battery so I keep it plugged in.  It‚Äôs taking 7gb of memory so make sure you‚Äôve got the space needed.  I can see I‚Äôll be playing this game for a very long time.

review: First started this game with an open mind and was not disappointed at all. Although this type of game was not the first of its kind, key characteristics such as: aesthetics, the gameplay, and even the functionality of things were impressive. To make the game even better, I believe that controller support for mobile devices should be implemented. Hear me out, in this day and age, many gamers have moved on to mobile gaming. By adding controller support, you are essentially letting the community know that you care about their opinions while it simultaneously attracts more audiences to the game. Thank you and looking forward to the future of this game.
title: Overall great game, however...

review: This game is beautiful. I want to love it, and I want to play it. However, Mihoyo is far too greedy, to the point where the future seems uncertain. The recently released character Zhongli is apparently a ‚Äúsupport‚Äù character, even though he was advertised as DPS. However, even as a support character, he is severely underwhelming, and he is easily outperformed by 4 stars. His stats and multipliers are terrible compared to 5 stars. Many of the basic things that should be included in his base kit, such as AOE shields and heal, are locked behind a massive paywall of constellations. Please buff him so he can fulfill his job as a support. The amount of money a player would need to invest for him to even be PLAYABLE is ridiculous. It is a shame that such a powerful character in lore is this weak in gameplay. If this continues, it‚Äôs possible that future 5 star characters will also be locked behind a paywall.
title: Justice for Zhongli

review: I really enjoy the game so far and even though I haven‚Äôt gotten very far yet I‚Äôm still enjoying myself. The only issue is that it crashes once every 30 minutes to an hour. Another problem is that the game drains your battery very quickly, but if you play it while it‚Äôs on the charger then it‚Äôs not really a problem. A good thing about this is that even though I don‚Äôt usually enjoy open world games I decided to give this one a shot and I‚Äôm so glad I did. Even though it has its problems it‚Äôs still very fun and I highly recommend this game to everyone.

title: So much fun! Would recommend 10/10

review:
This game is absolutely phenomenal, let me start off with one suggestion, after this one critique, the latter will all be on a positive note. I think there absolutely needs to be a deeper customization with character. A wardrobe, hair, body sizes, height, eye color, maybe mounts, etc. That would improve its immersion 10 fold.

Now that I have made my one and only suggestion, I can start to tell my true, transparent, deep love for this game so far.  I have played it every day since it‚Äôs release. If anyone is looking for a fulfilling game that will keep you up until 3 am, this is it right here. Don‚Äôt think about it, don‚Äôt hesitate. Just download it, you will not regret it.

title: This game

The third problem is when fighting the wind elemental to unlock the left-most tower, you can glitch a spot to where the wind-protector is stuck in its own trap and will die in under a minute. Lastly the game will crash often, I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs because the game just recently launched but I‚Äôve noticed that it will only do it when entering a new area.

title: Character customization

review:
This is a great game. Especially for a gatcha game. However, I‚Äôm finding it hard to care about wishes when leveling characters is such a pain. It‚Äôs very counter intuitive in a game that focuses on collecting characters to make it such a pain to level them. It‚Äôs slowly killing my momentum in the game sadly. You can‚Äôt even really try a character out or try different combos because you have to sink all of your exp items into a main team to make meaningful progress. If something isn‚Äôt done about it I‚Äôll probably just quit at this rate. 

Makes me sad not to give it a five star rating but they‚Äôre being greedy even by gatcha standards at this point. Which is silly because why would I spend money to get a character I can‚Äôt even use?

title: Reason for 4 Stars

review:
This is an amazing game that you will not want to put down. Literally you will spend all day playing and not even know it.
 
The graphics, amazing. Combat, amazing. Story, amazing. 

There are only a couple issues.

#1) not enough content, it‚Äôs been only 5 days since release and I have already finished almost everything. I am Adventure rank 33 and now all there is to do is search for chests, I have literally finished everything else. 

#2) the co-op leaves much to be desired. No real incentive to do co-op. Want to see more multiplayer options & benefits. Things you can only achieve by co-op (for example really hard large raids or bosses)

#3) there should be a way to extract materials. There is a set amount of materials in the game (mostly through chests & quests). Once those are completed, it‚Äôs extremely hard to find weapons or accessories. You then upgrade your current gear, to find better gear later.... but you have already spent most of your resources on those precious weapons. Need to have a resource extraction system.

Other than these 3, game is amazing! More work to do though!
title: Amazing Game. Not enough content.

review: Game is good, but the company IS VERY VERY GREEDY, almost everything is behind paywall, once you hit a certain level I literally only play 30 minutes a day then I log out.. if I want to play more i have to pay. If you want them stronger you have to pay for the character again 6 times oh and I also forgot to mention each high tier character costs around 360$ to obtain and you have to obtain em 6 times to get the full experience. And they‚Äôre getting greedier by the minute, they lack communication with their playerbase. It‚Äôs gotten to the point where everyone is protesting and the game isn‚Äôt even out for 3 months yet... 1 star review for the trash company that‚Äôs behind a good game smh.

title: The new Zelda

review:
... it‚Äôs hard to navigate with a black screen.

Now, let me be clear. I love, love, love the set up of this game and I‚Äôm having a blast with the open world play. It‚Äôs not overly complex and I like the random side quests that pop up. The cooking feature is  fun too.

I can navigate about 1/2 the map with a spotlight surrounding the character, which works fine most of the time. And even when the screen goes completely black (aside from the controls) it isn‚Äôt impossible to move around provided you‚Äôve unlocked the map for that area. Which is ALSO possible to do with a black screen lol. The rain seems to trigger it in Liyue and surrounding areas.

However completing certain quests are nigh impossible. The Gliding Test and Stormterrors Lair: Empty Abode have ground my gameplay to a near stop. Since I can‚Äôt make any leeway on those I‚Äôve just been focusing on level grinding, which isn‚Äôt nearly as satisfying.

The only place I‚Äôve found that shows the full sky is near the Cryo Regisvine, south-east of the Temple of Wolf. Which is quite lucky really, because the view is lovely.
title: I really want to give it 5‚òÖs, but...

My only problem is the lag and how it crashes on my phone occasionally. That‚Äôs a little frustrating. But other than those two things, AMAZING game!!!! title: DEFINITELY 5 STARS, just one tiny problem

review: It‚Äôs an absolutely phenomenal mobile game, the best I‚Äôve seen in a really long time, it doesn‚Äôt throw micro transactions in your face, has loads of voiced characters, a good story, fun gameplay and loads of exploration rewards with a surprising amount of content for, like I said, a mobile game. I really hope mihoyo continues to update and put out games like this, I miss the days of amazing mobile gems like aurum blade, monster wars, battle heart and more which has sadly died out in recent times with gimmicky ad filled games or blatant cash traps, but this gives me hope for at least one good mobile developer to revive the golden age of mobile games

review:
I‚Äôm super excited for the switch release whenever it happens so I can use a controller to play this great game. So far from what I‚Äôve experienced it‚Äôs been a lot of fun and I‚Äôm looking forward to see what else the game has in store. There are a few things that could be improved, however:

1. I don‚Äôt know what it is but the camera on mobile is really weird. It would be great if the camera was sort of soft-locked to a perspective that followed the character‚Äôs movements a bit more because sometimes you‚Äôll get swarmed by enemies but the camera is locked to an awkward position making it hard to see. No doubt camera controls work better on PC or console but it‚Äôs definitely troublesome on mobile.

2. Obstacles remain opaque when they block the camera‚Äôs view. I‚Äôll be in the middle of fighting a boss creature and accidentally run under a tree and now I can‚Äôt see anything but the top of the tree. 

Hopefully some of the issues can be resolved to raise the game‚Äôs standard of living a bit.

***Edit: really frustrating that melee characters have no way to attack aerial enemies :/

review: First off, I want to say I love this game! It has a huge world to explore, fun gameplay mechanics, and cool plot line. The game is certainly playable with the characters you can get for free. However, PLEASE improve the gacha rates! It hurts my soul to see people spending 4000+ dollars for one character!! I really want Diluc but the odds are just so insanely low that I can‚Äôt even try for it! My suggestion would be to perhaps add a sparking system where after a certain number of pulls you could choose which character to get (like Fire Emblem Heroes). I would totally spend money if I had a guaranteed Diluc after a certain amount. But right now, the rates are just abysmally low if you want a particular character.

There are some problems with mobile, like the game will randomly close on me. review:
I LOOOOVVVVEEEEE this game but I wish you could get old characters that have already came out such as Klee. I really want Klee but I can‚Äôt get her because she‚Äôs unavailable! I‚Äôve only played for maybe a month or so and I didn‚Äôt know how to use the wish mechanic so I wasn‚Äôt able to get Klee. I suggest two things to fix this problem because I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one that has missed out on a character due to this. 

1. Maybe put in a ‚Äútime travel‚Äù feature. Somewhere in the game you could have an option to put your game back in time. Similar to the forward time mechanic. So you could go back and wish on a banner that could no longer be available in real life time. 

2. Maybe put in more banners to wish on but like in elemental separate banners. For example all pyro characters in one banner and anemo characters in a separate banner. 

I think either of those ideas would be a tremendous addition to the game and would most likely help out when wanting specific characters.
title: My favorite game!!! But...

review:
Definitely beautiful. I've never seen a mobile RPG this beautiful, even on PC. The graphics are, IMO, far better than any other mobile game out there, even PUBG and Infinity Blade 3 and what else I've played before. Just prepare a fan to cool your phone's CPU and GPU when playing this game. Also, if you're an anime fan, you should definitely try it out. You might be in for a surprise.

Wasn't a fan of Honkai Impact, but this game is entirely a different beast. 

Tech Otakus Save The World.

title: Uh...

review: If you are a fan of anime products or anime games, this is a must-play. If you are a fan of open-world games with beautiful graphics, landscapes and music, this is a must-play. If you are a fan of RPGs, this is a must-play. Hell, if you are even a casual video game player, you NEED to try Genshin Impact. Excellent graphics, music, gameplay, and progression makes for a top-5 game of 2020, whether you play it on mobile, PS4, Windows, or otherwise. It helps to have good storytelling and co-op, too. If I had to nitpick, the game does drop frames at times, especially during drastic lighting changes, but I could hardly justify giving a 4/5 for something like that.
title: A Must-Play

review: Genshin Impact is one of the funnest and most favorite games I‚Äôve ever played. The story is fun (and depending on your choices can be funny too) and the gameplay and controls are good. One of the best things is that you don‚Äôt need good characters to be good and have fun. Actually, one of the things that surprised me was that the loading screen time is fast. However, I think that the co-op mode needs some new functions. Almost everything needs original resin and the map bosses are way too easy. I think that adding temples as co-op options would be a great addition to the game or some other feature that allows my friends and I to grind together and play together more.
title: One of the best game‚Äôs I‚Äôve ever played

review:
I‚Äôm putting a lot of time in the game on the PS4 and figured I might as well download the game on my phone since I‚Äôm spending a lot of time sitting around and waiting at places. Only problem is I can‚Äôt continue my PS4 save and I‚Äôm not going to invest any meaning time, or money for that matter, on the mobile version of the game when I‚Äôve already done both on the PS4.

And why can I not listen to my own music???? The music in the game isn‚Äôt bad by any means, I‚Äôd just like to listen to my own music.

My rating has nothing at all to do with the game or gameplay though. The game itself is amazing. The pricing is ridiculous but the game is also free so I can let that slide here. Drop rates are horrendous. I get that it‚Äôs a gacha game but c‚Äômon man, be at least a little consumer friendly here.

Definitely going to be buying a few rolls to get some of the characters I‚Äôve fallen in love with in the story though! Hahaha

review:
Genshin Impact completely raises the bar when it comes to mobile games.  While also launching on PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, and Windows, the mobile release provides the same, full experience.

The lovingly detailed graphics can be cranked to max on an iPhone 10 (other experiences may be different), and the music is extremely well done throughout.  Surprisingly enough, the English voiceovers are also quite competent (something that‚Äôs almost unheard of when it comes to anime style games).

Impressively, progression is stored in real-time.  Regardless of when the game is closed (aside from cutscenes), it will always resume at that exact location (along with every carried item) the next time it‚Äôs launched.

The vast, magical world features a massive amount of content already.  Exploring it is a joy, and I genuinely look forward to how it will continue to grow from here.

(Side note: Once the controller mapping and full screen resolution are fixed for the PC, I‚Äôll be continuing my adventures on there as well.)
title: Simply Amazing

That was a tangent, but anyway, I wish that you could sell a limited amount of materials to the shops, because I have extra, and I use my mora almost as soon as I get it. The graphics are amazing though, and I like the weather and day/night cycle actually affecting things.

title: I‚Äôve been supporting since it‚Äôs initial startup

review:
First off I‚Äôd like to say I gave 4 stars only because there is room for improvement like most games. But I currently don‚Äôt have any complaints besides more ‚Äúin game‚Äù shop option.

I am playing this on an iPhone 11 Pro Max currently.

-Graphics are really great! Colors are vibrant and details are well thought out.

-The option of 60 FPS is awesome! Hopefully even higher FPS in the next updates!

-Seems to be many character choices with various specialties. Such as Pyro type hero using spell book or a Pyro hero using a physical weapon.

-Open world seems to be decently vast, and your character can scale many different objects. 

I have played/play other games where you have a team of characters and a fairly open world realm. But this one tops those so far in many ways.

This game isn‚Äôt cluttered with an infinite stream of random chats popping up. It also doesn‚Äôt have a ton of ads for in shop items available to purchase all over the screen. 
So the screen stays fairly clean and visible. That‚Äôs a huge plus in my opinion.

Definitely worth trying it out!

title: This game is AMAZING

review:
Finally, a game to save me from 2020‚Äôs demise. I have been playing 10+ hours a day when the game came out. I love everything about it! 

The open world exploration, the beautiful, fantasy-like graphics, the character design and the combat system are well-executed. The puzzles, chests and random events always sucked me into playing another 2 hours. Honestly, after reading the criticism for the gacha system, I believe the system is fair compared to other mobile games. There is a GUARANTEED legendary after 90 rolls‚Äî most gacha games don‚Äôt have a guarantee.

Also, you aren‚Äôt limited as F2P since this is an open world PvE game. People who spend money on the game will not affect you at all. Plus, the game gives you lots of opportunities to obtain characters! As long as you can control your own spending habits, you‚Äôll be fineee.

Genshin is apparently updating every 6 weeks with new content. I love the excitement of new stories, characters and puzzles. So far, after 200+ hours in, I‚Äôm not bored at all!

title: Game review

review:
It‚Äôd be essay material to go into detail how how horrible this game is once past the honeymoon phase of early exploration and levels so instead short and concise. 
Minimal gameplay with gated resin (stamina) that refreshes slowly. The plus 40 to the cap does nothing except change time to cap resin from 16h to 20 hours. 
So much tied to this resin currency that even if you have luck in the rng Gatcha element, you need to use all you have to have them be mediocre on your team. Or just pay more money. Also pay money to roll another rng element of artifacts. Just roll roll roll and open those wallets! 
But yeah, could also just dedicate a months worth of log in dailies use up resin and repeat to get one character leveled and geared.  Considering there‚Äôs what? 24 characters? Guess you got two years of content to do on repeat then! 
Wasted potential.

title: Best Game On The Market!!!!

review: Ok straight up pros and cons about this game. Don‚Äôt get me wrong this game is extremely addicting once you get into it as most games should, but the fact that it‚Äôs a pc game that turned into a mobile app was a really big issue for me. This is due to Sony releasing Genshin Impact for PlayStation+. Now I‚Äôm not saying that‚Äôs there‚Äôs anything wrong with it, its just the fact that not everyone can enjoy an open world RPG as an app. So my suggestions are that if you‚Äôre planning on creating an app based on an Open World RPG platform which keep in mind, ‚Äúwas made on PC‚Äù. Can you at least make this game controller compatible so that way all players (Including veteran players) can enjoy this game to its fullest extent and see what more it has to offer? Please and thank you for reading this through. Sorry for the one star btw, I needed something eye catchingüòÇ
title: APPLE I HOPE YOU FRICKEN READ THIS!!!

review: I love the game. But... I hate how it boils down to luck and gambling. So of course it's a gacha game and you have to put money to get characters. Other games allow you to get 5star characters with enough work. This doesn't. The drop rate on the 5star char is like 0.01. I wish they'd change it to cumulative chance. Other games do this where the more you spend the higher the chance of getting the character you want. Soon reaching a point where it's a guaranteed drop. I just feel left behind by 1) guys who are super lucky 2) guys with a ton of money. I really wish they'd fix this. If they do I see myself staying for longer and spending more cash on this nice game.
title: It's a gambling game

review: So I‚Äôve played this for a few days. Good and fun game overall, characters are interesting and the mobs are fun to fight while also giving a good challenge. Why 4 stars? Trust me, I‚Äôd LOVE to give it 5 stars, and this is where the ‚Äúpatching‚Äù part from the title comes in. Myself and many other players suffer from a bug/glitch that hinders how far we can see, we can only see about 10-20 feet away from us and everything else is a dark abyss staring into your soul... and even worse, whenever you get wet, the water turns into ginormous black cubes that clings to your body which makes it really annoying. So good game, but Mihoyo needs to fix some stuff.
title: Pretty good but could use some patching

review: It is a great game! It is very suprising how good the game is to be free but it definetly is nice that it is free! The graphics are really good and the game is very smooth! The storyline is very clear, with no extra clutter that do not connect to the story. I recommend getting this game!
title: Great game!  | (‚Ä¢ ‚ó°‚Ä¢)|

review: i would definitely give this game a 5 star rating because of how much fun i have while playing the game but those hawks ....... please stop making me fight the hawks of oceanids when i have no characters on my team who can fight long or mid range <///3 it gets so annoying when i don't have any characters who can properly fight them because they are literally IN mid air and my catalyst users are all hydro characters therefore even if i try to hit them , nothing will happen ......... anyways please fix this i hate having to stress out about the hawks thank you mihoyo i love you for creating such a great game mwah kisses <3
title: stop making me fight hawks whenever i fight oceanids please

review: I love this game !! it runs surprisingly well on iPad, and what shocked me the most is how beautiful the graphics are. it‚Äôs just a lovely universe to spend time in, and the more you play the more you get to choose your own story and do whatever you like. It‚Äôs also really easy to understand, for games like these I‚Äôm often confused but that has never been a problem with genshin impact. I‚Äôm really unsure why some people are having a lot of lag and difficulty playing on iOS, because I play this game on both iPad and iPhone and it works perfectly.
title: I love this game, it‚Äôs such a nice universe to spend time in !!

review:
I wish there was a way to counter enemy attacks. Or a cause a break in them. Nothing literally infuriates me more than just getting pile driven by a million attacks all at once and there is literally nothing you can do.

Further more, on mobile changing out your characters or using your specials just sometimes doesnt work well. You can hammer away at the screen trying to swap or use a special and it just doesnt work. Ive yet to try it on pc to see if it makes more sense to play.

I also wish I could skip 90% of the dialogue and cut scenes. I dont really care about the story at all and I hate that you cant skip through it faster.

I think Im AR38 and Im happy to say I hardly know or care whats going on story wise, but the gameplay is fun and addicting. The gameplay gets super grindy after AR30 and theres not a whole lot to do after dailies. You can get single wishes just about daily but for the most part you have to pay money to try and get characters. I did roll diluc for free in wishes I earned in game, so that felt good. It does seem like they are considerably constant at rolling out new stuff, so thank you for creating a new free game for us to play.
title: Add a counter system.

review: I really enjoy playing Genshin. It scratches that RPG itch i‚Äôve been trying to get for years. The only thing that keeps turning me off from actually achieving things is the arbitrarily suffocating, quite pointless and frankly disgusting amount of unskippable dialogue throughout every aspect of the game. You can‚Äôt escape it. Its around every turn, with every quest. The conversations drone on for punishingly long durations, to the point where I‚Äôd rather be getting 30 second Mesothelioma ads. I spend more time sitting here tapping away skipping cutscenes and character conversations that lead nowhere, than I do actually playing the game.
title: Amazing game, if you want to spend equal time skipping dialogue.

review: This game gives off vibes that remind me of Breath of the Wild. And for a company that makes mobile games to do that.....outstanding. I do have some things I would like added or changed. Most importantly, I want to be able to pet the cats and dogs. They follow you around for a short while and all you can really do is...run around in a circle around them. I would also like it if there was a dodge mechanic in the game and not just dashing. I also think when you level up, overtime, the quests, commissions leylines, and all that stuff give you should give you more EXP. But thats about it. Amazing game.
title: Masterpiece

review: ever since playing on IOS ipad, I frequently had no issues in the beginning until it had started to crash while 30 minutes taken on the game, it kept crashing and crashing after the 30 minutes, I can sit there and come back and game crashed after lagging, periods of glitches, where sometimes on iPhone or iPad, we end up fallen through thin air through the grass and the detail of the grass suddenly disappears and I do lost track where I am, but it gets me annoyed of the crashes, I just needed to be mentioned if anyone else noticed this issue being on iOS but that‚Äôs all I have for you today:D
title: Not this game crashing on me

review:
Probably wait a few months for them to fix the worst bugs. Beautiful game, has a ton of potential to be even comparable to Zelda BOTW, however because it is so wildly incomplete some things become very frustrating. Here are just a few:
1. Bosses will sometimes disappear. You can‚Äôt see them and you can‚Äôt do damage to them until they glitch back in. When they do glitch back in, it is sometimes with a refilled health bar. 
2. The story is incomplete, so in order to make it seem like it is enough content, progressing through is painfully slow and barred by your ‚Äúadventure rank‚Äù stat that you can only upgrade quickly through hours and hours of gameplay or money. 
3. Free to play is heavily punished. I understand they need to make a profit, but if that‚Äôs true then put some cost up front. Don‚Äôt ever count on getting a five star character. 
4. Aiming arrow shots is broken, completely useless. Don‚Äôt aim yourself, rely on the auto-aim. 
5. You‚Äôll sometimes get stuck in the terrain which is especially frustrating mid combat.
Other than these main ones, the rest is ok.
Wait for the bugs.
title: Unfinished

review:
While athletically very beautiful and with a great story. This is a GACHA GAME. They have lots of predatory LOOT BOXES and MICRO and MACRO TRANSACTIONS implemented to ‚Äúspeed your progress‚Äù I strongly suggest for people early on in the game to get out while they still haven‚Äôt spent money on this game. They also have an energy systems called ‚Äúresin‚Äù which limits what you can or cannot do everyday.  So while yes you can explore and have fun with the story once you get to level between 40-60 the content drought becomes more apparent. They give you a lot of quests and progressing for early game to keep the player engaged and focused. However as far as late game goes you pretty much have to plan what you want to do as you have limited resin per day.
Which is just another way of pressuring you in buying the loot boxes which contain character/heroes  and weapons.
title: Warning before playing

review:
Such an amazing game! The only thing that‚Äôs making me sad is the fact that I can‚Äôt play using my ipad 7.. i hope the game can be compatible with more devices in the future.
Also i wish i can add my friends who play in Asia while im using America‚Äôs server.
And i think that we should be able to customize our main character‚Äôs face, hair, and color .. how tall and wide too, also maybe have the ability to choose our main character‚Äôs weapon type also.
O and i wish if the game was more of an online game where i can see real people walking around lol... yeah that‚Äôs all other than that I HONESTLY LOVE THIS GAME LIKE OMG T^T
title: Amazing!

review:
I have not had this much fun with a game in years. The theme of the game and characters are quite chipper, and helps me forget about what year we are in. The voice acting is on point, and my lord, Paimon is too pure for this world. 

There are a few minor bugs. The worst I‚Äôve seen is where a character will stop moving their mouth even though you hear them talking. But that is certainly minor compared to the huge success the game is overall.

If you haven‚Äôt already hit that download button.....then get on it! If you are on the fence about this game, it will at least be worth the download and try.
title: Refreshing and Fun

review: So far this game is astounding! I adore all the minor details of it and the voiceovers so far! However, I quickly experienced a few issues such as not being able to see the surroundings. When I play, everything besides a small circle in which the character is in is blackened out, including the water. For some strange reason as well, when the character goes into the water, they started emitting a bright light. When this happens, I cannot turn it off and it makes it quite difficult to see the few surroundings that are actually shown. Other than that though, this game is fantastic!
title: Incredible! A few issues though

review:

I did make a few purchases but the game can still be enjoyed without spending any money. It‚Äôs fun, the world is huge, the story is amazing, and the art work is phenomenal. 
I play FFXIV and Monster Hunter World and I‚Äôve put them on hold for weeks just to solely play Genshin Impact. 
I hope someone from support will see this!!

title: Beautiful Amazing Fun

review: initially saw ads for the game on my Social media platform under anime like content. title: So worth it!!! Give five out of five

I play on IPhone 7 and the game is now not accessible for me, I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs because I playing on a device lower than a IPhone 8, but the game rarely lagged on my part, so I don‚Äôt understand why y‚Äôall would put restrictions on who can play. review: This game is beautiful and entertaining, which is a combo I do not normally find in mobile games. The music is a blessing to hear and the characters (and certain monsters) are really cute, with certain exceptions. I have very few complaints about this game, and the few ones I do have are simply about how much I hate Paimon. Furthermore, I have high hopes and expectations for this game in the future. I hope to see costumes for the characters, buyable homes, and pets, among other things, in future updates. In general, this game has a nice storyline, beautiful scenes and music, and, for the most part, likable characters.
title: Absolutely Amazing

review:
Imma be real, I don‚Äôt play these Anime RPG style games but I downloaded it and immediately loved it, graphics are 10/10, super high quality, the game is barely P2W which is a good thing imo so it makes you progress at a set pace rather than just being able to buy your way to a higher level, the storyline is clearly well thought out and is great, I especially love that it‚Äôs a huge open world game, letting you experiment on your own and explore. review:
The stunning open world, amazing characters, and out of this world music truly makes this game worth playing alone. It is a free to play triple AAA game to be honest

But behind all that is the painful gated things in he game... The stamina system I understand but imo it regenerates way too slow (1 stamina every 8 minutes) and costs too much. You need 20, 40, and 60 to do certain things. The monetization is also kinda scummy.. 0.6% rate for a 5 star character, one of the worst in gacha gaming. Also becomes a chest opening simulator as you progress towards the end 

But ultimately I have some faith mihoyo will address and fix some of these problems hopefully
title: Beautiful game, just a few gripes

review:
This game is phenomenal overall. It‚Äôs very fun to play, however, I will say that there are quite a few slow aspects. Some of the missions drag and it‚Äôs horrendously slow to level up your adventure rank. Plus, if you aren‚Äôt lucky (like me), you won‚Äôt draw many characters from wishes (although my husband almost has all of them). 
The app is an absolute nightmare. I‚Äôm lucky to make it 3 minutes without it crashing and that‚Äôs a lot of luck. I‚Äôve had to play on PC (which is where it really shines) but I‚Äôve never had a game crash nearly as much as this on my iPad/iPhone. Also, the load time to start this game is ridiculous on the iPad/iPhone and everything I have is current on software. Hoping it improves to where it is actually playable on mobile!
title: Phenomenal Game-Terrible App

review: This game is very well made and just from an opinion of one of the players and more will most-likely share the same opinion, but I would love to play this game on controller using my phone, I don‚Äôt have a great computer to be able to play this or a PS4 but I would love to have controller support, it would definitely make the game more fun to play on iPhone, I‚Äôm not sure if this is already being planned or not but it would be great to have this feature, the game is still very easily playable on touchscreen it would just be more convenient for the people who have a controller but no supporting consoles for the game *besides IPhone that is*
title: Needs controller support in the future.

review: I don't think I have anything to say that hasn't been said already. It runs beautifully on my iPad Pro, and it's especially nice to be able to adjust the graphics to adjust performance. The only thing I would like is controller support for this mobile version. It would make playing on something like an iPad Pro so much better, since it has more screen real estate, and with stands and keyboards, notably the magic keyboard for iPad Pro, makes it feel like I'm playing PC games on my PC... except it'd be playing mobile games, like these ESPECIALLY, on my iPad Pro!
title: A game that does things well

review: I played it on pc, I personally like pc better since you can see the full details and graphics on the bigger screen. After playing on pc, I had to download on my phone bc it‚Äôs so addicting! Got my husband hooked on to it too, and he usually don‚Äôt like ‚Äòcute‚Äô graphics. I have to say, the developers did put a lot of thoughts into this game seeing the details of graphics, mechanics, elemental works, weather, etc. I personally think you didn‚Äôt even need to spend money to play this game (not yet atleast, I played for 8 hrs now). Thank you for a great game! It does lag on phone a bit, but pc is awesome!!!
title: Wow, just wow

review: This game is one of a few to deliver a console-quality experience on mobile (and the only one to do it for free). The gameplay is simply amazing, the element system leads to smooth combat, the story and characters are interesting (except Paimon, I hate her), the graphics are beautiful, just everything about this game is fantastic. The exploration, freedom, and pacing are superb. It's like Breath of the Wild but with simpler combat and exploration is rewarded instead of required. I love this game so much, and I will probably end up 100%ing it because it's just so fun. Thank you so much for this mobile port, nothing was lost in translation.
title: Quality mobile game

review: I have this game in my iPhone XS Max, PC, and PS4. I‚Äôm highly addicted and can‚Äôt get enough! I‚Äôve been waiting for this game for years and now it‚Äôs finally here. They didn‚Äôt disappoint! In fact learning that it was going to be free to play went above and beyond my expectations seeing as I was ready to spend just about anything on this game. I will say that it runs extremely smoothly on my pc (just waiting for that ultra option so I can uncap my frames above 60). It is super jittery on PS4 though. Maybe the console simply can‚Äôt keep up with graphics? If that could be further optimized that would be nice.
title: Amazing adventure awaits!

review: I saw this game in an article that I was reading earlier this morning and had to check it out. This is just jaw dropping for a mobile game. Currently playing this on my 11 inch iPad Pro and it just feels so nice to play a game that is similar to Breath of the Wild. My only complaint so far is that I wish there was controller support for people playing on iPad. It would definitely make the game that much better, but I can see why it hasn‚Äôt been implemented yet as it might be hard to combine the special moves that you acquire later on. All in all, just an amazing piece all together and can‚Äôt wait to see how much further things can go with this.
title: Absolutely stunning

review:
Game is far better then dragon raja in character personality and voices.

Combat is nice takes time getting used to like any mobile game. 

I wanted to play a game that got the itch that breath wild could quench, this game it‚Äôs not breath of wild but it‚Äôs good enough to feel the wild breezes. 

Most games this style, raja or gacha games there doing stuff all time to the point that it‚Äôs hard to stay on track and then the tasks become boring lists. However, this game rewards down time by giving tons of hidden things. 

If I were critical on anything bad about game it be hard to find anything to dislike. The one thing I‚Äôd say is I can clearly hear a light 16/14 year old voice for a 24 something dark/ptsd character and that bugs me slightly but that could just be me as someone who has experience being on the dark reality side. Who knows maybe the original acter is good. and the issue is from being dubbed.

 I really enjoyed the game besides minor bugs/voices. You should try it too.
title: Better then I thought

review:
The game has far exceeded my expectations! It‚Äôs a beautiful game with a vast world to explore. The combat system isn‚Äôt overly complex but still requires thinking to make it fulfilling and enjoyable! Lots to do daily without feeling the need to play all day to exceed! Despite what people say, it is extremely F2P friendly with lots of changes to get crystals to roll for characters you want. Even the free characters are decent enough to get you through most content. Definitely worthy a try!

Remember folks that it recommends iPhone 8 Plus or above to run decently. Runs perfectly fine with an iPhone SE 2020!
title: Wonderful Gameplay, Graphics, F2P

review: A beautiful game, I cannot believe something like this is even possible on mobile.  Amazing gameplay, graphics, story...  Gacha system is terrible however.  .6 percent chance for a 5 star? Unreal...for a game as beautiful as this I would have happily paid actual cash for it, so I‚Äôm rly unsure how such a monetisation scheme like this works except to pray on those with gambling problems.  It worries me that this is where we are at with gaming...free to pay needs to stop.   For something of this quality, I would happily fork over 40-50 bucks just to be able to play with everything unlocked, and not having to worry someone with a mental health issue is being exploited.
title: Beautiful game

review: Just started playing this game today and I like the game two things I would recommend the developers do is come up with a easier way for your characters to unequip there weapons and etc because it‚Äôs kind of confusing how u go about it and also idk if it‚Äôs just me but I reached level 20 already and I‚Äôm looking around and I don‚Äôt see a lot of different kinds of monsters just slimes and so called trolls which is ok I guess but having more different things to attack would be better other then that love the way u guys put this game together it‚Äôs different in a way which is cool

title: The game is good so far but I am having problems.....

review: This game is good in all, but I played Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild 2 years ago and the story, mechanics, and graphic are almost completely the same. For example, the gilder you get at the beginning is of the game works the exact same way the Zelda one does, the stamina bar, the climbing, and the evade mechanic are exactly the same as Zelda, and the four temples of air or whatever are like the shrines in Zelda. I mean, they literally glow blue when you use them and if that doesn‚Äôt wring a bell then i don‚Äôt know what does. Again, this game is cool, and I haven‚Äôt even finished it so maybe I‚Äôm being crazy, but it‚Äôs a close game to Legend of Zelda Breath of The Wilds. Thank you for reading.
title: Copy of legends of Zelda

review: Hello! This app is really amazing. I had never expected to get it in the first place, but I guess it grew on me. Such amazing graphics and gameplay, probably my favorite RPG. But, for some odd reason I‚Äôve had this weird glitch where it doesn‚Äôt load me in, the screen just stays white and It won‚Äôt let me play this game. This happened after I installed IOS 14.1. I am a but confused if this was from the update or a glitch. I‚Äôve tried to re-install it but nothing has worked. I really hope this is fixed and I will be able to play Genshin Impact on my IPad again.
title: Great app! But I have a small problem.

review:
Masterful combination of rpg elements, gacha, exploration and combat akin to Zelda breath of the wild, skyrim and assassins creed. Only a few things holding this back from a 5/5 for me. the lack of primagems in the end game. As well as the usual complaint of resin. Would be nice to have other instances or raids to complete with other people for regular rewards (outside of using resin for mundane daily activities.)

The rates are fine as is, with a guaranteed 5 star every 90 rolls, but being able to do a 10 roll once every week and a half is slightly infuriating, especially when it turns out to be a favonius weapon dupe.

Events are definitely a work in progress but only add to the fun factor. (Again, co op events and the like should be separated from the resin system, literally was able to play for like an hour with friends before we were done, all the built up excitement for nothing.)

Can‚Äôt wait for a resin-less guild system/ raids/ pvp and all that!

The only way the game can go from here is up!

I am a fan of gacha games. I‚Äôve played a few of them, and they come with a lot of ups and downs. Some of them have really cool characters, but bad battle systems, others you have to constantly grind to get things and end up getting nothing. It all comes down to luck. What I like about this game, however, is that every item has its own little story, each character with their own unique traits. It really makes you feel like you‚Äôre a part of the game, getting to know these people. Honestly one of the best games I have played, I would recommend this to anyone.
title: Not just any gacha game

review:
I‚Äôve never seen an open world online co-op anime RPG game that has cross play between this many platforms before. I initially started on PC then switch to mobile when I‚Äôm going to bed. The experience differs drastically but I enjoy both. Definitely not a game for people with underperforming or outdated devices. 

Biggest complaint is the gacha rates. HOWEVER, the game gives you story units to use so there‚Äôs not an absolute necessity to gamble gacha. Regardless, gameplay is so incredibly fun and it‚Äôs enough to make me not want to care about the rest. I don‚Äôt ever write reviews so this was structured horribly. Tldr, fun as hell game!
title: A genre of its own, ridiculously fun

review: Genshin Impact is a lot of fun, I have been playing it non stop recently. The only thing I would say it lacks is the ability to customize at least your main character. Most people like to play as characters that look like themselves, including myself. However, there are no redheaded female characters, only men. There‚Äôs even a girl with pink hair. I‚Äôd also like to add that it may expand the games audience to possibly add some poc characters in the future. I know the cavalry captain has darker skin, but you know what I mean. Hopefully a customizing feature will be released in the future!
title: Customizing Characters

review: This game isn't like other free to play games. It actually rewards you for playing and leveling up and doesn't force ads on you while you play. There is in app purchases but they aren't necessary as they give you some for free and have multiple ways of paying with items earned in-game. Takes a long time before you can play multiplayer and if I put the settings on max it overclocks the iPhone 12 Pro Max and makes it very hot and the game isn't even in 4K yet still studders while playing on 60fps. Other than that I'd give it 5 stars. Please try to make the game run smoother for iPhone 12 pro max and I'll make 5 stars
title: Very impressed!

review: This game is beautiful, and I was having fun playing it and happily investing money into it...until they released Zhongli.  Zhongli was advertised as a shield builder that could also dish out ‚Äúenormous damage‚Äù according to one of their trailers.  Sounded fun to me, so I spent money and got the character (pity, of course).  After many people tested out the character it was found that his damage dealing was lacking, and people complained en mass.  Mihoyo then released a statement that the character was intended to be a tank.  I felt cheated out of my money and will not spend anymore on this game.  Also, be careful of your account, the games security is very poor, despite the company making record profits, they have not acknowledged this problem, and have not released a statement about plans to upgrade.  Such mismanagement of a potentially great game.  Stay away!
title: Misleading Tactics

review: I absolutely love genshin impact, i am quite literally obsessed with it but there is just one problem. It‚Äôs not very playable unless you have wifi. I‚Äôm not at that stage yet, but I can already tell since the world got really empty once I completed the Mondstadt Archon Quest. Also, certain bosses like the Oceanid has too many ‚Äúhit you no matter what you try‚Äù attacks, which is incredibly frustrating if there‚Äôs a bunch of crows keeping you in stun-lock. I hope this game gets major improvement, it‚Äôs so good, but seems too against the player sometimes.

review: I was super exited, the graphics looked great. It took a while to download, so that was pretty annoying. When it finally downloaded however, (whole game package involved), there were black chunks everywhere. I had no idea where I was going! The only thing that helped was the mini-map. Whenever cutscenes came around, my device would crash, freeze up, or continue without showing the cutscene. I was super stoked for the game, but all I get to see is bad graphics, a black sky, and a small area that I can see. I tried seeing if it was a storage issue, but it wasn‚Äôt (I had more than 3/4 left of storage.) I tried taking off some huge files that I didn‚Äôt need, but nothing made a difference. Please fix this! The mobile version was overall chunky, and just took up a lot of data.
title: Great game, Horrible lag.

review: I don‚Äôt even know where to begin... this game is unbelievable! For those of you out there who have reduced this in your mind to being nothing more than a Zelda: Breath of the Wild clone I would dare you to try it for yourself. It is so much more! Heavily inspired, true, but it has enough of its own identity to stand apart. A breathtaking world filled to the brim, just waiting to be explored. Fast paced, engaging combat with rewarding equipment customization. A rich, interesting story that will keep you hooked. There‚Äôs something here for everyone, and being free to play (not even pay to win) there‚Äôs no excuse not to try.

Like you jump off a cliff dive downwards and then back up do your gliding faster and further. I also think the animation for gliding seems...just meh. -Clumsee

title: Pls fix

review:
Put simply, this is what I expected when I played Honkai Impact 3, and what it tried to accomplish is some regards

The world is so expansive, I nearly got lost during the tutorial, and that's a good thing! It shows how much effort was put into making this game as open world as possible. 

My only complaint is that, at least in the early game, there's no mid ground in traversing the landscape. You are either doing a leasurly jog or teleporting across the map with way points, but the game is so beautiful and full of extra content that there's always something to do while you explore and travel

title: Love this game

review: The game play is really great, more of the same from a great phone game dev. The characters are very cool and feel different from each other. But like my title I feel the system this game uses to fund itself is a huge scam. It charges an overt amount for people to roll for characters, with less than 1% chance to get what you actually want. Especially during these hard pandemic times it is such a shame to see such blatant thievery from hard working people to gamble their money away. I hope the devs fix their monitization of this game and really allow for a wider audience to enjoy the beautiful stunning world they have built. Final note from playing the start is a little slow, but after you finish the start area the game lets you explore more and is just amazing.
title: Scam

review:
The game itself is much larger than I anticipated for a phone game. I‚Äôm sad that you can‚Äôt play interchangeably between platforms, phone to ps4 and vice versa. That would be pretty awesome in order to play on the go, but maybe in the future? 
The controls are a little smushed, but it‚Äôs to be expected since it‚Äôs on a phone. 
The characters are well developed, the gameplay is dynamic, the worlds are very beautifully crafted. I‚Äôve only recently started playing, but have already made a lot of progress. You would think it would be harder to pick up, but it‚Äôs pretty intuitive! 
If you played Skyrim or games like it, and you enjoyed it, then you‚Äôll definitely love this game. 
My one critique would be that the menus are a bit convoluted. There are a ton of ways to get to everything, but they aren‚Äôt all easily deciphered. I still have great difficulty finding the daily log to
Check in and get my daily boost. Seriously, it‚Äôs frustrating.

review: SO GOOD!! Such a well made rpg, the graphics are INSANE for a mobile game. totally succeeded my expectations. I love all the characters, and I find the storyline REALLY INTERESTING. The whole world is beautiful, there‚Äôs so much to explore! I do have a complaint tho, i don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because of my phone or if it‚Äôs a universal problem. When i try teleporting, it kicks me out the app. Not all the time, but it‚Äôs happened more times than i‚Äôd like to admit. Other than that, i‚Äôve had no problems!
