title: I LOVE THIS GAME AAAA

review:
I‚Äôve played almost every mobile RPG there is and this is the first one that is indistinguishable from a console or PC game.

Genshin Impact made the smart move to avoid auto play features. I have deleted every game that uses auto play.

Also, there is no pay to play. I am enjoying the full version of the game entirely for free. I would happily pay $5 or more for this game.

I am leveling up based on game xp and not paying them. I love that they avoid micro transactions and p2p.

The controls are great as well. A bit rigid at times, but nothing that effects the game play too much.

The story and graphics are next to none. Incredible voice acting and a vast in depth story. 

It‚Äôs challenging as well. I‚Äôve died multiple times before figuring out how to fight certain bosses and it forces you to do the side quests to level up or some bosses are too much. 

If you like fantasy RPGs, this is the best mobile game you can possibly download and it‚Äôs entirely free.
title: Phenomenal mobile game

I tried to look up the solutions for both of the errors but could only find the answer for the insufficient storage error. It says to go to settings, go to storage, click Genshin Impact, and tap clear cache and data. I don‚Äôt have a cache and data button so I don‚Äôt know what to do.

review:
i loooove the story of Genshin Impact. It feels like a complete anime story. I like the assortment of characters, and they way the story makes you feel fall in love with them. 

that said, i haaaate the fighting control. the control limits my view on where i am going, and if the battle is happening near trees, it obscures the view. i guess that‚Äôs why they made healing really easy by letting the player pause and get food.

another thing that i hate is the archers controls. i try to aim, but then when i adjust the aim, i accidentally press the aim button so i lose the aim mode. this has gotten me into trouble several times especially in boss fights.

but the story is soooo good, and the graphics even at low setting is fantastic. i also love the glide mode and some small puzzles where you try to figure out what should be done in one situation, then later you find put that you did this before, ie time warp. Thank you so much for making this available as free to play!

review:
I originally had a review suggesting that we should be able to play with friends and it should have a chat system in game but once I got to a certain level all of that stuff is actually there. -facepalm-

HOWEVER I would still like to see the ability to chat in a server chat and direct message to your friends without being in their world. 
Currently I am seeking help to kill 6 of these fatui elemental guys and the only way I can ask is by setting a signature and hoping someone reads it. Or wait for my friend to wake up and message her on discord but that‚Äôs a lot. 

Anyway this game is still a 5 star game. Very impressive for mobile.

Side note: I think the people experiencing issues are likely using older devices. That‚Äôs usually the case so I wouldn‚Äôt pay them too much mind if you have the iPhone X or newer you won‚Äôt have an issue.
title: Great game. Some room for improvement.

review:
The open world loads itself seamlessly, and a combination of enemies makes for a good challenge of your know-how of the elements and their weaknesses. The lore and character interactions are abundant and meaningful. The gacha system in Genshin Impact is an afterthought. What makes the game more unique than other gachas is the pity currency and how its dupe system improves characters and weapons significantly - not their stats, but their passive abilities, making them much more effective in a combat system that relies on environmental mechanics more than numbers.
One major weakness is the game's lack of free currency, or rather, the amount of Primogems being limited to the world. Genshin Impact can retain more players if there's a login bonus everyday, and not just the 1 week event it's holding right now.
title: Lots of love went into this game

review: This is absolutely one of the best free-to-play games I‚Äôve ever encountered. The gameplay is massive, the soundtrack is a masterpiece *chef‚Äôs kiss*, stunning art and impressive voice acting especially JP ver. It‚Äôs so addictive and don‚Äôt get me started with the gacha. I was lucky enough to roll Diluc on my first try and that‚Äôs pretty much it for my luck. People might really have to control their spending otherwise they will go broke. I hope that mihoyo would add an option to dress up the characters. We can get outfits from either missions or the gacha. But, here‚Äôs your five stars mihoyo, y‚Äôall know what‚Äôs up.
title: Topnotch F2P game

review:
The game is stunning visually, one of the most beautiful games on mobile, it doesn‚Äôt feel at all like you‚Äôre playing a mobile gacha game or mmo. It feels like a full fledged story focused adventure JRPG. Which is incredible ignoring the gacha and enjoying the story is very easy to do. 

Then comes the bad optimization the overheating, I‚Äôm playing on a iPhone 8 so I can max out the graphics have a few hiccups which is alright but when it crashes like after every 20-30mins like srsly it just kills the mood, and you don‚Äôt feel like hoping back in just to face the crashes again! Once this crash update fixes. I‚Äôll rate it a full 5*s, till then imma have to keep like this. I‚Äôve played Honkai impact and I never had issues like this! So fix it fast MiHoyo.
title: Great Game bad optimization

review: So far, Genshin Impact has been a masterpiece of a game. It‚Äôs been amazing. The score and art are beautiful, and the gameplay and attention to detail are amazing. You even included motion blur! The game is *not* a Breath of the Wild clone, despite what people have been saying. It reminds me of Breath of the Wild, yes, but it also reminds me of The Elder Scrolls: Blades and anime. (Between you and me, though, the cooking mechanic is a lot better and more fun in this than it is in Breath of the Wild.) So far, I‚Äôve enjoyed this game a lot, and I like all of the mechanics. (Cryo freezing the rivers is one of my favorites, though. [super useful for preserving stamina!])
title: Good job, MiHoYo!

review: Yes it has some paid features but I probably have 15-20 hours in and have yet had to spend a penny on this game, in fact I more than likely will spend money just to support this game. For a free to play game this goes above and beyond easy to follow story fun combat giant open and detailed world. The art style is fantastic very much BOTW a lot of the features are similar as well but it sets its self apart enough that it doesn‚Äôt just feel like a knock off. I was super skeptical about downloading this game but I do have to say I‚Äôm happily impressed. Recommend everyone give this game a try
title: Great for what it is

Its an amazing game and it looks like something Nintendo would make. If the lag got fixed it would be one of the best open world games.

review:
It‚Äôs my favorite game right now and is unlimited in both creativity and opportunity, the only thing I would change is maybe outfit customization. Like you could be able to receive them as gifts for special occasions or main storyline missions, and be able to buy them or get them as special rewards for events or quests. That would be great! Also it would be amazing if you could sell things you gather at certain stores in the cities and villages or have trading posts of some kind.

title: I absolutely LOVE this game!

review:
I want to download this on my pc but it‚Äôs really bugged so I can‚Äôt for the time being... I was never a mobile person but I have to say I am pleasantly surprised- however there are just a couple things I hope they update. 

A screen lock where the screen turns with your character, my phone is really larger so having to hold and turn makes my fingers cramp up and I often need to take breaks in during battles.

MOUNTS. Traveling is painful- while some areas are plush with chests others make you walk for ten minutes through crappy wall climbs and rivers that takes FOREVER. It all apart of the grind I guess but it does get boring for someone with ADHD. 

The game is beautiful- and I look forward to the update and even would love to see this become an open world MMORPG with servers.  Although I don‚Äôt know the scale of this game but I feel like if they expand more this could become more legendary than the every famous world of Warcraft.
title: Best mobile game yet

review: I‚Äôve been searching for games like Genshin for a very long time. I‚Äôve played a variety of mmo/dungeon crawler, but i‚Äôve gotten bored due to styles that didn‚Äôt fit my expectations especially on the mobile. When I discovered Genshin, I was amazed of how amazing these graphics were and how much potential it can have. With crossplay, and party mmo, i feel like this game can become something bigger than it is if they play their cards right. If they listen to the community and continue to update and fix bugs, I could see this game with a huge community!
title: Lots and lots of potential

review: I love this game! I play it all the time. The characters are cool, and grinding for materials is fun. The resin system kind of bugs me sometimes, but I think changing it would be just as hard as keeping it the same, it would have downsides. I‚Äôm only worried that in the future it will take up too much storage space! it already occupies 8 gb on my phone, and we‚Äôve only completed 2 regions.  I also wonder how the leveling system will work over time, we‚Äôre already up to level 90, how would it look by the end of the game? Anyways, I love this game!

Other than people conplaining about things they can‚Äôt have, it‚Äôs a wonderful game and everything you would want in a mobile game. However the file size is quite big, but not necessarily a problem.

title: Dont play it, You will be addicted!!

review: I got both pros and cons. For pros, It is a great open world rpg with engaging storyline and graphics. There are a lot of choices for team composition and play style. For cons, comparing this to other games I played. The energy system in this game is probably the worst. It cost way too much to run a single dungeon and with max energy. Some fairly easy group content can only be ran three to four times a day. Lacks the perspective of multiplayer because of this. It is extremely hard to get new items and the refresh time is extremely long. The gacha rate is one of the lowest in current gaming market. Overall, I‚Äôm kind of disappointed considered that I spent quite a fortune on this too.
title: Pros and cons of Genshin

review: Alright here‚Äôs why I only gave it 3 stars. Now I don‚Äôt actually know if this is an error on Apple‚Äôs side or Mihoyo‚Äôs side but I played for 2 days straight just grinding really enjoying how amazing this game is just to log on a few hours later to be told ‚ÄúThird-Party account not yet registered.‚Äù I was using Game Center as my account and I had gotten quite far in the game just to try to play again and pretty much be told my account isn‚Äôt accessible anymore. I‚Äôve talked to the support on their discord server just to get nothing from it. Mihoyo if you actually go through these reports actually consider looking into this because I refuse to restart on a new account for your game.
title: Can‚Äôt play anymore.

review: While there are certainly good aspects about the game, MiHoYo seems to have shown they care very little about player feedback.  The most minimal of changes have been made to the resin system, and primogems are still very hard to acquire as a f2p player.  Furthermore, the newest character released ZhongLi is vary aggressively mediocre to outright bad in the current meta and has 4 different mechanics gated behind obtaining duplicates of his character.  When a limited time character costing $360 requires 6 copies to be passable and the developers aren‚Äôt even willing to buff him despite many many parts of the fan base complaining, there is clearly something wrong with the game.  I am only leaving this review because I really hope this game will become more generous and respectful to the fan base.
title: In wake of the 1.1 update

review: The quality of this game, from the graphics to gameplay is freaking awesome. I can‚Äôt believe that we come this far in technology where i can play this kind of game on a phone. Bravo! Well done
title: Best free mobile game I‚Äôve ever played!!!!

review: Hard to put into words. You can feel it in the world, and how it‚Äôs been crafted. it feels like they genuinely care about this game. I could definitely be wrong. But you can usually tell the difference between when a product is good because a company threw money at it until it was good, and when a product is good because someone had an idea for a world they were genuinely interested in building. And guess what? These guys did a spectacular job making this world something I want to explore every nook and cranny of.
title: It‚Äôs clear they love that they do.

review: I never write reviews on the App Store but this game got me. What a wonderful world to be in. What an atmosphere. An anime Skyrim for us to enjoy for free. Everything is top notch. From tiny character movements to the wind on the grass, from enemies to menu design. What a time to be alive. I‚Äôve waited for this kind of a game on mobile since mobile gaming was invented. About almost any mobile game I have to say that you are struggling to persuade yourself that you are truly enjoying it. This one I love with my heart. Thank you guys! This is kind of a game I‚Äôd gladly pay 10 bucks for once and that‚Äôs it.
title: What a delicious piece

review: In my honest opinion, this is such a fun game beautiful graphics, love the gameplay. I want to give this a 5 star but unfortunately, to get multiplayer you have to basically do the all of the campaign and side quest, the fact that you can‚Äôt open chest in other players world let alone get the rewards it completely unacceptable and should be fixed right away. Unfortunately I have stopped playing this game due to that reason cause I have multiple friends who would love you play this game together but we don‚Äôt want to if their is no reward and it‚Äôs just not fun. I hope you these issues get fixed soon it really is a fun free to play game.
title: Update multiplayer & reduce level

review:
The details are something I will never get bored of. Not to mention having a good story and explore while still having quests. Honestly I wish I could give more than just five stars. I dont think I‚Äôll ever find a game with so much flexibility such as this one in which the characters have such cool skills. Some are even adorable and I sometimes forget I‚Äôm in battle, just observing the little animal decoy. Other times I forget I‚Äôm even supposed to do quests as I get caught up in exploring, finding what‚Äôs out there. 

Please keep up the good work cause your amazing!
title: Forever amazed

review: One of the first gatcha games I've played that doesn‚Äôt constantly bombard you with sales. No clicking through endless announcements of bundles and specials designed to separate you from your money. In fact after the first week of playing I actually had to seek out the store to see what was in it, because it hadn‚Äôt come up one single time. Lots of fun though I will say, PC has better controls than mobile so if you have a choice to play it both ways I highly recommend doing that.
title: Doesn‚Äôt push micro transactions on you.

review: Ok starting out by saying this is one of the most fun mobile games I've ever played in my life, but this is also like. The least generous gacha too. The amount of primogems needed for wishes vs the amount f2p players can get in the open world without having to farm the Spiral Abyss is not sustainable/ doesn't add up to much unless you've been hoarding them for at least a few weeks. A suggestion would be to have daily login primogems all the time, not just during events? And somehow maybe like. Increasing the 5* appearance rates a bit because from what I remember the flat appearance rate right now is a 0.6%.
title: Really fun, but...

review: This game is amazing, there‚Äôs so much to do. Main quests, side quests, daily quests, an enormous map to explore, numerous monsters to fight, puzzles to solve for rewards, NPCs everywhere, love-able playable characters, and options to play a completely free game with no purchases! The only issue I‚Äôve had with the game is some crashes when I teleport into a large city, other than that perhaps a fast draining battery. Though, that can be easily fixed by lowering the graphics quality. Those would be my only complaints. 5 stars all around.
title: My Favorite!

review: I downloaded this game yesterday because I‚Äôve been getting burnt out with my daily rotation games. After seeing an ad for this game, I started it because I was doubtful of its open world claims, but holy smokes I was very pleasantly surprised. There‚Äôs so much to do, explore, and learn; I‚Äôm not very far in yet but I currently love all of my characters and enjoy they each of them seem individualized. A minor but enjoyable point is the male characters have a softness to them that you don‚Äôt see in many anime-sque games. Quickly becoming one of my favs, been playing non-stop.
title: Just Wow!

review: OMG!!! This game is so good!!!. I alway play Honkai impact 3rd so when I heard there was another game by Mihoyo I had to join. This game is a beautiful open world game. This game is good for exploring and leveling up the animation is be on this world. I can tell they took their time with this game. The story line is great! And I could play this for hours. I recommend 100%! I still wonder though will we have pets to follow us in battle. The elements was a good idea so it leads you thinking. Also there is different quest so you don‚Äôt have to keep doing the same one! This game is really awesome And the it‚Äôs the best!!!
title: Best rpg game of 2020!

review: This game is amazing and F2P friendly too. I love the characters and backstory and the fighting mechanics. It‚Äôs also like Breath Of the Wild which was another game that was amazing. They also give you free characters and a guaranteed roll for a 4 star character Noelle (who is good). I never spent a single penny on this game yet I got good characters and tons of materials for leveling up and stuff like that. But if I‚Äôm really being honest getting a 5 star character or item is pretty hard and you might have to spend money on that so that‚Äôs one downside (the gacha rates). Otherwise than that, great game!
title: Best game ever!

review:
I seriously recommend this game for anyone who is new to MMo‚Äôs. The story telling and sheer DETAIL is something to be marveled at. I‚Äôve only had this game for a few days but I am ashamed to say I am addicted. But for anyone who didn‚Äôt read the paragraph above, here are a few reasons why I like the game:
1. The lore/world building
2. The characters
3. It‚Äôs completely free to download 
4. It‚Äôs family friendly
5. The animation QUALITY 
6.The detail put into the backgrounds
7. Cool and unique mechanics
8. Mechanics that are simple and easy to get the hang of
9. The sheer size of the world
10. So many options! (Cooking, recipe collecting, artifact hunting, dungeon grinding, playing through the story quest, meeting people, or just exploring. The real mvp is the guide, 10/10. 
P.S. This game takes a lot of storage so when you download it, just wait a few hours and try to log in. It takes about half a minute to log in every time. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø
title: If you are on the edge, just download it!

review: This game is so amazing. An open world game that actually feels like an open world game that belongs on the ps4. The characters are amazing the story is interesting. There‚Äôs always something to do in this game. You can follow the story or get sidetracked in the open world and explore. There is one thing that kinda takes away the fun and that is the wish system. I wish (no pun intended) that we could get more of those stones to wish more and get more characters. Overall this game already has my attention and I crave more of it. I‚Äôm a week so this game touched my heart and soul.

It‚Äôs super fun I just hate waiting for my menu to load where I‚Äôm just stuck there waiting for it to pop up whenever, or when I try to do something in game like do challenges I basically sit there waiting for the enemies to spawn and even the chest take forever to spit out the items. title: ‚ÄúBreath of the weebs‚Äù

review: My friend showed me this game about a month ago during a voice chat. I wanted to check it out because he said he really enjoyed it. I love literally EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS GAME!!!!! The graphics, the designs of characters, everything is so breathtaking. Even the bugs, which I know are probably gonna get patched in the future. title: I think this is the best game I‚Äôve ever played

review: This game is a clone from multiple popular jrpgs. The is content from Zelda, Tales, Sword Art, Ni No Kuni, Final Fantasy, the list goes on... That is not all too, the game has the worst gacha rates compared to other games in the same genre. The concept of this game shows how greedy this company is. In Japan, there are laws to protect consumers from spending too much money or placing a minimum on gacha limits. This game from China has no problem making you homeless with the 0.6% gacha pull rates.  And what is worst, out of the 0.6%, 0.3% chance for a character and 0.3% for a weapon. I cant even progress into game with such a poor design for the rerolling process. This game is beyond frustrating for me already. The original concept of a game is designed for the players to have fun, not make them more stressful!
title: The most greedy gacha system ever released

review:
1. It called itself a open world game. But you cannot proceed the storyline until you reach certain adventure level.
2. You can only find junks in the chest around the map. Because all good weapons and characters are in the pool.
3. Stupid pooling chance. Characters and weapons are in the same pool. 0.6% chance for 5 star characters and 5 star weapon. 1.6% chance for 4 star characters and 4 star weapon. 
4. Expensive in game purchase. It took you approximately 20 dollars for 10 draws. 4 star is Guaranteed every 10 draws. It can be characters and weapon. 5 star is guaranteed every 90 draws. But with my experience, the chance you spend 100 dollars on the pool, there will be 99% of chance of drawing a weapon.
5. Hollow world. Once you reached adventure level 29, there is no more main story. All left in the game is grinding for gears.
6. You can only farm 6 dungeons per day if you do not use your dollar. Running 6 dungeons will take you about 8 mins. And you have 4 daily quest per day taking you 10 mins. And that‚Äôs all. Nothing else for you to play. All you can do is go offline and enjoy your normal life.
7. Summary. It‚Äôs A game will just waste your time.
title: The stupidest mobile game ever played.

review: I never write reviews, But Genshin Impact deserves one. It's incredible how this game is free-to-play. This game really does feel like you are in the game; you are on an adventure. The gameplay is fantastic; there is always something new to learn; you never get bored. The music soundtracks are just a blessing to your ears. I never felt so connected to a game; when you play, all your emotions, anxiety, thoughts on the real world disappear as you adventure through this game. I'm speechless!!! I'm so grateful I get to play this game. Thank you, MiHoYo, for creating this masterpiece. Much love!
title: Easily one of the best games!

review: I‚Äôm enjoying playing Genshin Impact. The game looks and sounds great. The touch controls are a little difficult at times and every device I play this on heats up very quickly (iPhone XR, 2018 iPad Pro, and the Samsung Galaxy S10e). The PS4 and PC versions have controller support, so I don‚Äôt see why the mobile version doesn‚Äôt. This game would be near perfect with controller support in my opinion, and I would rate it five stars if they added it. Hopefully they add controller support soon! A little optimization wouldn‚Äôt hurt either, but I can live with the performance if I could play the game with a controller.
title: Great game that needs controller support please.

review: To unlock constellations you need to actually get the same character 6 times in the shop and that‚Äôs really unfair that‚Äôs a lot of money that most people don‚Äôt have because everything is by chance I think that it‚Äôs unfair and because of not being able to get all the constellations it‚Äôs almost impossible to get your character at it‚Äôs full strength please allow the constellations gems for your characters to be grind able in game like with a boss or something PLEASEEE!!!!! Really would hate to leave a great game because my character is limited unless I spend 1,000 of dollars
title: Please fix this developers!!

review:
This game really defies what one has come to expect from a free title on the App Store. This game is absolutely incredible for being free. I‚Äôm about 10 hours in and am having a great time with the game, and haven‚Äôt had to pay any money for anything (We‚Äôll see if that lasts).

And while the game plays shockingly well with on-screen controls, the UI really muddies up what is otherwise a stunningly beautiful game. Seriously, this game looks bananas good, and will melt your mind (and battery) trying out the 60FPS option, it‚Äôs friggin amazing and showcases what a powerhouse mobile gaming has the capacity to be. 

It just needs controller support. Add that and the rating is an easy 5+ stars.
title: Needs MFi controller support.

review:
This game is incredible! The graphics are beautiful, the story is great and the characters are so lovable. I was really bored before I found this game and have nothing bad to say about it, but if i was gonna recommend anything it‚Äôd be having your own house or apartment.. it‚Äôd be nice to have everything u need in one area plus I‚Äôd be tired of running around searching for boar meat too üòÖ 
also more available costumes/skins for both our main and other characters. But anyways I love this game if anyone is looking for a great game to play I‚Äôd highly recommend this! üíô
title: obsessed..

review: I love this game, the story is solid, the characters are fun, and especially for mobile the art is genuinely good. It‚Äôs certainly imperfect and grinding in this game is a little below grueling at times, however it‚Äôs still balanced and in the end it‚Äôs still been less than a week. These few issues are fixable in the likely long time this game will be updated. I can‚Äôt wait to see where the developers take the story and the gameplay in the future. title: Perfect but..

review: I bet this game looks really nice. And that it has an expansive open world. I am sure there are countless ways to enjoy this mobile open world RPG. The problem is after two attempts to download and install this 6+GB game, it still lags incredibly and won‚Äôt load any of the world textures, so my character is running around a barren black landscape. I would understand if this issue happened on an older iPhone that couldn‚Äôt handle the GPU load, but that isn‚Äôt the case here: I am using an iPad Pro. There is no reason a ‚Äúmobile‚Äù game can‚Äôt run on a top of the line product line that the app is supposedly designed for. Devs should head back to the drawing board and optimize their product a bit more. This isn‚Äôt a console game, stop designing it like it is.

title: Love the game but a few issues

review:
This game is really good for a long time. Seriously really good, but once you hit a certain point the cracks begin to show. 

The gacha system is already bad so I won‚Äôt talk about that, but the stamina system is so bad it makes the game just miserable. You are gated hard by the amount you can play because of the stamina system. It makes too hard to raise new characters. So optimally you invest in 1, but even doing that, there‚Äôs not enough stamina to get enough materials/money to even afford 1 character. At that point why roll for new characters when you won‚Äôt be able to even use them?

Not only that but the content is just not there. Once you have explored the world, done the story, and opened all of the chests, your content is now running around opening common chests that have respawned and drop virtually nothing. All so you can push your AR higher to get stuck at another upgrade wall by the stamina system. 

Again this game is incredible until you hit the wall then it just becomes a game of frustration, with no answer from the devs about anything.
title: Great game with insane flaws

But the thing that tops this off is that you can use elemental skills to defeat your enemies. I can‚Äôt wait to see this game become huge

review: Good content and characters but the controls on mobile are clunky. In battle it‚Äôs much worse. The camera will often focus on empty land while enemies are attacking you. Recovery from getting knocked down needs work too. It‚Äôs often a long process leaving you open to follow up attacks. Reaction time is the main issue with the mobile version of the game.

title: AMAZING

title: It‚Äôs Amazing!

review:
This game is great, but let‚Äôs be honest, its nearly unplayable on mobile because it lacks controller support. It was developed alongside two other versions that support controller and mouse and keyboard, but this one doesn‚Äôt even support controller. 

For one, it‚Äôs a pain to just pick up items. constantly moving the position of my hand to mash away on items, or even to simply talk to someone is extremely annoying. 

Combat isn‚Äôt undoable, but it‚Äôs clunky compared to mouse and keyboard and controller. Archery is a pain unless you‚Äôve been playing a lot of shooters on touch controls, and tbf, I‚Äôve played mobile shooters and it just seems sloppy on here in comparison to say COD or PUBG. 

It‚Äôs a small feature to add, to simply map the same controls you mapped for the other two versions, and I‚Äôm certain many of us will appreciate that. Otherwise, an excellent game, I‚Äôd give it 5 stars instead of 4 with the addition of controller support.

And there should be no reason why you shouldn‚Äôt be regaining stamina while you‚Äôre hanging on a ledge staying still... a lot of things make no sense in this game. They‚Äôre literally making you waste HOURS even DAYS on things that should take MINUTES.

title: ‚ÄúWon‚Äôt Work For Me‚Äù

review:
I own an iphone 8 so I‚Äôm limited to a short few minutes (<40 minutes sometime <30 min) before app closes by itself and the overheating issue even on the lowest graphical setting possible is annoying.

Battery drains significantly on my end.

Mats are grind-y and takes a while to gather for both weapons and chars leveling.

Resin locked loot is a bit of a hassle but deters from people playing ALL day to get a certain loot...unless they are a whale who‚Äôll throw down for resins.

Primogems for random weapons and charas you probably do(n‚Äôt) want. Can be used for reset/gain max resin.

Enemies become tougher when world level increase. Watch you adventure rank (AR) and lvl up wisely.

Bounties and the other newly added quest seems forceful to complete imo.

No controller support for iphone.

Everything else is fantastic.

tl/dr:
 iphone 8 force close and overheats still.
Battery drains fast. 
Resin is okay but restricted.
 Primos, primos, primos.
World lvl = enemy toughness.
Bounties and newer quest seems forceful imo.
No controller support as of yet.

title: Almost perfect

review:
Okay, so I got finished playing the demo version of this game after finally caving in and downloading it (had to sacrifice an app or two to install it) and in all honesty... It‚Äôs not that bad. The visuals are really soft and colorful and the combat system is pretty good for a mobile game. 

There are just a few complaints that I have...
1. The intro to the game lagged my 6th Generation iPad and at first I thought my device wasn‚Äôt compatible (only come to find out that I was just being impatient).
2. The controls are a lot trickier as opposed to Honkai Impact‚Äôs, meaning whenever I try to go forward, I often find myself moving to the right or left (I will say that adding a system that lets you ‚Äòwalk‚Äô is absolutely awesome, bravo devs).

All-in-all, I thoroughly enjoyed the game. My only wish though, was that it was also available for Xbox One and not just PS4 (I mean seriously, 343 damaged Xbox‚Äôs reputation with Halo 5 so they kind of need a bone here).

review: For starters, this game took almost two days to download all the stuff, but I‚Äôve seen that happen in games like these before so it‚Äôs not that bad, but as soon as the intro cutscene started there was serious lag. Awesome game. I truly dislike the high-pitch anime voices, but that‚Äôs a personal preference, and the voice acting itself is very high quality. Graphics are fantastic and gameplay seems highly developed and of outstanding quality.

Their are tons to explore, combat system is fun, and they give tons of free premium currency. It‚Äôs very similar to Zelda: BOTW but with IMO a better combat system. F2P players are never inclined to use micro transactions and they NEVER shove it in your face.

I went from playing this game for hours a day to just 20 minutes to do dailies and use all 120 resin.  You will lose players because of this.

Game‚Äôs pretty fun, but unfortunately..

As I‚Äôd heard it said by an anonymous user online, ‚Äúthis game is so good, it shouldn‚Äôt need a predatory monetization system akin to lower quality mobile games that targets cash whales and gambling addicts to be successful,‚Äù but it has one anyway. 

The gacha in this game is simply unforgivable, and after my experience with Honkai Impact 3rd, I‚Äôm tremendously disappointed with the direction this company‚Äôs chosen to follow in Genshin Impact. 

Assuming you‚Äôre unwilling to wait the several months it would take you to Payless-ly acquire the 90 rolls it would take you to guarantee your first 5 star, (which otherwise has a .6% chance of being rolled on any banner,) we‚Äôre talking a price point of $1050 to get you through those rolls and guarantee you a COIN TOSS on whether or not you‚Äôll get the unit you actually want.

Regardless of whatever this game brings to the table, no game should be allowed to pick the pockets of their player base in that way, and I will not be giving money to this studio again so long as they continue these kinds of practices.
title: Predatory Monetization

title: Amazing game!

review:
This game plays like how all AA games should play. Smooth performance, beautiful sceneries, fantastic combat/party elements. 

The issues I do have are as follows:

1. Lack of meaningful co-op quests, adventures and gameplay. The one event that just came out, the Elemental Crucible, was buggy and laggy most of the time. I guess this could be due to the server overload. It gets lonely and boring running stuff by yourself all the time. 

2. Lack of Resin - The resin gets spent so fast that you find yourself running around in other people‚Äôs world stealing their materials just to spend quality time together.

3. Clunky artifact equipment 
system - no mechanism to lock the artifacts that you want to keep. When combining weapons or artifacts, no info interface to tell you what you‚Äôre combining. And I don‚Äôt know..just feels clunky. 

4. Stamina could be improved upon a bit, or give us a mount...

5. Could be a little less grindy.

review:
The Good:
Firstly, this game is a must try. Solely for the combat, game world, and beautiful art style. The open world exploration and story is enough to give you 20+ hours of gameplay. 

The Bad: 
What‚Äôs disappointing about this game is that a lot of content is gated by a ridiculously low stamina system with a ridiculously long refresh timer. All of the activities meant to give your characters exp and weapon progression is tied to this stamina system. Not my first Gacha but compared to ones I‚Äôve played, this system is by far horrendous. This is a Gacha game so I understand but they need to give a daily stamina refresh just for logging in. 

The Ugly:
Gacha rates are ridiculously low at 0.6% drop rate for a 5 Star with a 90 Roll pity timer.. which equals about $200 bucks for one 5 Star for character banners. Which the game does not have 3 Star characters so you would think it would even out but they dilute pulls by including weapons in character banner pulls. 

TL/DR 
Play the game for the content but don‚Äôt spend any money until they fix the Gacha system and the stamina system.
title: Amazing gameplay but horrible Gacha system.

review:
First 30-40 hours of gameplay are great. Full open world and things to do.

Then endgame hits and you cant do anything

Once story ends very abruptly and you lose all easy ways to get adventure exp, you are stuck doing dailies and burning resin for everything.

Especially burning resin for EVERYTHING

Progression is directly tied to resin since you need resin for any meaningful accumulation for everything.

Leylines for Mora and Character exp? 20 Resin
Artifacts? 20 Resin
Weapon Ascension Mats? 20 Resin
Talent Mats? 20 Resin
Character Ascension Mats? 40 Resin
Weekly bosses that can only be done 1/week? 60 Resin

This would be better if they had a short resin regen and high cap right? 

Regen is 1/8 minutes and the cap is 120

Doing weeklies will take up half of your saved resin, and why bother doing anything else that day? 

This is not including the 6-7 layers of gear RNG tied to each artifact. 

Its a fun one-off at the beginning 30-40 hours of play, but once you hit endgame you should just delete and find something else.

More in-depth complaints and criticisms of the game can be found on the reddit

title: A Great Game for the iPad

review:
An amazing game, love having this on my iPad Pro. Truly a masterful achievement bringing this to iOS! It looks incredible, and the level of depth in the exploration is truly amazing. Great voice acting, animation and the world is breathtaking. Combat is simple yet customizable and satisfying.

This game has been heralded as free-to-play Breath of the Wild... I was skeptical of that lofty claim of course, but it truly does reach the same levels of wonder with it‚Äôs dense open world, uninhibited exploration and clever world design.

The only downside is the lack of controller support.

title: Breath of the Wild- iPhone style

review:
It may have been my favorite open world RPG, maybe my favorite game in general. IF I COULD ACTUALLY PLAY.

The mobile version Lags so much unless it is on the lowest graphics settings, and even on the lowest settings it still lags so much! When I‚Äôm on the lowest setting sometimes it even displays thing like water and grass as black pixelated blobs. 

Not to mention, whenever I get into a cutscene...or heck when I even try to go to the menu, the game crashes! Once it crashes you have to listen to the character yawning the entire time, and the only way to fix it is to close the game, start it back up, wait for it to load, press start, pray it actually loads, and try again. 

I have had to do this so many times that I would rather just watch somebody play it, then go through the nightmare that is the cutscenes/menu. 

AND GUESS WHAT? I have asked other people, THIS ISN‚ÄôT JUST ME HAVING THESE ISSUES!

I will try the Pc version, but if that doesn‚Äôt work then I swear I quit this game!!!

Gems seem pretty plentiful, although collection is slow, so at least that‚Äôs pretty nice. I‚Äôm excited to see what the update brings! ...Although there is one grave sin this game makes that is inexcusable. You can‚Äôt pet the dogs or cats?! Outrageous and egregious.

title: Beautiful

review:
I echo what most ppl are saying, 
Pros;
The game is fun.
Character design is great. 
Lots of world to explore and things to collect and more to come.
Co-op mode has been good so far with only a few minutes (wait, at most, to fill a team).
Getting the character you want is challenging but not impossible for F2P players.

Cons;
On mobile to control system isn‚Äôt great. 
It doesn‚Äôt always register the movement of the character and I‚Äôd really like to be able to move or resize the controls. 
I‚Äôve also fired off random character skills when I just meant to jump or pick something up.
Wish there were more useful characters, the guys (apart from Venti and Diluc, neither of which I have) are pretty meh. 
#GirlPower

I‚Äôd love there to be a variety of costumes for the characters and maybe a more in depth skill tree too (dupes are fine for now but are mainly of characters I don‚Äôt use/need).

title: Addictive and well done

review:
This game has good gameplay. It‚Äôs a fun game. But I will never give anything but a one-star to lootbox games like this.

Games like this are a cancer to society. If you want to charge $10 or $20 or whatever for your characters, fine, more power to you. But gambling with actual dollars should never belong in any video game, period.

This is nothing but a well polished, enjoyable open world adventure corrupted by gambling and lootbox mechanics at every turn. Please don‚Äôt play this game. And developers, I know you won‚Äôt change, and that this model makes you stupid amounts of money. But you‚Äôre literally ruining lives and the damage you‚Äôre causing to people‚Äôs minds doesn‚Äôt have a price tag. Enjoy your mountains of money.
title: Gacha games are a plague.

review:
I‚Äôve played this game since release everyday and invest a lot of time into this so I do enjoy the game for what it is.

But as it stands right now, there is a way to brute force your way into people accounts that Mihoyo hasn‚Äôt brought to the attention of the public and they are acting like nothing is going on.

There are multiple people in the hundreds if not thousands who have lost the account they‚Äôve worked hard for due to the poor security of the game.

And when you contact customer service about this not only are there excessive wait times but also not a clear way of how they handle it. Some people get emails with different instructions on how to proceed or how to wait while others have their email or ticket completely ignored.

The point of this is for new people and current people playing is to know that no one is safe from losing their account and when they get it back is a complete mystery that might result in them not getting it back at all.
title: Your account isn‚Äôt safe. Security and CS doesn‚Äôt exist.

review:
For a mobile game, it‚Äôs quite impressive what they were able to accomplish (hence why it‚Äôs 2 and not 1 stars), but the title says it all and let‚Äôs not beat around the bush. 

This is Gacha at its worst. Required for progression in the form of the absolute best characters and weapons with no alternatives, stingy as hell after frontloading is over, rates being actual garbage compared to something like Dragalia Lost, and dupes of ultra-rare-due-to-terrible-rates stuff being required to max out power. It‚Äôs blatant pay to win and honestly ruins what could otherwise be an innocent RPG taking direct inspiration from BotW, but alas, greed has once again corrupted a promising venture.
title: Straight up ruined by Gacha

Already put a ton of hours into this game and it‚Äôs just been one day and I know I‚Äôm gonna put so much more into it. 10/10

title: A Trading System?

review:
A game that once held my heart is now nothing else than something to rip my hair out at. This game is beautiful and has a lot of love placed into it, but the developers have proven to us that they don't actually care to listen to their playerbase. 

This game has no 2FA and hacked accounts have been on the rise at a frightening pace, and their solution was to blame the players for not being secure enough. 

ZhongLi, their newest 5 Star character requires 300+ US dollars to absolutely confirm you get him through the pity system, and he performs worse than free 4 star characters in the game. Their response to the upset was an equivalent of "too bad, he's working as intended" despite their false advertisement on how powerful he was as a character. 

Players who have their account hacked are potentially screwed if the hacker spends more money than them on their account. 

Do not support this company. Do not give them a dime. They hide disgusting customer service and terrible PR behind a beautifully made game.
title: A favorite turned terrible. Absolutely disgusting developer practices.

review: Gameplay, art, music is great. The biggest issue is how everything is gated behind resin, which is essentially stamina. Once you get to AR 30+, everything becomes a slog since the bosses and domains take up a ton of resin and there‚Äôs not much content left aside from bosses and domains. Unlike most gacha games, however, where stamina increases along with level, the resin cap stays the same as you level up. This means around AR 30+, you can‚Äôt do much since you the bosses take up so much stamina. This game has such great potential and is being held back by the resin system.
title: Great game but is gated behind resin

I‚Äôm not sure how it is for newer phones but if you have a 6s older it most likely won‚Äôt be compatible with your device. I suggest getting the game on yOUR PC for the full experience. review:
This game is just a simply good game.

There are unique and well-spoken characters, an intriguing and sentimental plot line, and wonderful gameplay. The game is easy enough for a normie like myself to understand, while at the same time it challenges the player in multiple ways. It‚Äôs a complicated story with a complex and realistic world, but put into an understandable fashion.

I personally am a story oriented gamer. I see a good story, I like the game most likely. But... this game has both a good story and everything else that someone could wish for. I love the open world aspect as well, it seriously brings the realm to live. There are constantly new quests and battles to be won, and always something to do. 

It‚Äôs a lovable game with plenty of beef for both beginners and seasoned gamers alike. Seriously, a wonderful game.

review: As someone who‚Äôd hopped onto the Genshin train from Day one, I was amazed. I absolutely fell in love with the game. Genshin‚Äôs story, it‚Äôs world, the though out RPG system, and it‚Äôs well-designer characters had me glued to the game, so much so that I finished all the story content currently available within the first week. However, as I continued to play, I found myself disillusioned by an extremely predatory monetization model. Want a new character? Pay. You‚Äôre not ever getting them with luck. Want to grind levels or weapons? Pay. Want to get good artifacts? Pay, pay, and pay. Until Mihoyo listens to its (understandably) disheartened playerbase and fixes it‚Äôs energy system, this review will stay at 1 star.

review: I don‚Äôt normally give detailed reviews on games, but you guys did an amazing job with this one. It‚Äôs like if you mashed DND, Monster Hunter, and Breath of the Wild together. I‚Äôve only played it for three days and I‚Äôm not bored with it like other games. Thank you for the opportunity to play such a game on my phone! Much luck and prosperity to y‚Äôall

The game itself is beautiful and very fun to play. The voice acting is spot on and I love the character designs. Battles are very easy to understand and the music is quite nice.

However, beware. The app store says 2+ GB however this game is actually 6+ GB. Make sure you have this extra storage.

Also this game lags like really bad sometimes, npcs or items dont load in properly, and crashes very often. It also heats up the phone pretty badly, worse than when pokemon go did the same thing. 

Another note is that the rates for characters are abysmally low even for a gacha. Lower than FGO and that‚Äôs really saying something. 

I would play this on PC if it wouldnt just freeze my screen every 30 minutes and have no way to exit out without restarting my pC so unfortunately the only way for me to play is on the phone.

I hope these issues can be fixed in the future.

review:
I have to say, I was completely in love with the game when I first started playing, and I was super excited to reach lvl 16 to have a full experience playing with my friends.
When I and my friends finally reached lvl 16, we attempted to play the multiplayer mode, and honestly it is by far one of the WORST multiplayer experiences a game has ever offered.
For starters you can‚Äôt do ANYTHING in the game while you have a guest. Literally having someone with you blocks your progression, and the whole point of playing with friends is progressing together. 
This game had everything to be the best MMORPG out there, yet you can‚Äôt really call it an MMORPG, it is more like a single player based game. There is no point on even trying to continue playing this game... unless the developers actually listen to the community complaints regarding the multiplayer experience and try to improve it. 
This would have been a 5 star review IF the multiplayer was better. 
Overall, thank you for taking the time to read this review.
title: Multiplayer experience.

review: This game is great, big and expansive with action to keep the players attention going, goals to keep the players competing and even working together. Overall this game is great but there are some minor glitches to be found but what I really want would be cross save data( save data that can be used across platforms) as well as controller support for mobile users.

title: What a game dude

review:
Pros:
If you are looking for a game to spend time and progress at your own rate, THIS IS IT. Wow, I mean wow. In the first 30 minutes I was HOOKED into the game, the characters (no, not the designs only u perv) are awesome, the gameplay is fun and expandable, the quests fletch out a lot of the characters, and the amount of freedom you have while still being a linear story is incredible. 

Cons:
The only problem with this game is the occasional crashing and the size. My god does this app take up a lot of space, like 10 G! For my phone it occasionally crashes, but since the game auto saves it‚Äôs more of a slight annoyance.

Conclusion:
Buy this game if you have the space and power to run it, because even though this game occasionally crashes, I still love it with all my heart.

title: QUESTS LOOT SEARCH

review: I love almost everything about this game‚Äîthe open world, the soundtrack, how it‚Äôs friendly to free players who use their in-game resources wisely, the unique combat, the story, and more. However, as a married, Christian man, I‚Äôm uncomfortable with the level of fan service in the game. I know that many players find the sexual aspects appealing, but it ended up being a deal breaker for me. I don‚Äôt need to see jiggle physics or hear innuendos in order to appreciate what could otherwise be a perfect, revolutionary F2P experience. In fact, the sexual stuff was a deal breaker. If there were any way to disable it, I don‚Äôt think I would have needed to put down the game forever.

title: Black screen bug

review:
Exploration is a lot like zelda botw. Tons of things to do on the map that includes collecting chests and solving puzzles
Combat is really fun. The element system is really unique where you have to combo certain elements together to get a reaction.
Gacha rates are low, but to be expected of a gacha-genre game, but the game does not give you a lot of opportunities to get pulls later in the game. 
Game also includes a stamina system to open loot after certain world-boss fights and dungeons. You cam probably do 2-6 before you run out and have to either wait or spend $$$ to continue.

Game is great but i personally think the there needs to be some changes around the stamina system. Playing for 10min and closing the game doesn‚Äôt keep the open-world feel. The 5-star reviews are definitely there for the early content, however the flaws will reveal themselves with time.
title: Fun in the beginning. Not F2P-friendly towards end

title: Love the game but got a few problems

review:
What can I say? It's great. Absolutely phenomenal.

However some issues I'd like to talk about that I experienced:

1. I am unable to to see more than 10 feet in front of me, it's all black more than that

2. Entering rooms, they tend to be pitch black and I am unable to see anything

3. Entering water, I'll start flashing extremely brightly, and the water is pitch black as well

4. Entering the gacha crashes the gam

While I play with everything on the lowest setting, I still experience all of these problems. This game is truly amazing, and maybe it's becaus my iPad Pro 9.7 inch may have some problems, but I'd like to see these problems being fixed in order to make it more enjoyable for other people that experience similar problems, and I.

Thank you for such an amazing game

title: Beautiful

review:
Game is amazing, I‚Äôm in awe that its free.

Pros:
- Graphics are stunning

- Combat is diverse, enabling really deep combat mechanics and combos

- World and Story line are very well designed 

Cons:
- CONTROLLER SUPPORT !!! This is a must for this game, I‚Äôm surprised they haven‚Äôt added it to the launch version which is the ONLY reason I‚Äôm giving this a 4 star.

- Heating issues with iPad Pro.
  I have a 11 inch iPad Pro (2nd Gen) and i am getting really bad heating issues at high settings. I understand the output the device needs for this caliber of game but hopefully they can look into optimizing settings for certain devices to prevent damage to users devices.

- Glitchy at some parts for the launch version. Hoping this will improve down the road. 

Thank you miHoYo Limited for such an amazing game!
Hoping you guys can address the issues I stated down below soon!

title: Greatest anime game!

review:
The game overall is really good. But there are two glaring issues that need to be addressed. Genshin is prbly the best gacha game I‚Äôve ever played for the most parts but in two aspects it‚Äôs prbly one of the worse.
1. Resin system is way too limiting. Most other games allow the energy system to be upgraded to hold more energy or allow easier ways to refill it without paying money. The game gets grindy once you get into adventure rank 30 and above we need resin to farm. It‚Äôs extremely frustrating 

2. The drop rates for gacha pulls is prbly the worst I‚Äôve ever seen. It needs to be readjusted. The pity system needs to be better as well. You have great characters...it just costs an absurd amount to get them

Genshin can be the best gacha game ever but if you don‚Äôt fix these problems people will eventually get frustrated with it
title: Great but needs work

review: I‚Äôve never written a review before but this game has compelled me to write my first. This game is just wonderful, it‚Äôs almost hard to believe it‚Äôs free. Full voice acting, no ads, no pay to win crap, just an amazing storyline, character development, tons of enemies and a lot of fun to be had. I never thought a mobile game of this caliber could exist but this game has definitely surprised and wowed me. Thanks for making this great of a game developers.
title: Simply amazing

review:
Takes Breath of the Wild, adds in cute Anime girls, sprinkles some gacha on top, and you have a spicy dish.

Possibly the most beautiful and well-designed world on mobile. A true AAA experience. The gacha is ‚Äúfairly optional.‚Äù You can beat the game and experience all content with the free stuff, but the gacha characters do make the game more fun and add variety if you collected them. Developers, if you read this, please make collecting new characters easier.

Highly recommended.

The audio and cinematic cut in and out so horribly, I had no idea what was happening. It was too painful to watch let alone listen to. So I stopped. I would like to try it in consoles though that are better fit to handle this large if a game. But mobile is not the place for this game. Can‚Äôt wait to see the difference if consoles.

review:
This game is absolutely awesome, I love it.

  Current Device: IPad Pro 3

However, I am having some serious technical issues.
 - At first, the game seemed a bit buggy, the textures kept tearing and the cinematic lagged behind way too much.
 - Then, the over-world was only lit up in a cone directly in front of just the character model.
 - Next, every objective marker forced the character to become of pure orb of blinding white light that over-lays everything.
 - Finally, after the cinematic for the Storm Terror fight finished, everything disappeared.

  After finishing the fight, completely blind, the over-world has remained completely black. Objective markers still show up and so do menu items; however they are blocked off by every pitch black character model in the way.

Note: When searching really hard inside of buildings, very few slivers of the skybox can be seen, but nothing more.

Sorry not very good at describing it, there should be a specific term for that but idk. Most of the rpg games I‚Äôve play have such feature and makes the walking more smoothly.

title: Always crashing

review: This game was great for the first week until you run into it‚Äôs stamina gate keeper called ‚Äòresin‚Äô. Resin is needed to claim rewards from bosses, dungeons, and co-op events which you need for ascending characters and equipment, but your resin maxes at 120 and takes 8 minutes to refill 1 resin so 16 hours to completely recharge 120. So you basically have to wait 16 hours to farm materials for about 10 - 15 minutes. And this is universal for all platforms including PC and PS4. This system needs to be completely overhauled. Don‚Äôt waste your money buying crystals to pull for characters you can‚Äôt level up and enhance, i for sure won‚Äôt be spending anymore unless this resin system is changed.

title: Please add controller support

review:
If you like open world, action, anime rpg, you will love this game. I could go on ranting about this, but instead I‚Äôll summarize my opinions in short points.

Pros:
-Beautiful graphics, music, and voices
-Very responsive skill-based action combat
-Completely open world (little to no invisible barriers. If you see something, you can go there)
-huge map with tons of activities to do/explore/content
-lots of hidden quests/treasures/puzzles
-cross platform (pc, mobile, ps4) and cross save (pc, mobile)
-has multiplayer options (join friend‚Äôs worlds)
-f2p with no paywall (yet)

Cons:
-potato phones will DIE
-gacha system
-time consuming and grindy (great for ppl who love to immerse themselves into a game. Bad for ppl who enjoy auto-play progress)
-multiplayer is lacking (game more meant for single player)
title: Quick thoughts

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I do enjoy the game and it is very fun. I possess an iPhone XS Max so while I am able to play on the highest settings I avoid doing so because it will severely damage your iPhone battery‚Äôs lifespan. Even in the lowest settings your battery will drain quickly and even your battery health will deteriorate at a quick pace. Please find a way to improve on this even a little bit. The game also lags every now and then making it difficult to play but not unplayable. My internet connection is pretty good so I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the issue. I really do enjoy the game though.
title: Battery and lag

review:
Videogames are an art medium like any other. Art improves when they borrow and reuse concepts from one another. Many elements were taken from Nintendo‚Äôs breath of the wild, but does not copy them wholesale. A free open world is at your fingertips - with amazing combat right at your fingertips.

review:
Its truly fantastic for a F2P game; however, the iOS version has some serious bugs.
Most notably, it crashes every few minutes, and even when it‚Äôs running, the frame rate often slows down to almost a complete stop, generally during combat. It also never really recovers afterwards, which suggests a memory leak of some kind.
My device is an iPhone 8, which may not be the newest, but does meet the min requirements, and shouldn‚Äôt be suffering from such extreme issues as this.
Really hope the devs address these severe stability issues so it‚Äôs actually playable!

review:

title: Not being able to see

review:
Everyone knows of the low rates, but rather than complaining about them I want people to think about how the decision to uphold one the lowest rates of in the existence of gacha games could drive the future of this game. How will future content be balanced? How will players who spend vs players who don't grow in the game? How large will the gap between these two players last and in what ways will it affect the game's future content? 

Behind the beautiful art, music, and voice acting, a player needs to remember that their time is limited, and whether gambling it on a game that does not seem to respect its players is a worthy investment.

title: Such an Extraordinary Getcha game

review: I would love to give this more stars, but I won‚Äôt because this game is a literal copy of the Legend Of Zelda Breath Of The Wild. For example, in this game at the beginning, there is a ledge where you stand on and the screen pans to the side- that‚Äôs LITERALLY what happens when you first start breath of the wild. Also, you guys copied the map design, the gliding, and a whole lot more! It‚Äôs almost like you imported the breath of the wild game into this one, but changed up the characters and a little bit of the plot! So please, make it more unique. It‚Äôs kinda ruining the legend of Zelda fandom too (not tryna be dramatic or anything.)

title: My Review

review:
At first, I was skeptical about playing the game. Mainly because I‚Äôve been let down quite often. But this game was recommended through a YouTuber I follow. He usually plays games that I also enjoy playing so I thought I‚Äôd give it a shot.

From the opening scene alone, my attention was captured and I wanted to see more. I like that throughout the game you come across decision making dialogues and the wide selection of characters you‚Äôre able to play with.

Each character has ‚Äúelemental‚Äù talents that aid you throughout the game. I love that as the player every decision is yours to make. Adding/subtracting pieces of gear and artifacts makes this game fun!

I love it I definitely recommend giving this game a try for all you adventurers!
title: Great Adventure Game

review:
Is it good for the first 70 hours? Absolutely. The graphics are stellar, the soundtrack slaps (especially liyue‚Äôs), and the story is pretty decent.
After 70 hours, the ‚Äúhoneymoon‚Äù phase begins to end.
This game is far from finished, and so you‚Äôre just left frolicking around an empty world with nothing much to do. The banner rates are horribly low, the worst in any gacha game. If you‚Äôre new to the predatory gacha system, watch out. It‚Äôs not worth spending a single dollar. The stamina system is also very limiting. 
Don‚Äôt spend much effort or even money into this game. It‚Äôs meant to be played casually. Just 10-15 min a day is perfect. Explore the vast world for another hour or so if you feel like it because yes, it‚Äôs got the breath of the wild vibes.
But hey, maybe in three years my review will change. After all, this game is an unfinished product that still has hidden potential.
personal opinion: needs more husbandos.
title: Not worth in the long run

Whoever sees, this just play it through and you WILL NOT REGRET downloading this. Thank you developers for creating this amazing game.

review: The developers who created the game, miHoYo, are really greedy. While this game is free it's still a gacha game at its core. After you reach a certain point in the game you're unable to train your characters because you run out of stamina (aka resin). It doesn't sound bad now, but the game purposely doesn't let you advance further without spending premium currency to refill stamina. Gacha rates are also the lowest in the gacha industry. Good luck trying to get your favorite character unless you spend hundreds of dollars. Not to mention you need multiple copies to fully unlock their abilities. This game is a trap! DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME. IT'S ANOTHER GAMBLING TRAP.

title: Hands down the best game on the app store

review: With a stupefyingly low Half-a-percent 5-star item/hero rate (yes, they mixed gear and units into the same pool), it's surprising how rabidly anti-rerolling the devs are. Add on top the fact they don't have any value packs for moderate spenders or beginner deals (i.e a $20 for a 5* pick ticket or something), it really shows that the devs are 500% pure greed. I highly recommend holding off in playing this until better deals are available. Unless you're prepared to drop $1000+ without any cause for concern, this game is likely not worth your long-term devotion. Play a bit to sate the curiosity, stay F2P, and leave when it gets boring
title: Abysmal Gacha Rates (0.6% 5-star) and pure gambling monetization

review:
This game has all the potential of being an amazing game unlike anything else available on mobile. But after dropping $100 on summons, the drop rates have proven to be utterly ABYSMAL. Only ONE 5 star after summoning $100 worth, plus the free summons the game gives you. Until the 5 star drop rates are buffed to at least 5% I will not be spending any more money on this game. If you‚Äôre considering getting this game, know that spending money is worthless if you want anything beyond random 4 stars.

Rather than a stupid greedy gacha, would have been better to just put 5 star characters as purchasables for $5-$10.

title: Lovely and cute game with great graphics and questing!

review: If you‚Äôre looking for a single player experience, this game is absolutely 5 star. But if you were looking forward to playing with your friends, the amount of unlisted limitations will leave you disappointed. Beyond bosses and domains, there‚Äôs not much content for multiplayer because the visiting player can only benefit from those content. Spiral of Abyss, the most interesting challenge, is locked out of coop. And worse, if your world level is even one higher than your friends‚Äô, they‚Äôre locked out your world entirely. If someone wants to carry their new friend, let them smfh.

review: Let me start by saying that the game itself looks amazing. The dungeons remind me a lot of Dragalia lost, and the game seems to have tried to pull a breath of the wild but missed the essential parts of it somewhere down the line.

title: Amazing

review: The story, the soundtrack, the art, the characters...not to mention all the little secrets and side quests in the map. All of it is glorious, definitely recommend to play. The gacha system seems fair, though it does give you some characters as you level up. And honestly, the exploration aspect makes it all worth it even if you get some bad summons.
title: The best mobile game of 2020

review: I loving the game and the storyline however they need to seriously fix the crashing issues. The iOS app is nigh unplayable as it crashes all the time. The lack of custom keybind feature on the PC also means if you are a lefty like me then the game feels incredibly awkward on the controls. This is a potential AAA+ game if they fixed the issues. Also some dungeons in the game are incredibly difficult especially of you cannot react fast enough, difficult enough in an iOS game.

title: Ridiculously High Quality

review: To the creators: thank you for making such an amazing game! Love the open world, the missions are engaging, the characters are awesome, the dialogue is well thought-out. Definitely the top 5 of any mobile game I‚Äôve played. Keep up the great work!

title: Best game on the App Store

review:
It‚Äôs an incredible game in a lot of ways, but there are some really questionable components and it‚Äôs concerning on multiple levels.  Due to the lack of transparency and response from devs I‚Äôm leaving this here to forewarn newer players. 

1. Gacha element is extremely predatory and designed to encourage you to spend unreasonable amounts of money. Don‚Äôt play unless you can control your impulse to spend. It‚Äôs disgusting how easy it is to drop cash with little return...

2. Account security issues have not been addressed since release and this is unacceptable. 

3. Recent developments with released 5 star characters is showing that the developer has no interest in its player base, but is really out to squeeze every last dollar.

4. Some critical base game mechanics are still in need of being addressed with no real solutions implemented. 

I will adjust the review as I see these concerns being addressed. Thank you.
title: Game has serious potential, but...

review:
******EDIT******
Fix the hacking problem. Do you know how easy it is to get hacked in this game? DO NOT spend money on this game if you‚Äôre not aware of the risk of being hacked. It‚Äôs so easy to lose everything you‚Äôve worked for. Until they change this, the game gets a 1* from me. Put in a two-factor authentication system NOW.

I wish they would implement a monthly refresh of the double genesis crystal offer. I‚Äôm by no means a whale but I do make in game purchases. Current rates for gems and character / weapon drops are absolutely ABYSMAL but I feel like this could be somewhat resolved by making the ‚Äúfirst time purchase‚Äù offer available monthly like many of the previous games I‚Äôve played. As it stands, I can‚Äôt see myself paying ‚Äúregular‚Äù prices for genesis crystals.

Otherwise a great game with a great pace that keeps you going until the end game grind.

So I really liked this game, but the way they handle their customer service is disappointing.

They recently had a huge update which deleted the gnostic hymn bundle I purchased for $20, and I was at BP level 25ish trying to get to 30 to get the prized weapon, and suddenly after the update, it erased the purchase and brought me back to level 1...

I contacted costumer service, they said my points should upload any minute or try the classic ‚Äúturn it off and on again.‚Äù Did both, waited hours, days, it‚Äôs been about a week, and nothing.

Then days later they said I had to repurchase. !!! I‚Äôm not spending another $20! That‚Äôs a ridiculous game feature if that‚Äôs the process, and it doesn‚Äôt say anywhere that I would have to repurchase throughout gameplay!

Anyway, not impressed. Unhappy. Discouraged bc I don‚Äôt trust the company‚Äôs way of handling things.

When you play the game you‚Äôll be entranced at how beautiful the game is and how endless the possibilities seem. Once you reach the end game in about a week of playing you start to realize the only things you have left to do is run around the map collecting chests that contain trash.

title: Should‚Äôve just been a full priced game...

review:
Thousands of players have voiced complaints since Zhongli's release of how he is a disappointing character that does not compare to how he was advertised, with no clear strengths as either an attacker or supportive character unless you spend hundreds of dollars on him.

Despite these complaints, mihoyo has ignored the majority of community feedback about zhongli and prior issues with resin, and only seem to cherry pick the issues they want to address such as minor bugs.

While the artists and creative team have done a phenomenal job thus far with this game and its content, the business practices behind their choices to gate character usefulness behind an exorbitant paywall is predatory and should be corrected. 

Until mihoyo's purposeful deafness to feedback and money-grubbing practices are corrected, i cannot in good conscience recommend this game.
title: Company ignores and disrespects community feedback

title: backgrounds not loading

review:
It's not bad, but it has several flaws. 

First, it shows a white screen for more than a minute while it's loading the splash screen, and if I hold my phone in any direction other than landscape during that time, the app crashes.
Second, the app seems to crash randomly. 
Third, the fact that it requires a constant connection to the internet makes the game lag a lot, sometimes not spawning items or opening menus for minutes (I have gigabit internet, so it's not on my end). 
Fourth, some of the text isn't translated very well. 
Fifth, it restricts access to some places until you progress further into the game. 

Other than those things, the game is perfect. 

Note: I'm using an iPhone 7 running iOS 14.0.1

title: Absolutely incredible

review:
The app ALWAYS crashes for me unless I hold my phone in landscape mode *before* tapping one the app icon. Incredibly inconvenient.

The PC version comes with a kernel-level anticheat that hides itself from the Windows OS, doesn't close when you close the game, and isn't removed from Windiws if you uninstall the game. It's not a trusted anticheat such as EAC or BattleEye; it's something custom that we know nothing about. It's incredibly concerning. The devs have known about these issues since July and have done nothing.
title: Game constantly crashes, and PC version has disturbingly invasive anticheat.

review: Game does not accept refunds, even if you file a refund through Apple and you get your money back, the game will know and will change your game primogems to negative, and you have a week to balance this amount. If you cant balance the negative amount you account will be banned for sure. The game wont give you any flexibility on your refunds no matter what the issue was. This game is from China and the trade war is even taking place here, so the game purchase policy is: ‚ÄúTake it or leave it, no refunds, just banned‚Äù.

title: I got this yesterday

review:
Despite the star rating that I have given this review, the game is great! HOWEVER, this game has GLARING ISSUES with a few things.

1- If you are F2P (Free to Play), the amount of Primogems (the currency for the Gacha System) you get will not be enough to get you any of the good characters in a steady way. 
2- Resin has a low cap, and a high refill timer. 120 Resin (the Stamina system that locks you out of specific context) and an 8 minute per 1 Resin refill timer. Once you complete the story quests, the progression comes to a halt because of this system. Only way to refill is to pay with Primogems or with Fragile Resin, which is hard to come by. The Resin system blocks all EXP item grinding, Ascension and Talent materials, and Artifacts.

PLEASE consider supporting this game in the current state. While the game may be good, the marketing practices are not the greatest.(Written during 1.0)

title: Gotten Stuck

review:
This is an update to my prior review.

The game is gorgeous and really feels like a fleshed out single player game. The controls are great and everything just seems to click once it gets going.

The trouble is getting it to keep going... while there has been an improvement in crashing (I was previously crashing out of the app every 3-5 minutes and upon opening menus), the game still crashes with alarming frequency and without rhyme or reason.

The game also refuses to let you invert the Y-axis. This may not be a problem for some but for others, it puts us at a serious disadvantage especially during co-op.

If the crashing issues are fixed and they add camera inversion, this game gets a 5 from me.

review:
Lots of famous Genshin YouTubers have been hacked multiple times, yet Mihoyo still hasn‚Äôt addressed how they will fix this issue.

Absolutely beautiful game and relaxing scenery...until you get hacked and you don‚Äôt get a response from customer service for over 14 days.

If you link your phone number, your number gets leaked and get constant spam calls. If you don‚Äôt link your phone number, you become vulnerable to getting hacked.

Security has been an issue during Closed Beta, but I wrote it off as a fixable problem. Now it‚Äôs clear that it‚Äôs not a priority for Mihoyo.

It‚Äôs a great casual game; I recommend casually playing and enjoying the story. HOWEVER, do NOT get too invested. Do NOT spend money. And do NOT link any personal information. Also avoid playing on PC because there‚Äôs a security flaw in the PC version.

title: It needs controller support

review:
This game is very fun and addicting. I see it has a lot of potential, but the resin system needs major work. having a capacity of 120 resin with slow regeneration time is locking us down from progressing through the game. As you level up, you start to rely on resin for bosses and dungeons loot. The resin cost for these are so expensive for the resin capacity and regen time. This resin system is limiting the game‚Äôs from being enjoyable in the long run. Many other players in Genshin community are complaining about the resin economy as well.

Some solutions that may help:
-reduce resin cost
-bigger resin capacity through leveling up or purchase (with primogem or obtainable in game currency)
-more ways to obtain resin for free to play players
-faster resin regeneration time

review:
5 stars for the amazing gameplay, VA etc. That‚Äôs about it.

The first issue is the content drought that comes about 20-30hrs in or so.

The abysmal 5* rates. 0.6% and that‚Äôs between weapons and characters. If you want to Max your character you have to get copies of said character. Even FGO doesn‚Äôt have rates like this.

Even I wouldn‚Äôt spend on the monthly pass because I know there I would only get a chance every 6 months which by then new characters would be out and the meta would change.

So in all, I wouldn‚Äôt suggest this game if you are keen on having the best characters because you will be upwards of $1500USD per 5* character. F2P is very viable if you get a couple good 4* and you will be set for the current content

review:
Relying on character popularity to release a premium unit that is completely mediocre is unacceptable. Even built per Mihoyo recommendation, still underperforms compared to much easily obtainable 4star units (diona, noelle, xinyan, xiangling to name a few). An expensive 5 star character should be an investment performance-wise.

Hard limit on stamina to promote purchase is predatory.

Numerous bugs such as voices or inconsistent character effects (xinyan e proc condition , zhongli e energy recharge) but company claims is working as intended despite community wide evidence.

Not to mention security issue where company does not protect your Information such as phone number.

Horrible performance on iPad Pro 2020, causing overheat issue within 10m of play at medium to low brightness.
title: Predatory practices for stamina and in-game currency #JusticeForZhongli
