review:
5 star heroes have a 0.6% rate. You need 7 copies to unlock all of their game changing passives. 

They are generous with the launch rewards but they also nerf the free currency you get from chests. Mihoyo is also infamous for being stingy with free currency so just be mindful of this.

Resin regen is horrible. You can only do like a couple of boss runs daily.

Game also feels poorly optimize especially on mid end devices. It's unplayable for low end. I'm forced to play on pc but pc have better games than this. I'm not gonna boot up the game and play for like 15 mins daily.

It feels like it's between pc and mobile. Perhaps it'll feel better playing it on a switch.
title: Nice ad, get a 5 star when the rates are 0.6%

review: This is the most disappointing game with the most anti consumer practices. The entire community complains about 1 Major issue and what is their response? a minor increase to the reason cap from 120 to 160. This is very disappointing and do not recommend playing this game as you will be slapped in the face by the developers. Resin is the key factor in progressing through the game and they know this and insult our intelligence by making a minor adjustment. Absolutely pathetic and disingenuous

review:
okay, i‚Äôll write this review short and simple!

this is an amazing game and i absolutely love the gameplay. the game is fun and interactive. i will be honest; i used to be absolutely terrified of playing games alone, but this game definitely helped me get over that fear. i also met some really fun people through the game! it‚Äôs easy to navigate and i absolutely love the characters, not to mention the whole plot.

now, for advice, my phone (an iphone 7+) was also unable to open the game. i downloaded it on both of my phones (they‚Äôre the same model) and it wouldn‚Äôt open. at first, i thought it was a storage problem, but it turns out if you turn off screen lock and/or turn your phone sideways and open the app, it should let you in. just make sure you don‚Äôt get impatient.

good luck opening the app and have fun playing!

review:
The games enjoyment comes to a screeching halt as soon as you hit adventure rank 37.

In order to progress with your character with ANYTHING you need to use premium currency, called resin (energy in Mobil games)

You have a 120 cap on it and and recharges very slowly. You can‚Äôt farm anything without it not even in game currency or experience. 

It‚Äôs not enough that you get characters through the gaccha system you then have to use resin to farm book to lvl them all up because monsters in the wild give you like 10exp and gold when you need hundreds of thousands of them. It‚Äôs crazy. 

It‚Äôs beautiful game and has potential, but human greed once again ruins it.

The graphics, characters, and voice are amazing. The UI feels clean and simple and the story is interesting!

The only issue I have with the game is that on devices (like my iPhone 6s) it can be unplayable at times.
- Bright lights blocking the screen/things not rendering

- Extremely low render distance

If you have a newer phone with more RAM and better graphics, this should be no problem at all.

review:
Well, more than three weeks have past since launch, and I cannot even launch the game properly in my iPad.

Worst of all, the developers don‚Äôt even have a miserable ‚ÄúKnown Issues‚Äù section in their bare-bones forums to at least check that they know about the issue. They can create a full 3D game, but not a miserable post in their excuse of a forum.

Already sent a couple of tickets to their CS, and not a single reply back.

review:
This game is the perfect combination of exploration, storytelling, and collection all in one, wrapped up in an intuitive/easy to learn package. When I downloaded it off of a recommendation I expected another cute phone game that would keep me entertained for a couple hours before realizing there wasn‚Äôt much depth- but it was completely different (it also comes on desktop/console). I got hooked on running around this beautifully built GIANT open map finding secrets, treasures, and fulfilling battles long enough to learn that the story and quest system were also amazingly made. They make play intuitive with goals in the adventurer handbook and constantly reinforce the importance of elemental reactions (which is another feature that makes this game fun and unique). I feel like the game is generous with rewards and I almost never feel like I‚Äôm ‚Äúout‚Äù of crafting materials because they make the gameplay so fun that by the time I go stop running around and exploring I‚Äôll have enough to do some upgrading (level 34 ish atm, I‚Äôm sure it will get harder though) 

*some improvements I‚Äôd like to see* 1- some ways to refresh the current map with new events/adding a new map separate map to travel between to keep things interesting and make me want to keep exploring 2-more ways to play with other people (just like an on/off button on mmorpg style map for regular play) 3-custom main character or access to more characters (which they are working on and releasing now), I also don‚Äôt think it would hurt to allow more wishing gems to be earned, but i understand that they need to make money somehow.

I‚Äôve played through all the main quests for now leaving only some side quests that are too difficult to complete, so I‚Äôm excited for their new updates! Great job!
title: Unexpected new favorite!

review: Ps-There are no adds!! Since this is my first review that I did on a game or app means something anyways this game is so good. At first I wasn‚Äôt sure about getting the app but when I got it it turned out to be better than I expected. In this game you have charters that have unique powers. You go on quests and you find different thing and different creatures that you have to kill. What I mean is not like bloody kill just kill them in like a fighting way with no blood. Anyways overall this game is good. Some things I want the developers to add or remove is that I don‚Äôt like how when you fly,run, or climb it like a timer so you can only do this for an amount of time but it‚Äôs not really a problem but they can add for time. Also I just want the quest to be more detailed. For example sometime the quest is on the bottom or top and when you tap the quest it doesn‚Äôt really clarify where the place is. One more thing is when you do the domain quest there was a quest about fighting the monster or creature under this many seconds. I don‚Äôt really know if this is a problem for others but I find it hard to kill all these creature under this many especially when you kill one and multiple just come again. Also you should probably give the characters shields so they can protect themselves from the monsters. You probably think that this will make the game easier and if you think then you don‚Äôt have change anything this is just my opinion. Lastly I would like to say that I would recommend this game for people with like adventure and doing quest. Thank you for reading if you did.

I really like this game but when you have to get the last poisonous blood clot off dvalin‚Äôs back it‚Äôs terribly hard and I leveled all my characters up to lvl 40 three times! And for my other characters I leveled them up to level 34 and 20 but I still couldn‚Äôt finish it. I tried using different party‚Äôs and it didn‚Äôt work. I love this game and I‚Äôm really sorry if it sounds like I‚Äôm hating on it but still when you try to get the second blood clot off Dvalins neck I can‚Äôt do it. I tried about 10 times already but nothing I try works! I even got food to revive and heal my characters but they still died on the end. It doesn‚Äôt make things easier since I‚Äôm playing on my phone I was really good at playing honkai impact but this is just on a whole other level. Maybe if it was the same thing as when you were getting the first poisonous blood clot off his back but harder I would like that. Also I‚Äôm not trying to vent about this. Also I can‚Äôt switch out my party‚Äôs to make this easier for me because I don‚Äôt know what elements I should use and I have few characters. But aside from that I like the storyline a lot and how this game includes different elements. I also like that each character uses the elements that they can with visions in there own way. The characters designs in this game is very unique from other games I‚Äôve played so I really liked playing Genshin impact! That‚Äôs all I have to say

review: A lot of games, mobile or otherwise, have promised open world, or at the very least 3D movability, but have never fully given me the experience of that. The style that this game is set up means that it is not pay to win, and you can get the currency you need quite easily in the game. I haven‚Äôt played much yet, not even done with the first city, but I can tell that I will have an amazing time. My few criticisms are the following: for a game that is entirely open world with very few barriers, I find it hard to believe that mounts aren‚Äôt available. Nothing special, but maybe a horse trader or some sort of magic broom you can ride on? Also, you tend to get duplicate weapons, it would be nice if you could sell things for a profit (I‚Äôm not sure if you can already, I just started). And a few more side quests would be nice. Like if you could help the sick girl, again I just started, so I‚Äôm not sure if any of these are already in the game. Edit: Ok so after a bit more time I have noticed a few more things, the crystals you have to buy are a small amount for about a dollar, if the number of crystals you get could be raised a little then I would pay for the crystals, but for now I can get the same by doing simple quests. Also, if there is a way to find out what to do for the next adventure rank I‚Äôd greatly appreciate it. Also, I cannot stress this enough, DO NOT NO LIFE THIS! Pacing yourself makes this so much more enjoyable because you can really take your time and collect everything.
title: The best mobile game I have ever played

title: Genshin Impact

review: Look, I love this game but here is my dilemma. I downloaded this game on both my iPhone and iPad. On my phone, it works great, they gameplay is wonderful and as mentioned previously I love the game, but on my ipad it‚Äôs a completely different story and I have no idea why, that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm trying to find out. On my ipad, the intro screen is black, all of the audio and cut screens glitch and I literally, when I‚Äôm playing the game, can not see more than four feet in front of my character, because it is all surrounded in black abyss. Not only that, sometimes the screen would just go completely black even though it still let me click on the characters and missions and it would still let me fight and play, I just couldn‚Äôt see any of it! (Also whenever I go near a bunch of random things like water, enemies, and chests, this blinding light emits and covers basically the entire screen and I have to go to a certain position or wait for it to go away.) I‚Äôve tried many things to see if it will work and I‚Äôm completely stumped. I don‚Äôt know if this is an issue with my app individually or other people too, I came here to see if anyone can relate. I‚Äôm not going to go on and complain because I understand that an ipad is a privilege and I could just play on my phone, but I prefer my ipad and just want to find out why it‚Äôs doing this. review: Great game!!!! The graphics are amazing for just a mobile game and they are absolutely beautiful. The people, the sky, (the monstersüòÇ) but being serious I love this game. It has a wonderful storyline that is also intriguing and is never dull. I also like that if you don‚Äôt want to do the story, you can just explore around the open world map. The characters actually have personalities which I like. All the people are dressed nicely and the clothes and hair and overall clothes very much match the theme and make the game even better. I like that you have freedom to make who you want. You get to choose if your character is a boy or girl and you get to make your own name. I know that isn‚Äôt totally crazy, but I just personally like it. I have only had for two days and I love it. I wouldn‚Äôt want to ruin the game by telling the whole thing about it, but the story is amazing and I love it so so much. You can interact with literally everything and you can do almost anything you want. You can walk, climb, swim, and fly to beautiful destinations. I have seen tall mountains and waterfalls that are amazing. I also like the wildlife that you see around. There are many types of birds that I usually hunt to get food, and there are also many food resources. You can pick fruit from trees, get fruit form bushes on the ground, hunt animals, and you can literally cook!!! I love that so much because I like to cook anywhere and everywhere all the time. Here are the bad things about the game: I can‚Äôt get enough of it and I want to play moreeeeee!!!!!!!!! Should be way way way way way way way way way way way longer!!! More awesome characters!!!!!!!!!! I am writing this completely on my own and I was not paid to write a good review. I hope this helps to people that are thinking about downloading. Here is my overall suggestion of if you should play it. 9/10 I say you should get the game 9/10 is what I would get it. I only went down one because it is super addicting and once you start, you won‚Äôt be able to stop until you have had enough of this game ( which is impossible considering how fun and interesting and amazing this game truly is) I am sorry that this was so long but to everyone that read the whole entire thing, Congrats ü•≥ üéâ üëè!!! Byeeeee

review:
I was wary at first... a Chinese gacha game with character additions and a focus on making the characters cute? Surely it was a scam.
Then I decided to give it a try after my cousin got me to give it a shot. I was still skeptical for a while, but as I started to play it, I learned that the gacha themes were more-so something that you could truly choose to participate in if you felt like it. They weren‚Äôt mandatory in any way. The game itself stands strong on its own and could easily be one of, if not the best mobile games out there. My only complaint is the targeting system that they have. In the mobile game it‚Äôs understandable, but through the mobile game or the PC version it‚Äôs not toggleable and can be pretty frustrating when you can‚Äôt play around with what you want to aim at. If there was a way to turn it off or better yet, change targets, it would be a near flawless game for what it‚Äôs intention was.

Overall, I‚Äôm greatly impressed with how the game turned out. The gacha elements are entirely for you to decide if you want to put your money towards it as everything can be done just as well with whatever characters and weapons you‚Äôve obtained naturally. While using the gacha aspects may make things easier for you, given that it‚Äôs a single player focused game, there‚Äôs no real incentive to go out of your way and throw money at the game unless you don‚Äôt want to face any challenges. Even then, the advantage you get from utilizing the gacha aren‚Äôt so impactful that you‚Äôll breeze through things, rather some of the characters are just slightly better and therefore do have an advantage, which doesn‚Äôt feel as though you need to have them to succeed as there is no competitive or PvP oriented aspect.
title: A lot better than I thought.

review: This is impressive for a mobile game. I‚Äôve been looking for something like this.
title: I‚Äôm impressed

review: To start off the exploration is just like botw there are puzzles scattered everywhere that give rewards also chests and teleport waypoints so you might get side tracked a lot. Now the combat is different from botw because it encourages you to change characters and use elemental reactions. Like mixing water and ice which makes enemys freeze or mixing electric and fire to make explosions. Every character has a element their is 7 in total pyro, cyro, electro, anemo, dendro, geo, and water. Now there is a lot of grinding you have to do unless you‚Äôre p2w but if your f2p you can still do a lot of things that p2w people can do but a little bit slower. The gacha won‚Äôt guarantee you what you want and people get mad because of that but you don‚Äôt have to spend any money to use the gacha so it‚Äôs not something to get mad about. If you use money that‚Äôs on you but don‚Äôt get mad at the game when you don‚Äôt get that one character you wanted because it‚Äôs all your fault. Now there are many bugs but that‚Äôs not their fault I mean it‚Äôs a game they usually have bugs. But there is a lot of game breaking ones like enemies in walls enemies that are invisible and bosses that don‚Äôt work how they‚Äôre supposed to. I barely scratched the surface but like I said you can‚Äôt blame them. I had this one really bad glitch where I had a black screen and when I went into the game I could only see one chunk ahead of me, but I switched to a better device and it works fine. people complain about how their device is bad and doesn‚Äôt support the game then give one star. I mean it‚Äôs a open world game your device is just not cut out for it. So please don‚Äôt give one stars without thinking. Be able to play then rate. Last thing Mihoyo please bring controller support that would make more people play but don‚Äôt hurry because you‚Äôll mess it up that way. Also test things before you implement them into your game with all of the devices.

review:
WARNING: This game is very intensive for mobile devices and is better to use on more recent flagship phones. If you have a console or PC it is better to play on there, otherwise if you have a powerful enough phone this game will work fine even wonderful.

Many open world games have multiple problems of engaging the player. However, Mihoyo refines many of the good elements from open world games and implements it into a game that can be played on your phone and other platforms. It is definitely similar to Breath of the Wild from Nintendo on the Nintendo Switch but maintains its personal identity through different mechanics that is immediately introduced to you. Such as elemental combinations, it allows a wide variety and a new fresh take on combat. You can take a character that uses hydro such as Barbara and combo with an ice user such as Kaeya to freeze your enemies and monsters. With many more other combinations which give an addictive and satisfying experience. While there are many positive aspects, there are also many cons. You will need to heavily grind in the game to continue to story which can be extremely time consuming and there are bosses which consume stamina/energy which takes a day to recharge to reap the rewards. On the plus side the bosses can be fought even without the energy and rewards but take time to respawn. The game is still a gacha game and you must roll for different characters who wield different abilities and obtaining every character is definitely very expensive as retrieving ‚Äúprimogems‚Äù are tiring and very lacking. There remains an option to purchase primogems, however, if you are a free-to-play person this is not an option. In the end, this game is very well designed with minimal flaws that can be easily ignored, especially for a free-to-play game. 9/10

review: Never in my mobile gaming experience have I ever enjoyed a game so much to the point that I actually write a review about it. This is my first review, and I can confidently say the game being reviewed is a big success. Genshin impact has only been out for a few days and the amount of bugs and glitches I have experienced are minimal to a freaky level. Every time I venture into a mission in the story or a side quest, I am able to understand everything that is going on. In many adventure games like Genshin, the campaign can sometimes get confusing with its fantastical and fictional elements, but when I play Genshin impact I have no problem with that issue. In fact, I believe the campaign is flawless in many aspects. In addition, the multiplayer/co-op mode is just as astounding. I love easily joining my friends and the gameplay not being affected either. In light of the current situation of multiplayer, I only have two suggestions: I should be able to continue missions or talk to NPC characters while in multiplayer mode. I understand the missions being unavailable to co-op because there are probably multiple obstacles like level, cut scenes, etc, but I feel that one feasible change is enabling discussion between NPCs in multiplayer. My phone battery also goes down fast, but I can‚Äôt expect that to change because it‚Äôs PS4 and PC game running on mobile (which it does very well). Although I gave a few suggestions previously, I am completely satisfied and could wish for nothing more than the gameplay I am getting now. I wrote the review to bring this game‚Äôs greatness to light, and I hope that I encouraged some people to try this game out.
title: Enjoying it enough to actually rate...

review: Wonderful voice acting on a scale like I‚Äôve never seen before
title: Best game ever

review: To start off: I normally don‚Äôt leave reviews for mobile games. Mainly because I get bored easily and put them off. The last game I remember reviewing was Vainglory and that is because I had spent countless hours playing it as it is a really fun moba. Now, this game kept popping up on my Facebook feed before its release and I did the preorder just to give it a chance; I enjoyed watching the ad and the graphics looked fun and pleasing to the eyes. Now, as I started playing the game on my phone since its release, I‚Äôve come to find that not only are visuals gorgeous, but the world gives so much to admire and enjoy. The music is sweet and gives the world character, the combat system and the ability to switch between your favorite characters and their elements to create combos and strategic thinking in battle gave me a rush that I rarely get from mobile games. I work in pest control and one of the customers I was serving was playing this game on PlayStation and we were able to discuss the beauty that is this game. The dialogue and voice acting is good and the game constantly feels very rewarding. I explore and I am rewarded for doing so and I am constantly upgrading my characters and their weapons. The developers have done an amazing job with this game and I look forward to seeing what it brings as I continue to spend hours on it. It isn‚Äôt a cash grabbing game since all forms of currency are easily accessible through gameplay even though I will say that if you decide to put money down, go ahead because this company has earned any money they receive to fund more content and for the amazing work they have done.

review: This game is honestly so amazing, it has wonderful characters and the open world is just fantastic and I have never been so addicted to a game since Fortnite s7 but that‚Äôs beside the point and the other reason i decided to finally write this review was to warn new players about some of the stuff they may come across, for example once you have hit AR(Adventure Rank) 28+ you might encounter problems that players have been raving about: the Resin System and Character Drop rates(this one doesn‚Äôt matter for any rank). For starters, right now at the moment( remember that) the max amount of resin you have is 120 which as you get farther into the game will realize that 120 is clearly not enough and then the time to replenish that resin is 1:8 ratio 1 resin is 8 minutes, that means you have to wait at least 16 hrs for all your resin to be replenished, I personally is not that bothered by this problem only a little bit, but a lot others are and time to address the next problem which is Character Drop rates, I might be a tad bit biased for this one but the character drop rates are ridiculously low. For example getting a 5 star character is 0.6% and you have to wish 90 TIMES just get guaranteed 5 star and that is a very HUGE problem for the community because it makes a very large gap between the f2p(Free to play) and ptw(pay to win) players because people who spend money have a more likely chance of getting these amazing 5 star characters while f2p‚Äôs barely have a chance and have to grind and save like crazy. A solution I do have for the resin problem is to one increase the cap not to 160 but at least 180 and decrease the replenish time to at least 2:1 ratio(2 min = 1 resin) and introduce a resin mechanic called Condensed Resin because this will one. Allow players to play more and grind way more and not get hit by a resin wall. Two. Will also help people saves their fragile resin till at least AR 40+ and three. This will make more people play a lot more than just dailies everyday and a side note is plz mihoyo increase the drop rates of the characters and INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF PRIMOGEMS U GET IN GAME(new players will learn about primogems once they play) but all in all this a very great game and one of the best gachas out there so far and I don‚Äôt want anyone to quit because of the problems I stated here, All I‚Äôm trying to do is make new players aware of these problems so it won‚Äôt be such a big shocker when it hits them and I hope you guys enjoyed the review and keep doing your work mihoyo and I‚Äôll see you in gameüëã
title: Amazing Game but things to be wary of

review: Ok so i‚Äôm just going to start out with saying i know this is a long review but just stay with me üòÇ. Ok, this game is so amazing and beautiful! The world and the story and the characters are all just so breathtaking and this game was DEFINITELY worth the wait. And also ive read a lot of the reviews and i‚Äôm just going to start with clarifying some things. For starters, this game is 100% free to play. Yes there is an option to buy things and it is hard to get certain characters but the developers and SUPER generous with giving you the materials you would need to get those characters! and to all those people who are saying ‚Äúoh there‚Äôs only a 0.6% chance you‚Äôll get a 5 star character this game is trash.‚Äù ... well they‚Äôre kind of wrong... What they don‚Äôt understand is that there are things called events and they will change every so often and if your patient and wait for new events you could get one that would up your chance for getting a character you want! And i haven‚Äôt spent any money and just with the materials that the devs have provided i already have qiqi AND Venti on one of my accounts so i got lucky! So just keep playing if you want to get a certain character, that‚Äôs what i‚Äôm doing for mona and sucrose üòÇ. Also some people are saying that they‚Äôve finished the game and there‚Äôs nothing else to do... well that is totally incorrect and this is not just a treasure chest opening simulator! The developers will add new areas and new things to do every update and they will also add new amazing characters and stories!!! (or so i‚Äôve been told) but i‚Äôm pretty sure that‚Äôs the deal. and the last thing i‚Äôm going to say is that just so you know this game is a lot like botw,  it‚Äôs similar bc it has  lots of the same battle tactics and  gameplay aspects but the story itself is totally different so if u enjoyed botw as much as i did then u will prob like this game, it‚Äôs like botw gameplay with different characters and story and world üòÇ. Some ppl get mad bc of how similar they are and i agree that they are reallllyyyy similar but that doesn‚Äôt bother me too much. So with clearing up all that stuff, this game is phenomenal and it is free to play! i would defiantly recommend this is anyone and pretty much any age group! (Also at the begging of the story u get to choose if u want to be a girl or boy and that was so cool!)  Thank you developers for such an amazing game!! (one of my new favorites) Also i‚Äôm super hyped for the announcement of when the switch version will be released! yay!!

review:
Ok, I haven‚Äôt written a lot of game reviews, but this absolutely deserves a commendation. Getting started you‚Äôre immediately thrown into this what looks like Breath of the Wild world but with hints of anime. The art is amazing, the gameplay is really smooth, there‚Äôs tons of exploration, once you get looking the map is pretty huge, it‚Äôs cross-platform and tons of other great things. It can be a tiny bit confusing at first to get used to but once you take a look at things, you get that hang of it real quick. 
I‚Äôve played for a few hours probably now and I‚Äôm 100% in love with every aspect of this. For those who enjoy anime and were looking for something anime-esc, this is definitely a must play. You can change the language voiceovers to Japanese, or keep it English if you prefer, but Voiceover Audio and Game Language are different, so you can play with English but listen in Japanese. 
I‚Äôm having a great time with this. It‚Äôs something everyone can play and enjoy together, especially with co-op. They even give you enough starting rewards to get going with new things and/or characters to start. (At least for early players) I‚Äôm looking forward to what‚Äôs in store from these developers. They seem like they‚Äôre definitely interested and in touch with their community and I can see this taking off.
Absolutely amazing so far and I would recommend to anybody who comes across it, or even enjoys any kind of adventure game. Big hat tip to MiHoyo üôåüôå You guys are amazing!
title: Nothing short of AMAZING!

review:
I immediately started playing the minute it launched, and I was taken back for the first time. This game is absolutely stunning. The graphics are top-notch, and the animation is very smooth. On top of that, the world is very open and very detailed. The landscapes are sprawling an beautiful. My only animosity with that idea is that the player can‚Äôt go into areas deemed ‚Äútoo dangerous.‚Äù It could be more interesting if the player could still access these areas, giving it a ‚Äúmore risk = more reward‚Äù kind of feel. But this isn‚Äôt too bad and overwhelming, so the player can still access the world almost completely freely. The mechanics of this game are a mix of many hit games, and combines them in the best way possible. Each character has their own weapon and moves, and you can glide around the winds like a bird. I especially like the cooking system in this game. I found it very rewarding. Searching in every nook and cranny also rewarded me with many good early-game goodies, which I enjoyed. I also found that talking to some npcs netted me some mid-level gear all the way in the beginning too. The gacha system is also really cool, and I enjoyed it. The only concern about it for new players is that you will get more weapons than characters. I like the mix in class variants for the characters too. 

In all, this game introduces some really amazing concepts for the world of mobile gaming, and I feel it could pioneer a new era if this is pulled off right, and it gets the attention it deserves. To the team who made this: Great job! You guys deserve a pat on the back! I know this must‚Äôve taken a lot of time and hard work, and just know that it absolutely paid off!
title: A New Era of Mobile Gaming?

review: This is my favorite mobile game by far
title: Really great

review:
First off, as someone who has playedmany MMO RPGS on all platforms I have to say this is by far my favorite. 
We all know how much we hated the close to 0%  chances of unlocking anything good in any game, or how the combat system just didn‚Äôt make sense. Well that‚Äôs not the case anymore here. In this game EVERY character is bound to be useful on your team. You are not BOUND by any OP team comp or OP character anymore. The elemental combat system makes sure ALL characters can play off of each other in such a satisfying way. Of an enemy is wet they will be frozen with next ice attack OR attacks will do chain damage if hit with lightning damage. Burning enemies can be vaporized with water damage or overcharged with electric damage. Every character works on pretty much every team, thus nullifying that ‚Äúugh who do I have to get rid of to use this hero effectively‚Äù feeling. The best part is: it isn‚Äôt even hard to unlock more heroes. They have a perfect chance of coming out of a roll, with the game gives you plenty of. Not only this but the move sets of all characters are amazing. The fact that you can use any character a different way depending on what environment you‚Äôre in BLOWS me away. I must say the experience is much better on PC or console since this game is MASSIVE. Another pro of this game is that it is MASSIVE. There is just SOOOOO much to do that you‚Äôre not bound by any of those boring RPG rules where you have to grind to no avail to get anywhere. You are set to explore a good portion of the world right from the start. The game doesn‚Äôt hold you hand to the phony where it tells you EVERYTHING but it gives you a fantastic and helpful idea of what‚Äôs going on when it happens. For example when you do an elemental combo the game will give you the OPTION to check and see what on earth you just did to eradicate that enemy. Unlike other RPGs where you have to spam a button to get over the boring introductions and tutorials, you get the option to explore the games extremely diverse combat system and enviro engagement. You can literally set the ground of fire and create and updraft (just like breath of the wild) or set shields on fire. The game even gives you a mechanic to see what objects can be effected by what element without overwhelming the player with information. 

Perfect Game.
title: Easily the best RPG made

review:
First, I must say that I‚Äôm not one to usually enjoy ‚Äúgacha‚Äù games. Now, I have an exception to the rule that‚Äôs not only fun, but provides a beautiful and immersive experience. On top of that, the entire game can be played not only as a free to play title that entices you to dump hundreds of dollars into it, but also as I have played it: without spending a single penny. That game is Genshin Impact.

My boss and a few of my coworkers had been hounding me to try this game for weeks, and told me how spectacular it was from the getgo. Usually I wouldn‚Äôt trust such brash statements on a game, but my boss is quite the picky gamer. On that I decided to download the game onto iOS, as I don‚Äôt currently have access to PC or PS4. Once I installed the game and went through it‚Äôs relatively lengthy download time, I was greeted to something I knew was possible on mobile, but I never expected a team to actually pull it off. The world, while unfinished, was absolutely massive. On top of that, it was also gorgeous! As I took my first steps into the world of Teyvat, I quickly realized the game‚Äôs heavy inspiration from the Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. However, the second I unlocked a second character to play with, this similarity was smashed into pieces. The combat in this game is very unique, and if you like constantly changing strategies to take on different enemies... this is 100% the game for you. The only thing left I would want to gush about is the story... but... that would lead to spoilers, which I couldn‚Äôt fathom doing with such an enticing storyline. My only complaint in this game is Paimon. As a supporting character she would have been great, but the decision to have a mostly silent protagonist leads to her taking up the vast majority of player sided dialogue in the game. This would be okay, if her voice wasn‚Äôt annoying in literally every language. Overall, 9.9/10, too much Paimon, like Skyrim with Guns (last one there is a joke)
Thank you for this game MiHoYo, I look forward to sinking another late night before work into this masterpiece.

review:
This contains minor spoilers.
Since you can already see the star rating, I‚Äôm going to list my main complaint at the top: the dialogue. The disconnect between the voice lines and the subtitles can be really disconcerting - I especially noticed it during the Xiangling‚Äôs Cookoff quest. What, did you just... not give the subtitle-ers the same script the VAs read off of? Or were the VAs given something different from what the translators wrote? Very strange. Also, the gender switch-ups. I chose the girl twin, and Venti says at the end of the tutorial about ‚Äúfinding my sister,‚Äù when it‚Äôs my brother that I‚Äôm after. I think Jean also referred to me as ‚Äúhe‚Äù to Diluc the first time we all met up, although I could be misremembering. Anyway, given all the times I‚Äôve been gendered correctly in previous voiced dialogue or just been given something gender neutral (traveler, cutie, honorary knight etc.) I have to wonder why it was decided to be wrong at this moment/these moments. Really immersion breaking. Sadly, dialogue never ever gets fixed in games with these problems. Perhaps we‚Äôre just lucky to get correct lines for the girl twin at all, especially since the fairytale cutscene after defeating Dvalin shows the prince having to rescue the princess, indicating the boy twin is canon.

As for the praise, this is an excellent port. I completely forgive this game for heating up my phone enough that holding it is painful. Tons of freedom of movement and direction, good characterization. Paimon being a companion/guide that‚Äôs actually endearing instead of insufferable amazes me. I also enjoy that it‚Äôs not afraid to get dark like with the guy in Liyue whose parents got murdered. The controls are solid, though maaaybe the glider could be a little more responsive in opening, or maybe I‚Äôm just bad. Combat and puzzles beat the normal slog of just bashing away through element interaction, rewarding proper character usage. Though, the larger enemies do feel like damage sponges - mainly the wind orb (though I‚Äôll admit to forgetting to give Amber a better weapon) and the second kind of big robot, the one that levitates and moves quickly and ruins your HP bar. Anyway, sorry for the long read. I really enjoy playing this game. I just wish miHoYo didn‚Äôt get lazy with the dialogue, because of all the things that make an RPG that‚Äôs what never gets touch-ups.
title: wonderful experience, classic dialogue issues

review: First off let me say I LOVE THIS GAME. The graphics, the story, the flexibility and creativity that I‚Äôve experienced is phenomenal and made very meticulously. HOWEVER, others might agree with me on this, it‚Äôs expensive. A 10 pull is essentially 25$ and even then it‚Äôs not guaranteed you‚Äôll pull a character. For instance I saved enough for 3 consecutive pulls only to get majority 3* weapon, 2 4* weapon and one 4 star character, sure you can earn it for free but the primo gems gets scarcer as the plot line progresses and you have to spend significantly more time to farm for both books and currencies. The exp you get from monsters are so scarce that it makes it impossible to level a character quickly based on battles alone. Not only that I have slowly begun experiencing increased crashes and lag in game, usually during a large battle on one of my quests which I end up having to redo. All in all I love this game but the level of time and effort you need to level your characters and complete quests as you progress further in game isn‚Äôt proportional, the rewards should increase but it doesn‚Äôt or hardly does. Not only that but the only way you get primo gems and fragile resin is pretty limited to quests and purchase, unlike most other games which have a calendar advent that allows you to gain some rewards via monthly daily login. I love this game but it‚Äôs getting harder and harder to enjoy as i progress since I have other irl stuff that just doesn‚Äôt allow me enough to time a day to progress satisfactorily even though it did in the beginning. Whenever I‚Äôve been playing recently, I feel frustrated.
title: Great game, flaws and crash

review:
I‚Äôm so glad that I discovered this game! Everything about it is incredible! The graphics are gorgeous! It‚Äôs exactly like the adds! And the animation is smooth and satisfying! I‚Äôve been playing the game for months, and I still have so much to discover! There are quests and interesting stories! And there‚Äôs so much exploration in the game! The character designs are great! And the voice acting is great as well! And I was surprised that this game was free! You don‚Äôt have to spend a penny to get the best gaming experience! This game is so relaxing! I love climbing and swimming and listening to the beautiful music! I am absolutely captivated! Some people put down the game when trying it out at first because they say it‚Äôs 
a ‚Äúrip-off of breath of the wild.‚Äù But I disagree! Monstad, can be very similar to breath of the wild, but once you discover lingye, a beautiful land based on Asian culture, you see that it‚Äôs very unique! Lingye is beautiful! And I love exploring the well designed landscapes. So please, CHECK OUT THIS GAME! üòÅ
There is barely anything that I can think of to improve this game, cause it is already amazing! But maybe the option to sit and lay down? I think it would be so amazing to be able to lay down and look at the stars at night, or to sit by a rushing waterfall! And the option to pet cats and dogs? I love seeing cats and dogs in monstad, and I love how dogs follow you around, but I would love to be able to pet them! I feel bad for hitting them to get a reaction. Anyways thank you for creating this game! And sorry for the long review. I give this game five stars! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
title: Amazing!! My new favorite game!!

review:
I love this game. The open world concept really makes it fun to explore while grinding out missions and the battle system is satisfying. I also like the option where you aren‚Äôt necessarily forced to go at the story pace. If I was to take a break, I can just go off exploring at my own pace, so it‚Äôs relaxing. I don‚Äôt even care if it‚Äôs a gacha game. The experience makes it enjoyable enough for me to become addicted to it. 

However, there is a LOT of crashing. I use an iPad (6th generation) that is compatible with the game. I lowered my graphics settings to thr lowest available and have plenty of storage on my device. On average, it crashes 2-3 times per 30 minutes. I appreciate that the game saves data so I don‚Äôt have to redo something important, but the crashes irritate me and really interrupts the gameplay. ItKs even worse that I crash in the middle of co-op boss battles, so at this point I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an option for me. I‚Äôm aware that there are plenty of other people who have crashes like me, so if you can find a way to fix the crashes I‚Äôd highly appreciate it!

The final thing I‚Äôd like to address is co-op. While it‚Äôs cool to be able to join your friends in their worlds, you‚Äôre pretty limited in what you can do. As of now, it‚Äôs really only helping your friends grind for materials, though not being a party leader, you can‚Äôt progress yourself. Even as a party leader, I cannot unlock new nodes to teleport to, meaning anything storywise is frozen(I understand why story-related options are closed off in this mode, but I think should be okay to let players go into story dungeons if you already completed it.) If anything, I feel like its limits make me rather drop co-op and just continue singleplayer. Co-op doesn‚Äôt really take away from the game, but I feel it has more potential if implemented well.
title: Great, but crashes/co-op issues

review: This game is actually awesome. It‚Äôs a decent MMORPG and like any new games, it has its ups and down sides. The downside is that while I can see that they don‚Äôt want people to burn through the game content, advancement is painfully slow. One way they can fix this is by doubling the Adventure Rank Exp you receive or reduce the amount needed to level up slightly. Not only that but there is a limited loot pool so far and it kinda ruins the grind of getting the same things over and over. I should feel rewarded for taking on tough bosses, however I just don‚Äôt once I get the loot. Also the whole wish system is a bit of a downer if you don‚Äôt get lucky off the start or you don‚Äôt pay. For free, casual players, at least give everybody a free one wish everyday or something. Don‚Äôt lock characters behind weeks of building of currency just to get tons of low tier loot. Give us something to look forward to logging in. Also, why not add armor pieces and pets maybe? Weapon and armor accessories to customize your character would go such a long way. As it stands, characters are basic besides the weapons. Make us WANT to adventure. Make us WANT to go try and solo a hard boss fight. A little more game progress would help a lot with this game. Add more guild bounties. Add a server boss for all regions and compete for damage and exclusive rewards based of damage, final hit on boss, etc. this game has tons of potential, I just hope the developers can make this amazing. Cuz once you get higher levels the game gets stale fast.
title: Lots of Potential... BUT

The voice acting is great, story so far is interesting, gameplay is top tier even for a console or PC which makes sense since it‚Äôs on those platforms. On top of all this though, what gets me even more excited to play this game, is the UI in it!! It is BEAUTIFUL! A lot of games REALLY mess up the UI and don‚Äôt put much thought into it, but the UI in this game is simplistic with elegance and it runs SMOOTH. It doesn‚Äôt skip around when I‚Äôm scrolling through items or announcements! I think the UI in these games is almost ALWAYS overlooked! The ONLY issue I have with it though, is a big one. As I can tell A LOT of effort and hard work went into this game, it‚Äôs BLATANTLY OBVIOUS that not much thought went into it. I didn‚Äôt think it was going to be as bad as I heard, but it is. This game is most definitely a LoZ:Breath of the Wild clone, and it REALLY gets to me! At first I didn‚Äôt mind that they took some aspects from the game because I‚Äôd LOVE to see the gameplay aspects from LoZ:BotW to be in some other open world games. They just make sense to be in open world rpg games. Like the climbing, the elemental reactions, the shrines for fast travel. There‚Äôs a point where it goes from inspiration... to a clone though. And that‚Äôs exactly what happened with this game. All in all though, I REALLY like the game. I gave it a 4-star SOLEY for the reason it‚Äôs a clone. I‚Äôd give it 5 if it weren‚Äôt for that.

review: Visuals, Story, Graphics, Characters, and the Gameplay are all extraordinary. The only drawback is the Free to Play experience, and with it is the grind or give up play style. You either like this game so much to spend money or not enough and just play it as it is. The Characters you get should not start off at level 1 and instead start at what world level you‚Äôre at. For example if you‚Äôre world level 4 then your characters that you get from your wish should atleast be level 30 or something you find acceptable. The resin system is also something that‚Äôs holding this game back, with only 120 per recharge instead of something like 300 or maybe even 400. With an increase in resin capacity then the grind for this game may be worth it. Please don‚Äôt let your greed be your downfall MiHoYo as this game is beyond superb. After playing for a month I‚Äôve realized that these improvement changes are worth it for your supporters and  will make your game better than it ever was. World levels play a role in enemies why not your wished characters that you get and make the level up system for the characters worth it for the world level starting system. And the Gacha style wishing... man oh man the characters are amazing but the chances to get them? Not even close to what I was expecting. We only get trials and that barely makes up for what we grind for in this game the amount of time I put into this doesn‚Äôt reflect what I should be able to get. 5 star characters per 90 wishes is absurd and shows your greed for this game. Games are meant to be fun and enjoyable for everyone and not just give advantages for people who have money since the 5 star characters need 90 wishes to be able to be acquired.

review:
If you have a PC or a PS4, the game is much better on either. The mobile version is the same, but it will overheat your phone and drain your battery, so I recommend the other platforms over this one. It also currently lacks controller support, so it‚Äôs a much better experience when you aren‚Äôt on a small touchscreen. 

That being said, I had to drop a star due to a recent discovery. There are things in place meant to intentionally cripple the progress of those trying to play for free. The battle pass mission use 1600 resin is impossible to complete without spending primogems, which players save up to use for the Gacha. I‚Äôm sure they are aware that they‚Äôve done this and it‚Äôs meant to corner you into spending money. This is no longer some crappy mobile game. It‚Äôs a PC and PS4 game, so I suggest the developers stop treating it like a mobile game and using these type of tactics. Either it‚Äôs free to play or it isn‚Äôt. Not to mention the EXTREMELY low chances of drawing new characters. I have only managed to draw two characters that weren‚Äôt free. I keep getting four star weapons that I don‚Äôt even own enough characters to use. Please make it so that we can earn more characters by playing. This game has already raked in millions from whales alone, I‚Äôm sure you can afford to throw us a few more characters that we can earn through gameplay.

I was also forced to leave my review for the game here due to the feedback page on PS4 not functioning. There are also many bugs that need to be worked out, such as random boss resets that greatly hinder progress as well. Imagine having almost killed a boss when it suddenly starts to ignore you, walks back to its original position, and resets to full health. While some bosses do regenerate health on their own, I assure you that that‚Äôs not what‚Äôs happening. I am also not leaving the ‚Äúboss area‚Äù either. There‚Äôs also the issue of getting stuck in chairs and the Paimon push. Paimon will forcefully push you out of a red zone. However, she will often push you off a cliff or, occasionally, into a crevice. I was forced into a rock crevice and unable to get out due to Paimon repeatedly pushing me back into it and forced to teleport somewhere else, which resulted in a long walk back. Get rid of the Paimon push. Just put up an invisible wall. I already hate Paimon for being an annoying little demon. Don‚Äôt make me hate her even more.

review: I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a 5 star game early game. But I‚Äôve been playing since launch and have reached endgame content. It‚Äôs become pretty boring with almost nothing to do every day. From early to mid game there‚Äôs constant content with missions and storyline quests but as soon as you hit endgame it becomes a barren wasteland. Like it‚Äôs to the point where I check in for 30 mins every day to collect rewards and use up my energy (resin) and be done with the entire day. There‚Äôs literally nothing else to do. On top of that drops and money (mora) doesn‚Äôt scale with endgame content. But apparently leveling and ascension materials do, so it‚Äôs becoming a ridiculous grind to level anything. But I don‚Äôt mind grinding but only for the stuff that‚Äôs actually useful. I don‚Äôt want to run around the entire map and wipe the mobs on my farming routes to end up with a surplus in ascension mats for characters I don‚Äôt even have and almost no artifacts to power up my good ones and so few mora that it‚Äôs not even worth it. Therefore I think the BIGGEST setback for this game is the RESIN(energy) system. Either that or add so many quests that we need to do that we can‚Äôt finish them. I honestly think the entire system should be removed or just give us a ridiculous amount of condensed resin so we just never run out unless we‚Äôre literally farming for an entire day. Like I want to be able to play for a few hours and actually enjoy the game and not be limited by some stupid energy limit the devs put in the game. Most games with systems like that I don‚Äôt even bother playing or getting good since you can never catch up to whoever started earlier than you or whaled the game.
title: Fun for the beginning

review:
At first glance, Genshin Impact seems like an interesting Breath of the Wild-esque game.

Then you get closer and realize it's just a gacha that skinned Breath of the Wild and wore its skin as a suit.

The monetization is predatory and the later story quests are locked behind serious grind. F2P, P2W is in full effect.

In short, not that fun of a way to spend your time.

review:
This game is really interesting as you roam between the two regions like Monstadt and Liyue. Music is decent, graphics are great and mechanics in this game simple. 

I don‚Äôt know about other phones but my iPhone tends to overheat without a fan blowing it. This game is enjoyable even if you don‚Äôt have 5* but when you get one, it does help you feel more excited for adventure. I love exploring and solve mini puzzles. I love how having 4* is enough to get jobs done and not meta required. So far I‚Äôm kinda f2p but I bought the monthly rewards for some primo gems and to support the game that is somehow free $$$. Hope y‚Äôall play for the game itself and not just for the characters. I mean it‚Äôs cool to obtain such awesome characters but the downside is when you don‚Äôt get what you want. You automatically don‚Äôt feel like playing the game anymore. Even I went through this stage of sadness and depressed not getting my waifus but gotta manage. This game is time consuming and I spent like 6-10 hours on it everyday. Oh and you gotta be observant. Right now I might not see the cons because of how beautiful this game is. 

P2W doesn‚Äôt exist in here, it‚Äôs rather pay to play as f2p can accomplish such goals too but a bit slower. People pay to obtain weapons and characters. Imo those who are paying are doing us f2p a favor, that is supporting the game especially when it‚Äôs free. The concept of winner and loser simply doesn‚Äôt exist in this world. There‚Äôs no pvp but rather coop, helping each other or friends out is the main goal of coop. Don‚Äôt stress yourself out for not getting the 5* you wanted, you‚Äôll get them in the future as it only takes patience. Thank you to those reading this and supporting the game much love <3.

review:
I enjoy the game a lot and mostly play on PC. I only play on mobile to collect daily rewards or to use up some resin (used to claim rewards from activities in the game) if I‚Äôm near my cap and won‚Äôt be able to do stuff on PC. Whenever I‚Äôm fighting monsters, the game just lags a lot, especially if there‚Äôs a lot of reactions on the field and makes it hard to not die. I‚Äôll also randomly get crashes I freezes, not during combat, but just doing things like walking around the map, opening menus or talking to an NPC.

Other gripes ‚Äî this is a gacha game so there‚Äôs obviously lots of things you can buy to progress. The first 30-35 levels, there really isn‚Äôt any need to buy anything as what you get from progressing through the story and quests and dailies gets you through that without too much difficulty. After that though, it becomes really hard to improve your characters because you just can‚Äôt get enough resources, even if you do pay money as the amount you get per dollar is absolutely terrible. Even whales who have spent thousands on the game are struggling which is quite telling. It feels bad to spend on this game because you‚Äôd expect your money to get you somewhere and make the game more enjoyable, but the price ratio is too high right now. Of course, there‚Äôs a lot more content promised, but I don‚Äôt know when that content is going to come. It could be several months or even years and I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll wait around that long. It‚Äôs a shame, because at it‚Äôs core, it‚Äôs a really fun game.

review:
I started this game only a few weeks ago and im already addicted!  I love the graphics, the characters, The quests, and not to mention the amazing storyline! I think the best part about it is that it‚Äôs easy to gain XP and level up but just hard enough so where you're not finishing the game in the first week, it's a perfect balance! I also love the fact that since some parts of the story are only accessible to certain levels, you can still do side quests, and go hunting (Animals or monsters!) that way you're not stuck doing anything the entire time with no way to level up! I really only have a few complaints, which, honestly are just recommendations! 

-I think it would be awesome if with the characters with swords were able to jump from the ground and pull our weapons out midair, instead of having to climb up something and then jump off to attack.

-Another thing I would recommend is maybe having a chat for Co-Op mode? It‚Äôs kinda strange being to join other people's servers but having no clue what's going on and not being able to communicate with them.

-It would also be nice if some things were explained a little further when you unlocked them, for example, when I unlocked Co-Op mode all it told was if I clicked this button I could join other servers, and I couldn‚Äôt do quests while in Co-Op mode, but is there a way to invite people to my servers? Can I lock my server so people can‚Äôt even request to join? Just small things like that would make the game a lot more enjoyable!

-Please come put with a Switch version!I have a Nintendo Switch and I think it would be absolutely amazing to be able to play on an actual console! 

And that's really it! Thank you for taking the time to read this and for making such an awesome game! Have an amazing day/night!

review:
The game itself is great, I have played many hours on pc issue is that it didn‚Äôt open when I trued to play for the first time. It came up as a white screen while I waited a few minutes and then not being happened.
Besides that I feel like multiplayer need a little bit of a change.
Things I would love to see implemented would be a lower level multiplayer to level together at a slower rate then normal because of the speed at which you can progress and an increased difficulty when having more players. In ties to the multiplayer standards I would like to see some quest be available in multiplayer. Also merchants and data should be able to be tracked over to multiplayer. And for one of the biggest things is the chest system to fix it just have any chest that the non host player has found shown as an open chest to them but an unopened one for the host who hasn‚Äôt opened it yet. With these things implemented it should help the multiplayer part of the community to grow allowing possibly multiplayer events to be available and wanted by parts of the community. 
Final issue to address with having a high level and going to lower world level multiplayer game to make it easier for them it will make it hard to implement this but to counter this just have a max cap per level the host is to be applied for the non-host player who is of much higher level. This would allow for a at possibly worst case scenario a 90% decrease In most stats making the level 30 or higher a comparable to a level 3 or so when working with a level 1 or something.

TL:DR 
Great game but multiplayer is a bit annoying
Issues was higher level people playing with a low level host so to fix it would be to debuff the higher level player by a percentage of all stats, increased difficulty when playing any level with more people, allowing quest to be multiplayer, allowing loot from unopened chest to be picked up by only the player who opened it to let multiplayer non-host be able to get loot with out stealing it, and allowing for transition of items and characters between you and your friends worlds

review:
When I started playing this game, it was amazing and I was right off the back addicted to it 
I still am addicted to it however there are some things that bother me a bit
1. The further you get into the game, the more you start lacking mora, I wish there was an easier way to get mora, even 100k Mora isn‚Äôt enough when it comes to ascending, leveling up,etc 
2. Primo gems are a bit hard to get when you‚Äôre f2p, I can understand why Primo gems shouldn‚Äôt be extremely easy to get since this is a gacha game but I wish there was a better way to get primo gems, getting like 1 primo gem per every chest you open doesn‚Äôt help at all and that new hilichurl that has a chance to drop 1 primo gem doesn‚Äôt help at all either.
3. I wish there was some sort of relationship system, kind of like having actual conversations with characters, kind of like the friendship thing that‚Äôs in the game but better. A lot of people have waifu‚Äôs and husbando‚Äôs that are in this game so it would be pretty cool if there was a way to interact with them more with friendship quests or maybe even getting special cut-scenes with them depending on your relationship level with them. Kind of like a "dating" system or just a system that allows you to become close friends with a character. This is just something I would want to be added to this game but it isn‚Äôt really necessary :).
Thanks for reading this and I hope you can take some of my suggestions into consideration!

review: Good game some nice story feels like Zelda

I‚Äôm a big fan of these types of games, however I always struggled to find one that was captivating for more than a week or two. I‚Äôve been playing this game for almost two months and I still make an effort to log in and play at least an hour, sometimes more (depending on my free time), every day. I‚Äôll list out the pros and cons though.

Pros:
- The storyline is captivating and it progresses as you level up your adventure rank, and there are tons of side quests, dungeons and bosses you can partake in the meantime.
-The world is so open and free, you‚Äôre not bound to specific areas and you‚Äôre pretty much free to explore. Even when you are bound to certain areas, it‚Äôs typically in the early game when you‚Äôre not quite ready to venture too far into the world yet. You don‚Äôt even have to do the main storyline (although I really recommend that you do, it‚Äôs interesting and opens up more of the world as you progress), you can explore, do side quests, gather resources for cooking or leveling up.
-The graphics are beautiful! Typically Mobile game graphics aren‚Äôt the best, especially if it‚Äôs a free game, but I was honestly amazed. My boyfriend isn‚Äôt into mobile games and doesn‚Äôt play, but when he sneaks peeks at my phone while I‚Äôm playing he always remarks at how great the graphics are.
-You don‚Äôt need to spend money in game to progress. That‚Äôs the best part imo. Once you reach a certain adventure rank, you have to option to spend money on in game currency, but it‚Äôs not necessary unless you want it. The game provides multiple ways to get a surplus of coins and wishing stars by ranking up, doing quests, and giving you lots of in-game items that you can use to purchase more coins. The game also gives you different hero‚Äôs throughout as you complete quests, and it gives you in-game items that let you draw hero‚Äôs from whatever drawing pools are available at the time. There‚Äôs a lot of flexibility when it comes to in-game currency. So you can, but you don‚Äôt have to spend money in the game to progress. It takes away the feeling of being bound to a game because you spent money on it.
-The puzzles are difficult and actually make you work for your reward. I know that might sound like a con rather than a pro, but most games will just hand you the reward with minimal effort. This game is difficult and that‚Äôs what makes it so fun. It‚Äôs not insanely difficult, especially if you take the time to be prepared for battles and understand the puzzles a bit better than I do, but it will definitely make you sweat.

Cons:
-There are occasionally sharp increases of lag, especially if you play without WiFi (on LTE). It usually doesn‚Äôt affect the game too much, and it‚Äôs only crashed on me once or twice, but the devs update bugs and glitches constantly so it‚Äôs not a big issue.
-The multi-player aspect is a little difficult to grasp. I haven‚Äôt explored it too much yet, but everytime I have either my partner leaves or I leave in the first two minutes.
-The in-game draws are a little unbalanced. Although they‚Äôre free and require in-game items to use, the draws consist of both hero‚Äôs and weapons. Hero‚Äôs have a lower chance of actually being drawn compared to weapons. It‚Äôs a higher chance if you do the 10 at at time rather than the single ones, but still fairly common to not get any hero‚Äôs from a draw at all.
-Food items like meat or fowl are a little difficult to come by unless you grind certain areas to obtain it. Birds and other animals are skittish and will run off of you get too close. You either have to use an archer or use an AOE attack to get meat off of the animals. Later in the game you get to buy the meat and fowl off of merchants, but it‚Äôs still not too much.

Overall, the game is really well made and really fun to play. There isn‚Äôt much hand-holding and it doesn‚Äôt require any in-game purchases (unless you want to try your hand at the draws some more). There are things that can be tweaked, but they‚Äôre very minor and don‚Äôt take away from the concept of the game too much.

review: I LOVE the element and status effect system it leads to satisfying combos and visual spectacle. But the combat itself is a bit underwhelming since enemies stagger a lot to your attacks and larger enemies have super predictable movement patterns. It leads to a situation where when I was a level 10 player who could go directly to the purple cube boss and defeat it despite it being level 40. The game just needs to improve its combat system a bit and it would easily be one of the best games ever. Add some counter mechanics like parrying, shields, and weakpoints and decrease enemy stagger significantly. Also for larger enemies make their attack patterns a bit faster because right now they telegraph their attacks so so much that it's beyond predictable what they're going to do. All you do is click the dodge button and bam you're fine.  If I can beat one of the hardest bosses in the game when its at level 40 while I'm at level 10 I think there's something a bit wrong with the game's difficulty scaling and combat systems (more so the latter). I love the open world and element system (given I prefer breath of the wild's non linear level and objective design and puzzles for its open world), but if the combat is too simple it leads to an inability of mastery. The idea of accomplishment in video games doesn't purely stem from beating the game but rather mastering it and its mechanics. Genshin offers the mastery of its elemental system but the challenge it offers sets the bar way too low for its combat system. I like aspects of this game but I really think it has the potential for more and possibly to become one of the best mobile games and video games ever if it significantly improves and capitalizes on its enemy variety and elemental system by improving its combat system through the suggestions above. But rn for me "personally" it's okay. (this is just my opinion based on personal levels of reasoning by all means you can like this game, opinions are always valid as long as they don't negatively affect the self or peers mentally or physically.) I'm not asking for like darksouls level of difficulty I just want a good enough of a challenge that slowly progresses with the game that it can challenge the unique element systems that Genshin has with a nice combat system. Genshin‚Äôs graphics and world are stellar and I commend the effort the devs put into this game, but I see the potential this ground work set up for so so much more and I wish it the best. I may be a bit too critical since the game just launched and maybe the devs intend to improve these aspects of the game. However, I felt I had to say something because I just want this game to reach the heights I think it‚Äôs more than capable of given what‚Äôs currently there.

review:
There was quite the hype for this game for a while. I preordered the game a few months ago, but I know people who‚Äôve been waiting for a year or more. I started playing it a few minutes after the official release and have consistently played it since then. I‚Äôve used different platforms and would say that the newer your device, the better the experience. On my iPhone 7, it‚Äôs unplayable to the point it was unenoyable, essentially trash. However, on the IPhone 11, the game runs so smooth with only occasional crashes.

I feel the game is paced very well. For a casual player, you can enjoy the story line, explore the world, and appreciate all it has to offer. There‚Äôs so much to do, a few secret missions, sudden side quests, that the average mobile user would have no issue with game progression. However, I do believe there are a good amount of ‚Äúhardcore‚Äù or dedicated players that progress at such a fast rate that there‚Äôs nothing to do. As of now, I‚Äôm AR33, and have pretty much done all I can with my current line up. I could progress yes, but to level up my AR, I‚Äôd need to purchase resin to fight bosses for that little experience . HOWEVER, this does not mean you can‚Äôt level up; the daily missions supply a good amount of adventure rank and you‚Äôre guaranteed a level up a few times a week if you keep up. I‚Äôve seen a few people level 35+, a few even 40, in my area. As of now, the average seems to be around rank level 30, so I believe in terms of game progression, Genshin Impact is doing a very good job at serving all its player types.

The Gatcha system is so well balanced that it doesn‚Äôt seriously affect your ability to progress in the game. Literally any character can be used to progress, with each one having special abilities that one can specialize in using. I luckily drew a Diluc and the Bell weapon my first pulls, so the game has been extremely easy. Even if you had horrible draws, the game offers you two very powerful characters for free: Noelle and Barabara. I severely underestimated Noelle, and began using her for the Abyss and she has done wonders carrying me team. Along with the few other free characters you‚Äôre given in the story line, you should have no problem fighting the mobs/bosses in the world. 

One issue I do have in the game is the method of leveling up my characters. I feel the game doesn‚Äôt give enough experience for characters if you defeat bosses or mobs. There‚Äôs absolutely no way I‚Äôd be able to max out more characters in order to fight higher level abysses unless I use a few experience books, a rare commodity. I have 3 level 60 characters and 2 level 40/50s and I‚Äôm low on books. I‚Äôve wanted to save some books for my core team, but in order to progress in the abyss I needed a few more stronger characters in my lineup. That said, I feel they need to buff up the amount of experience you get for fighting mobs so that it‚Äôs much easier to level up characters. There‚Äôs so no way I‚Äôd have the time to grind up my characters to max just by fighting mobs. It‚Äôs just unreasonable. That said, people recommend you only hyper focus 1, maybe two characters to level up and play around. This is fine given the amount of books were give (you can probably max out 3, maybe 4 chars at my AR) but I still would like a way to grind up char levels without using books, like buffing the amount of exp you get from mobs. 

Overall, I think the game is very solid, very fun, and easy to get into. I do believe there needs to be some way to advance quicker, but I understand why the developers want to pace the game where it‚Äôs at. There are issues with running the game on iPhone 7, but anything newer than that you‚Äôll have no issues running the game. There are occasional crashes but it‚Äôs not game breaking. The world may seem big at first, but I‚Äôve explored so much of it, and uncovered so many things, that it seems small. I‚Äôm waiting for the next updates for even more story line and fun. 

4.8/5

review:
This game is amazing. Great gameplay loop, fun and dynamic combat system, enjoyable story and unique characters. There is a gotcha system in this game for both characters and weapons, but you DO NOT need to spend money in this game to complete it. Generally speaking I have no complaints about what is currently in the game.

The huge problem with this game is the lack of content. At first you feel overwhelmed (in a good way) with so much to do and explore. This feeling will stay with you for a few days, possibly weeks if you take it slow. But then you inevitably hit a wall, the story abruptly ends, and you are left with an empty feeling and an empty world. 

Don‚Äôt get me wrong there is still plenty to do and plenty to grind... but again, it just feels like meaningless tasks. The world level will increase meaning you can take on existing content at harder levels, but there is no new content. 

Moving forward the plan for the game that the developers have outlined is to update the game every 6ish weeks. Some of these updates seem to be bigger than others. The first update is coming out next week - and while it has new characters and quality of life features... there is very little content added and no continuation of the story.

This game has huge potential, and I am confident it will be amazing and full of content in a years time.... for now - it‚Äôs just too empty and they will just not be able to add enough content to keep their players busy for 6 weeks at a time. 

I still recommend it - but just know the end game is very bland and there is point where you will be longing for more.
title: Not Enough Content

review: I‚Äôm would give this game a five star review, but there is one major problem holding this game back. Please Mihoyo, I highly implore you to CONSIDER what I have to say. In a short and honest review, Mihoyo put a lot of love, attention and care into these characters and this gorgeous open world, but they also feed off people with gambling addictions. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, Mihoyo is just playing it smart, but they need to expand their target audience. A lot of new players that have never played a gacha before will pick this game up, and when they realize they cannot obtain all the characters they want without spending money, they quit the game. Also, a new player could feel like the progression system is too slow compared to a normal open world, which is why they likely picked this game up. Not because it is a gacha, but because it is an open world. Mihoyo shouldn‚Äôt think of this audience as players who won‚Äôt spend money, because that‚Äôs how they treat these players. ‚ÄúIf they don‚Äôt want to spend money on our game, then they don‚Äôt matter‚Äù. This is not completely true. The problem with Genshin isn‚Äôt how bad the drop rates are, or how much currency they give to players, or the prices. The problem is that new players, and eventual returning players CANNOT guarantee every character they want. That makes them not want to play or spend money. Here is an example. If a player wants Venti, Jean or Keqing, and they spend all the free currency they get in game without getting these characters, they don‚Äôt want to buy a chance to get the character. These players will quit the game, because they didn‚Äôt want to spend money. MAKE THEM WANT TO SPEND BY SELLING THEM WHAT THEY WANT. Not everyone playing Genshin is addicted to gachas, A LOT of new players to the gacha genre are playing Genshin because it is an open world. SO START MAKING MONEY OFF ALL YOUR PLAYERS FAIRLY AND HONESTLY BY GIVING US MORE CHARACTER BANNERS MORE OFTEN. Simple, easy. You could even have one copy of each character available to purchase for something stupid like 100$ each and I bet even players new to the gacha genre would consider buying. Don‚Äôt sell new characters for a month or so. This way players still have to spend a lot of money to get duplicates and resources, but we will feel motivated to play and get resources because we are getting what we want to spend our money on. But no, right now we spend money on a random chance to get an off-banner unit without a pity system? I‚Äôm not spending a dollar on this game until a keqing banner shows up, I don‚Äôt care how many gems you mail me. I need to know that I can guarantee what I spend my money on, and no one likes playing a game without the characters they want. Please Mihoyo there are many ways to fix this problem with your players, many different ways you can address the issue.
title: An Open World Gacha NEEDS more CHARACTER BANNERS

review:
So let me start by saying what the devs have been able to pull off with this game is nothing short of amazing. This is not your average open world mobile title, this is a full fledged AAA open world RPG. This game is also available on PS4 and PC but the mobile version is just as good. Playing on an iPad Pro with graphics setting all the way up this game blows me away. I still cannot believe how beautiful this game is! The art style and game play is incredibly similar to Zelda: BOTW. The only thing it‚Äôs missing is mounts. 

Besides the graphics, the story and gameplay are also top notch. I‚Äôve been playing for about 8 hours and still don‚Äôt feel like I have even scratched the surface. The music is beautiful and the voice acting is very well done and actually adds to the experience, which is rare in mobile titles. The combat system while relatively simple still has enough complexity to make it fun and not feel to hack and slash. It still requires a lot of skill and strategy. 

The only con is that it is not controller compatible despite being able to use a controller on PS4. Luckily the touch controls are well laid out and very polished and don‚Äôt detract from the game at all but I‚Äôd still love to be able to use an Xbox or PS controller for the full console experience. 

The fact that this game is free to play is just wild. Yes there is a gacha monetization strategy but i have completely ignored it to this point and do not feel hindered in any way. It is definitely not pay to win. There are a million other things I can touch on but if you‚Äôre still reading this just stop and download this game already.  Thank you devs for making an incredible game and pushing the envelope for mobile forward. This is the new gold standard for what is possible on a mobile device.
