title: Super heavy

review:
So since launch I was enamored with this game. Incredible graphics, cool heroes, insanely expansive world, cross play. All amazing things. There's so much to do and it's a lot of fun, I have to admit.

The co-op system leaves a little bit to be desired though. That's my only real knock to the gameplay. You really can't do much together or experience the story together. You can only free roam or run repetitive dungeons together. That said the gameplay is still fun and great.

Here's where my review starts to take a turn. I feel kinda anxious every time I load up the game. The "battle pass" has pretty tedious and mundane daily and weekly tasks that is not really fun and I don't want to do. Like "run around the huge world and collect 200 rare plants," or something like that. That's not fun, that's work. Maybe it's because I'm 34 and have a full time job... I don't want my games to be a second job.

The next thing is the summoning rates. Gachas in general prey on people's anxiety and addictions, and although I still play them and love them, this game is absolutely disgusting with how much you have to spend to get anything good... Unless you're ridiculously lucky or skip a banner or two to save for the pity system. The game doesn't even have PvP or like a clan system, so what's the point of spending $7,500 (the amount a content creator I've been watching spent on his account and stopped spending because of how gross this game is) to get all the 5* heroes and get really strong? There's no competition.

So my advice is: Definitely play this game, it's amazing and fun. Just don't fall for the gacha gimmicks.

1.) Don't spend money and fuel the greedy, predatory and completely unnecessary gacha system.
2.) Get familiar with and learn to love three starter heroes.
3.) Don't get excited for a new hero release unless you have enough currency for 90 summons (I think that's pity).
4.) Play the game at your own pace. There's no reason to build up quick and get strong because there's no competitive play

I hope someone finds this review helpful!

review:
All in all. 11/10 game. It‚Äôs quirky. It‚Äôs fun. ITS ENJOYABLE. the problem is it‚Äôs not sustainable for f2p casual players beyond the initial feeling and gameplay. You can play the game through with the free toons they give you but it‚Äôs going to take you 20x times as long to do it compared to a person that spends between 500 to 1000 in Gacha drops. Those drops are not promised to be lucrative characters though either unfortunately you could get 3 or 4 doubles of the free to play characters(or the same f2p character over and over) you have or in worse cases nothing at all beyond weapons you can already farm in game. You know what I can‚Äôt farm in game? A character or combination of characters that have a move set that doesn‚Äôt feel like a wet noodle hitting a hitting the pay wall. 

To be fair. I FULLY went into this expecting the free to play characters to be underwhelming. They always are in games like this. What I didn‚Äôt expect was the 1/million chance to roll a unique character on a case by case basis...... I‚Äôm heartbroken that I can‚Äôt build a team that feels like mine because I haven‚Äôt seen anything unique. I've played the game up to ar30 so far and I haven‚Äôt seen a new character. Now I‚Äôm in the home stretch to end game and I hit like a wet noodle unless I‚Äôm using the only combo team they give you. The water healer nun Barbra and the ice swordsman kyea. (Definitely butchered the names) 

I think there‚Äôs one other team comp I could use and it‚Äôs geo/geo using noelle and the traveler but from what I can tell it‚Äôs only kind of comparable in damage with another geo character to help with shields. That comes back to the root of the problem though!!!! 

How can I play the game and use the designed mechanics of what I‚Äôm given barely scratches the surface and the wish system punishes me for not spending money.(or from what I‚Äôve seen online it punishes you for not spending to get the pity 5 star. Which is even more scary. On top of that it‚Äôs not promised to be a character either unless you use the right banner which is a whole different kind of annoying)

Needless to say I‚Äôm upset because I LOVE THIS GAME but I don‚Äôt like the vicious tactics to get you to spend a lot of money for no reward. 

Please balance your free to play base team or fix the wish system drops. One or the other could go a long way to making this more sustainable. 

So please for the love of god change the rates or balance your game.

review:
TLDR: this game is so close to being special but it has some serious flaws.

Is Genshin Impact a good game? Yes.

Is it a good Gacha game? I honestly don‚Äôt know what to say. 

Genshin impact is arguably one of the most ambitious mobile games on the App Store and it does so much right but it also falls flat in certain departments.

The combat is simple yet fun, the elemental attack system that relies on blending different elements to do different types of combo damage reminds me a lot of Mass Effect Andromeda‚Äôs ability combo system. (arguably the only thing that game did incredibly well)

The character and world designs are great. Liyue is one of the prettiest environments I‚Äôve seen in any mobile game and it even beats some console and PC titles. 

One of the core problems with the game lies in its progression system. Simply put, it‚Äôs incredibly pedestrian. Adventure rank is easy enough to raise but the problem lies in the fact that the game locks a lot of resource farming behind AR 20 and 30+. This is a problem because it slows down player growth significantly and halts you from ascending your characters to higher and higher levels. My next gripe with the progression system is the battle pass because I feel like it is unlocked at a really awkward point in time at AR 20, and there are a lot of useful items that newer players could use to get through the main story.

The area where this game truly face plants though is in its gacha system, simply put. Hard pass on whaling, at least for now. I got all of my bonus currency from buying each currency pack for the first time and I can safely say that the current 5 star rates are so bad that you might as well just shoot for maxing out 4 star constellations and ignore most 5 star characters, and I got lucky and managed to get several 5 star pulls, I even got one node within the constellation of a 5 star character. The gacha system needs to be retuned for be a bit more consumer friendly if Mihoyo wants players to use characters other then Fischl and Xiangling who are incredibly easy to obtain while also being ludicrously powerful with constellation points. There should be a realistic chance to get a 5 star character or weapon without breaking the bank and as of right now, there isn‚Äôt.

If the gacha rates and progression system get tweaked so that they value players time more then this game is a must play but until the gacha system is made a bit fairer, I can only give this game a 3 star review.
title: Great but needs tweaking

review:
I‚Äôm going to start off with this - my friends and I absolutely ADORE this game. It‚Äôs the hot topic of the month, and we‚Äôre all having a blast playing it. The music, the visuals, the story, the characters, and the gameplay are all so good even for a mobile player like me. However, there are definitely a nick that worries me very much. I understand that this game is still in its very early stages, but please take these into consideration:

The Gacha 
I understand that a gacha system is a very good source of income and is also not too much of a deal in the actual gameplay (the game can be progressed with the F2P and common gacha characters), the rates and systems surrounding the gacha are putrid and can be perceived as predatory. 0.6% for a 5 star (with weapons and characters mixed together!) and a 90 for a pity in addition to the very expensive gacha currency of primogems both in terms of real life money and in-game accumulation, it would be an understatement to call this gacha system harsh. As this game is marketed for a very wide audience outside of the regular audience of gacha games, this is a major turnoff for many new players of gacha and even some of the old veterans. I do not have enough information of balancing a gacha game so I cannot give any specific advice, but some more generosity should go a long way.

There are definitely other minor problems such as not being able to find the objective of a quest for almost a hour even with I look all around (I still can‚Äôt find the wind clusters on the uninhabited island), several glitches such as suddenly launching into the air during combat, and the very limited co-op of this game. However, I know that these problems are either because of my shortcomings or just because this is a very new game. From what I heard from Honkai Impact players, the game developers here seem to be very generous, so I hope to see more improvements to the generosity of the game. Very excited for ver. 1.1!

review:
I want to love this game. It gets 3 stars for being a mihoyo game alone.  An ambitious developer and I think one of the most technically adept mobile developers on the planet. Genshin impact is a nice looking game, smooth animations, very pretty. There are some interesting elemental interactions in the world and combat system. Occasionally those can be annoying and needlessly draw out fights that should be simple, but for the most part it‚Äôs actually a pretty cool set of mechanics. 

However, some very fundamental flaws hold it back from being a great game. One problem, unfortunately, is how amazing mihoyo‚Äôs previous game is, Honkai 3rd Impact.  While genshin looks good, it cannot compare to how visually stunning Honkai is. Likely a conscious art style decision, and maybe not a fair comparison, but it is the truth. Honkai is very much console level stunning across the board, and genshin does not compete.  But I could easily forgive this. 

The real problem, is the writing and story.  The characters, the story, the dialogue, everything is as cliche as you can possibly get. It feels like this was written by teenagers for ten year olds. Character designs are childish, dialogue is not even surface level interesting let alone provided with some depth of thought and context. The story so far has zero nuance, not a single interesting hook. I feel like I‚Äôm playing a children‚Äôs book, and not even a good children‚Äôs book. 

Perhaps I‚Äôm being too hard on a mobile game. But my expectations for mihoyo are much higher than other developers. They are SO GOOD that they get compared to themselves. There is a lot of garbage out there on mobile, and even with the things I don‚Äôt like this game is far and away better than most mobile games. But I am disappointed that mihoyo has deviated from the maturity and nuance that made the world of Honkai so interesting and absorbing. I can‚Äôt get into the same cliche story that‚Äôs been used in 1000 other Eastern RPGs. I cannot care about sickly sweet or suave cool cliche characters that are part of every Eastern RPG for the last 20 years.  

I still adore mihoyo as a developer, one of the best out there no doubt.  But this game does not hit the mark for me.

review:
I really like the game don't get me wrong. The characters are well designed. The story is interesting and the open world is amazing. But, there are a few big things that are holding me back from giving the game a high rating. 

The first issue is the camera angles. Mid battle, especially on a hill or incline, the camera keeps deciding to just look into the ground rather than showing the enemy/fight. 

Next is the landscape. Again, it's beautiful, but when fighting enemies, if they slip, they would get clipped on the side of the hill and just stay there. They respawn if you run far enough but it gets frustrating to fight it again if it was a boss monster. 

Next would be the combat. The lock on mechanic is so frustrating. I would be aiming for the enemy in front of me and my attack decides to hit the one far in the back or on structures. The combat response is spotty. I would hold for a charged attack but instead the character just stands there. Abilities are spotty too with the same issue. Maybe it is not prevalent on PC. I really like Honkai impact and thought that it had one of the best combat mechanics and I assumed Genshin would be the same. Nope.

The response of the buttons on mobile is really janky. I would jump off a cliff to glide and when holding the glide button, it doesn't register. Even when repeatedly holding the glide button as I fall wasn't registering and I end up dying. It gets annoying when you thought you pressed a button on the game but it does not even go through. 

Overall the game is beautiful hands down and the best open world on mobile available. The character design is top notch. But the issues I had makes playing a game a chore and something that I don't look forward to playing cause it's gonna be aggravating.
title: Great Game but Has Become Frustrating

review:
I would give this game 1 star but it gets another star for beautiful in-game designs. The open world plays and looks beautiful. 

However, gameplay is....stale. Out of all the elements available, only one is really truly viable as a dps and with endgame content being a DPS stat check, team design is not as flexible as the developers market it to be. 

On the topic of the developers...there‚Äôs nothing wrong with being profit-driven. However, the issue lies not in their values but their lack of respect for the customer player base and the silencing of dissent. After the release of a character that many people saved and paid for, they waited several days to release a statement which said absolutely nothing. They pay content creators to back them up as white knights and then even went as far as to censor words that could bring attention or inconvenience to their playerbase‚Äôs frustration. 

Let‚Äôs also not forget that many players have had their personal information (phone numbers and email addresses) leaked and many accounts being hacked and resold because the devs are very very stubborn about not implementing two factor authentication. Accounts with thousands of real dollars hacked because the devs made linked phone numbers and emails visible to anyone who wanted to look for them. And on top of all this, they make putting in a ticket reporting that your account was hacked and resold basically a trash can. 

I want to recommend this game because it is a beautiful game. But with the precedence that Zhongli has placed, I think it‚Äôs better for you, someone reading this review, to skip out on this game. Why play a game that is focused on funneling money to the devs when they will do absolutely nothing for you as the player. Sorry, let me rephrase that: why give the devs money to play a game that they have given up on themselves? It‚Äôs a sinking ship with a terrible endgame, abysmal security, and a dictatorial and stubborn development team with no direction. I wish I could stick around to see how the story on Teyvat ends, but at this point it‚Äôs not worth my time anymore.

review:
I recently decided to pick up this game a few days after its launch after hearing all of the hype surrounding it and wishing to experience this game for myself. I want to begin by saying that this game is absolutely stunning, there‚Äôs no denying that one bit. However, my grievances with this game begin in the app store, more specifically with the expansive list of compatible devices.

It is the opposite.

I have seen many reviews made by players with older iPhone and iPad models, my iPhone 6 included, having difficulty even starting the game, much less actually playing it. This can likely be chalked up to our older models being ill-equipped for an app of this size, but I have seen reviews of people with the more recent iPhone 8 saying that the game lags horrifically to the point of being unplayable. I would expect an app, especially one with the degree of anticipation it had before launch, to be properly stress-tested with older Apple products to confirm exactly which ones are able to run the app and which ones are not.

This problem of older models not being able to run apps that they are supposed to be able to is not exclusive to Genshin, however. I had to delete a similarly recent release, Masketeers, as my device was unable to run that app as well despite being marked as compatible. The difference between Masketeers and Genshin for me, however, is the developer aid provided by the two apps. The developers of Masketeers can be seen responding to the problems the reviewers of their app have and making attempts to remedy said problems. Genshin has no such developer response. I have scrolled through the reviews for Genshin for 10+ minutes and have seen not one developer response to either a negative review with a problem nor any of the majority positive reviews praising the game.

To me, this is unacceptable developer behavior.

I will unfortunately be forced to download Genshin on my PC just to experience what this game truly is; at least until the game is released on the Switch. I hope miHoYo will address the problems its mobile players are experiencing in the near future, as currently there is only the void to shout our grievances into.
title: Mislead and Disappointed

review:
I‚Äôm rating it 2 stars because at its core, Genshin Impact is a Breath of the Wild knockoff with a big gacha emphasis and the sad reality is that most gacha games.. aren‚Äôt good. This is different in a sense that it‚Äôs a ‚Äúfull-fledged‚Äù game (disregarding the fact that it‚Äôs still significantly lacking content but it‚Äôs a only month old) but you have gamble to progress. Unlike other games where you can auto-farm gear, Genshin has to gatekeep gear behind the gacha system. This means you either pay for the rolls with real money (the easiest way) or grind out the resources needed to roll for better gear somehow (the most tedious). You best bet that the developers are NOT generous with said resources/gambling currency either, known as Primogems, as you need a significant amount of them for just ONE summon. Other gachas have better rates than Genshin.

The characters are also behind this same gacha system. That means in order for you to play with new characters you either pay for the rolls or again, grind out the resources (which also uses Primogems). Genshin has set up the character banners so that you don‚Äôt just roll for characters but also weapons as well. Personally, this is the worst kind of trickery there is because if you‚Äôre rolling for a character, it‚Äôs likely you'll summon an unwanted weapon. And they‚Äôre not necessarily good weapons either. Other gachas have done it better by having separate banners for characters/units and everything else.

In addition, the summoning rates in this game are awful. IIRC, there‚Äôs a 0.6% chance that you‚Äôll summon a 5 star character in this game. This is ridiculous as it‚Äôs possible to never summon the unit you want.

Overall, the game itself is decent while lacking a lot of content but the gacha itself is extremely anti-Free2Play. Stay if you‚Äôre interested in a Breath of the Wild rip-off but that‚Äôs about it.

review:
Genshin Impact is fantastic... for about the first week or so. I‚Äôm speaking as someone who frequently plays gachas and open-world exploration games, and Genshin Impact has so much going for it. It has a fantastically amazing world that you can tell a lot of work went into, a good soundtrack, lively characters/NPCs, and all for the low price of absolutely free. I‚Äôm currently AR34 and while I started this game a little after launch, I‚Äôve gotten quite far in terms of how I compare to other players.

All of that being said, there are some very glaring issues that start to pop up once you surpass AR30 and finish the main story. This will be said a thousand times over, across multiple platforms, but the stamina system (called Resin in-game) is really atrocious. Most gachas or free to download games have some sort of stamina system that limits you from just min-maxing and going full hardcore until you burn out and quit. That makes it completely understandable that a game would implement one - but Genshin is in a weird spot. While I write this on an app review page the fact of the matter is that this game was released across THREE platforms: phones, pc, and console (currently only PS4 but the Switch version will come eventually). And while phone games have an established history of limiting playtime to incentivize spending, pc and console games do NOT. So this has set the player base at odds with itself where the stamina system is somewhat acceptable for people who play exclusively on their phones, but completely alienates the enormous amount of players who experience this game through pc and console. The stamina system is severely limiting, with high refresh time and an extremely low cap relative to the amount needed to complete domains and the like. It NEEDS to be reworked, plain and simple, and Mihoyo has been completely ignoring the complaints they get about this across both the English and Chinese speaking communities. No statement, no acknowledgement of the problems, nothing. The lack of transparency is what truly hurts them the most and is what will kill this game ultimately.

But the stamina system is not the only thing this game has issues with. Character level progression is nearly impossible once you get to the current endgame/mid-game as the only way to increase the strength of your characters is by spending Mora (the in-game currency of Genshin). Mora becomes extremely scarce after AR30, as the loot system does NOT scale properly to your current level. This means that people who are at the stage where leveling a single character takes more than 300k Mora no longer have a loot system that can support that kind of spending. And even if you wanted to level your characters the old-fashion way via fighting enemies in the open world, the amount of EXP you receive after every battle is hilariously small. Barely a drop in the bucket - and that‚Äôs even true for characters who are starting at level 1! AR30+ progression is essentially forced to a standstill for the worst reasons, and this is a problem that will only become worse as more of the player base reaches that point. This problem will especially rear its ugly head after more content gets added to the game.

And now the final issue is somewhat a result of the two mentioned above: the gacha. The current rate of summoning the highest rarity characters (Genshin uses a star system to rate rarity, 5 star being the highest) is an abysmal 0.5%. Now, Genshin is NOT the first game to have horrendously low gacha rates. Fate Grand Order is one of the most popular and financially successful gacha games ever made, and their own gacha has a pull rate comparable to Genshin‚Äôs. But the reason FGO‚Äôs gacha works is because players are willing to risk it. Why? Because the player base is allowed the opportunity to build their characters with much more liberty, thus fostering a situation where they are attached to those characters and the teams they‚Äôve created. When the player base is allowed the opportunity to grow attached to these characters they‚Äôve spent money on or summoned via their free to play currency, it makes them more willing to roll for new characters via the gacha. But with the Resin and Mora situations being what they are, no one is allowed the opportunity to play frequently enough or to build their characters in Genshin Impact. And to make matters even worse, 100 USD is only enough to buy you 50 summons in a system where it takes 90 summons to get a guaranteed 5 star. 

I could go on and on about this, but you get the point. Genshin Impact has so much potential but it has so much holding it back from being the best game of 2020 and beyond. At the rate its going at, many players will simply quit if these issues aren‚Äôt addressed and Genshin will be a fleeting memory by the time the actual big games of late 2020 become the center of attention. If by the next major patch (Early November) we don‚Äôt have some changes announced, this game is doomed to a very early grave. And it truly breaks my heart to see so, especially with such a beautiful game like this one.
title: A game with great potential but is held back

review:
To cut it short. For one, I have played many games online that makes use of amazing graphics, without lag. This game has it so bad. It looks like the developers simply rushed it out without any optimizations. Even the settings menu does not work well. Now for another thing, which this is the most unintelligent play I have seen yet. The settings menu is locked to story progression. Given with the lag this game has. I am quite certain a lot simply left the game off the bat due to this one thing.

If I cannot even play the game properly. Then this game does not even deserve a single star. Unfortunately, I am forced to give it a star. To add on, the game is not properly optimized for iPad as well. Being stuck on a white blank screen for minutes before being able to enter. To add on, crashing on top of this. Frequently as well.

Honestly, unless some very basic implementations are made. This game is one of the worst ones out there. Simply due to what has been stated here.

Now aside from this, this game has even more problems. While pushing through, crashing every ten minutes, sometimes even less. For a single player game, it has a ton of walls. An illusion of an open world masquerading with the usual shady tactics of others mobile games. 

The adventure rank is possibly one of the worst implementations I have seen. Which halts to game to a near unplayable level. Ya know, not counting the whole crashing thing. Then on top of this, characters and weapons are mixed in with the same banners and whatnot. Naturally, power division as to entice others to spend. Never going to spend now I will let you know. 

The storyline just feels like it is dragging on. Given with the adventure rank limitations. Then do not get me started on the resin system. This is by far a very shady game. Using the elements of an open world as to create an illusion of limitless play. Lacking in balance on top of that, not to an extreme degree I will say. Overall, this game is simply another scam out there. I will not even call it a game anymore. With that being said, I am finished with it. To those reading this. Realize this is a system marketing on your addiction to keep going back into it, and spending. 

So long as you keep supporting this. They will keep bringing these games lacking quality in play and engagement. The only difference is that they waited a bit longer than usual, but it will come at one point or another. It has been a while since I wrote such a review. While the game started out with promise, like many others. It quickly falls into one of the worst, disgusting practices out there. Honestly, for a single player game. I should have seen this coming at one point or another. 

Lacking polish all around, and cannot even maintain a line of consistency like the beginning. The adventure rank limiting progress. The resin system furthering this. The open world feeling more like a chore than for fun. The power imbalance of the characters. It goes on and on.

review:
Let me start with the positive aspects. The combat is decent. I had fun playing it at least. Those are the only positive things I have to say.

Now for the negative. The game is boring. There are no good characters, no real challenges and no compelling story. The ‚Äúopen world‚Äù isn‚Äôt even open. There are areas of the map that Paimon won‚Äôt let you go into. Speaking of Paimon, she‚Äôs next. She‚Äôs like those annoying guides from Zelda like Navi or Fi, except ten times worse. Always constantly nagging with the most annoying voice. I guess I need to address the elephant in the room. THIS GAME IS A SHAMELESS ZELDA RIP OFF. I‚Äôm not too upset about this, but they stole entire themes from breath of the wild. Such as the monsters, map, Goddess statues(which double as towers), cooking, camps, materials, the gliding, and even the way ore deposits look. Not to mention the entire art style of the game which looks like it was copy pasted from Zelda.

As I said, the game is boring. The characters are bland, the entire story feels lame. There isn‚Äôt even a streamlined story, it‚Äôs all over the place! There are no objectives after awhile and if you explore there‚Äôs nothing intriguing to find and nothing fun to do. It‚Äôs just bland. It‚Äôs dry. It‚Äôs the same thing over and over.

There is no personality, passion, or love put into this game. It‚Äôs awful. I did have some fun playing it, but I have no interest in going on. I feel like I‚Äôve already experienced everything and I‚Äôve barely started the game. But please, download the game and see for yourself. Maybe you‚Äôll find it fun. It‚Äôs not a scam or a rip-off. It‚Äôs just a bad game.

title: Loser

review:
The game starts out great showering you with free summons and resources but once you hit level 29+ with all quests completed there is nothing to do besides 4 dailies each day that takes roughly 10-15 minutes in total and 2-3 bosses/4-5 dungeon entries and you are out of resin (stamina for this game) for the rest of the day. Resources are scarce that you really can only focus on 2-3 characters otherwise you won‚Äôt have enough to be on par with enemy levels when you ascend world levels with your main team.

They released their first co op event a few weeks ago but it was poorly optimized that players were glitching out while playing. They have been releasing some small login and events where you get a couple free resin refills and some gems for 1-2 gacha pulls but that is about it to compensate their poor resin system and low gacha rate issues that are known by the majority of the community.

The game has a great open world with interesting characters with unique skills and personalities but with very low rates on characters and limited resources to level them with you won‚Äôt be able to level and experience all of them for months to a year+ unless you are willing to open up that wallet. 

It is a great breath of the wild clone that does some things better but also takes two steps back with its severely time-gated resin system and scarce resources for you to enjoy playing multiple characters and doing some meaningful progress in the game unless you spend money on resin refills to get an average amount of gameplay for late game.

review:
I want to start by saying that I loved Genshin Impact. The world is beautiful, the story line is intriguing, and the characters are fun to play. But Mihoyo is making me re-consider all the things I loved about the game, and regret the money I‚Äôve spent.

There are a lot of security issues. Accounts are getting constantly hacked, and numerous vulnerabilities keep getting reported (most recent being the public email exploit). Although Mihoyo eventually comes to fix the security concerns as they come up, it still refuses to create 2 step authentication. How can I feel secure about spending money, when I have to live in fear of getting my account stolen? 

Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt care about it‚Äôs customers. There are numerous complaints about limited resources, unfair drops, and expensive characters. $200 guarantees one instance of a 5 star character. If you don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs insane, Mihoyo also limits the power of characters with their constellations. Zhongli, for example is so weak, that you need at least a constellation of one to have him be acceptable. For a full constellation, that‚Äôs $1200. And that‚Äôs only for the limited banner character. Your money definitely doesn‚Äôt get you far in this game, unless you‚Äôre willing to pay in the thousands. 

The app also crashes all the time, making it impossible to complete my dailies.

TLDR. You should definitely play the game, but don‚Äôt use your email to create an account and make sure not to spend any money on this game.

title: I love it

review:
At the start of the game, everything is pretty good due to quest rewards and low costs to upgrade your characters, however.

Cons- 

Insanely predatory pull system: 
0.6% chance to get a 5 star item, guaranteed at 90pulls, however, it‚Äôs only a 50% chance to get the ‚Äúfeatured‚Äù item from your 90th pity pull. So it isn‚Äôt even a pity pull.
- what this means:
‚Äî oh boy that unit looks really fun, can‚Äôt wait to spend around 400$ to get one. Then I do it 6 more times to get the upgrades for it! 

Abysmal levels of rewards:
Early game your costs to level are low, so you don‚Äôt notice it, but then as the game progresses and enemies get harder, your source of money and exp begins to go away;
Chests only respawn on world rank up.
Leylines do not give anywhere near the amount of mora or exp to be worth the cost involved from resin (I‚Äôll get to resin).
Monsters give 14-20 exp per kill. Mid game leveling a character takes 50k exp per level ish. Hope you‚Äôre ready to grind mobs for a month!
Running the dungeons for the character and weapon advancement materials is also a joke. You spend resin, again, to get a CHANCE to get one or two of the item you need, didn‚Äôt get it? Better wait 2 hours and 40 minutes to try again! ((That is how long it takes for the resin to recharge to pay the cost to attempt the dungeon.))

I could go on. I‚Äôm keeping my eye on this game to see if they will fix the issues that the community is kvetching over by patch 1.1, if they don‚Äôt, it simply proves this is a cash grab game with a lot of effort put in by the art, gameplay, sound, and music teams, only for the business team to utterly destroy their hard work and ruin the game with greed.

TLDR: don‚Äôt get this game in its current form, wait to see if it learns from its horrible mistakes, or dies on its feet. Your wallet and patience will thank me.
title: Great early game, horrible replay ability.

review: Good game
title: Good game

review:
The game can be so much better. Yes the game is amazing in so many ways. My biggest complaint is the terrible 0.6% gacha pull rates. So basically you will not pull a 5* except for once every couple months as a free to play. At first this doesn‚Äôt bother you because they give gems with quests. But soon enough you realize unless you pay a lot of money for crystals to pull heroes, you won‚Äôt be getting much. 

Again, to be clear the gacha rate for a 5* is 0.6%. So basically you will never pull a 5* out of luck. You will pull a 5* every 90 pulls. There is a 50% you will get the banner hero you want or another 5* weapon or hero. Or if you don‚Äôt, 90 pulls later you are guaranteed that banner hero. Which almost sounds tolerable. Until you realize you then need 6 more of that 5* to complete their constellation.  Oh and don‚Äôt forget, that 5* might be a weapon, screwing up your whole pity rate.  Eventually you need to buy gems. Which are ridiculously priced for the terrible gacha rates.   There are very few gems given in the game after AR 30. 

I am not a free to play player, but I stopped spending on this game. Even my friends who have played Fire Emblem and other gacha games for years say they are losing interest because it takes so long to pull anything good and the rates are so terrible. 

Wake up Mihoyo and listen to what people are saying. Friends are already quitting because you can‚Äôt manage to figure out how to make reasonable prices and decisions.

The fixes they can make are easy. The truth is I want to spend in this game. The game engine is beautiful, fluid and the best I have seen. Combat I find fun. Characters, art and story are amazing. Just come up with better business practices.

Most of the game can be played with 4* heroes. But at least make some of the 5* heroes accessible to people for decent prices.

title: Just amazing

review:
Just wanted to say that this game is really amazing, and has great potential. 

However, at the end of the day, it is still a gacha game with abysmal rates as well as extremely expensive rolls (avg $2 USD per roll). Right now a lot of players aren‚Äôt complaining about this because of the games honeymoon phase but this is detrimental to F2P player base months down the road if Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt address this issue.

Now to address the resin issue. For starters, you can‚Äôt even finish the weekly resin usage missions on the battle pass without spending primogems or fragile resin to refresh. What kind of joke is this if you‚Äôve bought the battle pass? It‚Äôs like paying $10 for the pass, then requiring to spend extra resources/money just to complete the pass. 8 min per 1 resin capped at 120 is a ridiculously low cap and slow regeneration rate even for a gacha game. At least in Fate Grand Order they allow you to raise your cap through levels and let you stack a lot of energy regen materials like golden apples for events for free. 

After AR30, the game becomes super dry in terms of content, I just log in, do dailies, use up resin for 20 min, and just log off. I think this problem will be resolved once new content gets released, but is also a byproduct of the poorly designed resin system. 

I really hope Mihoyo listens to players criticism and feedback. Like I said, this game has great potential, and I want to see it succeed, but this starts with communication and cooperation between the developer and player base.

review:
On the surface, Genshin seems like a great game. Open world gacha with story, side quests, co-op, and a fun combat style. And the game sells these aspects for awhile pretty successfully. I was enamored with the game for a week. I finished the main story, did all the side quests, tried out all the trials and domains, played around in abyss, and fully explored the map and collected all and oculus and geoculus. I got around adventure level 30 by the time I ran out of quests, and I‚Äôve been collecting chests to get my current rank 34. At this point, there are some pretty glaring issues.
     After fully exploring the map once, the open world aspect is essentially useless. Need to do a domain? Fast travel. Need to do a leyline? Fast travel. World boss? Fast travel. Farming mobs around the world feels pretty useless. They give so little xp that their only worth is they drop some mats to ascend your character. Open world might be fun if chests actually dropped some useful items, but it‚Äôs all trash. On top of that, the chests don‚Äôt seem to respawn. It seems like the only reason to run around the map is to collect ingredients for crafting or ascending one‚Äôs characters.
     Co-op seems pretty useless in this game. The content isn‚Äôt hard enough to warrant using co-op, but you are also pretty limited in the content you can do co-op. Abyss trials seems like something that should be co-op, or at least some similar challenge to play with friends. 
     I‚Äôm not too concerned about running out of story and side quests at this point considering how many hours I played the game and how new it is. 
     Even after playing to this extent, I still really enjoy the combat. Figuring out different combos between the characters is satisfying. But this leads to two more issues. 
     I would love to play and enjoy the combat, but I can‚Äôt because so much content is locked behind resin. Weekly bosses, leylines, field bosses, and domains are all locked behind resin. This might not be problematic in itself, but resin capping out at 120 and being able to make use of 180 resin a day due to how slow it recharges makes the resin mechanic feel extremely bad. I want to be able to grind something in this game. Right now, I‚Äôm forced to log on, do my daily commissions, spend my resin, maybe do some gathering and crafting, log off. Let me play your game please. Make leylines cost no resin. Or make finishing the dailies give you a free resin refill. Something. Please.
     The second additional problem is that you have a great combat system with fun characters, but the gacha rates to get said characters are pretty abysmal. This also might not be a problem if devs were generous in giving out currency, but considering some of the nerfs to getting this currency (chests give less primo now, abyss rerun only gives primo for floors after the initial 8), I think it is definitely a problem.
     I enjoy the game and want to see it succeed, and I really feel that they need to address some of these issues in order to do so.

review:
The potential to loose a lot of the time and money you put into the game because of the lack of account security is just embarrassing. To no fault of your own, you could lose your account, unable to get it back due to the developer‚Äôs faulty design. And when you do contact the developer, they do very little to help.

Beyond that, there‚Äôs security concerns involving your personal email and phone number being compromised as long as someone knows your in-game username. Though fixes have been made for the phone number, the lack of account security is still a lingering issue for people who want to put time and money into a game but don‚Äôt want to have that effort be lost due to an amateur hacker.

Aside from these issues, the game is obviously well-made and a lot of passion is put into it. When a greedy corporation collided with passionate and visionary people, you get a game like genshin impact. The characters are well-designed and the world is filled to the brim. But corporate greed takes over when characters are disappointing mechanically despite their aesthetic appeal. Corporate greed takes over when they do nothing to help you recover your account because you didn‚Äôt spend enough.
title: Account Security

review:
Update: I praise this game and it deserves the awards it is getting. But for the love of god, FIX THE CAMERA AND ARCHERS AND BATTERY!!! The camera for battle mode does not seem to do anything. It still swings around really quick constantly, sometimes it gives me a first person point of view, and I have trouble directing my attacks. Which leads to the distance fighters. Their accuracy needs to be improved or give us a lock on option. Too too many times I would have an enemy right in front but if I am not directly in view of that enemy my arrows can go somewhere else. Please fix this and the camera already! Lastly, I feel bad for those playing on phone. This game even on the lowest setting drains your battery instantly. You can get maybe 30 minutes of game time without plugged up on an Ipad Pro maxed out. Maybe this is an IOS software problem but still this needs to be fixed. One more thing; just add controller support already. I and many others can play with touch controls but a controller would make movement and accuracy so so so much better. You allow PC and console players to play with controllers at least give mobile players the option to do so. Love the game and it deserves the recognition and rewards. But please fix these issues. 

Update: Thank you for the update. The bug seems to have been fixed too! Thank yoU.

Update: I love the game but there is a bug in the Equilibrium quest. The slime does not show up. Please fix this ASAP and will change rating.

Update: I briefly touched on this in my first review but will discuss it a little more. This game is a GACHA game which if you want certain characters and weapons, you have to use in world currency. However, to get that currency you have to spend real world money. It is not guaranteed that you will get that character or weapon you want. It is pretty much loot boxing/slot machine. I should mention that there was an update that made it where every 10 times you use the in-game currency, you will get a character or rare weapon. However, through grinding you can get the in-game currency and try to get the rare characters or weapons that way. None and do mean NONE of these characters and weapons are needed to play the game. I would spend no more than $20 and grind the rest of the game. Do not listen to youtubers who spend more than that. For them, it is a tax right off. Spend no more than $20 and grind the rest. Nothing else changes from my previous review. 

WOW!! Just...WOW!!! This is truly proof that mobile games, good ones like this, can compete with console games. Here is my review. The bad and the good. 

The bad:

The only problem I have had thus far is the camera. It hasn‚Äôt been happening much but sometimes when in battle the camera swings behind my character and given that this TPP I could not see my character. Maybe it is just me but in one or two battles I was fighting the camera.

I wish this game did allow controller support. You can play this game with a controller on PC but not on mobile. I have an Ipad Pro 12.9 and although it is not heavy, I do not like holding it for 2-3 hrs while gaming.

Now the good:

This game is just beautiful. This game running on maxed settings is just gorgeous. It has the same art-style as Breath of the Wild which a lot of people loved and this game.........just beautiful. Bright, colorful, shadows, night, day, beautiful. It looks 1000X better than Oceanhorn 2. Also, this world is huge. A lot of open world games on mobile claim to be open world which they are but the world is not that big. This world, you can tell there is a lot of exploring to do especially when you look at the map.

Controls: They are very responsive and love it. My only gripe is I wish a controller can connect to play this game but that may come in the future.

Characters: so far I have 5 characters. I am still in the early stages of the game and heard there are 21. Some say you have to pay for some characters but it looks like you can grind to get them which is what I like cause I am old-school. Also like how with each character they bring certain skills. You have a party of 4 but you must carefully choose who you want. You can have all heavy hitter-close combat fighters but then you have to worry about what element they bring. Some elements do poorly against each other so you will likely have to swap it for your long distance fighter who counters an enemy element. Also, the weapons and gear of each character can be upgraded and you can spend a good 30 minutes trying to determine who needs what upgrade. It is very customizable and I love it. 

Story: the story is rather simple. You end up separated from your sibling and teleport to a different world. You meet certain people who become part of your party that try to help you reunite with your sibling. In doing so, you go on different adventures, quests, face off against different bosses, collect items etc. I will admit; I would be trying to do a main quest and on the way to the location I would get distracted and do a side quest...and another side quest, and another side quest....lol. 

This game is worth downloading, it is worth playing, and I am surprised they are not charging for it. I will spend some money in the game in the near future because you can tell that this game was made with love. And the creators just wanted you to have fun playing this game. Honestly, this should be $19.99 or be put on Apple Arcade. This game really should be mobile game of the year cause it sets the bar so high. Again, I give praises to the developer for making such a beautiful fun game and making it available on mobile. Thank you!!

title: Buff Zhongli

review:
This game is really great in theory. It has an amazing world, amazing characters, and amazing plot- it makes you want to keep playing. 

One issue is the paywall behind the characters. They advertise the game with characters like Childe, Venti, etc., but in actuality it costs upwards of $200-400 to actually secure one of them. Further, they‚Äôve showed extremely poor customer support relating to the new character Zhongli, showing that the general direction of the game is likely not a positive, user-friendly one. 

Another issue is safety. It appears that users can very easily be hacked, their account content stolen, their e-mails on display for everyone to see. It‚Äôs dangerous. 

The drop rates for 5 stars need to be better, they need to fix the resin issue, they need to fix Zhongli, they need to help protect their users from hackers, hide our e-mails. They need to listen to what their userbase is saying. It‚Äôs very clear that right now it‚Äôs less about us and more about money.  

If they don‚Äôt, then I would expect the game to crash and burn within the next few banners.

Minor 
-gambling addictions can be developed 
-a 5 star character is 100 bucks or more in other regions
-doesn‚Äôt give exact rates of 5 star chances
-everything is lock behind a energy system 
-resource are scarce

The most annoying problem is mostly the security since they make so much money from us in the hundred millions. They can‚Äôt even make their game secure enough so our account doesn‚Äôt get stolen. They are greedy pigs that would rather push out a update to earn revenue than make sure the player base would safe from hackers.

review:
Genshin Impact is, in short, a fantasy, rpg (role-playing game), mmo (mass multiplayer online game), and a ftp/f2p (free to play) game. It came out this year on September 28. A lot of people had heard about it before the game was released and was really excited for it to finally come out. I found out about this game not long after it was released (October 3rd) and was super excited to give it a shot. Little did I know, this game was the start of a fixation or even something I was infatuated with. Or, to put it realistically, an obsession.

           Here is some more information about this rpg game. It's your basic fantasy game. There's monsters, magic, gods, and more. The game itself is high quality. For example, the graphics are impeccable, the views from atop mountains especially (when the sun is setting/rising or at night) are remarkable. The sound fxs are well done (including the soundtrack), and you can tell that they put a lot of detail into the game and they sure did get people's attention. If you even get close enough to the monsters you start to notice the insane detail that you‚Äôve probably never seen in a fantasy game before. Although I am not an expert with gaming (especially fantasy games) I'm impressed, to say the least. 

         Although I can not describe this in a short amount of words, it's such an amazing experience. I have so much fun with this game and you‚Äôll just have to trust me or find out for yourself. It‚Äôs free on mobile devices as well as PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, Android, iOS, and Microsoft Windows. Although I think the game is better on Playstation 4 (which I play on) or Microsoft Windows, the game is fun on any device as long as you have the storage for it. Overall, this is such a fun game, and miHoYo (The company that created Genshin Impact) did a great job. 

(Friend me on the game @ Expiredtrash_01)

review:
Game has predatory monetization and has bad roll rates. 0.3% for 5 star character and 2.5% for 4 star character. You can expect to spend anywhere from 100$ to get a single 5 star character, maybe.
Cost 29.99$ to do a 10 pull which is expensive and chances are you won‚Äôt get what you want. The game initially lures you into thinking that they will be generous with primo gems for pulls but after you finish quests and find all the chests the primo gems dry up badly. It then only gives you 60 primogems a day, so it will take a month to get 10 pulls. Other games give you at least one pull per day.

review:
This is the best game I‚Äôve ever played on a mobile device. Why is it free? I would pay $ easy. I have not been playing long so maybe there are pay to play parts but I‚Äôve not found any yet. Love it!

Updated Nov. 2020: As a Zelda fan I downloaded this game because there are similarities. I am an old school Zelda fan and this game has moved to top my list over Zelda. It is far more imaginative than any game I have ever played. You can choose to read the stories or not, you can play without understanding but there‚Äôs just so much work and love poured into this game that it would be a disservice to not learn it all. There are updates almost daily, new quests, puzzles, lore, monsters, bosses....

I spend money because I want the devs to have reason to keep going and it‚Äôs worth it. You can play without learning but it‚Äôs so much fun to learn. There is a guide for nearly everything. I wish we could sell items we collect but it‚Äôs not a deal breaker. I can‚Äôt wait for this to come out on switch but it‚Äôs built perfectly for iOS as is. It is hands down the best game I‚Äôve ever played.Music, the story the art, it is truly incredible. Honestly I can‚Äôt find one thing to list that‚Äôs negative.I can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs a free game. I‚Äôm guessing the incentive for developers in app purchases and I hope they are making a ton of money. I am on an iPad Pro so I have no problems loading the game, I‚Äôve played on my phone which is an 11 pro max and I‚Äôve had no issues. I suspect the people that are having issues are on older devices.

review:
Decent Gacha system. No annoying p2w pop ups. No auto play ( though I want to suggest it for commission quests). Over all you can play at your own pace without feeling the need to catch-up or compete with anyone. Co-op is available, I personally have not done it yet (as of 11/17/20), but I will. I have simply focus more on building my teams and exploring the world. 

There is a lot to do if you are fan of Open world games. You can literally interact with everything. It blew my mind. Great job Devs! Now I‚Äôm off to read the manga lol just found that out two days ago lol

review: You definitely have to lower the graphics setting to get this to run well on iPad, which you unfortunately cannot do until you‚Äôve played a little bit through the tutorial. Because of this the opening cutscene is messed up severely. But you can easily watch it on YouTube. Once you reset the graphics, the game works great. I‚Äôm honestly so impressed that a game with this much open world content runs on an iPad at all! My iPad does get hot after playing for a bit but I just took it out its case to increase airflow and that helps considering it‚Äôs almost winter and the house is cold lol. Might be more of an issue in summer. The controls are decent. Designs are stunning. Storyline is interesting. Gameplay is fun. It‚Äôs basically a fusion of breath of the wild and Skyrim. I just started a day or two ago but I‚Äôm already LOVING it.

review:
Genshin Impact is an amazing game and you should get it if you like fighting games with great plots and cool characters. However, this game has some problems.
When I first got this game I was really exited and did all-nighters just to play it. I was really far into it and had a bunch of characters and really high levels on them. On one of the quests where I fought a strong rock golem thing, I finally killed it and got the stuff.. or so i thought. When I came back to the game a few minutes later, all of my progress for it was GONE! The only thing that stayed was the damage that my characters took (some were dead). 
Another problem that occurred was with changing my username. When I changed my username all of the data from the game deleted completely. I had to start off from nothing and re-download all of the data that I already had(which made my device have barely any storage). 

This is an amazing game like I said earlier. Genshin Impact just needs a few more things to fix.

title: 1000000% worth it

review:
This is one of the most free to play friendly games out there. Especially considering how high quality literally every aspect of this game is along with the fact it‚Äôs a free download, you‚Äôd expect to have some kind of paywall. Yet there isn‚Äôt! The pulls are expensive yes, but there are so many options for free gems and pulls aren‚Äôt really necessary unless you‚Äôre a simp! 
The graphics, music, characters, and world are so incredibly fleshed out and lovely. What they show to you pre download, they give 100%! That‚Äôs something a lot of games that try to mimic this game heavily fail on. The team communicates very well to their community through the mailbox in game and through their YouTube, if something is happening you‚Äôll know.
My heart goes out the the devs and everyone who has worked so incredibly hard on this game, they‚Äôve gone far beyond any expectation that I ever had about this game and they just keep going!

title: Almost perfect!

review:
When I heard my friends talking about this game, I decided to download it. I wasn‚Äôt expecting much because it was a free game, but overall it was a fantastic experience. 

Due to playing on mobile, the introduction cutscene was incredibly laggy for me, super laggy to the point I had to search the cutscene up on youtube because it wasn‚Äôt working out for me. This happens with all of the cutscenes (not the ones where the NPCs chat, but the cutscenes like where Stormterror is present in Mondstadt and the MC is pulled into the tornado). Next, every time I try to pull up something (map, inventory, characters, wish, etc.) it always glitches me out of the game. It has become a habit where I pray that it doesn‚Äôt glitch me out because the loading screen is way too long. This also happens sometimes when I am about to engage in a conversation with a NPC. Third, please remove timed challenges. As you can tell, many have quit this game because of these timed challenges. As I am writing this, I am stuck on the lost book quest with the 30 second interval challenge. I do not wish to give up, I have high hopes for this game. Fourth, I suggest bringing back some old banners for beginners so they have a ‚Äúlucky‚Äù beginner‚Äôs roll when they wish for the first time. This leaves a great impression on new players and I strongly encourage it. 

Otherwise, the scenery is stunning, details are absolutely beautiful. Character designs are likable and the concept of the game is great. The lore has the right amount of theater. I do wish that there was a way to level up our adventure ranks faster than grinding and completing commissions. I‚Äôd also like an easier way to gain intertwined fates rather than buying them and purchasing them at Paimon‚Äôs bargains. I am a f2p player, so we have it hard. I also recommend a trading system. Trading characters, artifacts, weapons, primogems, mora, and etc. 

Update: It has been kicking me out more than usual. Every time I interact with an NPC or pull up screen (bag, party set up, world map) it kicks me out of the game. I would really consider that. 
A glitch I found?: During the Luhua Landscape quest, I was able to glitch inside the ruins while it was loading. Now, when I go to finish the quest, I am not able to complete the quest officially and receive my awards.
title: Playing it every day! But...

Edit:
I got bored already.

Get to rank 30. Just spend your resin in 10 minutes and exit the game. 
There is not much to do. Reddit is complaining, chinese players are also complaining. Mihoyo are just printing the feedback and wiping their butt with them. It‚Äôs fun while it last with the story and such, but
Resin system is really bad. Low cap, low recharge and you spend it in 5 minutes. From all the games I‚Äôve played this one has the worst stamina system. Can‚Äôt believe that the ones making this games are the ones who develop Honkai3.
The game won‚Äôt get to 1.1 patch with all the backlash its receiving.

review: I‚Äôm always hesitant to download games on my iPhone because I‚Äôm too scared that they‚Äôre going to be stupid or the trailer doesn‚Äôt fit the game. This was not the case for this particular game. I was shocked to hear that this game was coming to the Apple store and also on other game devices. This open world game is one of the most detailed games you could possibly have. The storyline is super amazing and really thought out.The gameplay is great and has endless possibilities when it comes to exploring and discovering new things. The only thing that I would say I wish the game had would be better crafting for weapons and objects and also to add customized outfits for each character. It would be really nice to be able to buy clothes. I would also say that I wish that the main character could be customizable as well to cater to POC.It would just be nice to have a character that looked a little like me. Not just a name. Other than the lack of customization there‚Äôs a lot of characters to choose from when it comes to gaining them overtime and a lot of different game plays for each character. 10/10!

review:
I only downloaded this app yesterday and I‚Äôm so happy with it and drawing fanart. It‚Äôs a super exciting game where you canPlay around, interact with characters, battle and way more. but there‚Äôs one thing that‚Äôs confusing me. At the beginning of the game, you see the travellers backstory with their brother or sister (for me brother) getting taken along with the other travellers powers away by some wizard. But when we start the game the little elf helper Paimon has no intention of helping you find your brother. You go on different quest with Kaeya and Amber but I really wanted to hear the plot of the story with the brother because I wanted to find him. So how come(spoiler alert) I have to go on some random pirate quest that isn‚Äôt even relevant to the story and ends up being fake?? I want to figure out the real story with the brother not about some dumb quest that won‚Äôt matter later in the story and I want to be able to figure out where he is. Otherwise this is a really fun game I plan on playing it every day. And I will be posting some of my fanart for this game on my YouTube account called peachiiskies, so go check that out! Please take my review into consideration. 
Thx
Roxy

review:
Love the graphics. The detailing is sublime. Aside from doing quests you can gather ingredients (or buy/make them) and make dishes! So fun! 

Some things I would like to be added into the game. Real estate. I would love to save Mora to buy a house. ‚ÄúUnlocking‚Äù one of the doors and having a place for my character to call home/sleep to heal (I know there are statues but the idea that my character doesn‚Äôt have a home makes me a bit sad). I used to play SAOIF but what made me delete that game is because it got too repetitive and there was no way of buying a house for your avatar. Also I see little dogs in Monstadt and I can‚Äôt help but want one of my own to follow me on adventures. 

It would be so nice to save for a place in the game and buying all sorts of houses in the different regions (I‚Äôm still only at the Anemo region). Exploring is definitely super fun. 

Thank you for the game. I enjoy playing it on my free time and co-playing with my brother. The story line holds your attention. It‚Äôs not too wordy (like SAOIF) and I love hearing the voices. I can‚Äôt help comparing to SAOIF because that game was the only RPG game I seriously played. I can‚Äôt wait to unlock the next region! ~love this game!

title: Great game love it

review:
The game looks nice that I agree on. But the main problem with it is the aggressive micro transactions and monetization it pushes. It tries making it seem that you don‚Äôt have to spend money to progress an stay on an even field through out the game is a lie.

 At first it seem your strong or on even footing but as the game progresses the enemies scale at a much higher rate than you do. Not only that but to play story missions you have to meet a certain level. In other games they have systems like this but there isn‚Äôt a hudge gap between levels. You will finish a story mission at level 16 then the next one is 26. 10 levels doesn‚Äôt sound like a lot, but the amount of exp you gain is very small most missions only give you 100-250 rarely 500xp. And when it requires about 2000 xp to level up once early on, the game requires heavy grinding. The grinding doesn‚Äôt even that rewarding when you meet your goal. 

The only way to get characters is by using the games many forms of currency. There are only a few instances of where you can get characters you keep through quest. Most of the times there trial quest were get a feel and decide if you want to buy them or not. It‚Äôs a sad let down that characters that are heavily involved in the story are locked behind paywall called loot boxes. Yes you can get loot boxes from the wish mechanic but the guaranteed chances of getting a 4-star item is every ten if you bought them in one go. Then the promotional 5-star item/character is every 90 wishes. 

The game also feels a copy and paste of Zelda Breath of the Wild in a few ways. The glider you get acts the same way in that it consumes stamina. The enemies are just different models but the way they act is a one for one copy of BotW. 

My final thoughts on Genshin Impact are that is it‚Äôs an aggressive gatcha game that lures players with its free to play high quality graphics and good story to then using many forms of micro transactions and level gatekeeping to make the player grind or spend money to continue playing at an consistent paste. it‚Äôs a Zelda BotW re-skinned clone that uses many forms to slow the player down to want them to spend money. The only redeeming quality about this game being the story and looks.

title: Pretty dope

review: First of, I love how Genshin Impact has the stylistic gameplay of Breath of the Wild. I love how when I first started, after doing several quests, opened the world map for me to explore. Gathering the Oculus, finding chests, defeating enemies, combos with elements, and basically trying to get the most out of the game. Not going to lie, I loved it from the beginning. But then now I‚Äôm AR 35 and I will say it‚Äôs a daily grind. Resin, resin, resin.... you miss out on one day of using up your resin, you miss out on the much needed EXP. I don‚Äôt mind the grinding nonstop on bosses or finding resources.... but come on Mihoyo. For a game that is what most might consider the Triple AAA of mobile gaming, you need to make your players stay. I get that it‚Äôs still new since release, but the resin and spending too much money is a burden. I will say I traveled all over Mondstadt and Liyue for chests and seelies, but that gives so little experience. The resin system, is such a low blow to this game, that even warframe (which I play) has better mechanics to address these. It‚Äôs an F2P game with a grinding system almost similar to Genshin but at least it gives you that value. Warframe for me became F2P but straight up because I love the game I spent thousands of dollars on it. Genshin, not even a month, I spent nearly a grand. Your wishing system also has really bad rates on wishing. I mean great for the pity system but really at 90. That means you‚Äôd have to buy the $29.99 at least 10x to hit the pity mark and most of the times it‚Äôs not even a five star character. That‚Äôs $300 down the drain. So being upset I tried it again and lord and behold another 5* weapon. Like really?!!!! Bye bye $600. I‚Äôve finally hit rock bottom with this game. Fix the wish system where it at least has a better pity, swap back and forth with characters and weapons instead of giving you something like what I mentioned, also characters with Max constellation should at least be addressed on the drops, because I frankly do not know what to do with a Max constellation character that appears on wishes constantly, and fix the resin system. Another game almost similar to this is coming out, despite this games success on launch you might lose a lot of players if that game comes out and does it better. Please fix these.

review: I honestly would leave this game a 5 star review if they hadn‚Äôt taken away the ability to retool your account to try for a better team. You used to be able to make accounts using a username and password but now you have to have an email so there is kind of a limit as to how many times you can try for the person you like as most emails require your phone number and you can only sign up so many emails under one number. The game itself is great but in order to buy 60 rolls for the character you want it‚Äôs like $150 and that‚Äôs just way too expensive for me. That‚Äôs why having the ability to reroll your account was nice. I didn‚Äôt mind putting in the time and effort to try for it but now I‚Äôm capped out on tries and still don‚Äôt have the person I wanted... The story line is enjoyable and the fighting style is fun as well! Overall I would still recommend this game to anyone who wants something to kill time. You can still get the primogems for rolls without paying it just takes a lot longer.

review:
Genshin impact is a beautiful world and very polished. I‚Äôm amazed how well this runs on mobile devices and the quality of animation and voice work. 

However, the Mihoyo team has recently nerfed any reroll by making one associate an account with an email (not username as in the past) while also decreasing the amount of free wishes. I have played multiple gacha games with low rates and completely understand how they need to make money. However, unlike other games such as Epic Seven and Dragalia Lost that provide either an easy reroll process or more generous rates, Genshin is 0.6% for a five star with the need to pull 7 copies to unlock all abilities. 

These types of games need to strike a balance between both groups and unlike other games in the realm, my personal opinion is the rates and further nerf of reroll are very punishing for any players who do not want to invest $100+ dollars into the game. 

Profit of course matters but in the past the most successful of these games balanced the playerbasea. Just some thoughts on an otherwise quality game.
title: Beautiful world but careful - $$$ hungry

title: I love it but

review:
THE GOOD:

I just got it yesterday, and, oh boy, is this game beautiful. Upon starting I was just amazed at the open world aspect and how much free will the player had to roam whenever they please. How I could run into the ocean and swim as far as I wanted to even in the tutorial, which adds to the immersion. I hate it when games block off the ocean or this or that area. Also love the fact you can climb anywhere! Which is sort of unrealistic...to climb a flat, steep cliff like spider man, but also realistic in other circumstances like with trees. Nonetheless, instead of walking around through a set path and the mountain is blocked off, in this game, you can just climb the mountain if you have enough stamina and you can jump off with the glider. It just so much fun, not as repetitive, and adds a shortcut. Love how realistic and detailed everything is, how you can talk to most NPC, sometimes you get a little extra something too and each has their own personality. Haha, also strangely, you can‚Äôt hit NPCs but you can hit the NPC cat outside Diluc‚Äôs tavern and you launch it off the table it‚Äôs sitting on. Love that little funny detail.

THE BAD:

One thing that could be added is a better multiplayer support. I wanted to play this game with my friend, and I told him to download it so we could play together. Then, I read about how multiplayer works in the game and how limited it is. That just killed my friend‚Äôs interest in even trying it out. He finds one of the most important thing is to be able to make in-game friends/ play with your irl friends because it just makes it 100x more fun. Nonetheless, the NPCs are just so adorable and there‚Äôs so many NPCs scattered around the map that I rarely felt lonely. It felt like a lively city. Even if there‚Äôs not people, there‚Äôs animals and mobs all around. Also...it would be nice if the game is more realistic. You have to sleep or else you‚Äôll be tired. You have hunger and thirst. Since you have so much food to forage and there‚Äôs a lot of rivers, I think it would make use of the food u save up. Also it would be nice if we could build our own house and make it fully customizable. Where we can put on display our weapons and we can have a wardrobe and put a teleporter to home since a bag with like 30000 capacity is unrealistic and you feel free to collect everything in sight. I feel like this could be like a hard mode so people can choose if they want the challenge, but I personally think it would be fun. Although, the day/night cycle is pretty fast, so it would be annoying to eat/drink the normal amount. Maybe one meal required for full belly once a day? Also I would like pets! And if there are houses, maybe roommates of NPCs or my own friends when they are online. Maybe just make it an MMO and more PvP. I just see so much potential. Keep up the good work guys!

review: My favorite game at the moment. I dropped 3 of my Honkai Impact 3rd games for the past 3 years for this. It‚Äôs REALLY fun, beautiful graphics & animation, fabulous orchestral music, very CUTE waifus & husbandos, excellent English Seiyuus and not as grindy at level 20. Character narratives are so funny. Transition loading times are a bit too long but perhaps it cannot be helped since it‚Äôs similar with other games. It appears free to play at the moment. I thought I signed up for beta but not notified. The reason for only a 3 star rating is because there is a serious overheating problem on my 8 month old iPad 6th gen which causes the game to randomly auto close after a few minutes. It helps a tad bit to play in front of a fan. I lowered my graphical settings to low but it heats up in less than a minute. Now it freezes but not autoclose. I‚Äôm on iOS 13.7. Would updating to iOS 14 help? I attempted to seek support but encountered some issues with the Mihoyo website. As a workaround, I play on android and my gaming desktop. No overheating, freezing or autoclosing. I‚Äôve recommended this game to a few of my friends however none of them can play it because of their devices are not top tier models. Playing this on 2k is so gorgeous.

review:
The game is largely fine and a lot of fun to play. I‚Äôd live to see a few things fixed or changed though. The camera is really wonky on iOS and iPadOS. When in combat it‚Äôs difficult to dodge enemies and face them again. An enemy lock-in system would help here. Allowing the camera to float towards the direction the character is moving or facing would help as well. 

Movement suffers as well.the virtual joystick is a little too high and too far to the center to reach comfortably, especially in combat when you‚Äôre busy with other tasks and your hand moves. Moving the controller more towards the left corner would help a lot but allowing a floating controller to appear beneath your thumb wherever it lands near the corner would be best.

Character movement itself could also be smoother. Along with the camera changes noted above, allowing for a slower, mire controlled walking speed, and a slightly faster running speed, would make some tasks such as facing a chest or walking on windmill platform kedges a lot easier.

title: Great but

review:
Genshin Impact has forever redefined what is possible for mobile games. When you first play it, you won‚Äôt be able to believe it‚Äôs a free to play mobile game. Playing through it was one of my favorite experiences. But eventually, you start to realize...you can no longer play. Everything you need to grind for is locked behind stamina. Every. Single. Thing. You realize that there is no way to level up anymore. The only adventure rank experience you get is from a few daily quests which take 10 mins to complete. 

You realize that the amount of currency you get needed to summon is laughable. You get 60 gems per day from those same daily missions you need to complete for AR experience. You get MAYBE 2 gems here and there from chests you find. So let‚Äôs say you get 80 per day. You need 160 to summon ONCE, which will probably be a weapon. But hey, at 10 pulls (20 days) you get a rarer item!....which is probably a weapon. Well, at least after 90 pulls (180 days!!) you can get a 5*!....which also will be a f***ing weapon. Seriously, this is the worst game in terms of summoning that I have ever played. I cannot believe they made a game with such potential and turned it into another cash grab summoning game with the worst rates I‚Äôve ever seen.

review:
Okay, a long review here :)
Likes:
   The open world is amazing. I can never get enough of the sceneries and the side quests are so fun. All the characters are well developed and there are so many husbandos and waifus Wah! The story line is so good, I actually played this game for the story 100% no regrets. The game is pretty smooth and there really is no way to be bored in this game. Btw I am up to date with the story and am ar 30. I really like how the world advances with you, so I‚Äôm not fighting lvl 10 hilichurls. The events are fun and I enjoy the hidden things in the game.

Dislikes:
    There‚Äôs not much things I dislike in this game. But I‚Äôd start with resin. Resin makes a huge part of receiving rewards after bosses and such. I‚Äôm f2p, and I mean the amount of resin refills you get are pretty nice. But after leveling up you start to drain them quickly. And bosses are vital for ascending your characters. So quickly you can see what the problem is there...and then we have mora. Idk if it‚Äôs just me but my spending of mora is higher than my income. There‚Äôs a huge problem alr. I‚Äôm not buying unnecessary thing btw, I just level up and whatnot. But that‚Äôs all for now.

Suggestions:
Resin should refill more quickly
-Resin is vital and my resin doesn‚Äôt refill fast enough TwT
Primogems
-maybe make primogems more easy to obtain. I find it hard to save up for 90 summons. 
Co-op
-PLEASE MAKE CROSS SERVER CO-OP!!! I am in asian server but all my friends are in American. I can‚Äôt switch over nor play with them. Co-op is so fun but only if you have friends to play with.

Overall:
   100/100 recommend this game. The music is amazing, the entire world is beautiful. The story line is intriguing, the characters are fun to use, and there are so many things you can do. This does take a lot of space so I would recommend a more later model phone or device. I use an iPad, and there are no problems. This game is really amazing and I‚Äôm so grateful that I‚Äôm alive to witness this game. That‚Äôs all but my major request is cross server co-op :)
