review: The game itself is pretty good. The world isn‚Äôt as big as I would like, but I get that other areas/zones are being added with future updates- so that isn‚Äôt a huge concern. My primary issue is some of the fights and such are dang near impossible with touch controls with how fast paced this game is with elemental combos. I have the game on my iPad, Note 20 Ultra, and PC. The game looks and runs great on the iPad and the phone but I do 99.9% of my playing on PC because it supports a controller. Until the mobile version of this game supports controllers, I will never play it on my phone or tablet. Both Android and iOS have native controller support and the PC version of this game already works with a controller so it is absolutely mind-boggling why the mobile versions do not. Great game but if you‚Äôre going to seriously do end-game content, you‚Äôre going to want a controller.
title: Great Game - Needs A Few Things

review:
First off despite what I feel the game is missing even with what‚Äôs missing the game is still a five star game. But I just wanted to make a list of 4 things I feel would take the game over the top. 

1. Cross progression for the PS4 to all other platforms. Since PS4 owners can‚Äôt take their progress to other platforms it kinda makes PS4 owners disconnected. Plus since they can‚Äôt link their account they miss out on any redemption code specials going on. 
2. Mobile controller support - don‚Äôt know why this wasn‚Äôt a thing at launch. 
3. Xbox One port - this game needs to be truly cross platform it‚Äôs annoying not being able to recommend it to my Xbox friends.
4. Please do something to make coop fun as of right now not much to do with friends during coop play. 

Beside those four wishes I have for the game the game is amazing and definitely worth it. Download it and let your adventure begin.
title: Amazing game but wishing it had a few more things

review:
I‚Äôm a guy that doesn‚Äôt really like the RPG genre but this one definitely is an exception. The reason is that adventure mode literally felt like the legend of Zelda on the switch. The element mechanics simply amazed me because I am a big fan of elements that were featured in avatar:the last air bender.

The humongous world the game provides you is just gorgeous. I‚Äôve wasted a lot of hours just by exploring and doing side quests. I‚Äôve never expected to have this much of a fun by a mobile game. And trust me,I‚Äôve played a lot of AAA title mobile games.

However,I‚Äôll give it 4 stars because of 2 reasons: The first one is due to characters having an anime style look (personally not a fan of this but I definitely to understand why they made this choice). The other and the main reason is that the game has a loot box-ish mechanic called wishing. So you have to be lucky to get the characters/items you want. Thankfully,this effect doesn‚Äôt seem horrible at the moment because of the possibility of getting the items that are required to make a wish (unbox) for free and events that boost the chances of getting important things.

If you‚Äôre okay with the unbox mechanic,this game deserves 5 stars. The developers nailed it in my opinion,props to them.

review: I‚Äôve played plenty of gacha games, and the rates in this game are by far the lowest I‚Äôve ever seen. You have a 0.6% chance of pulling a 5*, and they have a pity counter that gives you a 5* at 90 rolls. At 160 gems per pull, that‚Äôs 14400 gems total. In terms of real money costs, that‚Äôs about $210 for a single 5*. That would be fine, if they weren‚Äôt so stingy with the free currency in the game. You could play for hours and earn maybe 80 gems, not even enough for a single pull. One of their weekly quests requires you to use 1500 ‚Äúenergy‚Äù (resin) which isn‚Äôt even feasible without spending premium currency. And to top it off, character duplicates unlock seriously powerful upgrades, so to unlock your character‚Äôs full potential you‚Äôll need to get 7 copies. I enjoy playing the game, but I won‚Äôt spend any money in this game until they make changes to their rates, energy system, and the amount of free currency given.

review:
From reddit user daggerfortwo
For perspective: In Genshin Impact you have a 1/333(0.3%) chance to pull a 5* character. In Dragalia Lost you have a 1/25(4%) chance to pull a 5*. In Arknights you have a 1/50(2%) chance of pulling the highest rarity, which is considered fairly low by industry standards. In Fate Grand Order, a much older Gacha known for its incredibly low and dated rates, you have a 1/100(1%) chance of pulling a 5*. A pity system is supposedly a failsafe. A system that prevents players who roll continuously from receiving nothing in return. Genshin Impact's base rates are significantly lower than the pity timer. This game is clearly set up so that the majority of players will only get a 5* character when hitting the pity timer. With the beta's rate of distributing premium currency players can expect roll once every 5-6 months, for a team of 5* characters in just 2 years' time!

review: Hi, usually I don‚Äôt give 5 stars on a review, but this game 100% deserves it. It has a beautiful story line, and breath taking world, where you can explore to your hearts content. Personally, I think Muihoyo (Sorry it I spelled it wrong) could change somethings in their next game.To me I feel the first character you get you could give the player the freedom to design it. If you add this, it will set it aside from any other Gacha collecting games. Another suggestion is pets. I know it sounds bazaar, but when I see all the adorable kittens and puppies I just want to steal them. (Would not do that irl)Back to why this game deserves 5 stars. This game so far has been P-13, and that I really enjoy, so even the younger children in my family could play. Sure yes it does mention drinking some times, but that‚Äôs just some of what gives the game character. All the characters are beautifully designed, as I‚Äôm always noticing little features they have all the time. The world is amazing, every blade of grass is important to the scenery. Overall, this is one of the best mobile games I‚Äôve played.

title: Okay

review: It took forever to load. During the opening cutscene freeze-framed so horribly I can‚Äôt even describe it. It also didn‚Äôt have any music or any narration like my two friends (who play on PlayStation and windows) when I got to the actual game still no volume or sound on ANYTHING. I was immediately met with a black screen except for a small patch of ground that I COULD see and my character was flashing a white orb thing (I have epilepsy so that is a huge problem for me, I had to get my cousin to tell me when it stopped, it stopped after 2 minutes) the fairy constantly went into the total black abyss so I had to depend on the mini map. I also was constantly glitching through rocks and the ground all the way up to half of my head and then I couldn‚Äôt move unless I was at the top of the ground. When I got the point of where I would defeat the first mobs (the red slimes) they would just repeatedly resepan and there was 0 instruction on what I do. I killed them 4 or 6 times and then they started glowing white and flashing (which again, is a problem for me and I had to get my cousin, they didn‚Äôt flash for long, only about 30 seconds) after that I turned away from them in game so I wouldn‚Äôt get a seizure...I looked up to see if there was a sky and there was yet another flashing white orb which I assume was probably the sun. I closed the reopened the app 5 times and nothing changed, each time I opened it it was the exact same as when I started, long loading time, my character glowing and flashing, no sound, the black abyss and small ground. The game looks beyond stunning and I‚Äôd say right at par with BOTW, it has so much opportunity and is so amazing on windows and PlayStation. To the developer if you see this, please fix this issue somehow as this is a major problem. It‚Äôs so horrible that I genuinely can‚Äôt play it and it‚Äôs a big disappointment. I play on an iPad, the game says that newer models of phones and tablets work better and my iPad is only 2 years old with a BUNCH of storage space. So nothing should be wrong.

title: The game

review: I‚Äôve put countless hours into this game since launch and this is the only phone game I‚Äôve ever been this invested in. A couple people say y‚Äôall ripped off from Zelda BOTW but in my opinion THIS is what every open world fantasy RPG should be like without a doubt. I want to thank the developers and anyone else who played a part creating this masterpiece. This is the only phone game I‚Äôve been this crazy about and suggested to all my friends. A couple are bummed out because they have android and can‚Äôt play so if you guys could get it on the app store for androids you‚Äôd get way more downloads and make more money. You guys deserve an award for this honestly and the highest of respect. This game makes me forget about the mundane day to day life and I just get lost in it. I‚Äôll be on for hours and won‚Äôt even notice. The only suggestion I have honestly is adding a mic feature for multiplayer and making the multiplayer a bit better and maybe making it a bit easier to find ingredients and items. But anyways sorry for the long review it‚Äôs my first one and probably my only one. But THANK YOU for this God tier game!

title: Disabled all other audio when running with focus

review:
There is no such thing, this is the best mobile game I have played in a very very long time, I want to say it is practically a console/pc game but I will go a step further and say that it IS a pc/console game miraculously brought to mobile players (just don‚Äôt turn the graphics all the way up). From the music to the environment, the japanese voice actors, story, combat, and unique interactive element mixing, everything about its production is absolutely amazing and I would feel guilty playing this game for free. Anime BotW but free? YES PLEASE. 

I actually started my play-through on pc and was just absolutely shocked when I heard it was fully integrated on mobile, the controls are seamless and are maybe even better than on the pc counterpart.

I have been seeing a lot of reviews complaining about the low five star rates and how it is going to be pay to win. Let me just say now, for the experience they provide free players, complaining about low rates is the last of worries. You do not NEED a five star, there is no point in the main story where you will require one. Sure itd be NICE to have one but there is no excessive/tedious grinding that f2p players need to do in order to compensate (if you know what you are doing). This is not some mindless hack and slash, players who creatively fight and make builds, make full advantage of the artifact system, make full advantage of top tier four stars like fishchl/barbara/xiangling ect, WILL be better than any mindless whale. 

You do not need to spend money on this game to have a good time, the four stars that the game provides are more than enough and with primo gems left and right for f2p, there is a very high chance you will get a five star on your run anyways.

This game should cost at least $14.99 in the appstore, hands down. I encourage anyone who has the spare change to at least buy the monthly pack since it is worthwhile and balanced. Have a good day!

review:
Honestly one of the best ‚Äúsimple rpg‚Äù games I‚Äôve ever played. It helps that it‚Äôs a console/pc game ported to mobile but it‚Äôs still runs and looks stunning on medium. Anyways here‚Äôs my full review.
Gameplay: 5/5- the game is smooth and what looks like basic combat on the surface has a lot of depth do to elemental reactions.Elemental reactions really pulls the weight of this category in fighting.
Graphics: 4/5- looking at this from an overall perspective the game looks good for a console game, nothing amazing. But for a mobile game it has a unique charm and looks great on your phone
World/game map: 5/5- the map is large and has many events and things to explore.
Other activities: 4/5- there is a decent amount of things to do other than fighting. Like cooking or solving mystery‚Äôs.
Final score: 18/20

title: PLZZ FIX UR GAME

review:
I can honestly say that this game has me hooked, and its free. I spend just as much time on my phone and iPad playing this game  as I do on my PS4 just playing anything.I have at least three hours of gameplay so far. Is this a BOTW ( Breath of The Wild) look alike? Yes, but a complete clone? I wouldn‚Äôt say that. It‚Äôs obvious that this game was inspired by BOTW but there are many things that they do differently to make it stand out. I‚Äôm not gonna give any spoilers so please continue reading.

Ok. Let me start by stating an issue that people may have with this game. This game has a sort of loot crate system. I know, I know but hear me out. While playing the story you will chances to obtain certain characters. Sometimes the game will will give you character upon completing a certain task so check events, mail, and notifications in the menu. It is very easy to get the in game currency to be able to put bet your odds on getting the characters you want, and check your daily logins. I hate loot crates as much as the next guy but you gotta remember that this is a free game. They don‚Äôt have that many other ways of making money except the store that allows you to my currency with real money. I can say for the past 2 days of playing that I have never once used real money for this and I don‚Äôt‚Äô think I‚Äôll ever need. I‚Äôll probably use real money just to show my support or if I really want something but I don‚Äôt see that happening to often.

The gameplay is amazing. Battling creatures feels so fun and fast paced especially with the dash mechanic. Like I said before I‚Äôm mostly playing on my iPhone and iPad but I do play on PS4 sometimes. It‚Äôs convenient to be able to take my phone out and grind for loot and characters. Sad thing is that you can‚Äôt connect your accounts with PlayStation but you can still play on the same servers as them, android, and PC players.

Probably one of the biggest differences in this game from BOTW is the fact that you can choose from multiple characters. This gives you a variety of different ways to play with your own squad of characters. Makes me super excited to play this with friends with my own high level characters to just to take on high level bosses. The map is huge for a mobile game. just like BOTW it really surprised me. While that‚Äôs a console this was on my phone and and requires only 8Gb of storage space. To play a game on this scale on devices like these is incredible. The colors really pop out at you so that‚Äôs something to really admire. There are plenty of enemies to fight and remember this game will have events that will keep you coming back to participate in. 

Like I said I‚Äôve only played a good near three hrs and I‚Äôm pretty sure I can say more but I‚Äôm goon and leave it that. I‚Äôll be posting videos of this game on YouTube. Channel name is DiversityPlay.

title: SO AMAZING!!!!!!

review:
PROS: If you‚Äôre an adventure seeker and love exploring, this game would fit suitable for you. I literally randomly saw this game recently drop yesterday (9/28/20) whilst scrolling through my App Store and decided to give it a download. Upon finish, I must admit, I played this game the ENTIRE day yesterday and couldn‚Äôt put my phone down. It has that story that just draws you in wanting to know more, if you know what I mean. The graphics are breathtaking, fighting system easy to control and pleasing to see, weapon/artifact enhancement aspect, ability to interact with most things you explore, and so much more. It reminds me a lot like Zelda and Kingdom Hearts if y‚Äôall are in to that.

Suggestions: 

- Be sure to have enough storage space on your phone to play this game smoothly
- Try to have a good connection via WiFi unless you have the ‚Äúlatest‚Äù phone that supports 5G (you‚Äôre not doing this game justice if you don‚Äôt have good connection to play it - it‚Äôs pitiful to see someone play and it lags through cut scenes and fighting scenarios)
- I am hoping this game could offer more of a multiplayer that could allow more open world exploration that would enable cross-platform accessibility with real-time players around the world. Perhaps other game modes that could allow players to link together and compete for whatever incentive. PvP is the wave when it comes to gaming, let‚Äôs be real. It‚Äôd be so dope to run through your world of exploration and see other real-time players in your servers, like World of Warcraft. (Though this game is great, any competitive online gaming will always have the edge and more people playing it compared to these adventure games [Genshin Impact])
- I‚Äôm hoping for a Season Pass that players could purchase that would grant them with exclusive skins, weapons, items/materials, etc...
- I‚Äôm hoping for a bigger and expanded world to explore enabling for developers/creators to impose more mobility into the game.
- More AI‚Äôs and bosses to fight
- More interaction with the open world (i.e. being able to dive down in waters, picking up/throwing things, fishing, farming?

I have a lot more suggestions I could say, but the game just dropped yesterday and I really really REALLY hope you guys, app developers/creators, see this review and take it into consideration for the app‚Äôs next update. This game has SOOO much potential, let‚Äôs ride with it and keep the curiosity of exploring going. Thank you, stay safe always, God Bless!

review:
Hey. This game is great! I totally recommend it maybe for 10+(I‚Äôm 12). The only thing that gets on my nerves sometimes are the gacha rates. I would maybe increase the 5 star rate to 4% and make it so we are guaranteed to get a 5 star every 60 or 70 pulls.  90 is kinda overkill üòÇ. I understand that you guys want to make money, and that this humongous game is free, but people who don‚Äôt want to spend money or are just not patient enough will just end up being frustrated with the game and delete it. But everyone, I know that gacha rates are impossible and I know that it looks like a cash grab, but the game is free, rather than it out right costing 60 dollars. You still have a choice and to be patient. The one 4 star every 10 pulls is fine. I just hope Venti comes back! ü§ûüèª

Edit: For those struggling with the Wish system, patience pays off. Just keep investing primogems into either Wanderlust Invocation or the event banners, and it will pay off. I got Keqing out of luck on the Childe banner after so many 4 star weapons and trash characters, and am nearing 90 pulls for Childe as well. I regret investing into the regular banner for Diluc, and realized that the event banners are more worth it at least for me. You just gotta have the patience. If not, this game is not for you , I‚Äôm sorry.

Edit 2: also one more thing, sometimes if your internet connection isn‚Äôt very good, first you won‚Äôt be able to perform a certain action, like switching characters for example, then, in about 20 seconds(maybe shorter or longer), it will say ‚Äúreconnecting‚Äù and then take about 45-60 seconds to reload after that. My internet connection in my room isn‚Äôt very good anyways, but if anyone reads this then for best results, try to play in an area with good connection.

Edit 3: Warning! Don‚Äôt get Zhongli. Even though he looks cool, he‚Äôs absolute crap. Just wait till they buff him or see who is next, I‚Äôm waiting for Xiao :)

title: Omg

review:
Honestly, I love this game, but there are many flaws with this. I would‚Äôve given it a 5 star if not for these.
First off, the whale-friendly stuff. The newer characters are too much constellation dependent, and that‚Äôs a huge flaw. For example, Zhongli is basically broken with his constellation maxed out while underwhelming if you are a free-to-play player. Overall, most characters don‚Äôt have too many flaws, but the newer characters without their constellations are underwhelming and not very satisfying to play with.
Then there is the connection. Yes, sure I am playing on a phone, but it would be a lot better to experience the game without this much crashing. For example, while challenging the Oceanid, my game had lagged me out of the game, restarting all my progress (I was almost done). Another situation was with the Pyro flower, where it had less than 10% hp left and my game had suddenly crashed, leaving me with my Q and E attacks needing to be replenished. I have much experience with the lags, and I do not personally enjoy the game as much as I do with the lag.
I‚Äôve been playing since day one of release, and I‚Äôve been through many crashes, in instances where I nearly kill an opponent before my game crashes and I have to restart it all over again. And during that time, my hp is drained, to the point where I am about to die. During that point, if I teleport out I have to deal with more crashes, preventing me from teleporting to the designated area. It has been extremely frustrating to deal with, and I think the game should at least not have you re-enter in the middle of the battlefield when you crash.
The gacha system. Yes, it sounds horrible, but my most hated is the gacha system. It‚Äôs very expensive, with 160 primogems, and can take hours to gather if you are collecting off of chests alone. Including that, the pull rates are extremely low, to the point where it‚Äôs futile to go much further. But I do like that they improvised with the system and created the carry-on pity system. 
Drop rate of anything and everything. Certain items can only be dropped by monsters at a certain level, but it is not guaranteed to even drop. Most of the time, you will get the lowest level, and frequently 1 or 2 even with the world level increasing. Once, I had challenged Midsummer Courtyard, an area to challenge for weapon ascension materials. I had used condensed resin on the second to last hardest rank, and using origin resin after beating the domain, it did not give me even one of the drops. It was not a Sunday, in fact it was a specific allotted day. Yet I had only received a small portion. It is disappointing to see that many times.
Broken characters. Just like how some characters are underwhelming and not very useful, there are also broken characters. The main one is Diluc. He is a claymore user and a pyro element, categorizing in both of the more favored sections of characters. Everything for him is flat attack, even at a low level. When I had gotten him, I was able to level him to level 40, with a level 40 weapon, and he had managed to overpower my two support DPS and tank, and with the potential to overpower my main DPS. All three of them are level 70, and one is over that. Meanwhile, Diluc who is level 40 could show enough power to beat my sub DPS and my tank/support. I have zero doubt he can overpower my main DPS. 
Favoritism. Spear users are not very good, and there are significantly less characters in the spear category. The claymore users are all in high attack, and the catalyst users all have decent attacks higher than both sword users and bow users. 
I don‚Äôt suggest you play the game unless you have extreme patience or are willing to spend a dime on this. 
But a lot of stuff is beautiful, these problems counter what I like about the game.
title: It‚Äôs good but has many flaws
